articles.title: Best Flea Markets, Fairs & Farmer’s Markets In Singapore 2025
articles.author: Sassy Mama
articles.content: We’ve got the lowdown of all the great flea markets in Singapore, weekend markets, pop-up markets, thrift markets and fairs taking place in Singapore. Here’s what’s on in 2025: Nothing beats the vibe at flea markets in Singapore (a whole different feel to shopping in malls !). We love heading out to neighbourhood Singapore farmer’s markets, checking out pop-up fairs, flea markets and Sunday markets as it’s a great chance to support local. If you are looking for preloved luxury brands, artisan foods, home decor, unique fashion, art, kids’ brands and even vintage goods, then keep scrolling for all the thrift markets, flea markets, fairs and pop-ups you need to check out in Singapore this year. Disclaimer: These are external events not owned or managed by Sassy Mama. Always check with the organiser for changes or cancellations before heading over. Read more: Things To Do This Weekend With Kids Jump to: – Pop-Up Markets & Flea Markets in Singapore – Permanent Weekend Markets & Thrift Markets in Singapore – Past & Upcoming Fairs & Flea Markets in Singapore Pop-up flea markets & weekend markets in Singapore: Night At Orchard: Flea market along Orchard Road Image credit: Night at Orchard via Instagram Get ready for Night at Orchard, the only night market in Singapore, located right in the heart of Singapore’s prime shopping district – Orchard! This night flea market will take place on the last weekend of every month from now until June 2025. Shop from creative and experiential brands as they showcase their latest innovations starting from Wisma Atria to Ngee Ann City. Flea market vendors will change every month. More info here . When: 30 May – 1 June, 27 – 29 June, 25 – 27 July, 29 – 31 August, 26 – 28 September 2025 (Every last weekend of the month), 3pm – 10pm Where: from the pedestrian walkway in front of Wisma Atria to Ngee Ann City How much: Free! Makers’ Market: Artsy flea market Image credit: Makers Market via Facebook Looking for unique handcrafted gifts or something to add to your collection? Check out Makers’ Market, a craft market in Singapore. At this pop-up fair and flea market, you’ll find plenty of handmade products, crafts and artisanal goods. More info here . Clarke Quay Central: When: 16 – 18 & 23 – 25 May; 20 – 22 & 27 – 29 June 2025 Where: Clarke Quay Central How much: Free entry! Guoco Midtown & Midtown II: When: 4 – 6 & 11 – 13 July 2025 Where: Guoco Midtown & Midtown II How much: Free entry! PLQ Plaza: When: 25 – 27 July, 19 – 21 September 2025 Where: PLQ Plaza How much: Free entry! One Soul Many Stories: Thrift flea market in Singapore Image credit: One Soul Many Stories via Instagram Fashionistas, this one’s for you. Shop pre-loved luxury fashion brands at One Soul Many Stories. This pop-up flea market in Singapore often sees the likes of popular designer brands. Prada, Hermes, Louis Vuitton, Chloé … you’re bound to find second-hand fashion treasures here. More info here . When: 27 – 28 May, Tue 9am – 9pm, Wed 10am – 8pm, Thrice yearly Where: Scape, The Treetop (Level 5), 2 Orchard Link, Singapore 237978 How much: Free! FOMO Weekend Market: Weekend market in Singapore Image credit: FOMO Weekend Market The FOMO Weekend Market is a new weekend market in Singapore, and visitors can expect amazing IG-worthy gourmet food, shopping, live entertainment and interactive experiences. The weekend fair is no stranger to giving away freebies to visitors, so stay tuned for their next edition here . When: 31 May – 1 June 2025 Where: Suntec Singapore Convention & Exhibition Centre How much: Free entry! Rasa Sayang Sunday Market: Sustainable weekend market Image credit: RASA It’s all about spotlighting low-waste living at the Rasa Sayang Sunday Market. Besides workshops supporting sustainability, such as repurposing old clothes into art pieces, the Rasa Sayang Sunday Market has an array of locally handmade and ethically produced goods. You’ll find arts and crafts, jewellery and fashion, food and beverages and activities such as Tarot and aura readings. Stay updated here . When: 8 June 2025, 2pm – 8pm Where: RASA, 9 Raffles Place, Republic Plaza Tower 1, #02-01/02, Singapore 048619 How much: Free entry! Sentosa Festive Market by Sunday Social: Weekend market in Singapore Image credit: Sentosa Festive Market Held at Palawan Beach Walk, the Sentosa Festive Market by Sunday Social is a weekend market in Singapore. This one-of-a-kind street market showcases sustainable products and emerging local brands. Shop from over 25 curated vendors, and indulge in delicious food from the food trucks. Look forward to plenty of kid-friendly vendors and activities, gorgeous jewellery, chic fashion and more at this flea market in Singapore. More info here . When: 7 – 8 June 2025, monthly Where: Palawan Beach Walk (next to Palawan Green) How much: Free entry! Cosford Container Park: Weekend market in Singapore Image credit: Cosford Container Park Cosford Container Park has a monthly Weekend Flea Market that features a different theme each week. In addition to an array of F&B delights at this park, stunning views of Changi Airport, an eclectic range of vendors and fringe activities, you can shop till you drop at their flea market featuring gorgeous jewellery, chic fashion, vintage clothing and so much more. Stay up-to-date here . When: 7 – 8 June; 19 – 20 July 2025, monthly Where: Cosford Container Park, 30 Cosford Rd, Singapore 499550 How much: Free entry! Vintage Market At Katong Square: Thrift market in Singapore Image credit: The Retro Factory via Facebook The Katong Square Lifestyle & Vintage Market is bursting at the seams with vintage treasures, Vinyl Records, and rare collectables. Every Singapore flea market is different with curated vendors digging out rarities from their personal collections! The one is great for those who like to rummage and find hidden treasures. Look out for the indoor fair section with lots of antiques, retro fashion, watches, pre-loved goods, luxury handbags, and other memorabilia at this Katong flea market. More info here . When: 6 – 8 & 20 – 22 June 2025 Where: Katong Square, 88 East Coast Road Singapore 423371 How much: Free entry! Twilight: Flea & Feast Market: Halal weekend market in Singapore Image credit: Twilight Flea & Feast via Facebook Twilight’s Flea & Feast is a halal food and flea market in Singapore ‘inspired by Australia’s hawker markets’ and apart from delicious halal food and snacks there will be a chance to shop from a wide range of fashion and beauty products, enjoy an exciting line-up of performances, movie screenings, and even kids activities at the three day fair. More info here . When: 13 – 15 June 2025, 12pm – 10pm Where: Suntec Singapore Convention & Exhibition Centre How much: Free entry! Asia Cat Expo: Pet fair in Singapore Image credit: Asia Cat Expo via Facebook Cat lovers, you’ll want to save the date for the next Asia Cat Expo. Over here, you can find everything you need for your cat, from accessories to food, as well as cat-themed products. Join a workshop and sit in for a seminar on responsible cat ownership and care, or observe the cat competitions and exhibits taking place. And yes, you can bring your felines along! More info here . When: 21 – 22 June 2025, 10am – 8pm Where: Suntec Singapore Convention & Exhibition Centre How much: From $6. Tickets here . Mummy’s Market: Massive baby fair in Singapore Image credit: Mummys Market Mummys Market returns this year and promises to be the biggest baby fair in Southeast Asia, with over 250,000 brands available in this 3-day event! From strollers, baby car seats, baby toys and much more, you’re guaranteed to find what you need here and more. There’ll also be exclusive freebies, deals, promotions and a chance to talk to brand experts! When: 4 – 6 July 2025 Where: Singapore Expo How much: Free entry. Seminars from $10. Tickets here . Me-you Market: Fashion market in Singapore Image credit: Me-you Market via Instagram Started by mamas for mamas and their families, Me-you Market is a curated flea market that works with regional brands to offer modestwear for women and occasionally kids’ brands too. For this upcoming edition, you’ll get to shop from a range of brands including BOONABOO, Cantique, Skaffo and more. Expect beautiful fashion and delicious food! More deets here. When: 2 – 3 August 2025, 12pm – 9pm Where: Taste Orchard How much: Free entry! PetExpo: Largest pet fair in Singapore Image credit: Pet Expo Pet owners and animal lovers will have a field day at the massive PetExpo. Pets are welcome, and humans can browse this mega pop-up fair in Singapore for pet accessories, food, items and more, for cats, dogs, birds and everything in between! Look forward to pet contests, expert talks, goodie bags, and of course, admiring the adorable furry companions trotting around the expo. More info here . When: 14 – 16 November 2025, Friday 11am – 8pm, Saturday & Sunday 10am – 8pm Where: Singapore EXPO How much: TBA Boutiques Singapore: Fashion pop-up market in Singapore Image credit: Boutiques Singapore Looking for a place to discover new fashion trends and support local designers? Head to the Boutiques Singapore (also known as Boutique Fairs Singapore)! The brands at Boutiques Singapore are highly curated so you’re in for lots of good stuff from women’s clothing to kids’ apparel, luxury chocolate, artisanal jewellery, bags and more. More info here . When: 21 – 23 November 2025 – Twice a year. Where: F1 Pit Building How much: TBA Permanent flea markets & weekend markets in Singapore Fleawhere: Weekend flea market in Singapore Image credit: Fleawhere via Facebook Fleawhere is one of the largest flea markets in Singapore. If you love thrifting, this pop up flea market’s for you. Pick up secondhand clothes at this thrift market in Singapore to give yourself a new look at Fleawhere @ Dhoby Ghaut. More info here . When: Every Saturday & Sunday, 12pm – 6pm Where: Staytion Lifestyle Centre @ Dhoby Ghaut MRT, 11 Orchard Rd, B1-13 Dhoby Ghaut, Singapore 238826 How much: Free entry! Curbside Crafters: Craft flea market in Singapore Image credit: Curbside Crafters Not really a fair, instead this retail store along North Bridge Road has a rotating line-up of crafters, entrepreneurs and artists all year round. When: Permanent space with flea market feels; Tuesday – Sunday, 11am – 7:30pm Where: 730 North Bridge Road, Singapore 198698 How much: Free entry! The Luggage Market: Thrift market in Singapore Image credit: The Luggage Market Need some new clothes? Try new-old clothes! The Luggage Market is the biggest flea market in Singapore for second-hand items with prices as low as $2! From clothes to bags, you can find all sorts of items here. With #SustainableFashion movement on the rise, flea markets such as the Luggage Market are the way to go. When: Every Sunday, 11am – 6pm Where: Aperia Mall, 12 Kallang Ave, L1 Atrium, Singapore 339511 Admission: Free entry but book your slot in advance. Past & upcoming flea markets & weekend markets in Singapore Singapore Cat Carnival: Weekend cat fair in Singapore Image credit: Clubpets The Singapore Cat Carnival is perfect for pet owners and animal lovers alike. Head over to find cat-themed and pet-care items, and learn about responsible cat ownership and care. There will be cat adoption drives and even cat shows where you can meet fellow cat enthusiasts! More info here . When: TBA Where: Marina Bay Sands Expo & Convention Centre How much: TBA Plantopia: Pop-up market for plant lovers Image credit: City Sprouts Can’t resist yourself a new houseplant for your abode? Look no further than Plantopia by City Sprouts, a market in Singapore for green thumbs or those looking for new green additions to their homes. Browse the marketplace for plants and yummy food. The fair is also known to host some great workshops for kids! Stay tuned for updates here . When: TBA Where: TBA How much: Free! Singapore Really Really Free Market: Thrift market in Singapore Image credit: Singapore Really Really Free Market via Facebook Singapore Really Really Free Market was created to build community, encourage people to share their resources and reduce consumption and waste on our planet. As the name suggests, everything at this market is truly free! Simply show up with your preloved items that you want to give away or pick up used toys or clothes to update your wardrobe. Those giving away stuff, there’s a request not to bring more than one suitcase of goods as there’s not much space. More info here . When: TBA Where: TBA How much: Free entry Glamorous Giving: Fashion market in Singapore Image credit: Glamorous Giving Looking to shop and make a difference? Glamorous Giving, Singapore’s fashion and homewares market, returns this February for its 18th edition featuring 55 brands with discounts of up to 70%! The best part – a portion of the proceeds will support Fashion For Cancer, a charity fashion show where cancer survivors walk the runway. This charity also raises funds for cancer research and provides financial aid to those in need. So mark your calendar and shop for a cause! Follow them here for updates. When: TBA Where: TBA How much: Free entry! Public Garden: Artsy market in Singapore Image credit: Public Garden The Public Garden weekend pop-up market usually takes place a couple of times a year in Singapore and it’s where you can go to find crafts, gifts, accessories, clothes and more from independent brands and designers in Asia. Their annual Christmas market in Singapore is also usually a big hit for those looking for unique gifts! Follow them here . When: TBA Where: TBA How much: Free entry! Garden Vibes: Farmer’s market in Singapore Image credit: Little Farms Garden Vibes is where you’ll find all things good for you, including produce from Australia, New Zealand, Europe and Singapore. This farmer’s market in Singapore also highlights an array of wellness activities and talks. Look out for a family-friendly line-up of activities such as urban farming workshops and sessions where kids can move! Stay updated here . When: TBA Where: TBA How much: Free entry with ticketed events. Christmas Markets: Year-end pop-up fairs Image credit: Christmas Wonderland Is it really Christmas season without a good ol’ Christmas fair ? Get all your Christmas shopping done at an array of Christmas markets and pop-up festive fairs that take place around Singapore around the end of each year. Shop for Christmas decor, Christmas hampers and goodies , try festive must-haves like eggnog and mulled wine and bring the kids for lots of family fun! When: November/December 2025 Where: TBA How much: Free entry! ARTBOX Singapore: Annual pop-up fair in Singapore Image credit: ARTBOX Singapore The annual ARTBOX Singapore never fails to disappoint those who love street food and shopping. This mega pop-up fair also usually includes family-friendly activities such as games, interactive zones, live entertainment and events that take place throughout the fair. Read about ARTBOX Singapore here . When: January 2026 Where: TBA How much: TBA Ramadan Bazaars: Pop-up bazaars in Singapore Image credit: Kampong Gelam Ramadan Bazaar We love the season of Ramadan bazaars in Singapore leading up to Hari Raya ! Look forward to plenty of yummy and IG-worthy F&B offerings, festive Raya outfits for the family, Raya goodies and more. The Geylang Serai Ramadan Bazaar is also back with plenty of goodies, so don’t miss it! Read all about the Ramadan bazaars that take place around Singapore here . When: February/March 2026 Where: Various locations How much: Free! Read more: The post Best Flea Markets, Fairs & Farmer’s Markets In Singapore 2025 appeared first on Sassy Mama .

articles.title: Opening 23 July! The NEW Singapore Oceanarium With 22 Zones (Former S.E.A. Aquarium)
articles.author: Jessica Fang
articles.content: The new Singapore Oceanarium (former S.E.A. Aquarium) opens on 23 July 2025, bigger and better than before! Explore everything from shallow waters to the deep sea, and prehistoric oceans to today’s waters. Here’s what we know so far: We were sad to see S.E.A. Aquarium go when our favourite aquarium closed its doors on 30 April 2025. But it wasn’t goodbye forever! In its place is the all-new Singapore Oceanarium, which is three times bigger than its predecessor. Good news, folks: it’ll be opening on 23 July 2025! That’s just before the school holidays wrap, giving us something to pad the post- June holiday blues. With 22 zones to explore, families can look forward to some great new additions at the Singapore Oceanarium. We’re plenty excited about the prehistoric underwater world, the massive collection of sea jellies, the new walking net and its many new teractive elements. Read on to find out what to expect at the Singapore Oceanarium: Read more: Guide To Sentosa Island With Kids Jump to: – Singapore Oceanarium Zones – Singapore Oceanarium Research & Learning Centre – Singapore Oceanarium Opening Hours – Singapore Oceanarium Tickets – How to get to Singapore Oceanarium Guide To Singapore Oceanarium (Former S.E.A. Aquarium): Singapore Oceanarium: Former S.E.A. Aquarium Image credit: Resorts World Sentosa – Singapore Oceanarium Singapore’s Coast zone We absolutely loved spending the weekends at S.E.A. Aquarium with its amazing floor-to-ceiling aquariums in 10 zones filled with colourful marine life and educational snippets. As part of Resorts World Sentosa’s (RWS) 2.0 expansion plan, S.E.A. Aquarium has been rebranded and revamped into the Singapore Oceanarium. Are we sad to see S.E.A. Aquarium go? A little; but we’re also mega-excited about the new Singapore Oceanarium. The Singapore Oceanarium is now three times larger than its predecessor, with 22 zones that allow visitors to connect with the marine world. You can look forward to experiencing everything from life in the shallow waters to the deep sea, and get a peek into ocean life during prehistoric times, all the way to marine life as it is today! Read more: Guide To Universal Studios Singapore With Kids Singapore Oceanarium zones: 22 zones to explore Image credit: Resorts World Sentosa – Singapore Oceanarium Whale Fall and Sea Mount zone Here are some of the highlights of the zones at Singapore Oceanarium: Ocean Wonders: We love how mesmerising sea jellies can be, and now you’re about to be wowed at one of the largest kreisel habitats in the world. The kreisels will house thousands of moon jellies! Singapore’s Coast: A tribute to our nation’s very own vibrant biodiversity, this zone features a mangrove-inspired landscape and interactive habitats that kids will love. Ancient Waters and Conquering Land: Bring your dinosaur-loving kiddos to this new dinosaur attraction in Singapore , featuring prehistoric ocean animals and living fossils. There’ll be life-sized animatronics and replicas of majestic ancient creatures. Migrators: This zone highlights the open waters and its vibrant ecosystems. Open Ocean: Our favourite Reef Manta Rays and Zebra Sharks are back at the Open Ocean, where you can observe thousands of marine animals gliding by via a 36-metre-wide viewing panel. Whale Fall and Sea Mount: Families can learn all about marine protection initiatives and successful efforts that’ve taken place. Hallway of Hope: An educational experience where kids can learn how they can play their part in protecting and cherishing the world’s oceans. Spirit of Exploration: This zone will look familiar to those who’ve visited the Maritime Experiential Museum & Aquarium at S.E.A. Aquarium. The Jewel of Muscat is still there for families to explore the ninth-century Arabian dhow. Pier Adventure: Need to let off some steam after exploring the Singapore Oceanarium? Kids can check out this suspended web that overlooks the Jewel of Muscat! Explorer’s Nook: A new themed cafe with pastries and light bites with marine merch. Singapore Oceanarium Store: A staple at every Singapore attraction (and our favourite to browse) is the gift shop! The Singapore Oceanarium Store will have marine-inspired apparel, books and souvenirs, plus sustainable brands. New Research and Learning Centre at Singapore Oceanarium Image credit: Resorts World Sentosa The opening of the Singapore Oceanarium comes with the new Research and Learning Centre, just adjacent to the Singapore Oceanarium. Along with learning labs, collaborative spaces, seminar rooms and a rooftop event space, the centre will serve as a hub for scientists and researchers to work their magic when it comes to marine science. Singapore Oceanarium opening date & opening hours Image credit: Resorts World Sentosa The Singapore Oceanarium will open to the public in Resorts World Sentosa on 23 July 2025! Opening hours have yet to be announced, so stay tuned for updates. Singapore Oceanarium ticket prices & ticket promos Image credit: Resorts World Sentosa – Former S.E.A. Aquarium Details of the Singapore Oceanarium ticket prices and entry fees have yet to be announced, so stay tuned for updates! How to get to Singapore Oceanarium The Singapore Oceanarium is located at Resorts World Sentosa, making it easy to travel over via public transport or car. By public transport: Take the Sentosa Express Monorail from VivoCity (HarbourFront MRT) or take bus RWS8 from VivoCity or HarbourFront to get to Resorts World Sentosa. By car: Resorts World Sentosa has plenty of parking onsite as well as drop-off points. Singapore Oceanarium, 8 Sentosa Gateway, Sentosa Island, Singapore 098269, www.rwsentosa.com The post Opening 23 July! The NEW Singapore Oceanarium With 22 Zones (Former S.E.A. Aquarium) appeared first on Sassy Mama .

articles.title: NDP 2025: National Day Celebrations at the Padang & Marina Bay, Heartlands NDP Events, FlyPasts & Fireworks
articles.author: Sassy Mama
articles.content: NDP ticket balloting opens 28 May! Here’s everything we know about the National Day Parade 2025. From the National Day concert to flypast information, NDP activities at the Padang and Marina Bay on 9 August, new parade segments, fireworks, NDP heartland events and more! This year’s SG60 National Day Parade is promising to be the biggest yet! With the theme ‘Majulah Singapura,’ the 2025 NDP will celebrate Singapore’s 60th birthday with the National Day Parade extending from the Padang to Marina Bay. This means stunning fireworks displays across both areas, promising some of the biggest NDP fireworks yet. Plus, the festivities will kick off in the lead-up to 9 August with NDP events around Marina Bay, as well as at heartland locations around the island that follow after National Day. What makes this year even more exciting is its SG60 theme, its brand new NDP 2025 theme song ‘Here We Are’, and more provisions in place to accommodate 200,000 more people for NDP 2025! Here’s what to expect at NDP 2025, from crowd favourites like the Red Lions, the Presidential Gun Salute, fireworks and much more. P.S. NDP 2025 ticket balloting opens 28 May 2025! Scroll down to find out more on how to ballot. Read more: Where To Watch NDP Fireworks For Free Jump to: – NDP 2025 Celebrations at the Padang and the Promontory @ Marina Bay – NDP 2025 Celebrations in the Heartlands – Where to catch NDP 2025 Flypast – Other National Day 2025 Events, Buffets and Dining Offers – Where to Watch NDP Fireworks Disclaimer: This is an external event not owned or managed by Sassy Mama. Always check with the organiser for changes or cancellations. All information is correct at the time of publishing. NDP 2025 at the Padang and Marina Bay Image: NDPeeps There will be two venues to celebrate NDP 2025, the Padang and Marina Bay. While the main NDP parade will be held at the Padang, the shows at both locations will be synchronised, with spectators at both venues experiencing all the highlights at the same time! While the Red Lions perform their iconic parachute down into the Padang, viewers at Marina Bay will get to see naval divers descend into the Bay’s waters. There’ll also be light projections and NDP fireworks across the city for all to see, as well as LED screens at Marina Bay where viewers can watch the live broadcast from the Padang. Image credit: MINDEF Look forward to other crowd favourite programmes such as the State Flag Flypast, the Presidential Gun Salute and more. NDP 2025 will also see the return of the mobile column that’ll showcase military vehicles and assets spanning from the air to the land and sea. This segment will also include an aerial flypast at the Padang and a maritime display at Marina Bay–a first for NDP! Image credit: NDP.gov.sg Of course, we’re all looking forward to the show segment. Local icons including Kit Chan, Charlie Lim and Dick Lee will take the stage, presenting four National Anthem-inspired acts. For those at Marina Bay, there’s also a floating stage for expanded parts of the show, so you’ll be able to catch all the excitement in person! NDP 2025 ticket balloting for the NDP preview and National Day Parade opens on 28 May 2025 at 12pm and closes on 9 June 2025 at 12pm. Note that only Singapore Citizens and Permanent Residents can apply. Successful applicants will be notified between 20 to 25 June 2025. You can submit your application here . NDP 2025 Preview and Rehearsal Shows at The Padang & Marina Bay: NDP Previews: 26 July and 2 August 2025 National Day Parade 2025 at The Padang & Marina Bay: When: 9 August 2025, timing TBC (firework timings: around 8pm onwards) Where: The Padang & Marina Bay Here’s where to watch the fireworks for free! NDP 2025 Flypasts Map of last year’s Flypast Routes If you’re planning to watch the parade from the comfort of your home, good news! You might still catch the state flag flypast and F-16 jets making their rounds in the heartlands. The Fly Our Flag segment is a highly anticipated part of NDP each year, allowing viewers who are unable to attend the parade to still experience the NDP 2025 celebrations by spotting the majestic jets and helicopters in several neighbourhoods across Singapore. Details of the NDP 2025 flypast have yet to be released, but here’s what happened last year’s two routes: The western route included Woodlands, Choa Chu Kang, Bukit Batok, Jurong, and West Coast, while the eastern route will cover Seletar, Sengkang, Punggol, Pasir Ris, Bedok, and East Coast. Meanwhile, six F-16 jets made their flypast over locations such as Clementi, Jurong West, Choa Chu Kang, Bukit Batok, Woodlands, Toa Payoh, Seletar, Punggol, and Bendemeer. RSAF Island Flypast: When: 9 August 2025, Timing TBA Where: TBA NDP 2025 in the Heartlands Image credit: NDPeeps via Facebook Every year, Singaporeans look forward to exciting NDP celebrations all over the heartlands during the National Day weekends. This year, NDP 2025 brings the festivities to five heartland locations on 10 August 2025, each with a unique theme. NDP 2025 Heartland celebrations will feature carnival games, family activities, live performances, static displays of SAF, SCDF, and SPF vehicles, and fireworks ! P.S. National flags can be redeemed on the NDP Shop on Shopee from mid-June 2025 onwards! Singaporeans and PRs may redeem the flags for free. Details have yet to be released, so stay tuned for more info! When: 10 August 2025 Where: TBA How much: Free, but you must have a ticket to join the event. National Day 2025 events As we’re awaiting more announcements on National Day 2025 events, take a look at what took place last year: National Day Specials at El Chido Image credit: Pullman Singapore Hill Street El Chido at Pullman Singapore Hill Street has crafted a special locally-infused menu to celebrate Singapore’s 59th birthday! This National Day, the Mexican-themed rooftop bar invites you to commemorate the nation’s birthday with exciting fusion dishes such as Chicken Rice Chimichanga and Crispy Seafood Otah. There’s also the limited-time sharing Singarita which you can sip on while enjoying the stunning view of the Singapore skyline. On Saturday evenings, you can dine with a backdrop of the NDP fireworks display. Plus, there will be an in-house DJ to keep the vibe festive and an infinity pool for a refreshing dip! When: from 6pm daily (Available from 4pm on Saturdays) Where: El Chido, RF at Pullman Singapore Hill Street, 1 Hill Street, Singapore 179949 How much: $88.88++ per set. Durian Fiesta at Ellenborough Market Café Image credit: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court What better way to celebrate Singapore’s birthday than by indulging in the nation’s favourite fruit, the durian! For NDP, Paradox Singapore Merchant Court is hosting a Durian Fiesta at Ellenborough Market Café, featuring a delectable buffet spread that highlights the ‘King of Fruits’. Look forward to unique dishes such as Durian Fried Rice and Hokkaido Pumpkin Durian Cream Soup, along with dessert classics like Durian Hazelnut Choux and the signature Durian Pengat. Can’t get enough of durians? Head to the Durian Fruit Bazaar ($138/adult, $50/child), available exclusively for dinner on Thursdays between 18 July and 8 August, and on National Day. Enjoy unlimited servings of fresh durian at Ellenborough Market Café’s alfresco live station overlooking the Singapore River! When: 1 July – 31 August 2024 (Friday – Sunday), 6:30pm – 10pm Where: Ellenborough Market Café, Paradox Singapore Merchant Court, 20 Merchant Rd, Singapore 058281 How much: $98 per adult and $42 per child. Edge’s National Day dinner & lunch Image credit: Pan Pacific Singapore Celebrate National Day with Edge’s special National Day buffet, where you can indulge in some of Singapore’s most iconic dishes, including a live Kueh Pie Tie station, Bak Kut Teh, Singapore Laksa with Baby Lobster, Bak Chor Mee, and more. There’s even a unique pop-up drinks stall featuring local favourites like Teh Tarik, Iced Limau, Soya Cincao, and a Virgin Singapore Sling! Don’t miss the dessert station with exclusive local treats such as Ice Cheng Teng Soup, Lychee Bandung Compote Trifle, Milo Dinosaur Panna Cotta, Kueh Lapis, and the National Day special, Chempedak Cake. Plus, the ice cream station will offer the iconic sandwich and potong ice cream. Singapore citizens born in 1965 enjoy a special price of $88 per adult for the National Day lunch buffet! When: Dinner: 9 July – 9 August 2024, 6pm – 10pm; Lunch: 9 August 2024, 12pm – 3pm Where: 7 Raffles Blvd, Level 3 Pan Pacific, Singapore 039595 How much: Dinner: $128 per adult, $64 per child (6 – 12 years old); Lunch: $128 per adult, $64 per child (6 – 12 years old). Citizens born in 1965: $88 per adult. The Capitol Kempinski Hotel Singapore: National Day menu and staycation package Image credit: The Capitol Kempinski Hotel Singapore The Capitol Kempinski Hotel Singapore celebrates the nation’s birthday with a special National Day three-course set menu at 15 Stamford! For just $59++ per person, look forward to a local take on some of your favourite international cuisines, such as Foie Gras Kaya Toast (smooth foie gras and organic egg foam layered with kaya in a soft brioche bun) and tender prime ribs glazed with an angelica barbeque sauce, which takes inspiration from Bak Kut Teh. There is also the Laksa, complemented by succulent Hokkaido scallops. For desserts, indulge in the Pandan Tiramisu. If you’re dining on National Day, we highly recommend enhancing your experience for $59++ per person to get exclusive access to the rooftop of Eden Residences for unobstructed views of the spectacular fireworks displays. Your package will also come with free-flow champagne! But if you want the full NDP experience, book the Celebrate Singapore staycation package, which gives you 20% off room rates for your second night, plus daily breakfast and three-course dinner for two. Where: The Capitol Kempinski Hotel Singapore, 15 Stamford Rd, Singapore 178906 How much: $59++ per person. Local Food Parade @Stevens Image credit: Novotel Singapore on Stevens Novotel Singapore on Stevens celebrates National Day with month-long festivities filled with beloved local dishes. The Local Food Parade @ Stevens will feature over 50 iconic hawker dishes for one night only on National Day itself! Some highlights include Janggkut Katong Laksa, Original Serangoon Hokkien Mee, Rochor Original Beancurd, Heng Kee Curry Noodles, He Zhong Carrot Cake and more. Enjoy nostalgic flavours from Uncle Ice Cream and Kacang Puteh Uncle for dessert. The buffet, priced at $59 per person, includes a live telecast of the National Day Parade, allowing you to enjoy local cuisine while tuning in. Stay till 8:30pm for performances from local artists and buskers. Plus, enjoy bottomless servings of the signature @Stevens Singlish Beer! Do you share the same birthday as Singapore? If so, you can dine for free with every two paying adults ! Where: Novotel Singapore on Stevens, 28 Stevens Rd, Orchard District, Singapore 257878 How much: $59++ per adult. National Day Concert @ Gardens by The Bay Image credit: Mediacorp The Gardens by The Bay and Mediacorp National Day Concert is back for its sixth edition this year, with plenty of activities to celebrate Singapore’s 59th birthday. With the theme ‘Our Home, Our Heart, Our Singapore’, this year’s concert will be headlined by local talent Olivia Ong and will feature plenty of other homegrown talents, including Benjamin Kheng, who sang the NDP theme song! Aside from musical performances, there will also be plenty of exciting activities for the families, including go-kart races, carnival games, and roving acts from stilt walkers and roving jugglers. Stay till the end for the event highlight, where vibrant fireworks fill up the night sky against the gorgeous Supertree backdrop! When: 4 August 2024, 7:30pm – 10pm (doors open 4:30pm) Where: The Meadow, Gardens by the Bay How much: Free! Singapore Flyer: National Day Moonlight Flight Image credit: Singapore Flyer via Facebook Singapore Flyer is celebrating National Day with a special Moonlight Flight, a first-of-its-kind overnight flight! This one-day-only event takes place from 9 August, 11pm to 10 August, 8am. Tickets go for just $25 per person, and Singapore Citizens and Permanent Residents born in August can enjoy free entry to the Moonlight Flight with every paying guest! All tickets will also give you free admission to the Time Capsule, an interactive journey that depicts Singapore’s past, present and future. To add to the festivities, there will also be a night market featuring a variety of F&B options and ample seating, making it one of the perfect places to watch the fireworks! Where: Singapore Flyer, 30 Raffles Ave., Singapore 039803 How much: $25, purchase your tickets here . Experience the NDP Fireworks in Style at JW Marriott Singapore South Beach! Take the front seat and witness the spectacular NDP fireworks display over the Marina Bay skyline from the comfort of JW Marriott Singapore South Beach’s Premier Marina Bay Room and Suites! The spacious, designer-led décor room with a “floating” king-size bed is perfect for a family staycation. Guests can also watch the glittering fireworks up close from the Flow18 Sky Garden and swimming pool. During this celebratory period, indulge in the signature Chefs-on-Show Seafood Buffet at Beach Road Kitchen. Enjoy an array of Singaporean flavours with a culinary spread of international and local delights, including fresh seafood on ice, Bak Kwa pizza, chilli crab pasta, delectable durian treats for dessert, and more. When: From 8 – 11 August 2024 Where: JW Marriott Singapore South Beach, 30 Beach Road, Singapore 189763 How much: Dinner (8 – 11 August): $108++; Lunch (9 August): $108++; Brunch (11 August): $118++ NDP @ Pororo Park Singapore: Mascot parade, carnival games, live streams Image credit: Pororo Park Singapore Pororo Park Singapore is hosting a special National Day celebration with an evening packed with fun activities! On 9 August from 6pm – 9pm, Pororo Park Singapore transforms into its own NDP with carnival games, balloon sculpting, Pororo & Friends tattoos, a mascot parade, and more. Enjoy live streaming of the NDP, and since Pororo Park is located in Marina Square, there will be a special fireworks viewing segment where you can watch the stunning display live! Your little ones will also receive a special goodie bag worth $100, filled with Pororo merchandise, snacks, and vouchers. Buy two admission tickets and get a Pororo merchandise of your choice for only $5.90 ! Plus LITE membership for 1 Adult + 1 Child is going for just $59 ! These promotions are valid from 1 – 31 August 2024. Where: Pororo Park Singapore, Raffles Blvd, Marina Square, Singapore 039594 How much: from $69 (1 adult + 1 child). Ticket sales begin 8 July NTUC x NDP Bay Celebrations Image credit: NDPeeps NTUC will be hosting its first large-scale NDP event as part of the extended National Day Parade celebrations at the Promontory @ Marina Bay. This event, NTUC’s biggest in over a decade, will take place on 3 and 9 August and will consist of live musical performances, a live broadcast of the NDP, the state flag flypast, the “Salute to the Nation” bomb burst by the Republic of Singapore Air Force, the presidential gun salute sail-past, the Total Defence 40 dynamic defence display’s high-speed chase, and a fireworks display. Attendees will receive an NDP fun pack, and there will be a photo booth, interactive installations, and more. When: 3 & 9 August, 3pm – 10pm Where: Promontory @ Marina Bay How much: Balloting is now closed. National Day Celebrations at One Punggol Good news for north-easties, because plenty of National Day celebrations are popping up! Celebrations will take place on two separate days with plenty of activities for the whole family. On 3 August, look forward to various activities, including stage performances, craft workshops that include making your very own Merlion plushies, movie screenings, arcade games and even bouncy castles! There’ll also be a sing-along segment, where you can show your patriotism by singing to your favourite NDP tunes. On 9 August, there’ll be plenty of live screening of NDP. However, the highlight would have to be the State Flag Flypast and the Six F-16s Flypast that’ll pass through the Punggol district! When: 3 & 9 August Where: One Punggol, 1 Punggol Dr., Singapore 828629 How much: Free! MAJULAH FIESTA: National Day Celebrations at Singapore Sports Hub Image credit: Singapore Sports Hub The Singapore Sports Hub brings back its National Day festivities this year with plenty of activities across three weeks! With the theme: ‘Together We Play, As One United People,’ there will be several aspects to ensure everyone’s at their patriotic best. Try a new sport at the Sports Tryouts, or get your groove on at the Majulah Fiesta Fitness Party. You can even bring your furry friends along for Pets Play Day. Some other programme highlights include the Lion City Dance Convention, the Active Health Fitness Challenge, and the live telecast of the NDP, flypast and fireworks on 9 August! Check out the full itinerary of programmes here . When: 27 July – 11 August Where: Singapore Sports Hub How much: Free! National Day Celebrations at Community Centres Image credit: Punggol West, Our Neighbourhood, Pasirris.org, Sembawang Town Council National Day celebrations kick off a week early at several heartland locations in Singapore, featuring various exciting weekend activities for the whole family. From carnivals and fitness events to durian parties and even fireworks, these heartland festivities are perfect for getting into the National Day spirit! When: from 3 August Where: Various locations How much: Free! We will be updating this page with more information on the NDP 2025 events and side activities when more information is released. Want to be in the know about everything NDP 2025? Click here to sign up for our newsletter ! The post NDP 2025: National Day Celebrations at the Padang & Marina Bay, Heartlands NDP Events, FlyPasts & Fireworks appeared first on Sassy Mama .

articles.title: Where To Shop Cute Baby Clothes & Kids’ Clothes In Singapore
articles.author: Sassy Mama
articles.content: Whether you want comfy baby clothes or stylish kids’ clothes in Singapore, we’ve got you covered with this list of physical and online stores for cool clothes for kids! Where do I find cute baby clothes and kids’ clothes in Singapore? We’ve found all the best baby gear and kids’ clothing brands and shops in Singapore and beyond so you can plan matching outfits for the fam, pick up gorgeous clothes for kids of all ages (how hard is it to find tween clothing!?), or get ready for your little one’s arrival with organic baby clothes and more. Happy shopping! If you’re looking for outfits for festive seasons or special occasions, check out our guides on where to buy Indian traditional clothes for kids, kids’ cheongsams and baju kurung for kids . Best Shops and Online Stores for Baby Clothes & Kids’ Clothes in Singapore: Angelibebe: Luxury baby & kids’ clothes Image credit: Angelibebe via Instagram A curated collection of brands offering luxury clothes for kids and babies aged between 6 months and 12 years, Angelibebe offers quirky and exclusive pieces from both established designers (Milly Minis, Sonia Rykiel Paris) and up-and-coming brands (Tutu de Monde, Mini Rodini) from all around the world. For selected locations, they offer free shipping with a minimum order value. Plus, there’s a live chat and a fabulous kids clothing sale section! Angelibebe, www.angelibebe.com BaeBeeBoo: Kids’ clothes made with 100% luxe cotton Image credit: Baebeeboo via Facebook We’ve been lusting after their gorgeous kaftans since forever , so it’s been super exciting to see BaeBeeBoo expand into other stylish, sustainable kids’ clothing that’s perfectly suited for hot and humid Singapore. This socially-conscious fashion label’s clothes are made from 100% luxe cotton, much of it hand-sewn by women in Jaipur, India. We also love that a portion of their profits goes toward supporting underprivileged children. Keep an eye out for mama-daughter twinning sets. BaeBeeBoo, 442 Orchard Road, #02-01, Claymore Connect, Singapore 238879, www.baebeeboo.com Bochechas: Premium kids’ clothes in Singapore Image credit: Bochechas Breathable clothes are so important if you want to stay cool in Singapore, and this local fashion brand has everything you need. Created by a mama who had trouble finding beautiful, practical clothing that was also safe for a child’s delicate skin, Bochechas blends functional designs with premium, hand-selected fabrics. Bochechas carries clothes for kids aged 1 to 12, and for adults, too, so it’s easy to match your looks for a day out as a family. Bochechas , 1 Kim Seng Promenade, #01-158A, Singapore 237994, www.bochechas.sg Carter’s: US brand for baby & kids’ clothes Image credit: Carter’s via Instagram Carter’s is a popular brand that retails clothes for kids and babies. Hailing from the US, their range of multipack onesies and clothing sets are sure to be in many kids’ wardrobes in the first couple of years! They always have fun designs you can’t resist and are exclusively available online at Amazon.sg and KidStyle stores across the island. Carter’s, www.carters.com Château de Sable: French-style kids’ clothes Image credit: Château de Sable via Facebook Created by a French mama and inspired by French style and impeccable clothing quality, Château de Sable has five boutiques across Singapore. From exclusive Liberty prints to adorable hand-smocked dresses, every gorgeous piece of clothes for kids – ranging from newborns to kids aged 12 – sticks to the brand’s philosophy that children should dress like children! Free local shipping for orders above $50. Château de Sable, five locations in Singapore including Tanglin Mall, Great World and i12 Katong, www.chateaudesable.com CottonOn Kids: Affordable baby & kids’ clothes Image credit: Cotton On Kids via Facebook If you’re looking for a bright pop of colour, CottonOn Kids is bound to have something that fits the bill. With a great range of clothes for kids in breathable thin materials that suit this hot climate (did we also mention wallet-friendly prices?), CottonOn Kids is always a winner, especially for little kids up to around 10. For teen clothing and adults, check out CottonOn. CottonOn Kids, multiple locations including Wisma Atria, United Square and Plaza Singapura, Singapore, www.cottonon.com The Elly Store: Clothes for kids aged 0 to 14 years Image credit: The Elly Store A perennial stalwart in our CNY cheongsam roundup , Elly is a local label that makes gorgeous baby wear and clothes for kids aged 0 to 14, all year round! It’s also one of our go-to’s when choosing special, new baby clothes to send to friends overseas! Never one to compromise on comfort or practicality, The Elly Store’s collection of fun prints were designed with tweens in mind, with a matching baby collection so siblings can coordinate and make it a family affair! The Elly Store, multiple stockists in Singapore including Orchard, Tanglin Road and VivoCity, www.theellystore.com Gingersnaps: Fashionable kids’ clothes Image credit: Gingersnaps Singapore Gingersnaps is always on the list when we are kids’ clothes shopping for a new birthday dress or smart shirt – they do such sweet prints and colours. They stock enviable gear for babes, tweens and older kids too. Gingersnaps, multiple locations in Singapore including Raffles City, Paragon and IMM (outlet store), www.sg.gingersnaps.com.ph H&M: Affordable baby & kids’ clothes Image credit: H&M via Facebook You’ll find adorable affordable clothes for kids, babies and teens at H&M. Get baby clothes in Singapore easily, thanks to their range of pieces from newborns to 24 months (all-in-ones in super-soft organic cotton!), while older kids can try styles like dungarees, soft jersey pieces and fun animal print tees. H&M, multiple locations in Singapore including JEM, Vivo City and Suntec City, www.hm.com Kiddy Palace: Affordable baby & kids’ clothes Image credit: Freepik – for illustrative purposes only. You can often find Kiddy Palace in neighbourhood malls all around Singapore, offering affordable children’s clothes for every occasion! We love their range of comfy onesies and casual clothing for wearing around the house, plus they’ve also got multi-sets that are great for building bub’s wardrobe of clothing essentials. Have a wedding or birthday party to attend? Kiddy Palace also has plenty of options for flouncy dresses, smart shirts, pants and fancy shoes! Kiddy Palace , multiple locations including Causeway Point, Marina Square and Westgate, Singapore Kids21: Kids’ clothes from designer brands Image credit: Kids21 via Facebook Calling all mini fashionistas! Kids21 carries baby clothes and kids clothes from more than 80 designer brands. Their kids’ clothes are designed for kids aged 0 to 16. They’ve also got a wide range of accessories, plush soft toys, and other fun gift ideas for kiddos. Kids21, multiple locations in Singapore including Dempsey, Forum and Marina Bay Sands, www.kids21.com Le Petit Society: Kids’ clothes made of certified organic cotton Image credit: Le Petit Society via Facebook As parents to two little girls, the founders of Le Petit Society vowed to create safe and comfortable clothes for kids with every collection. Le Petit Society believes in using only choice fabrics that children will want to wear daily and last generations! Le Petit Society, multiple locations including Paragon and Downtown Gallery, Singapore, www.lepetitsociety.com Little Baby Singapore: Baby clothes & nursery products Image credit: Little Baby Singapore Little Baby Singapore is a one-stop shop for baby products! Mostly known for their nursery products from bedding to furniture, feeding accessories and more, Little Baby Singapore also offers cute and comfy baby clothes from brands including Elly Milley, Hoppetta, Agabang x Disney Baby and more. Plus, don’t miss the adorable baby romper inspired by the traditional Japanese kimono! Little Baby Singapore, 38 Ang Mo Kio Industrial Park 2, #Level 7, Lobby A, Singapore 569511 (visit by appointment only), www.littlebaby.com.sg Little Ground: Premium Korean baby & kids’ clothes Image credit: Little Ground via Facebook You can shop cute baby clothes and kids’ clothes from popular Korean kids’ fashion store Little Ground at Forum The Shopping Mall, Singapore! Little Ground is a fashionable premium baby’s and children’s store brand from Korea that provides discerning and fashionable mamas and dads with a one-stop shop for the best of quality, trendy kids’ clothes. Little Ground , three locations including Forum The Shopping Mall, Great World and Raffles City, www.littleground.com.sg Little Happy Haus: Organic baby clothes & toys Image credit: Little Happy Haus via Facebook Little Happy Haus has Insta-mamas covered with their curated, IG-worthy clothes for kids aged 0 to 10 years. There’s also a range of open-ended toys and handmade home decor. We love how pretty everything is, and we’d highly recommend them for baby and kids’ gifts for fellow mum friends. Little Happy Haus, www.littlehappyhaus.com Little Kooma: Seasonal kids’ clothes Image credit: Little Kooma Your tot will be the apple of everyone’s eye when you dress them up in outfits from Little Kooma. Specialising in baby clothing in Singapore, this online store has adorable clothing options for babies and kids alongside baby feeding accessories, baby gifts and all the essentials you’ll need. Little Kooma, www.littlekooma.com Read more: Where To Find Kids’ Cheongsam In Singapore Mango Kids: Chic kids’ clothes for aged 5 and up Image credit: Mango Mango is known for their trendy, chic outfits for men and women, but did you know they also have a kids’ section? At Mango Kids, you’ll find all of the kids clothes in Singapore that you’ll need from shorts to t-shirts, tops, jumpsuits, swimwear and more. They have minimalist looks to floral print so you can find something for every style! Mango Kids, multiple locations in Singapore including Ion Orchard, Tampines and Serangoon, www.shop.mango.com moodytiger: Activewear for kids Image credit: moodytiger Have a little athlete in your midst? moodytiger offers tech-driven and design-led athletic apparel for kids ages 4 to 16 years old, covering a variety of sports activities such as running, swimming, tennis, ice skating, skiing or gymnastics. Their selection of kids’ clothes is stylish, comfortable and multi-functional for everyday outdoor activities and even perfect for your budding pros! moodytiger , The Shoppes at Marina Bay Sands, #B1-61, 8 Bayfront Ave, Singapore 018955, www.moodytiger.com Mothercare: Go-to store for kids’ clothes & accessories Image credit: Mothercare Singapore Singapore’s go-to for all things kids-and-baby, Mothercare is also a great all-rounder if you’re looking for kids’ clothes in Singapore! With 11 stores across the island (including the experience stores at Paragon and Harbourfront). They also have some great cold-weather clothing, as well as cute sleepsuits and pyjamas too! Mothercare , multiple locations including Harbourfront Centre, Paragon and Jewel Changi, Singapore, www.mothercare.com.sg NEXT: Online kids’ clothes store Image credit: NEXT via Facebook We love the extensive range of clothes for kids offered at online store NEXT. Whether it’s cute baby clothes, kids’ clothes or clothes for older teens, they have a ton of designs and styles, and we’re always spoiled for choice. Plus, delivery is just a standard $7 for all orders! NEXT, www.next.sg Nimbu: Buy-Use-Return policy for kids’ clothes Image credit: Nimbu Online, sustainable kids’ clothing store Nimbu offers a circular platform for all things kids, ranging from handmade comfy ethnic wear to cotton dresses, shirts and handcrafted shoes for newborns to kids aged 14 years old. Their unique Buy-Use-Return policy allows you to return kids’ outgrown outfits in exchange for credits that you can use to offset your next purchase. Nimbu , The Green Collective, #02-18, Funan Mall; OG People’s Park, Level 4; Design Orchard, www.nimbu.sg PatPat: Affordable baby wear & kids’ clothes Image credit: PatPat From cute baby clothing to must-have clothes for kids, PatPat has it all at prices that won’t break the bank! PatPat doesn’t just do cute kids’ clothes, they’ve also got plenty of Disney-inspired threads that your tot will love. They also have adorable baby clothes and matching family sets for your next family photoshoot! PatPat, www.sg.patpat.com Read more: Best Photo Studios & Family Photographers In Singapore Plume Active: Lightweight children’s sportswear Image credit: Plume Active While we love all the adorable, cutesy kids’ clothes available, activewear is what you should really stock your kiddos’ wardrobes with because these kids get sweaty all. the. time! Online clothing store Plume Active has the perfect wear for this, with minimalist, lightweight essentials that are great for kids aged 3 to 10 years old. Plume Active, www.plumeactive.co Read more: Best Football Academies & Football Clubs For Kids PreLouLou: Pre-loved kids’ clothes from designer brands Image credit: PreLouLou PreLouLou was born out of the belief that dressing up our kids fabulously shouldn’t cost the planet! You’ll find over 200 brands available on their site, including Ralph Lauren, Jacadi, Chateau de Sable, Our Mini Nature and more at up to 70% off retail price. PreLouLou, www.preloulou.com PONEY: Kids’ clothes from Malaysia Image credit: PONEY Hailing from Malaysia, this kids’ clothing brand offers oh-so-cute (not to mention super stylish!) clothes for boys and girls. articles.title: Top Places For Middle Eastern, Turkish, Greek & Mediterranean Food In Singapore
articles.author: Sassy Mama
articles.content: Craving fluffy pitta, hummus and grilled meat platters? Here’s where to find the best Greek, Turkish, Middle-Eastern and Mediterranean food in Singapore Looking for the best Mediterranean, Middle Eastern, Greek or Turkish food in Singapore? From creamy hummus and fluffy pita to smoky grilled meats, fresh salads and generous mezze platters, these vibrant cuisines are packed with bold, sun-kissed flavours perfect for sharing. While Singapore is famous for its amazing Italian restaurants , sushi and dim sum , there’s something special about the communal, flavour-rich experience of Middle Eastern and Mediterranean food. Whether you’re craving a cosy Greek taverna, an authentic Turkish grill, or Middle Eastern mezze with friends, we’ve rounded up the best spots in Singapore for Mediterranean, Middle Eastern, Greek and Turkish food that’ll transport your tastebuds straight to the Med. Best Middle-Eastern & Mediterranean Food In Singapore 2025: Alaturka: Mediterranean Food & Turkish Hospitality Image credit: Alaturka Mediterranean Food & Turkish Hospitality Alaturka Mediterranean & Turkish Restaurant has been a solid choice for many years for those craving a taste of Turkish food. Go for the Meze Tabag – a sharing platter of hummus, babaganoush, saksuka, tarama salata, muhammara, feta, olives and lavas. Then tuck into Falafel and salads to go with the house-made Pide (similar to pizza) or jump straight to the Grilled Meats and kebabs section. Save room for the flaky sweet Baklava and a strong black coffee! Alaturka Mediterranean & Turkish Restaurant , 15 Bussorah Street, Singapore 199436, www.alaturka.com.sg Alati Divine Greek Cuisine: Greek restaurant in Singapore Image credit: Alati Divine Greek Cuisine Sporting a very Greek blue and white interior, Alati on trendy Amoy Street offers all the usual Greek staples. Think whole grilled fish and other seafood (flown in directly from the Aegean Sea), beef moussaka (a traditional Greek casserole) and Greek salads and dips. Alati Divine Greek Cuisine , 73 Amoy Street, Singapore 069892, www.alati.sg Aniba: Middle-Eastern restaurant with views Image credit: Aniba Aniba puts a new spin on Middle Eastern cuisine with its European style and Asian influences. This spot is part Middle Eastern restaurant, part chef’s kitchen, and cocktail bar and is by the same people behind our other Middle Eastern food go-to, Miznon. Tuck into Arabic Salad Ceviche, grilled Middle-eastern Cauliflower with Tahini and Pecan-Parsley pesto, and sharing mains of Chilean Sea Bass with Freekeh Pilaf or Grilled Grouper, Bouillabaisse with Hummus Cream and Couscous . Aniba, 6 Battery Road, #05-03, Raffles Park, Singapore 049909, Tel: (+65) 9668 8036, www.aniba.com.sg Artichoke: Middle Eastern-inspired Mediterranean food Image credit: Artichoke Artichoke has to be the granddaddy of Middle Eastern and Mediterranean food in Singapore. Chef-owner Bjorn Shen brings a playful twist to traditional Middle Eastern dishes with a modern, bold approach. Must-try dishes include lamb shakshouka, halloumi fries, Jewelled Hummus and Muhammara for Turkish bread dunking, and don’t skip the Fried Cauliflower and the famous Feta Burrata. Artichoke , 46 Kim Yam Road, #01-02 New Bahru, Singapore 239351, www.artichoke.com.sg Ayasofya Turkish Restaurant: Turkish food prepared tableside Image credit: Ayasofya Turkish Restaurant Ayasofya Turkish Restaurant along Bussorah Street is a Muslim-owned eatery that offers a diverse menu crafted by OG Turkish chefs. Signature dishes include the theatrical Pottery Kebab, which comes with lamb and vegetables baked in a clay pot and opened tableside, and the Mixed Grill platter, ideal for sharing. Complement your meal at Ayasofya Turkish Restaurant with traditional starters like hummus and baba ghanoush, and conclude with their signature Kunefe dessert. Ayasofya Turkish Restaurant , 51 Bussorah Street, Singapore 199467, www.ayasofyarestaurant.com.sg Bakalaki Greek Taverna: Mediterranean restaurant in Singapore Image credit: Baklaki Greek Taverna Bakalaki is a bustling Greek taverna in the heart of River Valley. This Mediterranean hotspot in Singapore is known for its buzzing atmosphere and great dips and starters from tzatziki to the sinful Saganaki Kefalotyri cheese and fava bean spread that goes great with fluffy pitta bread. If you’re in a group order the Mmeat or seafood platters or hoard the delish lamb chops all to yourself. Bakalaki , #01-01, 38A Martin Road, Singapore 239072, www.bakalaki.com Blu Kouzina: Popular Greek restaurant in Singapore Image credit: Blu Kouzina Blu Kouzina offers an authentic Greek dining experience with a focus on fresh ingredients imported from Greece. At this Greek restaurant in Singapore, tuck into grilled octopus, moussaka, and a selection of traditional Greek dips like tzatziki and taramosalata. It’s always super lively here (and it’s sometimes hard to get service) but the Mediterranean food at this Greek restaurant keeps us coming back again and again. Blu Kouzina , multiple restaurants in Singapore including Dempsey, Siglap and Sentosa, www.blukouzina.com Cappadocia Turkish & Mediterranean Restaurant: Famous restaurant in Bugis Image credit: Cappadocia Turkish & Mediterranean Restaurant Located at the vibrant Bussorah Street just steps away from the iconic Sultan Mosque, Cappadocia Turkish & Mediterranean Restaurant is always bustling with customers that flock daily to try their famous Kunafa, and trust us, it’s worth the journey. The Turkish and Mediterranean dishes here might be a little pricier, but the consistent crowd suggests it’s a spot well worth checking out. Cappadocia Turkish & Mediterranean Restaurant , 69 Bussorah Street, Singapore 199482, www.cappasg.net Éla Jalan Sultan: Greek restaurant with brunch sets Image credit: Éla Jalan Sultan Nestled in the heart of Kampong Glam at Jalan Sultan, Éla is a Muslim-owned eatery by the famous The Black Hole Group (the same guys behind Tipo!) that combines affordability with authenticity, serving up hearty Greek dishes like grilled meats, fresh seafood, and classic dips. Popular picks in Éla Jalan Sultan include the Farmhouse platter, melitzanosalata with fluffy pita, and their signature brunch sets. Éla Jalan Sultan , 33 Jalann Sultan, #01-09/10, Singapore 198965, www.ela.sg Kazbar: Middle-Eastern restaurant in Singapore Image credit: Kazbar Leaning towards Middle-Eastern flavours rather than Mediterranean food? Check out Kazbar with its comprehensive menu of Lebanese dishes. Order Kazbar’s Hot Mezzeh Platter if you’re in a big group and graze on sambousek lamb, arrayes, spinach borek, kibbeh, jawaneh and falafel. The vegan mezze platter is always a winner and the artichoke stew is super tasty. Kazbar , 25 Church Street, #01-03 Capital Square, Singapore 049482, www.kazbar.com Miznon: Greek restaurant in Singapore CBD Image credit: Miznon Good food and a light-hearted fun atmosphere? Step this sway! Miznon’s pita sandwiches are somewhat legendary by now. And for good reason. The pitas at this Greek restaurant in Singapore are fluffy and soft and encompass hearty fillings that are a real meal in itself. Try the pita with egg, sour cream, tomato, and onion or tuck into a pita with cheeseburger, sour cream, chili, pickle, onion, tomato, and a sunny side egg. Miznon Singapore , 6 Stanley Street, #01-01, Singapore, www.miznonsingapore.com Mykonos on the Bay: Greek food in Sentosa, Singapore Image credit: Mykonos on the Bay You’re sure to get Mediterranean vibes when you sit al fresco at Mykonos on the Bay on the Sentosa Quayside waterfront, with beautiful views of the marina. This Greek restaurant in Singapore gets points for romantic vibes but it’s also buzzing and fun enough for a group. Tuck into souvlaki, grilled seafood platters, and baklava for dessert. Mykonos on the Bay , 31 Ocean Way, #01-10 Quayside Isle, Sentosa Cove, Singapore 098375, www.mykonosonthebay.com North Miznon: Mediterranean food by Michelin-starred chef Image credit: North Miznon When we get asked where to go for a fun evening out we very often recommend North Miznon! Serving up modern Mediterranean food with a buzzing vibe, North Miznon on Amoy Street is the brainchild of Michelin-starred MasterChef Eyal Shani. The service can feel a little rushed (especially for the first seating) but the atmosphere makes up for it. Foccacia is free and free-flow, best eaten with the hummus and prawn dish, Lamb Shawarma and the Bish Bash salad. North Miznon , 110 Amoy Street, #01-01, Singapore 069930, www.northmiznonsg.com Sofra Turkish Cafe & Restaurant: Established in 1999 Image credit: Sofra Turkish Cafe & Restaurant Sofra Turkish Café & Restaurant has been a top go-to restaurant for Turkish food since 1999, serving up hearty, homestyle dishes. Located at Marina Square, Sofra Turkish Café & Restaurant is known for its generous portions, friendly service, and comforting classics like lamb shank, beef moussaka, and freshly baked pide. Don’t miss their signature Sofra Platter if you’re dining in a group! Sofra Turkish Cafe & Restaurant , 6 Raffles Boulevard, Marina Square #03 – 129A, Singapore 039594, www.sofra.sg Whether you’re planning a casual meal with friends or a romantic dinner, these top Middle Eastern and Mediterranean restaurants in Singapore offer authentic flavours and unforgettable dining experiences. Read more: The post Top Places For Middle Eastern, Turkish, Greek & Mediterranean Food In Singapore appeared first on Sassy Mama .

articles.title: Gallery Children’s Biennale 2025 At National Gallery Singapore
articles.author: Aisyah Amin
articles.content: Gallery Children’s Biennale 2025 at National Gallery Singapore is free to enter! It’s themed ‘Tomorrow We’ll Be…’ and it features 8 kid-friendly art installations – including baby-friendly artworks for the very first time!” The fifth edition of the Gallery Children’s Biennale, themed ‘Tomorrow We’ll Be’ is back at National Gallery Singapore . This year’s edition is in conjunction with the Gallery’s 10th anniversary and the nation’s 60th birthday, and you can look forward to a showcase of eight art installations by local and international artists that spotlight four core values: Joy, Kindness, Dream and Love. For the first time ever, all artworks at the Gallery Children’s Biennale are baby-friendly, inviting kids of all ages (and the young at heart!) to explore eight interactive and larger-than-life artworks that stimulate their auditory and visual senses in a safe environment. Visitors are encouraged to think of the endless possibilities of their future through multi-sensorial art installations and engaging programmes. Read more: Must-Visit Kid-Friendly Museums & Art Exhibitions In Singapore Gallery Children’s Biennale: 8 art installations for kids Image credit: Gallery Children’s Biennale 2025 The Gallery Children’s Biennale 2025 invites little ones to dive into eight fun, kid-friendly art installations filled with hands-on play and sensory surprises. To kick things off, kids can grab a Gallery Children’s Biennale 2025 Art Pack, which is a colourful kit packed with art supplies, easy-to-follow instructions, and creative prompts inspired by the artworks. With baby-friendly installations featured for the first time, the Art Packs now come in two versions: one for ages six and under, and one for seven and up! Check out full details of each installation below. 1. Embracing the Future with Joy Image credit: Gallery Children’s Biennale 2025 Some of the installations at the Gallery Children’s Biennale 2025 are by local artists, including Embracing the Future with Joy by Fern Wong. This vibrant installation features Fern’s signature papercut art and invites children to explore what happiness means to them through bright hues, playful textures, and patterns. Kids can help complete a giant magnetic wall design adding their own creative touch to the artwork. For the smaller ones, there’s a dedicated corner with a sensorial “busy board” filled with sound makers, mazes, and textured panels designed to support early development while keeping little hands engaged! Where: Spine Hall 2. Dance Dance Chromatics Image credit: Gallery Children’s Biennale 2025 At Dance Dance Chromatics, local artist Wyn-Lyn Tan invites children to experience art in motion. This installation is set against a stunning AI-generated video wall inspired by two decades of the artist’s paintings and transforms movement into colour and emotion. Kids can jump, twirl and step on four-floor pads that trigger visual changes in the digital landscape. With motion sensors, little ones get to explore how movement and colour can express joy. 3. Empowering the World through Kindness Image credit: Gallery Children’s Biennale 2025 Kindness Garden is a sensory-filled installation by Japanese artist Hiromi Tango that encourages children to explore empathy through sight, sound, touch, and smell. Surrounded by oversized flowers, kids can discover messages of kindness written in braille, offering a glimpse into how the visually impaired experience the world. At the heart of the garden is a “sound flower” that invites playful interaction through sound and movement. Designed with inclusivity in mind, the installation also features calm domes filled with lavender-scented plushies, creating a quiet, soothing space especially thoughtful for neurodivergent children. 4. Lessons in Being Kind Image credit: Gallery Children’s Biennale 2025 Lessons in Being Kind features a stop-motion film by Laotian artist Souliya Phoumivong, where kids can explore themes of identity, self-acceptance, and the power of kindness through the adventures of colourful blob-like characters. Get creative at the activity area by making your own stop-motion videos, and let the kids have fun at the balancing chair! 5. I WE THEM Image credit: Gallery Children’s Biennale 2025 I WE THEM is a whimsical installation that transforms everyday surroundings into playful, character-like forms. Designed to spark connection and comfort, families are invited to slow down and share moments together. Babies and toddlers can explore freely in a soft ‘flower bed’ filled with gentle sculptures encouraging sensory and emotional development, while older kids will enjoy giving high-fives to a giant inflatable hand and spinning seven rotating discs of different sizes! 6. Home is Where the Heart Is Image credit: Gallery Children’s Biennale 2025 Inspired by Mohamed Salehuddin’s Malay House in Malacca in 1960, Home is Where the Heart Is is an imagined neighbourhood that celebrates Singapore’s rich and diverse heritage. This vibrant mural invites children to explore what home means to them through playful, interactive elements. Here, they can ring a doorbell, open a neighbour’s door, or listen to greetings from a cheerful ice cream seller. Parents and grandparents can also share memories of past homes, sparking conversations that connect generations and deepen appreciation for the places we come from. 7. Fantasy Image credit: Gallery Children’s Biennale 2025 Fantasy is an installation by Malaysia-based art collective Co2_karbondioksida that transforms 130kg of upcycled children’s clothing and nearly 400 donated toys into a dreamy, sustainable space. At its centre hangs a large-scale mobile made from repurposed toys. Soft cubes crafted from donated clothes cover the cushioned floor, providing a safe and cosy area for babies and young children to explore. While playing, visitors are also encouraged to think about waste, overconsumption, and the environment. 8. Imaginary Peach Garden Image credit: Gallery Children’s Biennale 2025 Imaginary Peach Garden by South Korean artist YeSeung Lee blends technology and storytelling through an interactive installation. Inspired by traditional tazo puzzle cards and animals from Korean and Southeast Asian folktales, children can create their own fantastical creatures in two ways: by piecing together physical foam puzzles or using digital devices to form shapes projected onto the wall. Programmes and workshops at Gallery Children’s Biennale 2025 Throughout Gallery Children’s Biennale 2025, there will be plenty of kid-friendly programmes and workshops that are mostly free to join! These include storytelling workshops, adventure trails, craft activites and more. Check out the full list of programmes on Gallery Children’s Biennale 2025’s website . Read more: Kid-Friendly Guide To National Gallery Singapore & Keppel Centre for Art Education How much are tickets for Gallery Children’s Biennale 2025? It’s free for Singaporeans and PRs to enter Gallery Children’s Biennale 2025. Simply head down to the National Gallery Singapore to explore these exciting art installations and kid-friendly workshops at Gallery Children’s Biennale 2025. Read more: Kid-Friendly Guide To National Gallery Singapore & Keppel Centre for Art Education How to get to Gallery Children’s Biennale 2025 By MRT: Get off at City Hall (7-minute walk from exit B), Clark Quay (10-minute walk from exit E) or Raffles Place (10-minute walk from exit B). More deets here . By bus: Click here for all the public buses that will take you to the Children’s Biennale 2023. By taxi/car: The taxi stand and drop-off point is at the Coleman Street entrance. If you’re driving, you will need to use Parliament Place and St Andrew’s Road to access the car park. More deets here . Gallery Children’s Biennale 2025 When: 31 May 2025 – 29 March 2026 Opening hours: 10am – 7pm daily Address: National Gallery Singapore, 1 St. Andrew’s Road, Singapore 178957 Gallery Children’s Biennale 2025, National Gallery Singapore, 1 Saint Andrew’s Road, Singapore 178957, Tel: (+65) 6271 7000, nationalgallery.sg The post Gallery Children’s Biennale 2025 At National Gallery Singapore appeared first on Sassy Mama .

articles.title: Singapore Marathons & Running Events In 2025: Fun Runs, Half Marathons, 10km Runs & More
articles.author: Jessica Fang
articles.content: Looking to reach a new fitness goal or simply support a good cause? We’ve got the lowdown on all the best Singapore marathons and running events taking place, including half marathons, 10km runs, fun runs, kids’ runs and more! It goes without saying that Singapore is a fab place for running, especially with so many family-friendly parks around. That said, you might be looking to challenge yourself to a full marathon (41.195km), a half marathon (21.1km), or even a 10km run or below. Well, you’re in luck because there are so many running events in Singapore and marathons that take place throughout the year! Many of these Singapore marathons also support good causes, and we love that there are plenty that include fun runs and kids’ dashes for some good family fun. Read on to find out all the running events in Singapore and Singapore marathons taking place. We’re constantly updating this list, so stay tuned for everything including walkathons, half marathons, night runs, fun runs and more! Read more: Fun Kids’ Events & Things To Do This Weekend Guide To Singapore Marathons & Runnings Events In Singapore: National Vertical Marathon 2025: Vertical marathon in Singapore Image credit: National Vertical Marathon via Facebook If you’re always the one saying, “let’s take the stairs,” then the National Vertical Marathon is for you. The National Vertical Marathon is back for its 2025 edition, and this year, the goal is to race up Guoco Midtown. Attempt the challenge solo, or pair up with a buddy to reach the top of the tower. Gather your best runner buddies for the Teams Open, or take it on as a family! Singapore marathon race categories: Men’s & Women’s Open (aged 16 and up); Veterans’ Open (aged 45 and up); NTU Alumni; Junior Climbers (aged 10 – 16); Teams Open (4 – 5 runners); Duo Challenge (aged 10 and up); Family Fun Run (3 – 5 family members) Is this a kid-friendly running event? Kids aged 10 and above may join the vertical marathon. When: 25 May, 7am – 7pm Where: Guoco Midtown National Vertical Marathon entry fee: From $24 – register here . SAFRA Diaper Dash: Baby run in Singapore Image credit: SAFRA via Facebook The adorable SAFRA Diaper Dash is back and it promises a tonne of fun for the little ones. This year’s SAFRA Diaper Dash takes on a special SG60 theme, with Pororo Park as its partner. There’ll be Pororo meet-and-greet sessions and sing-alongs, and of course, adorable baby races for little ones as young as 6 months old to 36 months old. There are prizes to be won, so it’s going to be an exciting race! Singapore marathon race categories: 6 categories for various age groups (6 months – 36 months old) Is this a kid-friendly running event? Yes! The SAFRA Diaper Dash is for ages 6 – 36 months old! When: 29 May – 1 June 2025, 10am – 8pm Where: Marina Square SAFRA Diaper Dash entry fee: From $60 – register here (fully registered). Income Eco Run 2025: Half marathon in Singapore, kids’ run & more Image credit: Income Eco Run via Facebook A run for competitive runners, families, kids and even cats and dogs? We’re so here for it! There’s so much happening at the Income Eco Run 2025, and it’s all for a great cause as it shines the spotlight on a zero-waste lifestyle. The Income Eco Run is introducing the 1km Pets Category for the very first time, so bring your good furkids to join the cause. Kids as young as 4 years old can also participate in the Kids Categories. It’s all worth it–because for every kilometre each participant clocks, Income Insurance will donate $1 towards the zero waste movement. Singapore marathon race categories: 3km, 5km, 10km, 15km, 21.1km runs for adults; 700m & 1km run for kids; 1km pet’s run Is this a kid-friendly running event? Yes! Kids aged 4 – 12 can join the kids categories, and kids aged 13 and up can join the adult categories. Dogs and cats are also welcome for the pets category! When: 8 June 2025, 4.30am – 11am Where: Marina Barrage Income Eco Run entry fee: From $16 – sign up here . Smurfs Run 2025 Powered by JomRun: Running event in Singapore Image credit: JomRun Marina Barrage will see a sea of blue as the Smurfs Run takes over on 28 June. This family-friendly weekend event has two non-competitive race categories: a 2km fun walk and a 4km fun run. Complete the Smurfs Run race and you’ll get your finisher medal, and be sure to collect your race pack beforehand, which includes Smurfs-themed keepsakes. Singapore marathon race categories: 2km fun walk, 4km fun run Is this a kid-friendly running event? There is no dedicated kids’ category but junior fit tees from 4 years old and above are available. When: 28 June 2025, 7am Where: Marina Barrage Smurfs Run entry fee: From $58.88 – sign up here by 26 June 11.59pm. Unlabelled Run 2025: Fun run & competitive run in Singapore Image credit: Unlabelled Run As the conversation surrounding mental health continues, there’s no better way to raise awareness about stigmatisation and discrimination than with those who’ve experienced it themselves. Enter: the Unlabelled Run, which is a call to unite society to be more inclusive, cohesive and compassionate and remove prejudicial labels. Singapore marathon race categories: 5km run, 10km run Is this a kid-friendly running event? Kids aged 6 and above may join the run. When: 28 June 2025, 7am Where: OCBC Square, Singapore Sports Hub Unlabelled Run entry fee: From $39 – sign up here by 31 May 2025. Cold Storage and Giant Kids Run 2025: Kids marathon in Singapore Image credit: Cold Storage & Giant Kids Run Finally, a kids’ marathon perfect for the energetic little ones who love to run! The Cold Storage and Giant Kids Run is back and kids can take part in both competitive and non-competitive races. Some great prizes are up for grabs, including hampers worth up to $400 and trophies for the top finishers. P.S. Strollers are perfectly welcome if you’re coming with younger kids! P.S. There is a FREE Breakfast Run for all participants taking place on 31 May 2025 from 8am – 11am at Marina Square. It’s limited to the first 300 participants, so be sure to register early. Singapore marathon race categories: 1.6km non-competitive run; 1.6km & 2km competitive run Is this a kid-friendly running event? Yes! Kids aged 6 months to 12 years old can join.
