Here, you can look out for new experiences like Culogo Camp and upcoming attractions like Curiosity Cove and Dining Alley. articles.title: Families Can Join Urban Farm Tours, Workshops & FREE Nature Walks From 16 May – 29 Jun
articles.author: Sassy Mama
articles.content: Go Green SG invites the whole fam on an exciting greenventure with many sustainability activities, programmes, and experiences! Looking for a fun way to turn your kids into eco-warriors this June school holidays ? Go Green SG ’s got you covered! Grab the fam and dive into a myriad of green activities that are anything but boring. We’re talking outdoor adventures, hands-on crafts, and all kinds of sustainability fun that’ll have everyone hooked. Trust us, this isn’t your typical green day out! Join fun workshops, farm tours & more Brought to you by the Ministry of Sustainability and the Environment (MSE) and its partners, Go Green SG is a nationwide movement that’s all about inspiring families to go green. Happening from 16 May to 29 June 2025 , and in celebration of SG60, the public can look forward to an expanded line-up, including exclusive behind-the-scenes tours, curated learning journeys, events, workshops and activities for youths and families. Got a little explorer at home? Go Green SG has guided nature walks that invite you to explore Singapore’s parks! On 7 June, take the fam to Chestnut Nature Park for a free guided walk through one of Singapore’s hidden green gems. You’ll uncover the park’s rich history, learn about its fascinating plant life and maybe even spot some of its endangered residents like the mousedeer! This volunteer-led walk is run by the Friends of Chestnut Nature Park and guided by local residents, so expect plenty of insider knowledge along the way. Image credit: City Sprouts Don’t miss out on the 60-minute guided farm tour at City Sprouts’ flagship urban farm in Henderson, featuring six interactive stations! Discover different farming methods, meet the resident chickens up close, and learn how composting and bio-digesters help manage food waste sustainably. After the tour, unwind with a mindful tea workshop that invites you to reflect on your relationship with food, others, and yourself. There is also the Sustainability Shopping Learning Journey with World Wide Fund for Nature (WFF) at FairPrice’s flagship sustainable store at City Square Mall, where kiddos can explore how they can make smarter food choices, learn about eco-labels, discover ways to reduce packaging and waste, and pick up tips to fight food waste at home! Contribute your creativity to a good cause Image credit: Peace of Art SG Eager to do your part to build a more sustainable Singapore? Kick things off at Wings of Art (24 Jun to 1 Jul), organised by Peace of Art SG and Wings of Childhood! This event invites you to contribute your creativity to a breathtaking butterfly-themed installation that symbolises hope and renewal. Look forward to a one-of-a-kind, 60m-long Barbie runway made from upcycled wine crates and brought to life by 60 Singaporean artists and artisans. Feeling inspired? Join the effort by creating your own winged Barbie doll using repurposed materials. Plus, 100% of the proceeds from the event go towards supporting education and mentorship for underprivileged children, and the dolls you make will be gifted to underprivileged children. Creativity with a cause? Yes, please! Ready to go green this holiday? Sign up for these Go Green SG activities and many more at www.gogreen.gov.sg ! With so many activities, there’s bound to be an activity that suits your family’s interests! Go Green SG, www.gogreen.gov.sg The post Families Can Join Urban Farm Tours, Workshops & FREE Nature Walks From 16 May – 29 Jun appeared first on Sassy Mama .

articles.title: Bring Your Daughter For A Free Trial To Perform With The International Girls Choir
articles.author: Sassy Mama
articles.content: If you have a daughter who loves singing, dancing and performing, here’s your sign to check out the International Girls Choir open houses for a FREE trial class. Plus, read on to find out how to score a scholarship to join their Performing Choir. If you have a daughter who can’t resist singing, dancing and putting on skits at home, the International Girls Choir (IGC) from the International School of Performing Arts might be the place where she can truly shine! Open to girls aged 5 to 15, the IGC is where little ladies can develop their confidence and skills while having fun at the same time. Plus, no performing arts experience is required! Read on to find out more about how girls can find their voices (and dance moves!) with the IGC, and how to join a free trial class: Girls get their talent, confidence & resilience nurtured At the International Girls Choir, every girl has the opportunity to discover her voice. With a training model developed from the highly successful Australian Girls Choir, which has over 40 years of experience, the International Girls Choir offers a supportive, all-girls environment that nurtures talent and self-belief. This year, the International Girls Choir is also launching its Performing Choir–an audition-based group for girls who are ready for more challenging music and high-profile performances across Singapore. Beyond helping girls find their voice and take their talent to the next level, parents testify to how the International Girls Choir helps their daughters grow in confidence, resilience and emotional well-being. Girls gain public speaking and presentation skills, learn teamwork and build friendships that boost their sense of belonging. The International Girls Choir offers experiences that will shape your daughter’s character and gift her with memories of a lifetime. Just this year, 15 members from the Singapore choir will travel to Sydney to perform with their Australian Girls Choir sisters at the Sydney Opera House. Free open house events in May & June Want to see what it’s like for yourself? You’re invited to witness the International Girls Choir in action at their upcoming Open House events in May and June. Check out their new City and East Coast locations, as well as existing venues in Tanglin and Serangoon. Girls can try a free class, take part in an optional assessment workshop, and even receive a personalised report. No experience? No problem! The International Girls Choir offers a place for those who have potential, nurturing talent at each child’s pace. Plus, girls who show potential for joining the Performing Choir stand a chance to win multiple scholarships. Ready to see your daughter shine? Register for the International Girls Choir’s free Open House events in May and June to discover how they can unlock your daughter’s potential, nurture her confidence and open doors for a bright future. Quote SASSY5 to get 5% off tuition fees. International School of Performing Arts (ISPA), rehearsal locations in Tanglin and Serangoon & new venues to open in Dhoby Ghaut, Bencoolen and Katong, Tel: (+65) 8399 4372, www.ispa.com.sg The post Bring Your Daughter For A Free Trial To Perform With The International Girls Choir appeared first on Sassy Mama .

articles.title: 20 Sushi Restaurants In Singapore For Affordable Japanese Cuisine
articles.author: Sassy Mama
articles.content: On the hunt for the best sushi in Singapore? From affordable value-for-money bento platters to conveyor belt sushi and gourmet sashimi, we round up the best Japanese restaurants for a casual family meal in 2025. Wondering where to get the best sushi in Singapore to satisfy that craving? There’s nothing like a beautiful platter of sushi and sashimi, whether you are dining out or ordering sushi delivery. The best part is … kids love it, it’s not fried, and it’s filled with Omega-3 goodness – so, everybody wins. Some sushi restaurants offer huge sushi platters for delivery, which are great for birthday parties , picnics , or family dinners. Restaurants like Sushiro with conveyor belt sushi are always super popular with the kids (especially when that avocado maki is delivered on a sushi train!). As always, what constitutes the best sushi is subjective, so here we are highlighting what we reckon is the best sushi in Singapore for families. If you’re dining out with kids who love conveyor belt sushi, skip to the conveyor sushi section below . While we’d love to splurge on omakase with Edo-style sushi, instead, we round up our favourite affordable casual Japanese restaurants where the fam can indulge in some of the tastiest bentos, tempura, sashimi, and sushi in Singapore! Jump to : Conveyor Belt sushi restaurants Read more: Ultimate Guide to Food Delivery in Singapore Best Sushi Restaurants In Singapore: Ganko Sushi: Fresh sashimi, omakase sushi menu Image credit: Ganko Sushi Singapore via Instagram Offering premium quality Japanese sushi and seafood at reasonable prices, Ganko Sushi is a Japanese restaurant that has high-quality seafood in a smart, bright restaurant (it’s refreshing to enjoy premium sushi in a non-hotel setting). Ganko Sushi has a new 15-course sushi omakase experience, where you can feast according to the season. The Japanese head chef at Ganko Sushi personally places orders with professional buyers at the Osaka Fish Market so there’s always fresh seafood flown in three times a week. Priced at an accessible $110 per person, Ganko Sushi’s new 15-course sushi omakase includes a starter, sashimi, multiple sushi offerings prepared individually according to the season, and a dessert. Definitely one we recommend if you are looking for premium sushi in Singapore! Ganko Sushi Singapore, 9 Penang Road, UBS Building, #01-01, Singapore 238459, Tel: (+65) 8828 2280, www.facebook.com/gankosushisg Akashi: sushi platter Image Credit: Akashi via Instagram In the heart of Orchard, Akashi Japanese Restaurant serves up exquisite sushi like the Uni Tempura Nori, Ika (cuttlefish) with Uni, Foie Gras, and Caviar on toast and much more. Each dish is prepared with the finest ingredients from Japan. Sushi takeout and islandwide sushi delivery available online. Akashi, 290 Orchard Rd, #B1-01/02 Paragon Shopping Centre, Singapore 238859, Tel: (+65) 6735 8887, www.instagram.com/akashi.sg En Sushi: fresh sashimi and sushi rolls Image credit: En Sushi via Instagram A trendy and contemporary Japanese restaurant, En Sushi features a wide variety of sushi, sashimi, donburi, maki, handrolls and yaki (grill). Whether you’re craving a classic California Maki, an Unagi Avocado Hand Roll or Grilled Salmon Mentai, En Sushi promises fresh, premium ingredients at an affordable price. Sushi takeout and islandwide sushi delivery available with minimum order of $90. En Sushi, 112 Middle Road, #01-00B Midland House, Singapore 188970, Tel: (+65) 6259 8548, www.ensushisg.com Ginza Sushi Ichi: One Michelin star sushi in Singapore Image credit: Ginza Sushi Ichi Singapore via Facebook Nestled in Singapore Marriott Tang Plaza Hotel, Ginza Sushi Ichi is a sushi restaurant with one MICHELIN star. While the sushi here is quite significantly pricer than most places, you can rest assured that you will get your money’s worth. They offer omakase, but the most affordable set is at lunch at $130 per person and includes an appetiser, 10 pieces of nigiri sushi, sushi roll, miso soup and dessert. Sushi takeout is available if you order one day in advance. Ginza Sushi Ichi, 320 Orchard Road, #01-04, Singapore Marriott Tang Plaza Hotel, Singapore 238865, Tel: (+65) 6235 5514, www.facebook.com/ginzasushiichisg GOGO Sushi: sushi takeout Image credit: Sushi Express Singapore When you’re in a hurry but need to grab a quick meal, GOGO Express offers a wide range of sushi, bentos, and handrolls to go! Get an affordable mini eight-piece sushi platter. And keep a lookout for their ever-changing sushi deals and promos for affordable sushi. Their sushi platters are perfect for a birthday party! Sushi takeout and sushi delivery are available on Foodpanda and Grab. GOGO Sushi, multiple locations in Singapore including Bishan, Hougang, Sengkang, www.gogosushinow.com Read more: Guide To Sengkang Grand Mall Hei Sushi: halal sushi restaurant conveyor belt Image credit: Hei Sushi via Instagram Hei Sushi is the world’s first halal-certified sushi conveyor belt restaurant. As an arm of the Sakae Sushi group, they bring quality sushi and Japanese dishes in a casual dining concept for the whole family. Their sushi party platters are great for celebrations at home! You can also get Hei Sushi delivered right to your doorstep. Hei Sushi , multiple locations in Singapore including Downtown East, Woodlands Civic Centre, Jurong East delivery.heisushi.com Read more: Halal Restaurants & Cafes In Singapore Ichiban Sushi: Cheap sushi in Singapore Image credit: Ichiban Sushi Singapore via Instagram Looking to take the kids to a casual Japanese restaurant? Ichiban Sushi offers affordable set meals. Whether you’re craving Japanese Katsu Curry, Gyu Teriyaki Don or Salmon Belly Mentai Sushi, you’ll be able to satisfy every sushi craving here. Sushi takeout and delivery available via their website, Foodpanda and Deliveroo. Ichiban Sushi, multiple locations in Singapore including Bukit Panjang, Hougang, Sengkang, Jurong East, www.ichibansushi.com.sg/en Itacho Sushi: Handmade sushi & Japanese food Image credit: Itacho Sushi SG via Instagram Itacho Sushi has been making delicious sushi since 2009. From handrolls to creative sushi rolls, sashimi and more, Itacho Sushi has every kind of Japanese food you can think of! Each sushi is lovingly hand-made to order to ensure you get the freshest ingredients and the best sushi on your plate. Sushi takeout and sushi delivery available through GrabFood and Deliveroo. Itacho Sushi, multiple locations in Singapore including Jewel, Orchard, Novena, Bishan (sushi takeaway), www.itachosushi.com.sg Kotobuki: Fresh seafood & sushi rolls Image credit: Kotobuki Having been around since 1981, Kotobuki sets the bar for authentic, fresh Japanese food in Singapore, with yummy bento boxes and noodles in addition to sushi and sashimi. They even have a Japanese school menu that offers typical bento meals that students would eat in Japan. Islandwide delivery is free for orders over $80, or a flat fee of $8 for sushi orders below $80. Kotobuki , 3 Yuan Ching Road, #01-02A, Singapore 618642, kotobuki.com.sg Maetomo Restaurant & Bar: Sushi restaurant Image credit: Maetomo Restaurant via Instagram Be transported to Hokkaido with Maetomo’s many options native to the Japanese island, from fresh sashimi to hairy crab and summer truffles on rice! The quality selections are well worth the splurge if you’re feeling a little celebratory. Make sure you check out their Facebook page for special off-menu bento sets. Sushi orders can be placed over the phone, with delivery available in central, southeast, and southwest areas of Singapore. Free sushi delivery for orders over $150. Maetomo Restaurant & Bar , 39 Scotts Road, Sheraton Towers Hotel, #01-01 Singapore 228230, Tel: (+65) 6219 3990, maetomo-restaurant.sg Rakuichi: Sushi rolls Image credit: Rakuichi Japanese Restaurant via Facebook This Japanese spot in Dempsey offers colourful, inventive maki rolls (like the Rakuichi–soft shell crab wrapped in avocado and raw fish), sashimi, Aburi Spicy Tuna, delicious grilled meat skewers, and a Salmon bento lunch set for just $48! Order sushi delivery via Deliveroo or walk in for sushi takeaways. Rakuichi Japanese Restaurant , 10 Dempsey Road #01-22, Singapore 247700 and 1 Seletar Road #02-12, Singapore 80701, www.facebook.com/rakuichirestaurant Read more: Restaurants Where Kids Eat Free in Singapore SUN with MOON: Japanese dining & cafe Image credit: Sun with Moon We love the dinner and lunch sets at this Orchard Road mainstay, along with their special sushi rolls. Really you’re just spoilt for choice–there are six kinds of salmon sushi preparations, for instance. Available for direct orders (they’ve even got takeaway Sake) and via Foodpanda and Deliveroo. Sun with Moon , 501 Orchard Road, #03-15, Wheelock Place, Singapore 238880, Tel: (+65) 6733 6636, www.sunwithmoon.com.sg Read more: Best Lunch Spots & Lunch Deals In Singapore Sushi Sato: Omakase in Singapore Image credit: Sushi Sato via Instagram When you dine at Sushi Sato, you get to indulge in authentic Japanese cuisine surrounded by the lush greenery of Dempsey Hill. This fine-dining lunch experience starts at $168 for an appetiser and sashimi, 10 pieces of Nigiri, a handroll, soup and dessert. Thanks to Chef Sato’s connection with the best suppliers in Japan, you’ll get to eat rare produce reserved only for the best sushi restaurants. Not the cheapest sushi in town but one for special occasions! Sushi Sato, 6B Dempsey Road, Singapore 247662, Tel: (+65) 6971 8265, sushi-sato.com Sushi Yujo: Omakase restaurant in Singapore Image credit: Sushi Yuju via Instagram When you step into Sushi Yujo, you’re transported into a different world, one that revolves around authentic Japanese flavours created from premium ingredients. The dinner omakase menu features the Chef’s seasonal signatures like the hairy crab served in whole yuzu or Awabi abalone with house-made liver sauce. Book a table here for a fine dining experience. Sushi takeout is available for online orders. Sushi Yujo, 165 Tanjong Pagar Road, Amara Hotel, #02-26, Singapore 088539, Tel: (+65) 8877 8831, www.sushiyujo.sg Umi Sushi: Cheap sushi in Singapore Image credit: Umi Sushi via Instagram You can get sushi for as cheap as $1 per box (on selected days) at Umi Sushi! This is a great grab-and-go option if you’re looking for a quick sushi takeout during your lunch break, or even if the kids just need a quick snack. For a more filling option, opt for donburi (rice bowl), Japanese bento or a sushi platter. Sushi takeout and islandwide sushi delivery are available with a minimum order of $30. Umi Sushi, multiple locations in Singapore including Ang Mo Kio, Changi, Sengkang, Holland Village www.umisushi.com.sg Conveyor Belt Sushi Restaurants in Singapore: Sakae Sushi: Classic conveyor belt sushi Image credit: Sakae Sushi SG via Instagram Think ‘sushi in Singapore’ and Sakae Sushi will probably come to mind. The award-winning conveyor belt sushi restaurant group is probably what started our love for Japanese food here in SG! Their value-for-money sushi options and dishes are available on Foodpanda and on their e-store. Best of all, they offer islandwide sushi delivery! Sakae Sushi , 217 E Coast Rd, #01-01, Singapore 428915, www.sakaedelivery.com Genki Sushi: conveyor belt sushi train Image credit: Genki Sushi Singapore via Facebook Genki Sushi needs no introduction because they have 22 sushi restaurants in Singapore! Genki Sushi is best known for the conveyor belt sushi, where a train that looks like Japan’s famous speed trains delivers food right to your table. Dig into Aburi Sushi, a variety of Handrolls, fresh sashimi and more. Islandwide sushi delivery available with a minimum order of $35 and sushi delivery fees from $5. Genki Sushi, multiple locations in Singapore including Tampines, Bishan, Jurong East, Bugis, Orchard, www.genkisushi.com.sg Sushi Express: Cheap conveyor belt sushi Image credit: Sushi Express via Facebook Sushi Express is the place to go if you’re looking for affordable sushi from $1.50++ per plate. From cute bento boxes to sushi party platters and unique Korean-inspired creations like Kimchi Tamagoyaki, there’s a great variety of sushi that will satisfy every palate. Sushi delivery via Food Panda and Grab Food. Sushi Express, multiple locations in Singapore including Orchard, Jurong East, Bukit Panjang, sushiexpress.com.sg Sushiro Sushi: Affordable sushi in Singapore Image credit: @princesssamantha via Sushiro Sushi’s Instagram Sushiro is Japan’s #1 conveyor belt sushi chain, and our kids adore the fresh sushi here! The sushi is very affordable and there’s a wide variety–everything from Shrimp with Avocado to Grilled Eel, Seared Bonito, Pickled Yellowtail and lots of different salmon sushi. It’s one of those sushi restaurants where you can let the kids go wild selecting dishes without worrying too much about the bill, so for that reason we reckon it’s one of the best sushi restaurants in Singapore! Sushiro’s value-for-money sushi platters are available for islandwide delivery (through Foodpanda and Deliveroo). Sushiro Sushi , multiple locations in Singapore including Tiong Bahru, Woodlands, Orchard, Jewel, www.instagram.com/sushirosingapore Sushi Tei: conveyor belt sushi Image credit: Sushi Tei via Facebook Sushi Tei manages to balance low prices with fresh, tasty fish and a massive sushi menu. There’s always some sort of special or promotion on such as member’s deals and l unchtime deals . For islandwide sushi delivery, Sushi Tei is available on all the major food delivery platforms. Sushi Tei , multiple locations in Singapore including Changi Jewel, Holland Village, Jurong East and Serangoon, www.sushitei.com Closed Sushi Restaurants In Singapore: Sens Dining (Closed) Image credit: Sens Dining via Instagram SENS Sushi in Holland Village boasts four incoming cargo shipments with fresh produce straight from Japan. They take traditional Japanese cuisine and transform it with an innovative spin. Look for super fresh imported specials like Striped Mackerel or Sea Bream; our kids also love the yummy garlic fried rice. There’s always something for the whole family. For sushi delivery, look for them on Food Panda, Deliveroo and GrabFood. Sushi Jiro (Closed) Image credit: Sushi Jiro via Facebook Sushi Jiro at PARKROYAL COLLECTION Marina Bay offers an exquisite sushi dining experience and promises premium ingredients for every dish. Indulge in an omakase course, assorted sashimi like ika, salmon, uni and more, or order a rice bowl for a more filling option. To make sure that you get to enjoy the freshest sushi, only dine-ins are available as Sushi Jiro does not offer sushi delivery. Unkai Sushi: omakase experience Image credit: Unkai Sushi via Instagram If you want to get real fancy, perhaps for a big birthday celebration or a special date night, head over to Unkai Sushi in Tanglin for fine Japanese cuisine. Feast on a gourmet multi-course menu with premium sashimi, a variety of donburi bowls and omakase creations that will blow you away. Since this is a unique dining experience, Unkai Sushi does not offer sushi delivery. articles.title: Where To See Dinosaurs In Singapore: Dinosaur Parks, FREE Dino Playgrounds & More!
articles.author: Sassy Mama
articles.content: Looking for where to find dinosaurs in Singapore? Little dinosaur fans will roar with excitement when you take them to these dinosaur playgrounds, dinosaur museums and dinosaur parks in Singapore! Looking for dinosaur parks in Singapore for your little dino fan at home? From dinosaur parks like Dinoland in Yishun and Jurassic Park at USS, to free dinosaur playgrounds in Singapore– we list all the best places to find T-rex skeletons, life-sized dinosaurs that make real dinosaur sounds, and dino fossils in Singapore! Some of these dinosaur parks have dinosaur rides, plus there’s a dinosaur-themed food hall with shows, exhibits with animatronic dinosaurs that roar, and even virtual dinosaur experiences. We break down all the places where you can bring the kids to see dinosaurs in Singapore! Read more: Where To See Wild Animals In Singapore: Crocodiles, Dolphins, Otters & More Jump to: – Pop-up Dinosaur parks in Singapore – Permanent Dinosaur parks & exhibits in Singapore – FREE Dinosaur playgrounds in Singapore Pop-up Dinosaur Parks, Exhibitions & Experiences in Singapore: NEW! Jurassic World: The Experience in Cloud Forest Image credit: Aida Hamid This is the latest dinosaur park in Singapore to turn heads! You can now rub shoulders with life-sized dinosaurs at Gardens by The Bay, because Jurassic World: The Experience lands at the misty landscapes of Cloud Forest on 29 May 2025! There are plenty of exciting zones and interactive exhibits that you can look forward to, including an 8.5m tall Brachiosaurus (that’s almost three stories high!), a life-sized animatronic Tyrannosaurus rex, a Petting Zoo area with baby dinosaurs and more! Look forward to more than 72,000 plants and over 50 species that date back to prehistoric times. Many of these plants once thrived alongside dinosaurs. Plus, don’t miss the exclusive Evolution Walk experience, where you can travel back in time to learn about ancient plant species that existed long before the flower-bearing plants you see today. When: From 29 May 2025, 9am – 9pm Where: Cloud Forest at Gardens by the Bay, 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953 Price to see dinosaurs: $26 per adult and $22 per child. Get tickets here. COMING SOON! Dinos Alive: Dinosaur exhibition in Singapore Image credit: Dinos Alive There’s a new dinosaur exhibition coming to town and it’s going to be an immersive one that really takes you back to a time when these magnificent reptiles ruled! At Dinos Alive: An Immersive Experience, you’ll journey through the Triassic, Jurassic and Cretaceous periods and see over 80 dinosaur replicas that move. You’ll meet all your favourites: the T-Rex, Stegosaurus, Ankylosaurus, velociraptors and more–all life-sized. This dinosaur exhibition in Singapore also includes a giant virtual aquarium, where you can observe prehistoric marine life. Want something even more realistic? Check out the VR experience at Dinos Alive! Kids will also get to become palaeontologists and become dinosaur tamers at the “Budding experts” interactive experience. When: TBA Where: TBA Price to see dinosaurs: TBA – Join the waitlist here ! Permanent Dinosaur Parks, Exhibitions & Experiences In Singapore: NEW! Ancient Waters & Conquering Land at Singapore Oceanarium (opening 23 July) Image credit: Resorts World Sentosa What’s possibly cooler than dinosaurs in Singapore? Marine dinos! The Singapore Oceanarium (former S.E.A. Aquarium) is back, and it’s three times bigger than before. We’re super excited about the Ancient Waters and Conquering Land Zone that spotlights prehistoric ocean creatures and living fossils! There’ll be replicas of prehistoric marine creatures as well as life-sized animatronics. The S ingapore Oceanarium opens on 23 July 2025, so stay tuned for more info on its prehisotric zone. When: Opening 23 July 2025 Where: Singapore Oceanarium, Resorts World Sentosa How much: TBA Read more: Guide To Singapore Oceanarium: Zones, Opening Dates & More NEW! clubFACE: Dino Putt dinosaur golf Image credit: Cherilyn Gan Mini golf with dinosaurs? We’re here for it! Bring the little ones to Dino Putt at clubFACE to see dinosaurs in Jurong. This 18-hole putting golf course has dinosaurs waiting for you at every corner, including animatronic ones to make you feel like you’re in a dinosaur resort in Singapore! Spot all your faves such as the T-Rex, Pterodactylus, Brachiosaurus, Stegosaurus and more. You can also hop onto Dino Rides to explore the whole dino golf course in a fun way! Take your pick from a Triceratops, Parasaurolophus and more. Just be sure to lather on sunscreen and stay hydrated because this mini golf course is not sheltered. When: Open daily, 10am – 11pm Where: clubFACE, 511 Upper Jurong Road, #02-05, Singapore 638366 Price to see dinosaurs: 18-hole golf from $12/child & $25/adult; Dinosaur rides from $3 – more info here . NEW! Wan To Play @ T3: Dinosaur playground Singapore Image credit: Wan To Play via Facebook Bring the kids for lots of wholesome dino fun at the new Wan To Play indoor playground at Changi Airport Terminal 3. Toddlers can dig in at the kinetic sand pit, while older kids head straight for the slide that lands in a giant ball pit. Don’t miss the giant pink T-Rex – it’s a great photo op. There’s also a merry-go-round to keep the little ones busy, plus role-play areas and battery-operated cars for kids to take for a spin around the indoor track. For those with energy to spare, the rock climbing wall is a solid bet. When: Friday – Saturday, 10am – 9pm; Monday – Friday 10am – 8pm Where: Changi Airport Terminal 3, 65 Airport Boulevard, B2 North, #B2-14-18, Singapore 819663 Price to see dinosaurs: $18 for a one-hour pass; $35 for a two-hour pass – more info here . Dinoland: Yishun Dinosaur park Image credit: Dinoland Facebook Dinoland Singapore at SAFRA Yishun offers kids the largest display of life-sized animatronics dinosaurs in an indoor air-con forest trail. The 1.5 hour guided tour at this dinosaur adventure park starts with getting dressed as a ranger, then get stuck into hands-on activities such as fossil digging and climbing through an underground cave. At Dinoland Yishun, you’ll be able to get up close with these different types of life-sized dinosaurs at Dinoland too. There are over 20 dinosaurs at this Singapore dinosaur park so you can learn about the Tyrannosaurus Rex, Brontosaurus, Pterodactyl, Triceratops, Velociraptor and more. Do note for little ones – the animatronic dinosaurs at Dinoland are super realistic and can be quite loud so warn them in advance! When: Saturday – Sunday, PH & School Holidays , 10am – 8pm; Tuesday – Friday, 5pm – 8pm (Closed Mondays) Where: Dinoland, SAFRA Yishun, 60 Yishun Ave 4, #02-01, Singapore 769027 Price to see dinosaurs: $35 per Dinoland ticket. Dinoland tickets on sale now for $32. (SAFRA members get additional 10% off Dinoland entry). Get tickets here . Lee Kong Chian Natural History Museum: Singapore Dinosaur museum Image credit: Lee Kong Chian Natural History Museum via Facebook Did you know you could see real dinosaur fossils in Singapore? The best place for your kids to learn about dinosaurs in Singapore is the Lee Kong Chian Natural History Museum. This Singapore dinosaur museum has a Dinosaur Zone which features three real diplodocid sauropod fossils that were among the largest and heaviest animals to ever walk on land. These fossils dwarf even the biggest theropods such as the Tyrannosaurs. The dinosaur fossils at Lee Kong Chian Natural History Museum are estimated to be between 149 and 156 million years old and are more than 80% complete. Two of the dinosaur skeletons come with skulls which we are told is a rarity! When: Tuesday – Sunday, 10am– 6pm (Closed Mondays) Where: Lee Kong Chian Natural History Museum, National University of Singapore 2 Conservatory Drive, Singapore Price to see dinosaurs: Singapore Residents $17/adult, $9/child; Standard Rates $24/adult, $15/child – Get tickets here . Read more: Guide To Kid-Friendly Museums & Exhibitions In Singapore Jurassic Park USS: Dinosaur adventure park with rides Image credit: Universal Studios Singapore Looking for a dinosaur adventure park in Singapore? Take a step back in time into the world of dinosaurs in Singapore at The Lost World in Universal Studios Singapore . Home to Singapore’s very own Jurassic Park, this dinosaur park features lots of adrenaline-fuelled fun for dino lovers. Three USS rides are of note; the Canopy Flyer for a prehistoric bird’s eye view of Jurassic Park, Dino-Soarin’ where kids can ride on the back of flying Pteranodons, and the Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure for a thrilling river raft ride through dinosaur habitats – expect to get soaked! You can even meet a Velociraptor from Jurassic World at the Raptor Encounter and watch a baby raptor hatch from its egg. When: Monday – Saturday, 10am – 7pm; Sunday 10am – 8pm Where: Universal Studios Singapore, 8 Sentosa Gateway, 098269 Price to see dinosaurs: Entry to USS: $76/adult & $59/child for Singapore residents – Get tickets here . KidsSTOP Singapore: Dig up dinosaur fossils Image credit KidsSTOP – Digging for dinosaur fossils. The Dino Pit at KidsSTOP (part of Science Centre Singapore ) is a must-visit for budding palaeontologists! Preschoolers and little ones love taking off their socks and getting stuck in the sand here while they dig out dinosaur fossils. Designed to provide kids with a memorable sensory experience, this Dino Pit activity will have your kids identifying the different parts of dinosaur fossils, as they role-play at being a palaeontologist. There’s also an interactive board that booms out dinosaur facts to test your kids’ knowledge about these prehistoric creatures. When: Tuesday – Sunday 10am – 1pm, 2pm – 5pm (Closed Mondays) Where: KidsSTOP, 21 Jurong Town Hall Rd, Singapore 609433 Price to see dinosaurs: KidsSTOP entry from $20/adult & $10/child – Get tickets here . Jewel-rassic Quest: Dinosaur AR Experience Image credit: Jewel Dinosaur lovers will be excited to know that you can even see dinosaurs in Singapore at Jewel Changi Airport ’s Jewel-rassic Quest! This dinosaur-themed augmented reality experience takes you back 89 million years to the Cretaceous period. Kids aged 6 years old and above can look for augmented reality dinosaurs with a TimeLens. Hunt through Shiseido Forest Valley and Canopy Park and see if you can spot the dinosaurs. Complete the mission and participate in activities and games. When: Daily, 10:30am – 5:30pm Where: Jewel-rassic Quest, Jewel Changi Airport Level 1 Concierge, 78 Airport Boulevard Price to see dinosaurs: From $18 – get tickets here . DinoVenture: VR dinosaurs in Singapore Image credit: Klook DinoVenture is a Virtual Reality ride at Sentosa that’s great for some family dino fun. All you have to do is don your VR headset, sit back and relax as the ride takes you through a rugged jungle filled with dinosaurs on the hunt. You’ll experience a rush as the ride zooms through the prehistoric world. Take note, though, that the ride is only about seven minutes long, so do check out the other attractions at Sentosa when planning a day here. When: Open daily, 10am – 10pm (last ride at 9.40pm) Where: Beach Station, Sentosa Price to see dinosaurs: $15 per ticket – get tickets here . Amazonia Singapore: Woolly Mammoth & dinosaurs Image credit: Amazonia Singapore Amazonia Singapore may not be a dinosaur park per se, but you can spot some dinosaurs and a Wooly Mammoth at this indoor playground ! It’s more ice-age than a dinosaur playground, and kids can’t quite interact with the prehistoric creatures here, but lots of fun nonetheless if you’re looking for dinosaurs in Singapore. When: Sunday – Friday, 9.30am – 7.30pm; Saturday 9.30am – 9pm Where: Amazonia Singapore, Great World Price to see dinosaurs: From $28.80 (inclusive of 1 adult and minimum of 2.5 hours play) – get tickets here . FREE Dinosaur Playgrounds & Exhibits In Singapore: Changi Jurassic Mile: 20 Dinosaurs in Singapore (FREE!) Image credit: Changi Airport Group Head over to Changi Jurassic Mile for Singapore’s largest permanent outdoor display of 20 different types of life-sized dinosaurs. This one-kilometre dino-themed adventure park has a cycling and jogging track along the 3.5km Changi Airport Connector path that links the Jewel Changi Airport to East Coast Park and the Park Connector Network (PCN). Look out for the Tyrannosaurus Rex, dinosaur eggs, the Brontosaurus and the bright blue Velociraptors. Handy information panels show facts about these dinosaurs along that path while outdoor speakers play safari-themed music for the complete Jurassic Park-style experience. Full deets here. If you are heading to the Changi Jurassic Mile with little dinosaur-fan kiddos, do be warned that it is a walk of 2 km from HUB & SPOKE car park to the start of Jurassic Mile (which is a one-kilometre path)! So you may want to bring scooters or cycle instead. When: Open 24 hours daily Where: Changi Jurassic Mile, Airport Boulevard (alight at Changi Airport Terminal 4, Car Park 4A and follow signage). Deets here. Price to see dinosaurs: Free! Causeway Point Dinosaur Water Playground (FREE!) Image credit: Causeway Point The playground at Causeway Point is not only a water playground , it’s dinosaur-themed! There’s a 2.2m hollow dinosaur rib cage with water jets, a Toddler Dino Zone, Adventure Volcano and Crater Zone, two long slides (best for kids age 5 and up!), giant rocks and even a mist-spraying volcano that ‘erupts’! In the evening, this dinosaur park wet play area even lights up in cool neon colours. Watch the video here for a sneak peek before you go! Entry to this wet play dinosaur park in Singapore is free and no pre-booking is required, however, do note that each entry is limited to an hourly session of 45 minutes of playtime and 15 minutes of changing time. When: Open daily, 10.30am – 9pm Where: Causeway Point, 1 Woodlands Square Level 7, Singapore 738099 Price to see dinosaurs: Free! Read more: Best Water Playgrounds & Water Parks In Singapore Jurassic Nest dinosaur food hall at Gardens by the Bay (FREE Entry!) Image credit: Jurassicnestsg via Instagram Jurassic Nest is a dinosaur-themed food hall in Gardens by the Bay , Singapore. You’ll find 18 dinosaurs at Jurassic Nest at Supertree Grove including a Tyrannosaurus Rex and Brachiosaurus, the two fiercest and tallest dinosaurs which will come alive roaring (for approximately three minutes each time). Catch the dinosaur ‘show’ with free admission every hour from 11:30pm to 8:30pm. This dinosaur-themed food court is where you’ll also find Michelin-starred brands serving up a range of Asian cuisine from Hawker Chan’s Chicken Rice and Tsuta Ramen to Mama by Putien. There’s also an outdoor alfresco area JN Café, where you can see an Oviraptor that comes alive nine times a day at hourly intervals from 11.30am to 8.30pm. In between, catch 15 other static dinosaurs from the Velociraptor and Dilong Paradoxus to the Corythosaurus and Parasaurolophus, scattered across the food hall while you dine on your favourite foods. Pssst! Don’t miss the new educational trail that takes you around the gardens on a prehistoric adventure to learn more about the unique diets of herbivorous dinosaurs! When: Jurassic Nest Cafe: 9am – 9pm, Mon to Sun; Jurassic Nest Food Hall: 11am – 9pm, Mon to Sun (last order at 8:30pm) Animatronic dinosaurs ‘shows’ : Alfresco Area 11:30am º 8:30pm (hourly); Dining Hall (Indoor) 12pm – 9pm (hourly) Where: Jurassic Nest, 18 Marina Gardens Drive #01-02, Singapore 018953 Price to see dinosaurs: free to enter. Food priced individually from $8.80 to $10 per dish. More info here . Kim Keat Dinosaur Playground at Toa Payoh (FREE!) Image credit: Ton Yong Lin via Flickr You’ll find dinosaurs in Singapore at this super old-school heartland outdoor playground ! The Kim Keat Dinosaur Playground in front of Block 27, Kim Keat Avenue, features two dinosaurs that are probably the oldest dinosaurs in Singapore. They were installed by sculpture specialists Hong Hai Environmental Arts in 2000. The gigantic, three-metre-tall Tyrannosaurus rex is at the centre of this Toa Payohh dinosaur playground surrounded by white dinosaur eggs with a baby T-rex nearby. Kids can’t really interact with these dinosaurs, but there’s some play equipment nearby with a small slide, activity panel and climbing handholds. When: Open 24 hours daily Where : Toa Payoh Dinosaur Playground, Block 27 Toa Payoh East, Singapore 310027 Price to see dinosaurs: Free! Fu Shan Garden Dinosaur playground (FREE!) Image credit: Playpoint Asia If your kids want to get up close and personal with dinosaurs in Singapore, head over to the dinosaur slides and stone dinosaur sculptures at the free-to-enter dinosaur playground Fu Shan Garden. Kids can clamber all over the dinosaurs here unlike at other dinosaur installations. Can you find the dimetrodon, sauropod, pteranodon, triceratops, and tyrannosaurus rex? There are tunnels to explore and some newer additions to this dinosaur playground include the colourful wooden stegosaurus and triceratops with hollowed-out tummies to hide in. When: Open 24 hours daily Where: Fu Shan Garden, 81 Woodlands Street 81, Singapore 730827 Price to see dinosaurs: Free! Read more: Best FREE Outdoor Playgrounds In Singapore Sky Terrace @ Our Tampines Hub: Lone dinosaur (FREE!) Image credit: Jessica Fang We found a lone dinosaur at the Level 2 Sky Terrace free outdoor playground at Our Tampines Hub! While not exactly a dinosaur playground, it’s a cute dino surprise for kiddos who love these prehistoric creatures. The dinosaur is a realistic-looking raptor and is “trudging” amongst the vines where you’ll also find giant fruits. Kids cannot interact with the raptor, but the sheltered playground has plenty of space for running around and small play structures that offer lots of fun with a dinosaur in presence! When: Open 24 hours daily Where: Level 2 Sky Terrace, Our Tampines Hub, 1 Tampines Walk, Singapore 528523 Price to see dinosaurs: Free! Closed dinosaur parks in Singapore: Roarr! Dinosaur Adventure Park 2.0 at Marina Square (Closed) Image credit: Kiki Tjai Roarr! Dinosaur Adventure Park 2.0 at Let’s Play @ Marina Square is a pop-up for kiddos with plenty of thrilling activities. Journey through a spectacular Jurassic world featuring life-sized animatronic dinosaurs at this Marina Square dinosaur park. Older kids can get competitive with arcade and PlayStation 4 games, while younger ones can ride on an adventure car to explore the dinosaurs in the forest, jump into a dinosaur-themed ball pit and bounce around on dinosaur inflatables.They can even put on their thinking caps and pretend to be a palaeontologist to dig up dinosaur fossils in the sand pit. Plus, snap photos with the giant dinosaurs to remember this exciting dinosaur adventure with the kids! Every effort has been taken to ensure details are correct. However, as venues may close without warning, it’s always best to check with each venue directly before heading down. articles.title: Where To Find the Best Birthday Cakes In Singapore: Unicorn Cakes, Ice Cream Cakes, Halal Cakes & More
articles.author: Sassy Mama
articles.content: On the never-ending quest for the best kids’ birthday cakes in Singapore, we’ve rounded up unicorn cakes, halal cakes, ice cream cakes, birthday cakes with names on them, 3D Fondant cakes and more! Looking for the best birthday cakes in Singapore for your little one’s upcoming birthday party ? Whether it’s for a discerning kiddo or something a bit more adult, there’s a huge range of birthday cakes in Singapore to choose from. We’ve separated the wheat from the chaff (or the eggs from the flour, as the case may be) to highlight some of our personal faves. Bear in mind that this list of where to get birthday cakes in Singapore is not exhaustive , in fact, there are loads of home bakers across the island (many of them hard-working mamas) who can hook you up. Now all you need to do is host the party at home (or find a good party venue), decide if you need a party entertainer or magician, organise party games, send out invites and you’re all set! Also, check out these great birthday deals in Singapore while you’re at it! Jump to: – Customised cakes and personalised kids’ birthday cakes – Halal cakes – Gluten-free cakes & dairy-free cakes – Off-the-shelf cakes Read more: Best Kids’ Birthday Party Venues Where to get a birthday cake in Singapore Pinch Bakehouse: Halal-certified birthday cakes Image credit: Pinch Bakehouse The bakers at Pinch Bakehouse believe that birthday cakes should be the star of the party. They deliver mind-blowing flavours in a fun, playful package, while keeping your health and dietary needs in mind. Just because the birthday child has dietary restrictions doesn’t mean that they can’t enjoy a sweet treat! Choose from a wide range of sugar-free, allergen-free and halal cakes to suit your party’s dietary preferences. Pinch Bakehouse also has choices to delight the grown-ups, such as the classic Ondeh Ondeh Cake, which is available as a gorgeous customised birthday cake. Want extra treats for the party? Pinch Bakehouse also has brownies, cupcakes, cake pops and macarons! Price of customised birthday cake in Singapore: $158 – $568 Pinch Bakehouse, 218 Pandan Loop #05-09, Singapore 128408, Tel: (+65) 8380 6722, www.pinchbakehouse.com Bob The Baker Boy: Over 400 designs & custom-made cakes Image credit: Bob the Baker Boy Bob the Baker Boy, a persona created by the founder, MayEe, is fond of moist and cottony-soft cakes using natural ingredients. Bob the Baker Boy’s cakes are lower in sugar than many regular birthday cakes in Singapore, so you won’t have to worry about the sugar crash after the party! Choose from their extensive menu of customisable birthday cakes featuring over 400 past designs including Blue and White Ombre Anna and Elsa Snowflakes Cake for Frozen fans, a Cocomelon Bus Themed Birthday Cake for friends of JJ and more. Bob the Baker Boy can even accommodate any request for the perfect children’s birthday cake; all you have to do is submit a request online. With their truly Insta-worthy birthday cakes in Singapore, it’s no wonder they have over 1,000 five-star Google reviews from happy customers. Price of customised birthday cake in Singapore: $118 – $498.90 Bob the Baker Boy , 218 Pandan Loop, Xpace@218 05-06, Singapore 128408, Tel: (+65) 8380 6722, www.bobthebakerboy.com Henri Charpentier: Elegant French-inspired birthday cakes Image credit: Henri Charpentier If you’re looking for a classier birthday cake in Singapore, Henri Charpentier is where you want to go. A French-inspired bakery selling financiers, madeleines, petits gâteaux assortis (assorted little cakes) and more, Henri Charpentier designs minimalistic birthday cakes in Singapore for every occasion. Don’t let the simple design fool you, as each cake is meticulously handcrafted and infused with a variety of fresh flavours for a delightful treat. Henri Charpentier’s Fresh Cream Birthday Cake is light, airy, and made with the finest ingredients, offering a melt-in-your-mouth experience. The Chantilly Fraise is adorned with fresh strawberries and their signature fresh cream, creating a harmonious balance of flavours. The Shortcake, topped with strawberries, blueberries, and their signature fresh cream, is another popular choice that highlights the freshness and deliciousness of the ingredients used. Price of birthday cake in Singapore: $31.40 – $220 Henri Charpentier, six locations in Singapore including Orchard Central, PLQ, Ngee Ann City, Great World, 100AM, and VivoCity, www.henricharpentier.oddle.me Bloomsbury Bakers: Customised birthday cakes made from scratch Image credit: Bloomsbury Bakers Each birthday only happens once in a lifetime, so your little one certainly deserves a memorable birthday cake to celebrate another year around the sun. Since every child is different, Bloomsbury Bakers specialises in customised birthday cakes in Singapore. With a repertoire of hundreds of designs for kids’ birthday cakes, you’re sure to find one that will put a smile on your child’s face. From mermaids to unicorns, dinosaurs, transport vehicles and more, there are plenty of designs to choose from. Bloomsbury Bakers make birthday cakes in small batches from scratch with high quality ingredients including Danish butter, sustainably sourced cocoa power and French chocolate without additional preservatives or additives, so you know you’ll be giving your child the best. Price of birthday cake in Singapore: from $40 onwards Enjoy free delivery for orders above $200! Bloomsbury Bakers, 30 Bendemeer Road #01-889 Singapore 330030, WhatsApp: (+65) 8308 9396, www.bloomsburybakers.com Abite Atelier: Kid’s birthday cakes & event planner Image credit: Abite Atelier This jack-of-all-trades event planning group does everything from conceptualising dreamy parties to creating gorgeous cakes. Abite Atelier can accommodate pretty much any cake design request (we’ve seen cool Paw Patrol birthday cakes, whimsical mermaid cakes, and lots of pretty floral cakes for adults or too-cool teens), all freshly baked in their NEA-approved kitchen located at Duxton Hill. Price of customised birthday cake in Singapore: $250 – $388 Abite Atelier , 10A Duxton Hill, Singapore 089594, Tel: (+65) 8499 3463, www.abite.sg Baker’s Brew: Customised birthday cakes Image credit: Baker’s Brew Studio via Instagram The talented bakers at Baker’s Brew are known for their creative customised cakes for every occasion. Whether you’re looking for a kid’s birthday cake or one for a special occasion like Mother’s Day, just say the word and watch them bring your dream to life! They offer islandwide delivery for just $15, as long as you make your order three days in advance. Their classic cakes feature flavours such as Salty Matcha Cake and Gula Melaka Salted Egg Cake, and they also do amazing custom bakes. Price of customised birthday cake in Singapore: $48 – $368 Baker’s Brew , multiple locations in Singapore including Woodlands, Great World, Jurong East, www.bakersbrew.com Read more: Where to Find Party Planners in Singapore Butter Studio: Less-sweet halal birthday cakes Image credit: Butter Studio The team at Butter Studio put a local and playful spin on familiar home-style bakes, taking inspiration from their grandmothers’ recipes to create photo-worthy cakes that will make every birthday celebration picture-perfect! From their award-winning Salted Caramel Red Velvet Cake to the fun Netflix and Chill Cake, all their cakes are halal-certified and made less sweet, without artificial preservatives or stabilisers. You can customise birthday cake or choose a predesigned cake if you’re time-pressed! Price of customised birthday cake in Singapore: $68 – $168 Butter Studio , multiple locations in Singapore including Takashimaya, Bugis Junction, Tampines Mall www.thebutterstudio.com Cake Avenue: Customisable halal birthday cakes Image credit: Cake Avenue via Facebook Cake Avenue specialises in customised birthday cakes for any occasion. Whether it’s a Cocomelon cake or Paw Patrol cake for kids or even a beautiful cake to celebrate your 50th anniversary, this bakery can create any type of cake that you’re looking for. This is also a good bakery to get halal-certified birthday cakes. If you want to do a customised children’s birthday cake design that’s not on their website, simply email them a picture of what you’re looking for, and they’ll respond with a quote. Same-day delivery available with a four-hour notice. Price for customised birthday cake in Singapore: $68 – $185 Cake Avenue , 33 Lor Kilat, #01-01 Kilat Centre, Singapore 598132, Tel: (+65) 6877 9008, www.cakeavenue.com.sg Caked By Seraphina: Vegan birthday cakes available Image credit: Caked by Seraphina Seraphina launched her business to balance her passion for baking with being at home with her two daughters. Not only can Seraphina take any challenge you throw at her – cakes with delicate flowers, intricate piping, moulded fondant – but her cake flavours go way beyond your basic chocolate and vanilla. Some of her 21 flavours offered include White Chocolate Matcha, Black Sesame Honey Cake, Rose Lychee, Chocolate Salted Caramel, and even vegan cake options like Swiss Meringue Buttercream. Price for customised birthday cake in Singapore: $55 – $700 Caked by Seraphina , WhatsApp: (+65) 9672 4583, www.instagram.com/cakedbyseraphina The Cake Shop: Eggless cakes available Image credit: The Cake Shop We love The Cake Shop’s cute 3D fondant cakes! Kids will love the Mario Surprise Knock-Knock birthday cake, the Poke Ball birthday cake and the Unicorn Special birthday cake. They do also offer more economical options like the adorable Sunshine Floral birthday cake. They also offer Eggless Cakes for those with dietary restrictions. Price for customised birthday cake in Singapore: $42 – $168 The Cake Shop , multiple locations in Singapore including Jurong East, City Square Mall, Admiralty, WhatsApp (+65) 9662 0303, www.thecakeshop.com.sg Cake Spade: Customised birthday cakes Image credit: Cake Spade We’ve always loved the clever name of this pretty pink cake shop on Tanjong Pagar Road, and it turns out their birthday cakes are just as colourful and vibrant as their storefront! Cake Spade offers everything from crumbles to cupcakes, brownies and takeaway cake slices. Their customised cakes include both 3D fondant and beautifully piped icing options. They generally recommend ordering a week in advance. Price of customised birthday cake in Singapore: $120 – $238 Cake Spade , 28 Keong Saik Road, Singapore 089135, Tel: (+65) 6444 3868, www.cakespade.com Chubby Bubs: Has dairy-free kid’s birthday cake Image credit: Chubby Bubs Looking for creative children’s birthday cakes in Singapore with stellar ingredients? Chubby Bubs uses only cage-free eggs and unrefined sugar in their cakes and cupcakes (with the exception of the cake decor). Customised dairy-free cakes are available too! Chubby Bubs encourages you to share your cake requirements, ideas and preferences when placing an order so their cake artisans can help to create a work of edible art for your special occasion. Price of customised birthday cake in Singapore: Enquire with the cake shop. Chubby Bubs , The Fernhill, Singapore 259049, Tel: (+65) 9299 1840, www.chubbybubssg.com Creme Maison Bakery: Themed birthday cakes Image credit: Creme Maison via Instagram Looking for something other than a traditional birthday cake? Choose from a range of beautifully decorated cakes, cupcakes, and desserts to complete your celebration. Creme Maison also specialises in customised children’s birthday cakes, whether it’s a Chanel-inspired cake for that teen or a dinosaur-themed birthday cake. Simply reach out to them with your desired cake design and watch them turn it into reality. They offer a cake delivery service, though do note that cupcakes need to be preordered. Price of customised birthday cake in Singapore: $92 – $450 Creme Maison Bakery , 30 Tai Seng Street #08-03C Singapore 534013 Tel: (+65) 8181 3689, www.crememaison.com Edith Patisserie: Birthday cakes with local flavours Image credit: Edith Patisserie Edith Patisserie (home to the bubble tea tart!) is a patisserie dedicated to providing recipes tailored to the local palate – think less sugar, unique flavour pairings, and options for a range of dietary requirements. The Lychee Rose Cake ( pictured above ) is a bestseller, and they also do stunning customised cakes, including the ever-popular Unicorn Cake. Price of customised birthday cake in Singapore: $120 – $360 Edith Patisserie , four locations in Singapore including Tiong Bahru, Dhoby Ghaut, Holland Road and New Bahru, Tel: (65) 6443 7150, www.edithpatisserie.com Fitri Creations: Halal birthday cakes Image credit: Fitri Creations via Facebook Looking for a halal birthday cake? Fitri Creations is a halal bakery in Singapore with a wide range of delicious desserts like cupcakes, birthday cakes, doughnuts, tarts, macarons and brownies! If you’re looking for a colourful birthday cake for your little one, the Rainbow Marshmallow Birthday Cake is sure to satisfy. Or try the Ferrero Rocher Birthday Cake or the Brownies Indulgence Birthday Cake for chocolate fans. Pick up the cake from one of their outlets or request birthday cake delivery for a flat rate of $25. Price of halal birthday cake: $45 – $90 Fitri Creations , 361 Sembawang Crescent, #01-02, Sun Natura, Singapore 750361 & 11 Tanjong Katong Rd, #B1-34/35, Kinex, Singapore 437157, www.fitricreations.com The Frosted Chick: Has rainbow birthday cakes Image credit: The Frosted Chick With easy online ordering, the Frosted Chick specialises in customisable cakes, cupcakes, macarons, cake pops, and other artisanal desserts. The bakery was actually started by two parents who were struggling to bake a cake for their son’s first birthday – how far they have come! The Frosted Chick offers all manner of 3D Fondant cakes, along with personalised cakes with your kiddo’s name. They also have a great selection of ready-made standard birthday cakes, including the ever-popular rainbow cake. Price of customised birthday cake in Singapore: $115 – $330 The Frosted Chick , 41 Opal Cres, Singapore 328428, Tel: (+65) 6969 3368, www.thefrostedchick.com.sg Happy Oven: Halal birthday cakes with local flavours Image credit: Happy Oven via Instagram Happy Oven bakes delicious Halal birthday cakes and pastries. They are known for adding a modern twist to traditional local flavours, so you can choose from a unique range of handmade cakes with local flavours like the Signature Ondeh Ondeh Birthday Cake, Mango Pomelo Birthday Cake or even the Chendol Birthday Cake. If you’re ordering for a chocolate lover, pick up the indulgent Chocolate Ganache Birthday Cake or Black Forest Birthday Cake. Free delivery for orders above $200. Price of birthday cake in Singapore: $25 Happy Oven , 40 Beo Crescent, #01-08, Singapore 160040 and 678 Hougang Avenue 8 #01-505, Singapore 530678, www.happyoven.com.sg HoneyPeachSG Bakery: Customised gourmet birthday cakes Image credit: Honeypeachsg via Instagram Honeypeachsg has everything from beautiful gourmet cakes like a Golden Wings Cake to scrumptious desserts like fudge brownies, macarons, cupcakes, fruit tarts and more! They can also create customised birthday cakes for kids (and adults!) according to your desired cake design or theme. They are not halal-certified, but they do not use lard, alcohol or gelatine in their cakes. For other cakes, the standard three-hour delivery fee is $15. Don’t miss the mouth-watering Sea-Salt Chocolate Salted Caramel Cake! Price of customised birthday cake in Singapore: $148 – $268 Honeypeachsg , 11 Irving Place, #01-01, Singapore 369551, WhatsApp: (+65) 9088 4932, www.honeypeachsg.com LÉLE Bakery: Low-sugar kid’s birthday cakes Image credit: LELE Bakery via Instagram LÉLE Bakery is known for their cute cake designs for all types of occasions like birthdays, weddings, baby showers and more. All birthday cakes are created with a soft chiffon sponge base that is low in sugar but equally delectable. Every cake is carefully made from scratch to make sure that you get the freshest cake for your celebration. From Chi Cha Bubble Tea Drinkable Cake to a Pinata Cake, there’s a birthday cake for everyone. They offer cake delivery at a flat rate of $10 or free delivery for orders above $150. Price of customised birthday cake in Singapore: $98 – $238 LÉLE Bakery , 5 Mandai Link, Mandai Foodlinkm#05-01 Singapore 728654, Tel: (+65) 8776 1510, www.lelebakerysg.com Little House Of Dreams: Themed birthday cakes Image credit: Little House Of Dreams via Instagram This oh-so-pretty shop offers both signature and bespoke cakes along with all manner of other confections like cupcakes, macarons and “bloom pots”. We love that you can order signatures like Fondant Earl Grey and the Over the Rainbow cake online (note that 3 days’ advanced notice is required), while imagination is your only limit when it comes to their absolutely gorgeous custom fondant cakes available in 9 different cake flavours – just be sure to order at least a week ahead of time! Price of customised birthday cake in Singapore: Enquire with the cake shop. Little House of Dreams , www.instagram.com/littlehouseofdreams Miss Muffet: Unique themed birthday cakes Image credit: Miss Muffet If you’re looking for something completely unique and a centrepiece for your party, Anita from Miss Muffet is the person to call. The Sassy Mama team has had the pleasure of diving into one of her delicious cakes, but not before colouring in the edible colouring sheet that wrapped around the cake’s buttercream exterior – a fun idea for kids and families! Price of customised birthday cake in Singapore: $115 – $540 Miss Muffet , WhatsApp: (+65) 8801 0671, www.missmuffetcakeboutique.com Monice Bakes: Kids’ birthday cakes, cupcakes & cookies Image credit: Monice Bakes Got a last-minute request to bring cupcakes to the school fair, or did you forget to buy your co-worker a birthday cake? Monice Bakes does customised cakes, cookies and cupcakes for all occasions, freshly made with quality ingredients with no preservatives or artificial flavourings. We also love that their cakes aren’t too sweet – good news for kids’ birthday parties ! NB : Monice Bakes is not Halal-certified, but there is no pork or lard in any of the ingredients. Price of customised birthday cake in Singapore: Enquire with the cake shop. Monice Bakes , 6 Bedok Reservoir View, The Clearwater, Singapore 479234, Tel: (+ 65) 9815 0022, www.monicebakes.com Plain Vanilla: Affordable birthday cakes Image credit: Plain Vanilla Plain Vanilla makes custom cakes in delectable flavours. Try the Raspberry Vanilla Bean Layer Cake ( pictured ) filled with raspberry compote, frosted with a vanilla bean buttercream and decorated with fresh raspberries! You can even customise your cake with a hand-piped message and your choice of sprinkles. Chocolate lovers can indulge in the Chocolate Truffle Layer Birthday Cake. Plus, don’t miss their signature cupcakes! Price of birthday cake in Singapore: $42 – $68 Plain Vanilla , multiple locations in Singapore including Tiong Bahru, ION Orchard, East Coast, www.plainvanilla.com.sg River Ash Bakery: Character birthday cakes for kids Image credit: River Ash Bakery via Instagram River Ash Bakery specialises in creating trending cakes and customised birthday cakes for kids and grown-ups. From Frozen to Baby Shark, Pokemon, Mario and more, their birthday cakes are sure to put a smile on your child’s face! If you’re in a pinch, they also offer same-day delivery or collection for selected birthday cake designs. Price of customised birthday cake in Singapore: $68 – $268 River Ash Bakery, The Promenade @ Pelikat, 183 Jalan Pelikat #B1-40 Singapore 537643, Tel: (+65) 8700 3352, riverashbakery.com Sinsations By Radhika: Elegant birthday cakes Image credit: Sinsations by Radhika Baking gorgeous cakes in both fondant and buttercream varieties, Radhika is equally adept at making adorable kids’ birthday cakes or elegant floral confections for grown-ups. She offers a variety of delicious cake flavours, including mango, orange ricotta, and Meyer lemon curd, and can also deliver gluten-free, dairy-free, and refined-sugar-free cakes upon request! Price of customised birthday cake in Singapore: Enquire with the cake shop. Sinsations by Radhika , 139 Cavenagh Road, Singapore 229627, Tel: (+65) 9673 4562 www.sinsationsbyradhika.com Susucre: 3D birthday cakes Image credit: Susucre SuSucre has really nailed kids’ birthday cakes (and adult cakes too!). They can literally make anything out of icing, so no request is too silly for your concept. They also offer a wide selection of filling and frosting flavours, and the taste is just as good as the look. Lastly, they’ll deliver your birthday cake to your door at the time they say they will, so you don’t need to stress on party day (any more than you already are!). Price of customised birthday cake in Singapore: Enquire with the cake shop. Susucre , 5 Ontario Ave, Singapore 576193, Tel: (+65) 9867 2176, www.susucre.net Temptations Cakes: Customised 3D birthday cakes Image credit: Temptations Cakes If you’re looking for a 3D birthday cake in Singapore, Temptations , a gourmet bakery in charming Joo Chiat, has a reputation for their delicious special occasion 3D cakes! We’ve had a little peek at their gallery and we’ve seen a few jungle-themed cakes, Captain America’s shield, as well as a variety of Frozen styles. Modern reinventions of classics like a creamy Oreo cheesecake and a fun strawberry shortcake are on the shelves if you don’t have the time for a customised birthday cake. Price of birthday cake in Singapore: $39 – $130 Temptations , 199 Sims Avenue, Singapore 387503, Tel: (+65) 6440 9200, www.temptationscakes.com.sg Whyzee: 1-hour express same-day delivery Image credit: Whyzee via Instagram With more than 100 different cake designs to choose from, Whyzee will surely have a cake to suit! One of their biggest perks is their 1-hour express birthday cake delivery that’s perfect for anyone who may have forgotten to order a birthday cake in advance! Chocolate lovers can enjoy indulgent cakes like the Chocolate Praline Cake or the Chocolate Desire Cake, while those looking for something lighter can opt for the Lavender Earl Grey Cake with aromatic lavender cream infused into each layer of the chiffon cake. Price of birthday cake in Singapore: $48.90 – $188 Whyzee , multiple locations in Singapore including Bugis, Jurong East, Serangoon, Plaza Singapura, www.whyzee.com.sg Halal Birthday Cakes In Singapore Image credit: Sooperlicious Cakes If you have dietary requirements, or your kiddo can only bring Halal-certified cakes or cupcakes into school, these are the top spots to contact. All Things Delicious Cat & The Fiddle Chocolate Origin Del’s Sweetness Delights Fluff Bakery The Malayan Council The Royals Sooperlicious (pictured above) Swee Heng Bakery Swensen’s Gluten-Free Cakes & Dairy-Free Cakes In Singapore Delcie’s Desserts And Cakes Image credit: Delcie’s Desserts and Cakes Known as “The Sensitive Chef”, Delcie launched her business 10 years ago with innovative natural cake recipes that are free of eggs, dairy products, chemicals, and egg-aiding products. Her cakes contain no white cane sugar or honey and are wonderful for diabetics. She also offers specific allergy-free options including soy-free, nut-free, and wheat-free cakes, and even makes a keto cake and special baby cake. She’s basically the go-to cake shop for when you need a ‘free-from’ birthday cake in Singapore! Price of customised birthday cake in Singapore: Enquire with the cake shop. Delcie’s Desserts and Cakes , 34 Whampoa West #01-83, Singapore 330034, Tel: (+65) 6282 2951, www.delcies.com Image credit: Bakening In addition to the above-mentioned cake shops (The Cake Shop and Sinsations by Radhika), other birthday cake bakeries that specialise in allergen-free alternatives (but with fewer kid-centric customisable options) include Bakening ( pictured above ) and Oh My Goodness . Off the Shelf Birthday Cakes in Singapore Image credit: Once Upon a Table Did you leave the party planning to the last minute? Or at least miss the deadline for an OTT custom cake creation? No worries, there are plenty of places to find a birthday cake in Singapore, many of which you can pick up from the shop (some even offer Deliveroo!). With some creative frosting and cake toppers, kiddo will never know the difference (and you’ll have saved yourself some dough!). Here are some of our fave off-the-shelf cakes in Singapore: Awfully Chocolate Bengawan Solo Cat & The Fiddle Cedele Lady M Marks & Spencer Polar Cake PS.Cafe Good luck with the celebrations! articles.title: Fab Restaurants To Book For Father’s Day Singapore 2025
articles.author: Sassy Mama
articles.content: We’ve got some great suggestions of restaurants to book for Father’s Day in Singapore with special menus for Father’s Day dinner or family brunch! Father’s Day in Singapore is on Sunday 15 June 2025, so mark it down peeps! Aside from awesome gifts for Father’s Day , you can also order Dad’s fave ingredients and get cooking at home. But if you’re hoping to outsource the cooking and washing up , then celebrating Father’s Day in Singapore at a restaurant is ideal! We asked lots of sassy Dads for their favourite places to be taken out to for a Father’s Day meal – steak restaurants feature heavily – here are the spots that made our list. Psssst! Click here if you’re looking for Father’s Day gift ideas ! Best Restaurants For Father’s Day 2025 In Singapore Crowne Plaza Changi Airport: Dads dine for free at Allora Image credit: Crowne Plaza Changi Airport This Father’s Day, thank Dad for all of his hard work with an indulgent buffet at Allora. Start off with a fresh seafood spread featuring prawns, mud crab, scallops, mussels, lobsters and oysters. Plus, don’t miss the Japanese corner where you can fill your plate with salmon and tuna sashimi, sushi and green tea soba noodles. Savour rich flavours with Braised Porchetta, Beef Ribeye with Mustard and Herbs, and Oven-Roasted Herbal Chicken. Pasta lovers, make a beeline to the crowd-favourite cheese wheel pasta, and enjoy authentic Mediterranean flavours from the Lamb Shawarma station. For local delights, look forward to Roasted Five-Spice Pork Belly and Fragrant Chicken Rice. No meal is complete without dessert! End off on a sweet note with classic Italian Tiramisu, Black Velvet Cake, New York Cheesecake, Apple Crumble Tart and warm Chocolate Pudding with Vanilla Sauce, in addition to a variety of gelato and sorbets. Dads dine for free with every two paying adults, and kids aged 6 and below dine for free too! Plus, enjoy 1-for-1 on selected house pours and cocktails during happy hour from 12pm to 7pm. Father’s Day lunch and dinner: 15 June 2025, 12pm – 3pm How much: $98++ per adult (Dad dines free with a minimum of two paying adults. Do indicate the number of dads in the reservation notes.) & $49++ per child (aged 7 and above). Click here to book a table. Allora , Crowne Plaza Changi Airport, 75 Airport Boulevard, #01-01, Changi Airport Terminal 3, Singapore 819664, www.changiairport.crowneplaza.com Read more: Best Buffets In Singapore For The Family Lawry’s The Prime Rib: Father’s Day five-course meal Image credit: Lawry’s The Prime Rib Singapore Lawry’s The Prime Rib Singapore is known for their succulent and indulgent prime rib. This Father’s Day, celebrate Dad with an extravagant five-course Father’s Day meal that will leave him brimming with joy. Begin with Grilled Halloumi Cheese with Smoked Duck, and sip on a comforting Roasted Garlic Creme Fraiche soup. Then cleanse your palate with a BerryFruit Sorbet as you prepare for the star of the show. For your entree, choose from one of three options. The Gentleman’s Choice features Signature Roasted USDA Prime Rib of Beef with Mashed Potatoes, Yorkshire Pudding and Whipped Cream Horseradish. The Heirloom Braised Short Ribs comes with a side of Mashed Potato, Roasted Pearl Onions, Broccolini and Pearl Tomatoes. For a lighter entree, opt for Dad’s Sunday Catch featuring Seared Halibut with Crispy Japanese Leeks & Garlic Kale. End your celebration on a sweet note with Grandpa’s Favourite Carrot Cake. Father’s Day lunch and dinner: 14 & 15 June 2025 How much: $169++ per guest. Click here to book a table. Lawry’s The Prime Rib Singapore , 333A Orchard Road, #04-01/31, Singapore 238897, www.lawrys.com.sg Wolfgang’s Steakhouse Singapore: Father’s Day feast with steak Image credit: Wolfgang Steakhouse Does Dad love steak ? Book a table this Father’s Day at Wolfgang’s Steakhouse Singapore for the ultimate steakhouse dining experience. Treat Dad to a three-course Father’s Day meal that starts off with 100% USDA Prime Short Rib in French Onion Soup. Then choose from one of two entrees: USDA Prime Black Angus Ribeye Steak served with Mashed Potatoes, White Asparagus and Trio Peppers Sauce or USDA Colorado Lamb Chops served with Mashed Potatoes, White Asparagus and Chimichurri Sauce. For dessert, indulge in a decadent Pecan and Raisin Pie for a grand finale to your Father’s Day celebration! To complement this meal, top up $24 for The Butcher’s Pour, a blend of Porterhouse-infused vodka and Rittenhouse Rye cocktail. Fancy other alcohol? Check out their Wine Cellar for a carefully curated selection of new and old age bottles. Plus, take home a complimentary Polaroid photo to capture cherished memories with Dad. Father’s Day lunch and dinner: 11 – 18 June 2025 How much: $168++ per guest. Click here to book a table. Wolfgang’s Steakhouse Singapore , 1 Nanson Road, Robertson Quay, #02-01 InterContinental Singapore, 238909, www.wolfgangssteakhouse.sg Read more: Best Steakhouses In Singapore Edge: Lavish Father’s Day buffet Image credit: Pan Pacific Singapore Book a table at Pan Pacific Singapore’s Edge for a lavish Father’s Day buffet. Start with fresh seafood on ice with highlights such as Snow Crab Leg, Sustainable Boston Lobster, Tiger Prawns and more. Then make a beeline for the Charcoal Barbecue Pit Live Station where you’ll find Marinated Lamb T Bone, Smokey Baby Pork Rib, Garlic Butter Tiger Prawn and more. Other highlights include hand-stretched pizza, local delights Penang Hawker’s live station and an array of sweet treats. Father’s Day lunch & brunch: 14 June 2025, 12pm – 3pm (lunch) & 15 June 2025, 12pm – 3pm (brunch) How much: $128++ per adult & $64++ per child aged 6 and up (Father’s Day Lunch); $158++ per adult & $79++ per child (Father’s Day Brunch). Click here to book a table. Edge, Pan Pacific Singapore, 7 Raffles Boulevard, Level 3 Pan Pacific, Singapore 039595, www.menu-ppsin.panpacific.com Food Capitol: Father’s Day brunch buffet Image credit: Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel Singapore Celebrate Dad’s unwavering strength with an extravagant international brunch buffet at Food Capitol. From fresh seafood on ice including shucked oysters and snow crab legs to hearty protein like Josper-grilled Wagyu Beef Ribeye and a comforting Seafood Stew, this Father’s Day buffet is one for the books! Plus, all fathers will take home a complimentary keepsake framed photograph, a memento of your joyful Father’s Day celebration. Father’s Day brunch: 15 June 2025, 12pm – 3pm How much: $128++ per adult & $64++ per child aged 6 and up. Click here to book a table. Food Capitol, Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel Singapore, 322 Havelock Road, Singapore 169663, www.millenniumhotels.com KWEE ZEEN: Father’s Day seafood dinner Image credit: KWEE ZEEN Does Dad love seafood? This one’s for him! Book a table at KWEE ZEEN to treat dad to a Father’s Day seafood buffet spread featuring the best catches of the sea! From fresh seafood on ice to Asian and Western seafood dishes like Singapore Laksa with Slipper Lobster to Spaghetti Aglio Olio with Seafood and more, he’ll be in for a treat. Meat-lovers will enjoy Roasted Ribeye with Roasted Potato, Butter Chicken and more. Father’s Day brunch: 13 & 14 June 2025, 6pm – 10pm How much: $140++ for two adults & $88++ per adult. 50% off for kids aged 7 – 12 years old. Complimentary dining for kids aged 6 and below. Click here to book a table. KWEE ZEEN, Sofitel Singapore Sentosa Resort & Spa, www.sofitel-singapore-sentosa.com Keep scrolling for more ideas for a fab Father’s Day 2025 celebration! articles.title: Top Tuition Centres In Singapore 2025 For All Education Levels
articles.author: Sassy Mama
articles.content: Looking for a top tuition centre in Singapore? We round up established tuition centres in Singapore offering primary school tuition and beyond in key subjects from Maths to English, Science and Chinese If your child is struggling in school, getting extra help from an expert at a top tuition centre in Singapore might help! Whether your child needs tuition in Chinese , English , or Maths or whether you just want your child to have increased confidence in their studies or be better-prepped for preschool , there’s a tuition centre that can help. With plenty of tuition centres in seemingly every shopping mall, we’ve done the heavy lifting to round up tuition centres in Singapore for all ages. Here are some tips on how to choose a tutor for your child. When searching for a top-ranking tuition centre in Singapore it’s always good to check if the enrichment centre is MOE-registered or operated by MOE Teachers, so you can be sure the tuition centre is best qualified for the subject. Many tuition centres offer English tuition , creative writing classes, Physics, Chemistry and Biology lessons, as well as Chinese tuition and Maths tuition classes , too. Some even offer online tuition classes for those who want the convenience of learning from home. When considering a tuition centre, ensure the location works for you and ask to do a trial tuition session before purchasing any long-term tuition programs so you and your child can check that the tutor is a good fit. Read more: All Things Enrichment & Tuition For Kids Find a top tuition centre that suits your child’s needs: TLS Tutorials: Customised lessons to enhance performance Image credit: TLS Tutorials Looking for a tuition centre in Singapore that provides personalised educational support? Thanks to TLS Tutorials’ small class sizes with a maximum of four students, each child receives the attention and guidance they need, so the teachers can address academic challenges and foster a motivating group dynamic and supportive learning experience. Because every child is unique, the tutors at this tuition centre in Singapore take the time to understand each child’s personality, motivations and learning style to craft customised lessons that will enhance comprehension and performance. By building critical exam skills and techniques, students will not only catch up to their peers but also excel in key topics and areas of weakness. Their experienced tutors are not only experts in the subjects they teach but also continuously update their knowledge to align with the latest educational standards and exam requirements, ensuring the most current and effective educational practices. Quote 400OFFSASSY to get $400 off if you sign up for one year of classes. Only valid for new customers. TLS Tutorials, 10 Windstedt Road, Block A, #02-04, Singapore 227977, www.tlstutorials.com SG Physics, Chemistry, Math & POA: Learn from award-winning teachers Image credit: SG Physics, Chemistry, Math & POA Looking for subject-specific tutors with more than a decade of experience? SG Physics, Chemistry, Math & POA is a top tuition centre in Singapore that has been offering effective lessons to Upper Secondary and JC students since 2015.
