He is a noted specialist in high-risk pregnancies and ultrasound assessment, along with gynaecological laparoscopic surgery. Two other big selling points for Dr. Chang – he has clinics near two different hospitals (TMC and Mt. E Novena) and counts superstar midwife Kiki Porter-Wolff on his staff. Dr. TC Chang , Thomson Medical Centre, Ground Floor 339 Thomson Road, Singapore 307677, Tel: (+65) 6253 6174 / 6253 4122 or 9446 0595 (Whatsapp during office hours), www.doctor-chang.net Dr. Chee Jing Jye Closest hospital: Mount Elizabeth (Orchard) “Dr. Chee Jing Jye delivered my son nine years ago and I couldn’t have been happier. She is a highly experienced OBGYN, with more than 15 years of practice. Before joining private practice in 2010, Dr. Chee was the Consultant and Head of the Peripartum Unit, Department of Maternal Fetal Medicine, KK Women’s and Children’s Hospital. During her time as Head of the Peripartum Unit, Dr. Chee has overseen the medical management of the KK Hospital Delivery Suite, with over 12,000 deliveries annually. I am a worrier by nature but when it comes to pregnancy, it just took another level. So when we arrived in Singapore and found out we were pregnant, I wanted to find an OBGYN that I could trust. With her background, I knew I would be in good hands. In addition, her calm and sweet personality was the perfect match for me. She accompanied me throughout my pregnancy, reassuring me every step of the way. The delivery went smoothly and I have recommended her to many of my friends since. Oh, and I never had to wait too long for any appointments! – Emilie Dr. Chee Jing Jye , 3 Mount Elizabeth, Mount Elizabeth Medical Centre, #12-02, Singapore 228510, Tel: (+65) 6732 9882, www.drjjcheegynae.com Prof. Chong Yap Seng Closest hospital: NUH Renowned for introducing water births at NUH, Dr. Chong (often referred to as Professor Chong – he’s also Dean of NUS Yong Loo Lin School of Medicine) has a reputation as one of the most pro-natural birth gynaecologists in Singapore. We have to say we also love his selection of natty bowties. “Professor Chong is very popular, and NUH is very busy in general, so expect long wait times (I’m talking hours). However, my appointments were never rushed, and Professor Chong was happy to answer all my questions. Professor Chong was very supportive of my birth plan, however, my little one arrived very quickly in the early hours of the morning so he didn’t make it to the hospital in time for the birth.” – Jessica Dr. Chong Yap Seng , NUH Medical Centre, Level 3 (Kent Ridge Wing), 5 Lower Kent Ridge Road, Singapore 119074, appointment@nuhs.edu.sg, Tel: (+65) 6772 2002, www.nuh.com.sg/nuhgynae Dr. Choo Wan Ling Closest hospital: Mount Elizabeth Novena, but she is also able to deliver at Mount Elizabeth Orchard, Gleneagles and Mount Alvernia In addition to her popular obstetrics practice where she’s a huge advocate for a natural birth, Dr. Choo is well-versed in other gynaecological issues such as infections, endometriosis, fertility challenges and ovarian cysts. She also has a special interest in menopausal care and female sexual dysfunction. If you’re after a female gynaecologist in Singapore who will put you at ease, look no further. “Dr. Choo and her staff are warm, relaxed and friendly, and she is always happy to answer questions and offer down-to-earth advice. Her office was always buzzing with patients (book early in the day or you may have a long wait ahead of you), but I never felt rushed, and always appreciated her personal touch. When I was pregnant with #2, she let my then-3-year-old daughter sit with her to look at the ultrasound; to this day Maggie still compares all doctors against Dr. Choo! She was completely open to my birth plan and respectful of my desire to pursue a natural, drug-free birth.” – Kate Dr. Choo Wan Ling , 38 Irrawaddy Road, #10-30 Mount Elizabeth Novena Specialist Centre, Singapore 329563, Tel: (+65) 6262 3060, www.sog.com.sg Dr. Freda Khoo Closest hospital: Thomson Medical Centre. She is also credentialed to practice at several other hospitals, including Mount Elizabeth, Gleneagles, Parkway East and Mount Alvernia. A mother of three herself, Dr. Khoo is a gynae committed to the belief that every woman deserves quality and dedicated women’s healthcare throughout her life, from puberty till menopause and beyond. “I started out seeing Dr Freda Khoo at KKH and she saw me through my pregnancy till the birth of my second baby, and my husband and I had a wonderful experience with her. Dr Khoo doesn’t just talk to you like a doctor and an expert – she gets to “friend level.” That’s how much she shows she cares: it feels like she’s taken a personal interest in you, your family and your well-being. When Dr. Khoo left to start her own practice at Thomson Medical Centre, as much of a fan of KKH as I was, I went along with her! Dr. Khoo listens to her patients and if anything, her soothing voice alone will calm your nerves in any situation.” – Nadia Dr. Freda Khoo , Freda Khoo Clinic, 339 Thomson Road, #06-05B Thomson Medical Centre, Millennial Wing Lift Lobby C, Singapore 307677, Tel: (+65) 6259 6964, www.fredakhooclinic.com Dr. Goh Shen Li Closest hospital: Mount Alvernia. A mum of three herself, Dr. Goh is an award-winning doctor who is reported by patients to be extremely gentle and answers all your questions thoroughly. Dr. Goh was previously attached to KKH but now runs her practice out of Mount Alvernia. Dr. Goh Shen Li , 820 Thomson Road, Mount Alvernia Hospital, Medical Centre D, #05-59, Singapore 574623, Tel: (+65) 6258 8174, www.slgohclinic.com Dr. Jasmine Mohd Clinic: WC Cheng & Associates Closest hospital: Thomson Medical Centre. She also has admitting rights at Mount Alvernia, Gleneagles and Mount Elizabeth Hospitals In addition to Obstetrics and antenatal medicine, Dr Jasmine’s sub-speciality is in advanced laparoscopy (keyhole surgery), hysteroscopy and robotic surgery, and she previously served as Consultant Colposcopist in the Gynaecological Cancer Centre at KKH. She is a female gynae who’s fully supportive of natural birth and breastfeeding and has even been certified in hypnotherapy techniques. She is currently serving as Vice President of Singapore’s College of Obstetricians & Gynaecologists. “I started seeing Dr. Jasmine at Thomson Medical Centre from my second trimester onwards. As a first time mum, I liked that she explained what’s next and what to expect to me, as it reduced my anxiety of not knowing what’s to come for labour. She gave useful advice and tips on birth preparation and also respected my wish for a natural birth. Check-up sessions were always a breeze – I didn’t have to wait for long hours. She was very responsive during my panic call in the wee hours before labour. Post labour, her stitches were clean and I healed well.” – Atikah Dr. Jasmine Mohd , 339 Thomson Road, Thomson Medical Centre, #01-01, Singapore 307677, Tel: (+65) 6253 4122, www.wcca.com.sg Dr. Kelly Loi Closest hospital: Mount Elizabeth (Orchard) A mother of three with a special focus on fertility treatment, IVF and surgery in addition to antenatal and obstetrics care, Dr. Loi was educated in the UK and did further training at some of the top hospitals in the United States. She is incredibly patient and kind and has a beautiful office with state-of-the-art facilities conveniently located on Orchard (she’s also the Medical Director of the Mount Elizabeth Hospital Fertility Centre). As with many of the most popular OBGYNs in Singapore, it’s best to book early appointments to avoid long wait times. Dr. Kelly Loi , Health & Fertility Centre for Women, 3 Mount Elizabeth, Mount Elizabeth Medical Centre, #15-16, Singapore 228510, Tel: (+65) 6235 5066, www.healthfertility.com.sg Dr. Lai Fon-Min Clinic: A Company for Women Closest hospital: Camden Medical Centre, Mount Elizabeth, Parkway East & KKH. Due to his non-interventionist, true-to-mama’s-wishes delivery style, Dr. Lai is very popular (and pricey, too). Rumour has it that he’s got the lowest C-section rate in town and that he doesn’t do episiotomies (hallelujah we say!). He’s also the only gynae in Singapore who might even consider home births, which is far from a given these days and has a good relationship with many doulas. Dr Lai specialises in high-risk pregnancies, is frequently sought out to help mamas safely deliver breech babies, and welcomes patients who wish to go for VBAC . He also works alongside Ginny Phang-Davey, a certified birth and postpartum doula who also runs Four Trimesters Birth Sanctuary. Dr. Lai Fon Min , A Company for Women, Camden Medical Centre 1, Orchard Boulevard, #03-05/06, Singapore 248649, Tel: (+65) 6333 6181, www.acompanyforwomen.com.sg Prof. Mahesh Choolani Closest hospital: NUH & Mount Elizabeth Novena Dr. Choolani is Head of the Obstetrics & Gynaecology Department at NUH Women’s Centre. Considered one of the top high-risk pregnancy doctors in Singapore and also noted for his calm demeanour and support for a natural birth, Dr. Choolani operates a super popular clinic at NUH (he used to have an office at Mount E Novena but no longer does). Expect lengthy wait times for this popular gynae, but his patients rave about him. Dr Mahesh Choolani, NUH Medical Centre , Level 3 (Kent Ridge Wing), 5 Lower Kent Ridge Road, Singapore 119074, appointment@nuhs.edu.sg, Tel: (+65) 6772 2002, www.nuh.com.sg/nuhgynae Dr. Paul Tseng Closest hospital: Thomson Medical Centre Sought out by natural birthing mamas, Dr. Paul Tseng draws raves for his kind and gentle bedside manner and can be counted on to follow your birth plan as far as he possibly can. We hear he’s particularly great for Singapore ladies seeking VBACs and gives mamas the option to skip scans during appointments if they don’t feel one is strictly necessary. Click here to read two birth stories from mamas who gave birth with Dr Tseng (Tricia and Pooja). Dr. Paul Tseng , TLC Gynaecology Practice, 339 Thomson Road, #03-02 Thomson Medical Centre, Singapore 307677, Tel: (+65) 6254 2878, www.thomsonmedical.com/doctor/dr-paul-tseng Dr. Tan Thiam Chye Clinic: O&G The Women’s Medical Specialist Closest hospital: Mount Elizabeth Novena & Thomson Medical Centre With more than 15 years of experience, Dr. Tan Thiam Chye has delivered more than 5,000 babies in Singapore. Before joining O&G, he was Head of Department and Senior Consultant in Obstetrics and Gynaecology and the Urgent O&G Centre at KKH. He is also an Associate Professor of OBGYN at Duke-NUS Medical School, where he’s won numerous awards as both educator and clinician. The O&G Clinic offers telemedicine services, too, so you can skip long wait times and talk to your doctor through real-time video, which is especially useful for post-natal visits. Dr. Tan Thiam Chye , O&G The Women’s Medical Specialist, 38 Irrawaddy Road, #04-24 Mount Elizabeth Novena Specialist Centre, Singapore 329563, Tel: (+65) 6974 4188 / (+65) 8202 3803, www.ogwomensspecialist.com.sg Dr. Tony Tan Closest hospital: Mount Alvernia. He is admitted to deliver at all private hospitals in Singapore. Along with Drs. Biswas, Chang and Choolani, Dr Tan is another name that frequently comes up when discussing top OBGYNs in Singapore for high-risk pregnancies – these include including twins/multiples, second opinions, genetic disorders and abnormal ultrasound scans. Of course, he also treats low-risk pregnant women, as well as other gynaecological conditions such as fibroids, endometriosis, ovarian cysts, and more. Dr. Tan personally screens foetuses in every trimester and has a full team of medical specialists in his clinic, including a midwife and consultant anaesthetist. Dr. Tony Tan , 820 Thomson Road, Mount Alvernia Hospital, #07-66 Medical Centre D, Singapore 574623, Tel: (+65) 6972 4497/98 or (+65) 8622 3850 (Whatsapp for appointments only), www.drtonytan.com Dr. Vanaja Kalaichelvan Closest Hospital: NUH Dr. Vanaja has special training in maternal-fetal medicine, including a clinical fellowship in ultrasonography at St George’s Hospital, London. In addition to her position at NUH’s Antenatal Diagnostic Centre and teaching responsibilities, she also jointly runs its O&G Diabetic Clinic. “Dr. Vanaja made every appointment very comfortable. As a first-time mama, I was clueless a lot of the time, but she helped explain anything I had questions on. She didn’t impose anything on me that I wasn’t open to, and she was very respectful of my plan for a natural delivery without pain relief. Since she was at her other clinic in Jurong , she was absent during a portion of my active labour period but came just in time to deliver the baby. I’m very happy with her service overall! However, due to her popularity, I usually had to wait before seeing her for my appointments – at times it took up to half a day of waiting.” – Syazana Dr. Vanaja Kalaichelvan , NUH Medical Centre, Level 3 (Kent Ridge Wing), 5 Lower Kent Ridge Road, Singapore 119074, appointment@nuhs.edu.sg, Tel: (+65) 6772 2002, www.nuh.com.sg/nuhgynae We’ve got plenty more pregnancy and baby must-knows you’ll love! The post Women’s Clinics, Gynaecologists & OBGYNs In Singapore & How To Choose One That’s Right For You appeared first on Sassy Mama .

articles.title: Guide To Student Care Centres In Singapore: Locations & Student Care Fees
articles.author: Sassy Mama
articles.content: Looking for a student care centre in Singapore to make sure your child is well taken care of after school with academic help, enrichment and activities? Here’s our guide, including info on subsidies, locations and student care fees While preschool and kindergarten-aged children have childcare centres , primary school and lower secondary school-going children have student care centres. Student care centres provide safe, conducive environments for children who don’t have care arrangements at home during after-school hours or school holidays . At student care, children get to fill their afternoons with holistic activities and after-school programmes and more importantly, complete their homework so they won’t have to do it in the evenings at home! In addition, student care centres provide meals. On top of homework supervision and meals, different student care options provide after-school programmes like music, sports, outdoor play and field trips! Types of student care centres All MOE primary schools have a school-based student care centre. These school-based student care centres make it easy for kids to go from their classrooms to student care without leaving the school! Only children from primary school can enrol in the school’s student care. If your child is already enrolled in a primary school, you can check with the school about the student care application procedure and criteria during orientation or at any time after your child’s confirmed enrolment. A few main operators of school-based student care include NASCANS, Pro-Teach, Big Heart, YMCA, Morning Star and Commit Learning. Community-based student care centres If the school-based student care is fully subscribed, you can consider a community-based student care centre near your home or your child’s school. This could mean your child will have to head to the student care centre themselves, but it also gives them the chance to meet and make friends with children from other nearby schools, widening their social circle. How much are student care fees in Singapore? Student care fees start from $200 per month. You’re likely to pay less if you qualify for certain subsidies at MSF-registered student care centres under the Student Care Fee Assistance (SCFA) scheme. Check your eligibility here. Looking for student care centres near you? Read on! in:genius by NASCANS: Has an AI-powered holistic learning model Image credit: in:genius by NASCANS in:genius by NASCANS (Global EduHub) is a leading student care centre with over 15 years of experience in running student care centres across nine locations in Singapore. Voted Singapore’s ‘Best Student Care Programme’ for five consecutive years, they offer a unique suite of programmes that help students develop holistically and acquire a strong academic foundation. They offer academic tuition programmes, fun enrichment programmes like Coding and Chess, and their signature T.I.T.A.N.S. programme that nurtures intelligent thinking habits. In addition, they have a revolutionary learning platform called INFINITY that’s powered by cutting edge AI. This platform tailors the learning journey of every child to reach their fullest potential. When you drop off your child, you can rest assured that they will be in good hands. The educators at this student care centre in Singapore undergo over 200 hours of training through their rigorous programme, ensuring that each person is equipped to nurture confident and well-rounded young learners. Monthly student care fees: From $550 in:genius by NASCANS, multiple student care centres in Singapore including Tampines, Bukit Merah, Jurong East, www.ingenius.nascans.com Agora Colearning Student Care: Parent app with real-time updates Image credit: Agora Colearning Student Care Agora Colearning Student Care offers children a unique after-school experience where children are able to learn, grow and play. This student care centre in Singapore has created an innovative programme, emphasising critical aspects of a child’s development, such as autonomy, learning to learn, personal growth, as well as their well-being. Students can also research, join creative programmes and participate in outdoor activities for a well-rounded development. Centrally located at HarbourFront Centre, Agora Colearning Student Care spans 20,000 sqft of indoor and outdoor learning spaces with a terrace overlooking Sentosa, so your child can benefit from a variety of learning spaces throughout the day. They can dive into stories at the library, get creative at maker spaces and stay active outdoors. They recently launched their own Parent App, so you can stay up to date with your child’s academic progress and gain insights about their social development. This student care centre also offers door-to-door transport from a wide number of primary schools, so your child is safe and well cared for. Monthly student care fees: $689 Agora Colearning Student Care is now open for 2024 registrations! Quote SMM50 during registration to enjoy the early bird pricing . Agora Colearning Student Care , HarbourFront Centre, #04-01 access via Lobby C, www.agora-colearning.space Brave Feats Student Care : Open concept & mixed-age grouping Image credit: Brave Feats Student Care Brave Feats Student Care is a changemaker in the after-school care space. Brave Feats sees itself as a critical part of the “Village of Care” in raising joyful children into purpose-led adults. They provide a positive and inspiring space with a child-centric and purpose-built environment. The open concept, flexible furniture, mixed-age grouping and caring adults allow children to feel at home, be themselves and explore confidently beyond school and the classroom. Brave Feats is not only a space for children, but also builds a community with parents through close communication and parenting support. The after-school programme, designed by experienced educators, is underpinned by the principles of Positive Education and the Montessori pedagogy. Through the programme facilitated by nurturing and committed teachers, Brave Feats children develop both social-emotional competencies and executive functioning skills, which set them apart as confident and joyful children. Monthly student care fees: Enquire with centre. Sassy Mama readers enjoy a waiver of registration fees, complimentary seats for the 3-day P1 Transition Programme (3 – 5 Dec 2024) and 1-day Brave Feats Experience Day (9 – 12 Dec 2024, 16 – 20 Dec 2024), and three free Brave Feats t-shirts. This is a total savings of $1,040! Valid until 31 October 2024. Terms & Conditions apply . Brave Feats Student Care Bedok , 21 Bedok North Street 1, #02-02 Common Ground, Singapore 469659, www.bravefeats.community Changemakers By Seed Campus: Unique programmes to complement learning Image credit: Changemakers Changemakers by Seed Campus is not a typical, cookie-cutter student care centre in Singapore. Instead of simply getting students to complete their homework and giving them a safe space until their parents pick them up, Changemakers by Seed Campus nurtures essential life skills through a research-backed curriculum that teaches children innovation and communication. The team that is made up of ex-MOE teachers here encourage students to be responsible in daily routines and take ownership of their own learning. Though academic support is readily available, Changemakers gives students the opportunity to develop essential life skills. Students also benefit from unique programmes including fireside chats with experts, the opportunity to run a mini retail store and more. With over 3,400 square feet of space, this student care centre in Singapore gives students plenty of room and interactive spaces to learn, grow and explore. Their low staff-to-child ratio of 1:10 gives parents peace of mind knowing that each child can learn and grow at their own pace and receive the support they need. Quote SASSYCHANGEMAKERS to receive exclusive enrolment savings of up to $2,300 . Terms & conditions apply. Changemakers by Seed Campus, 80 Marine Parade Road, Parkway Parade, #22-08/09, Singapore 449269, www.seedcampus.sg Curos: After-school care with enrichment programmes Image credit: Curos Curos is a student care centre in Singapore that offers a safe, nurturing and dynamic environment where your child can thrive. They provide a holistic after-school care that perfectly balances academics and enriching activities such as STEM, Arts Appreciation and Effective Communicators. Partnering with Singapore’s top enrichment providers, Learning Point and Hua Cheng , students will be able to join top-tier face-to-face tuition in English, Chinese, Mathematics and Science. This reinforces what your child learns in school and helps them build a strong academic foundation during the week, so they can relax with family on the weekend. Beyond academics, Curos offers nutritious meals, thrilling excursions and outdoor adventures. By offering time for guided play and homework, learning at Curos is fun and effective. Students look forward to a well-rounded experience that fosters creativity, social skills and character development. Monthly student care fees: Enquire with centre. Quote CUROSSM24 to enjoy a registration fee waiver when you sign up. Offer is non-transferable, not exchangeable and not refundable for cash. Only for first-time enrolment and not stackable with other ongoing discounts or promotions. Curos, 301 Upper Thomson Road, #02-22, Singapore 574408 and 1 Jln Anak Bukit, #02-01D, Singapore 588996, www.curos.com.sg Elevate After School Care By EtonHouse: Holistic after-school care with enrichment Image credit: Elevate After School Care by EtonHouse Elevate After School Care by EtonHouse redefines the after-school experience for primary school children by offering a nurturing home away from home where children can truly thrive. Their kind and nurturing teachers ensure that children feel cherished and supported as they learn and explore through their enriching after-school programme. With a holistic approach anchored on the core pillars of Mind, Body, and Soul, Elevate promotes academic success alongside physical well-being and emotional and social development. Their programme features tailored academic enrichment, comprehensive homework support, and specialised programmes like Maths Olympiad and Coding, all designed to enhance cognitive abilities and critical thinking skills. To support a healthy lifestyle, they offer balanced, nutritious meals crafted by in-house chefs, engaging fitness activities and thoughtfully designed rest spaces. Holistic modules on stress management, mindfulness, and financial literacy equip children with essential life skills. Elevate After School Care offers a unique environment that fosters both academic and social growth, providing a safe and enriching space for children to thrive. Explore how Elevate After School Care transforms your child’s after-school hours into a time of meaningful learning and growth. Monthly student care fees: $1,200 Elevate After School Care, Sengkang Grand Mall, 70 Compassvale Bow, #02-02, Singapore 544692, www.info.theetonacademy.com.sg Mind Sparks: Tuition programmes in English, Science & Maths by Mind Stretcher Image credit: Mind Sparks Mind Sparks is the student care brand under the Mind Stretcher Group, one of Singapore’s leading private education providers. This student care centre caters to students aged 7 to 12 years old, and they affectionately call their students “Sparkies”. Their goal is to ignite young minds through a blend of a rigorous academic curriculum and enriching experiences. Sparkies builds strong academic foundations with Mind Stretcher’s top-quality academic tuition programmes and daily Skills Boosters worksheets for core academic subjects such as English, Maths, and Science. To ensure a holistic development, Sparkies also participate in other enrichment programmes such as Coding and Robotics, Public Speaking, Chess, STEAM, Creative Arts, and Personal Development to foster design thinking and problem-solving skills. With bright, spacious classrooms and beautiful shared learning spaces like reading nooks, stages and dining rooms, Sparkies always have a blast learning and connecting with their friends. This student centre’s warm and nurturing atmosphere sure makes learning fun! Monthly student care fees: WhatsApp them at (+65) 8508 9010 to enquire. Enjoy a complimentary one-week student care trial ! T&Cs apply. Mind Sparks Student Care By Mind Stretcher , four locations in Singapore including Bukit Batok, Toa Payoh, Woodlands and Tampines (upcoming), www.mindsparks.com.sg Big Heart Student Care: Affordable after school care Image credit: Big Heart Student Care Big Heart Student Care is a non-profit, Voluntary Welfare Organisation providing affordable, quality after-school care. Big Heart Student Care works closely with schools, parents and the community to monitor and guide students, while providing fun programmes and activities. Monthly student care fees: $290 before subsidies Big Heart Student Care , over 30 student care centres in primary schools islandwide, www.bigheartstudentcare.com Commit Learning Schoolhouse: Bilingual student care Image credit: Commit Learning Schoolhouse Commit Learning Schoolhouse is part of Commit Learning Group, which provides bilingual student care, tuition and preschool education for children 4 to 6 years old. Commit Learning Schoolhouse student care integrates the values promoted by MOE into their curriculum. This student care centre has locations all over the island, with branches located in or near primary schools. Monthly student care fees: From $240 before subsidies Commit Learning Schoolhouse , 23 student care centres in Singapore, www.facebook.com/CommitLearningAcademy EduFirst Learning Centre: Has field trips & experiments Image credit: EduFirst Learning Centre EduFirst Learning Centre is a tuition centre and student care centre with a holistic program, with an Integrated Student Development Program (ISDP). Services provided include homework guidance, tuition classes, enrichment activities, field trips and hands-on experiments! Some of their student care centres even have shower facilities and a napping area. Monthly student care fees: From $380 before subsidies EduFirst Learning Centre , 15 student care centres in Singapore, www.edufirst.com.sg Graceland Student Care Centre: Has enrichment classes Image credit: Graceland Student Care Graceland Student Care Centre provides homework supervision, tuition, enrichment courses, hobby-based projects and educational field trips. All their programmes are conducted by well-trained teachers, using methods such as brainstorming and intuitive thinking to engage students in active learning. Monthly student care fee: From $390 before subsidies Graceland Student Care Centre , three locations including Bedok, Teck Whye, Jurong West, www.graceland.sg Little Professors Learning Centre: Healthy meals Image credit: Little Professors via Facebook Little Professors is a student care centre that has been providing after-school care since 2005. Offering a holistic student care experience, their team of dedicated and diligent staff conduct programmes to keep kids occupied with guidance for homework completion, warm, healthy meals and more. Monthly student care fees: From $232.32 before subsidies Little Professors Learning Centre , multiple locations including Jurong East, Ang Mo Kio & Pasir Ris, www.facebook.com/littleprofessorslearningcentre MindSpace: Student care with weekend enrichment classes Image credit: MindSpace via Facebook MindSpace provides student care services and weekend enrichment classes for children, incorporating the MindChamps enrichment curriculum that complements the MOE syllabus. MindSpace student care centre reinforces subject-specific knowledge. Their student care centres feature facilities such as quiet reading corners, smart boards, heated shower facilities and more. Monthly MindSpace student care fees: Enquire with centre. MindSpace , multiple locations in Singapore including City Square Mall, Raffles Town Club, The Woodleigh Mall, www.mindspace.mindchamps.org Morning Star Community Services: Theme-based activities Image credit: Morning Star Community Services via Facebook Morning Star Community Services offers a values-centric programme at their student care centres, with interesting curriculum-based learning stations and theme-based activities. This student care centre allows students to hone their cognitive abilities and social skills while nurturing character formation and emotional development. Monthly student care fees: From $352.05 before subsidies Morning Star Community Services , multiple locations in Singapore including Hougang, Sengkang, Bedok, www.morningstar.org.sg PlayFACTO: Coding & robotics curriculum Image credit: PlayFACTO PlayFACTO School offers premium student care and enrichment. It has a cosy environment, healthy and nutritious meals, low student-to-teacher ratios, academic-focused daily homework assistance and a Coding & Robotics curriculum. PlayFACTO’s student care centres are available islandwide. Read more about PlayFACTO here! Monthly PlayFACTO student care fees: Enquire with centre. PlayFACTO School , 50 locations in Singapore, Tel: (+65) 9773 4336, www.playfactoschool.com.sg Raffles Student Care Centre: After-school care with speech & drama Image credit: Raffles Student Care Centre via Facebook Raffles Student Care is a child-safe organisation caring for children of all backgrounds and subsidising/ sponsoring learning journeys for at-risk children. Kids are exposed to a variety of indoor and outdoor activities all week and often learn about various cultural practices and celebrations in Singapore. Monthly student care fees: From $227.25 before subsidies Raffles Student Care Centre, 20 student care centres within/near primary schools in Singapore, www.rafflesstudentcare.com Singapore Edusmart Learning Hub: Enriching outdoor activities Image credit: Singapore Edusmart Learning Hub Edusmart’s student care programme includes supervised study time to complement the school’s teaching and a holistic approach to play and learning. They are strong advocates for the phrase “It takes a village to raise a child”, and often partner with parents, schools, community and like-minded organisations towards this cause. Monthly student care fees: From $235 before subsidies Singapore Edusmart Learning Hub , 11 student care centres in Singapore, www.singaporeedusmart.com.sg YMCA Student Care Centre: Located near primary schools Image credit: YMCA Student Care Centre via Facebook YMCA Student Care Centre has been providing after-school care services since 1997. With the belief that every child is unique, the teachers and mentors at YMCA take a keen interest in every student, offering after-school care to kids in over 20 centres islandwide within/near primary schools. Monthly student care fees: From $260 before subsidies YMCA Student Care Centre , 23 student care centres in Singapore, www.facebook.com/ymcascc Read more: The post Guide To Student Care Centres In Singapore: Locations & Student Care Fees appeared first on Sassy Mama .

articles.title: Guide To Geneo @ Singapore Science Park: Food At Geneo & Things To Do
articles.author: Jessica Fang
articles.content: Geneo @ Singapore Science Park is the newest aesthetic spot in town! Head down to check out the stunning architecture, all the things to do in Geneo and food at Geneo for your next family outing. There’s a new aesthetic spot in Singapore turning heads for its grand foyer and urban greenery–and it may very well be the next reason you go to Kent Ridge. That’s Geneo @ Singapore Science Park, the latest mixed-use development to crop up on our Little Red Dot. Located in a business hub dedicated to life sciences and innovation, Geneo adds a great dose of community-friendly facilities, beautiful spaces, a serviced apartment, co-working spaces, and, of course, food–all packed in this spacious enclave spanning 39,000 square feet. You’ll bet there’ll be more kid-friendly events taking place at Geneo soon, so check out what this science and business hub has to offer, including food at Geneo and what to do at Geneo with kids. Currently, there are a good number of F&B establishments open, but there will be more retail and food amenities opening in the future. Jump to: – Food at Geneo @ Singapore Science Park – Things to do at Geneo @ Singapore Science Park – Citadines Science Park Singapore – How to get to Geneo @ Singapore Science Park Food at Geneo @ Singapore Science Park Luckin Coffee: Coffee run at Geneo Image credit: Luckin Coffee Need a quick pick-me-up while innovating (or exploring the photo-worthy spaces of Geneo)? There’s a Luckin Coffee right here, so you can easily get your caffeine fix. Pick up their popular beverages such as the Coconut Latte, or try whatever’s on their daily deals that go as generous as 50%+ off or even 1-for-1! Luckin Coffee, 1B Science Park Dr, #01-32, Geneo, Singapore 199315, www.luckincoffee.com PUTIEN Geneo: Michelin-starred Fujian Cuisine Image credit: PUTIEN via Facebook PUTIEN has landed at Geneo, so you can expect a feast of great Fujian cuisine. This Chinese restaurant has previously bagged a 1 Michelin star for 7 years in a row between 2016 and 2023. Go for their signatures such as the Fujian Red Mushroom Seafood Lor Mee, ‘100-Second’ Stewed Yellow Croaker, PUTIEN’s Bian Rou soup and more! PUTIEN Geneo, 1B Science Park Drive, Geneo, #B1-33, Singapore 119315, www.putien.com Ha-Jun Korean: Korean food at Geneo Image credit: Ha-Jun Korean via Instagram For many of us, Korean food has practically become a daily staple! Well, you can now get your fix of classic Korean fare at Ha-Jun Korean at Geneo, whether it’s comforting Bean Paste Soup, familiar Kimchi Fried Rice, or indulgent Kimchi Chicken Steamboat. Ha-Jun Korean, 1B Science Park Drive, Geneo, Singapore 119315, www.instagram.com/hajunkorean Read more: Guide To Korean BBQ Spots In Singapore Great Nanyang Heritage Cafe Geneo: Kopitiam at Singapore Science Park Image credit: Great Nanyang Heritage Cafe Geneo Great Nanyang Heritage Cafe has pretty much everything you need to get your Kopitiam fix: half-boiled eggs, toast bread and coffee, as well as Penang dishes, steamed buns, and other satisfying local tastes. Great Nanyang Heritage Cafe, 1B Science Park Dr, #B1-32, Geneo, Singapore 119315, www.instagram.com/greatnanyang Grains & Co: Healthy bowls at Geneo Image credit: Grains & Co via Instagram Fancy a nourishing tofu bowl or a bowl for an energy boost? Grains & Co has an array of yummy superfood bowls for those craving a guilt-free meal. Order one of their signature bowls or build your own with your choice of bases, supplements, dressings and protein. Grains & Co, 1B Science Park Dr, B2-41 Geneo, Singapore 119315, www.grainsandco.sg Swensen’s Unlimited: Halal buffet at Geneo (Opening soon) Image credit: Swensen’s Unlimited – image for illustrative purposes only. Swensen’s Unlimited has yet to open at Geneo, but it’s great to have another great buffet option in Singapore . Not only do you get access to an unlimited ice cream bar and waffles, but there are also live cooking stations and a spread of hot dishes, seafood and more. Swensen’s Unlimited is also a halal restaurant , so everyone can join in on the feast. Swensen’s Unlimited, 1 Science Park Dr, #01-06, Singapore 118221, www.unlimited.swensens.com.sg More food at Geneo @ Singapore Science Park: Bread Talk: #B2-37/38 Fun Toast: #B2-42/43 Olive & Peach: #01-31 Pasta Express+: #B2-39 Subway: TBA Things to do at Geneo The Canopy: Instagrammable event plaza Image credit: CapitaLand There are many reasons to be in awe of The Canopy, Geneo’s 3,000-square-metre event plaza. This area at the entrance of Geneo is visually stunning, with mass engineered timber (MET) pillars towering some 27 metres tall, branching off to a louvred glass canopy. It’s also where plenty of events are expected to take place, with a capacity of about 300 pax. On a regular day, though, you can simply hang out at this naturally ventilated space and enjoy the view before you. The Seed: Outdoor garden at Geneo Image credit: CapitaLand Geneo is not lacking in green spaces—case in point: The Seed, a ginger-themed genomic garden. Besides playing host to specially selected ginger plant species, this outdoor garden at Geneo is beautifully landscaped. It features a lily pond and lots of shrubs for a great dose of oxygen. Fitness Corner at Geneo Image credit: CapitaLand Designed by Italian artist Vito Di Bari, the fitness corner (known as MyEquilibria) has perhaps the most interesting fitness system we’ve ever seen. This 7-metre-tall sculpture allows people to do over 500 different types of exercise from nine sports disciplines. You’ll soon be able to find it over at 5 Science Park Drive, just opposite Geneo. Bicycle facilities at Geneo Image credit: CapitaLand Cyclists have plenty of reason to head to Geneo, thanks to its bike-friendly facilities. There are a total of 466 bicycle lots at Geneo, as well as shower and locker facilities, all meant to promote the Singapore Green Plan 2030. Visit Kent Ridge Park Image credit: NParks Kent Ridge Park is just an 8-minute walk from Geneo, making Geneo a great spot to drop by for some food after spending the day outdoors. The park is known to be the site of one of the last WWII battles in Singapore, and now has easy walking paths, ponds, and even a mountain bike trail. Citadines Science Park Singapore: Serviced apartment & co-working spaces at Geneo Image credit: Citadines Science Park – Co-working space Geneo is now home to the new Citadines Science Park Singapore, a serviced residence. It’s got everything you need for a comfy stay, including a 24-hour fitness centre, an infinity swimming pool with a great view, a launderette and more. There’s also a co-working space here that’s open 24 hours for guests to use. How to get to Geneo @ Singapore Science Park Image credit: CapitaLand By train: The nearest MRT station to Geneo is Kent Ridge MRT with sheltered access to Geneo. Kent Ridge MRT station is just an 8-minute walk from Geneo. By bus: There are a couple of bus stops outside Geneo: 5 Sc Pk Dr off the AYE and 1a Sci Pk Dr and Ascent on Science Park Drive. By car: Parking is available at Geneo @ Singapore Science Park. Parking is free on weekends and public holidays and standard charges apply on weekdays between 12am to 5.59pm. Parking is free from 6pm – 11.59pm. Read more about new shopping mall openings in Singapore: Punggol Coast Mall and The Cathay . Geneo, 7 Science Park Drive, #1, 5, www.geneo.sciencepark.com.sg Read more: The post Guide To Geneo @ Singapore Science Park: Food At Geneo & Things To Do appeared first on Sassy Mama .

articles.title: Handy List Of Best Nursing Rooms In Singapore To Breastfeed
articles.author: Sassy Mama
articles.content: Looking for a place to pump, change a diaper or breastfeed your baby? Consult our handy list of nursing rooms in Singapore! As one of the most kid-friendly nations in the world, there are plenty of nursing rooms in Singapore to give you the privacy you need to feed and change your little one while you’re out. It can get overwhelming when your baby’s crying for milk, but you don’t have to stress yourself out wondering where you’ll find a clean nursing room with everything you need to feed your baby. We’ve rounded up a list of the best nursing rooms in Singapore, so bookmark this for the next time you want to find the closest family room, baby care room or changing stations in your favourite mall , amusement park and even the airport! Read more: Ultimate Guide to Breastfeeding in Singapore 1. 313@Somerset Location: Levels B3, 1 and 5 Expect changing stations, nursing cubicles with armchairs and benches, large waiting areas, a hot and cold water dispenser, power points at the level 1 nursing room, a microwave at the B3 and Level 5 rooms, and a child look level 1 plus a child-friendly loo at Level B3 . 313@Somerset , 313 Orchard Rd, Singapore 238895, www.313somerset.com.sg 2. Anchorpoint Shopping Centre Image credit: Anchorpoint Location: Basement 1 and Level 1 by the restrooms There are two nursing rooms here with armchairs separated by curtains. There are also changing stations, hot and cold water dispensers and power points to charge your breast pump, phone or any other electronic device. Anchorpoint Shopping Centre , 370 Alexandra Road, Singapore 159953, www.anchorpoint.com.sg 3. Ang Mo Kio Hub Location: Level 3 near restrooms The lockable nursing rooms at AMK Hub are spacious and come with benches, changing stations, a waiting area and sinks plus a hot water dispenser. Ang Mo Kio Hub , 53 Ang Mo Kio Ave 3, Singapore 569933, www.amkhub.com.sg 4. Aperia Kallang Mall Location: Level 1 next to the restrooms The two nursing rooms here are separated by curtains and have no locks. There are also three changing stations, a sink (no soap), power points and a waiting area. Aperia Kallang Mall , 12 Kallang Ave, Singapore 339511, www.capitaland.com/sg/malls/aperia/en.html 5. Bedok Mall Image credit: Bedok Mall Location: Level B1 near restrooms Key features include two lockable nursing rooms with armchairs, but there’s no table or space to park your stroller in the room. However, there are two changing stations and a waiting area, so park your elder tots there and make use of the power points to charge your devices. There are also family toilets with a diaper-changing area at Bedok Mall, a children’s loo and a baby seat within the handicapped restrooms. Bedok Mall , 311 New Upper Changi Rd, Singapore 467360, www.capitaland.com/sg/malls/bedokmall/en.html 6. Bugis Junction Location: Ladies’ restrooms on Levels 1-3 (baby changing and child protection seats) Head up to Level 3 to use the baby care room, which has two nursing cubicles separated by curtains, a changing station, hot and cold water dispensers, a waiting area and a playground for the little ones. Bugis Junction , 200 Victoria St, Singapore 188021, www.capitaland.com/sg/malls/bugisjunction/en.html 7. Bukit Panjang Plaza Location: Level 1 (within ladies’ restroom); Level 2 to 3 (next to lifts) and Level 4 (next to the library) The nursing room on Level 1 is merely a cubicle with curtains and no locks, so head up to those on Levels 2 to 4 for lockable doors and added privacy. Other amenities include changing tables and sinks. Bukit Panjang Plaza , 1 Jelebu Rd, Singapore 677743, www.capitaland.com/sg/malls/bukitpanjangplaza/en.html 8. Bukit Timah Plaza Location: Level B1 The entire nursing room at Bukit Timah Plaza can be locked, guaranteeing absolute privacy. The downside? There may be longer waiting times if queues are long. The nursing room also has a changing table and a sink. Bukit Timah Plaza , 1 Jalan Anak Bukit, Singapore 588996, www.bukittimahplaza.com.sg 9. Causeway Point Location: Levels 1 to 5 and Level 7 (near the restrooms) There’s not much here, but the basic amenities within the nursing rooms include sofas, curtains for privacy, changing tables, sinks, a hot and cold water dispenser and power points. Causeway Point , 1 Woodlands Square, Singapore 738099, www.causewaypoint.com.sg 10. Central @ Clarke Quay Location: Level 1, near female restrooms Don’t expect luxury from Central’s nursing room, but it’s got the basics and you can lock the room to have the entire space to yourself. The nursing cubicle can’t be locked, but the entire baby care room can be locked, and there’s also a changing station and sink. Central @ Clarke Quay , 6 Eu Tong Sen St, Singapore 059817, www.fareastmalls.com.sg/clarke-quay-central 11. Centrepoint Location: Level 6 (one within Metro Department Store, one beside Management office and restrooms) You can expect lockable nursing rooms with armchairs and side tables (there’s even a bed in the Metro baby room!), alongside changing tables, a hot and cold water dispenser, a sink and power points as well as a playpen and cot. Centrepoint , 176 Orchard Rd, Singapore 238843, www.thecentrepoint.com.sg 12. Changi Airport Image credit: Changi Airport via Facebook Location: Click here for locations across all four terminals. Changi seriously sets a global standard for its family-friendly facilities, with a whopping 30 baby care facilities spanning its four terminals, in both public and private areas. The nursing rooms are as modern and spacious as the airport itself, offering pretty much everything you need, plus a diaper dispenser in case you forgot to pack those! Each and every room is equipped with a hot water dispenser and clean and comfy changing facilities, and many also have dedicated, private nursing stalls as well. Our hands-down fave is the Peranakan-themed nursing room in gorgeous Terminal 4 . Unsurprisingly, this most modern terminal offers no less than eleven nursing and changing rooms, including five in public areas like the departure and arrivals halls. Changi Airport , 60 Airport Blvd., Singapore 819643, www.changiairport.com 13. Changi City Point Location: Level B1 to Level 2 Mamas will get to use the two available nursing rooms, which contain armchairs and bag hooks, changing stations, sinks and a hot and cold water dispenser. However, there are no locks on the doors, just curtains to shield you as you feed your little one. Changi City Point , 5 Changi Business Park Central 1, Singapore 486038, www.changicitypoint.com.sg 14. Chinatown Point Location: Level 3 The nursing room is small and does not have locks or any form of separation. There is a small armchair with a changing station and a sink. Chinatown Point , 133 New Bridge Rd, Singapore 059413, www.chinatownpoint.com.sg 15. City Square Mall Location: Levels 2 and 4 (nursing rooms); Levels B2 to 4 (diaper changing stations in male and female toilets) This vast mall has several baby care rooms that can fit your stroller and offer privacy with lockable nursing rooms. The two lockable nursing rooms have a sofa, changing stations, sink, power points and a hot and cold water dispenser. City Square Mall , 180 Kitchener Rd, Singapore 208539, www.citysquaremall.com.sg 16. Claymore Connect Location: Level 3 (near restrooms) Breastfeed in the lockable nursing rooms, which have benches, changing stations and power points. Claymore Connect , 442 Orchard Rd, Singapore 238879, www.claymoreconnect.sg 17. Clementi Mall Location: Level 3 and 4 (two baby rooms by food court and restrooms); Level 5 The lockable nursing rooms have a chair or sofa, changing stations, sinks, a magazine/reading rack and power points. There’s also a play area next to the baby room on Level 4 by the food court. Clementi Mall , 3155 Commonwealth Ave W, Singapore 129588, www.theclementimall.com 18. Compass One (formerly Compass Point) Image Credit: Compass One via Official Website Location: Level B1 and Level 4 Warmly lit and spacious, the nursing room at Compass One has a hot and cold water dispenser, diaper-changing stations and a comfy long bench for bigger tots to sit and unwind while mama feeds baby. Compass One , 1 Sengkang Square, Singapore 545078, www.compassone.sg Read more: Guide To Sengkang Grand Mall 19. Far East Plaza Location: Levels 1 to 5 (Next to the restrooms) The individual parenting rooms at Far East Plaza are fitted with a bench and a changing table, and the entire room can be locked. There’s also a sink, hot and cold water dispenser, high chair, bottle warmer and a waiting area. Far East Plaza , 14 Scotts Rd, Singapore 228213, www.fareastplaza.com.sg 20. Forum The Shopping Mall Location: Level 1 The Mother’s Room comes complete with changing stations, two nursing rooms with armchairs (separated by curtains) and a wash basin. Forum the Shopping Mall , 583 Orchard Rd, Singapore 238884, www.forumtheshoppingmall.com.sg 21. The Fullerton Hotel Singapore Location: Level B1 (near the restrooms by the foot of the staircase) Options in the CBD are few and far between, so if you find yourself on the Northern/Eastern side of Raffles Place this may be your best bet (of course, we suggest purchasing a coffee or a trinket from the gift shop if you’re not already there for a lovely afternoon tea or brunch !). Amenities include a hot and cold water dispenser, power points, a fold-down changing table and a separate nursing alcove (NB: we’ve also nursed in a comfy chair in the larger women’s restroom on B1). The Fullerton Hotel Singapore , 1 Fullerton Square, Singapore 049178, www.fullertonhotels.com/the-fullerton-hotel 22. Great World Location: Levels B1, 1 and 2 Great World’s baby care room is bright, colourful and comfy, with plenty of privacy and facilities such as a basin, hot water dispenser, diaper changing stations and nursing rooms. The nursing rooms can be locked, and have a cosy armchair and table, too. Great World , 1 Kim Seng Promenade, Singapore 237994, shop.greatworld.com.sg 23. Harbourfront Centre Location: Levels 2 and 3 (Lobby A) This is a pretty old shopping centre, so it’s no surprise its family rooms aren’t very impressive, but they have all the basics and are often much less busy than the nursing rooms in neighbouring VivoCity! Expect changing tables, private feeding areas, as well as hot and cold drinking water. Harbourfront Centre , 1 Maritime Square, Singapore 0992531 www.harbourfrontcentre.com.sg 24. Hougang Mall Location: Levels 2 and 5 (near restrooms) Nursing rooms have armchairs (no locks; separated by curtains), changing stations, sinks, hot and cold water dispenser and power points. Hougang Mall , 90 Hougang Ave 10, Singapore 538766, www.hougangmall.com.sg 25. IKEA Location: The baby care room is located near the restaurant IKEA’s baby care rooms feature some of its own products with a minimalist but functional design, plus those famous white high chairs to keep bub safely strapped in while you re-pack that diaper bag! Bonus: you can get free jars of baby food upon request and there are microwave ovens for warming up milk at the restaurant, too! Other must-haves include a waiting area, nursing cubicles, changing tables, sinks, water dispensers, bottle warmers, and a disposable diaper dispenser. IKEA , three locations in Singapore including Tampines, Jurong East and Alexandra Road, www.ikea.com/sg/en 26. IMM Location: Level 2 (behind Kohong Health Care Centre and near OSIM); Level 3 (near car park entrance) Rejoice if you’ve got a pram with you because there is plenty of space for prams and daddies! In addition to lockable family rooms with nursing and changing areas, the nursing rooms here have baby holders to prop older babies up, power sockets and sinks. IMM , 2 Jurong East Street 21, Singapore 609601, www.capitaland.com/sg/malls/imm/en.html 27. ION Orchard Location: Levels B4, B3, B1 and Levels 3 and 4 ION has some of our favourite restrooms in Singapore so it’s little wonder that their nursing rooms are just as nice. In addition to standard amenities like a hot water dispenser and changing tables, on B3 and B4 you’ll also discover a bottle warmer and handy diaper vending machine if you find yourself in a pinch (has definitely happened to us on more than one occasion)! We also like that these rooms have plenty of room for a stroller. Other amenities include a hot/cold water dispenser, cushioned changing tables, bottle warmer, diaper vending machine and separate nursing alcoves. Their baby rooms can only accommodate one family, but you can lock the entire room and have it all to yourself. I ON Orchard , 2 Orchard Turn, Singapore 238801, www.ionorchard.com 30. JEM Location: Level B1, Level 3 and Level 5 and the family toilet on Levels 2 to 5 Spacious and clean, these are truly family care rooms with child-sized toilets for your older bubs! There are three spacious lockable nursing rooms with armchairs and a small table, as well as three diaper changing stations (the changing table is at the family toilet on Level 2), a sink, hot and cold water dispenser, bottle warmer, children’s loo and power points. The family toilet includes a children’s loo and baby holder. JEM , 50 Jurong Gateway Rd, Singapore 608549, www.jem.sg 31. Jewel Image Credit: Jewel Location: every level from B2 to Level 4 We just have to rave about the nursing rooms at Jewel because it is one of the most spacious, clean and beautifully designed nursing rooms in Singapore. There are padded diaper changing stations, hot and cold water dispensers, and private cubicles for nursing your little one in peace. There are even charging outlets for your phone in case you end up being nap-trapped when your little bub falls asleep in your arms! Jewel, 78 Airport Boulevard, Singapore 819666, www.jewelchangiairport.com 32. Junction 8 Location: Level B1, 1, 2 and 3 In addition to complimentary baby stroller rentals, Junction 8 also has two lockable nursing rooms with chairs and a small table, a changing station, a bottle warmer, a high chair and more. Junction 8 , 9 Bishan Pl, Singapore 579837, www.capitaland.com/sg/malls/junction8/en.html 33. Jurong East Bus Interchange Image Credit: Hegen via Facebook Location: Jurong East Bus Interchange This beautiful, calming nursing room was created by a partnership between Tower Transit Singapore (TTS) and Hegen. There’s a padded changing table, sink, hot and cold water dispenser and a nursing room with a lock (and a comfy nursing chair!). Jurong East Bus Interchange, 17A Jurong Gateway Road, Singapore 608513, www.towertransit.sg 34. Jurong Point Location: JP1, Level 3 (near Kopitiam), JP2 Basement 1 (opposite Samsung) and Level 3 Mongkok Street The Jurong Point nursing rooms are decently sized with padded diaper changing stations, a sink, hot and cold water dispenser and a nursing room (only on Levels 2 and 3). Jurong Point, 1 Jurong West Central 2, Singapore 648886, www.jurongpoint.com.sg 35. KINEX Location: Level 2 The nursing room at KINEX is clean, bright, and modern with three locked nursing rooms, a comfy waiting area for family, and plenty of room for parking strollers. We deem this the best nursing room in the East; it’s exceptionally clean and tidy, with three handy, private nursing stalls as well as multiple changing rooms and plenty of room for multiple strollers. Amenities include a hot/cold water dispenser, power points, cushioned changing tables, three separate nursing alcoves with comfy chairs and shelves, three lockable nursing cubicles with comfy chairs, sinks and a bench for those waiting. KINEX , 11 Tanjong Katong Road, Singapore 437157, www.kinex.com.sg 36. Mandarin Gallery Location: Level 2, Level 3, Level 4 near restrooms Key amenities include a nursing area with a sofa (the entire room can be locked), a changing table and a sink. Mandarin Gallery , 333A Orchard Rd, Singapore 238897, www.mandaringallery.com.sg 37. Marina Square Location: Level B1 and Levels 1 to 3 (near restrooms) What will you find here? Think lockable nursing rooms with sofa, a changing station and sink, hot/cold water dispenser, power points and a waiting area. Marina Square , 6 Raffles Blvd, Singapore 039594, www.marinasquare.com.sg 38. Marina Bay Link Mall Location: Level B2 There’s nothing particularly special about this nursing room except that it’s in the basement of a mall connected to one of Singapore’s biggest office buildings – we’ve had a few working mama friends who’ve pumped in the Marina Bay Financial Centre at lunchtime. It’s too small to fit a pram, but it does have a seat for nursing, a fold-down changing table, a sink, and the all-important power point. Marina Bay Link Mall , 8A Marina Blvd, Singapore 018984, www.marinabaylink.com.sg 39. Millennium Walk Location: Level B1 (next to lift lobby B) These two nursing rooms aren’t the fanciest, but we like how bright and spacious they are, with plenty of room to park strollers. There are also two toddler high chairs in case you’ve got multiple kiddos in tow and one is hankering for a different kind of snack! Amenities include power points, separate nursing alcoves, toddler chairs and cushioned changing tables. Millennia Walk , 9 Raffles Blvd, Singapore 039596, www.milleniawalk.com 40. National Gallery Singapore Location: One nursing room per floor on level B1, and levels 1 to 5 The nursing rooms at National Gallery Singapore are particularly sleek, and you’ll find one cosy nursing room per floor (that’s six in total!). Each has a comfy chair and enough room for a stroller – except on Level 5, which only has a small stool, and no sofa – as well as a hot/cold water dispenser, power points, cushioned changing table and sink. And while the nursing rooms have step-free access, they are not wheelchair accessible. National Gallery Singapore , 1 St Andrew’s Road #01–01 Singapore 178957, www.nationalgallery.sg 41. NEX Location: Level B2 (near Holland & Barrett and Jean Yip Lifestyle); Level B1 (near MoneyMax); Level 1 (near G2000); Level 2 (near Isetan and Giordano); Level 3 (near Isetan and QB House); Level 4 (near Food Junction); Sky Garden (near the Serangoon Public Library) A nursing room with a Yakult vending machine to distract older bubs? We’re loving the convenience! Other bonus points include two lockable nursing rooms with chairs, sink, hot and cold water dispenser, power points and high chairs. NEX , 23 Serangoon Central, Singapore 556083, www.nex.com.sg 42. Ngee Ann City Location: Level B1 (inside female restroom); Level B2 Ngee Ann City’s nursing rooms are functional but minimal, so head over to the nearby Takashimaya baby care room (see entry no. 63) if you’re looking for a premium nursing room experience. The nursing room here has an armchair and a table, a changing table and sink. Locks and power points are only available in the rooms on Level B2. Ngee Ann City , 391A Orchard Rd, Singapore 238873, www.ngeeanncity.com.sg 43. Northpoint City Location: B2 to Level 3 (North Wing) and B2 to Level 2 (South Wing) The nursing rooms are fitted with a small armchair and table. You can lock the door for privacy. The rooms also have changing stations, a sink and a hot/cold water dispenser. Power points are available, too. Northpoint City , 930 Yishun Ave 2, Singapore 769098, www.northpointcity.com.sg 44. One Raffles Place Location: Level 4 (next to restrooms) We hear horror stories about workin’ mamas lining up to pump here – the only nursing room in the heart of Raffles Place (we know offices should all have their own pumping facilities, but sadly that just isn’t the case right now). That said, for mamas who find themselves needing to pump (or toting their babies around the CBD), head to Level 4 to get the job done (but try not to go at peak times like lunch!). Note that this room is also too small to fit a pram. Amenities include a hot/cold water dispenser, changing table, sink, chair for nursing and power points. One Raffles Place , 1 Raffles Pl, Singapore 048616, www.onerafflesplace.com.sg/shopping 45. Orchard Central Location: Levels 3, 4 and 7 Believe it or not, there are NO changing tables available at Orchard Central, but if you simply want to nurse, it’s got you covered! Orchard Central , 181 Orchard Rd, Singapore 238896, www.fareastmalls.com.sg/orchard-central 46. OUE Downtown Gallery Location: Level 2 The nursing room at this shiny mall and office building on Shenton Way is a welcome addition to the CBD area (though nursing rooms are still too far and few between!). Here, the nursing room is separate from the changing area, which is good for efficiency’s sake but does create some pretty tight quarters (there’s just enough space to fit a stroller into each, though). The nursing rooms also have a hot/cold water dispenser, power points, a padded changing table and sink, as well as separate nursing alcoves with one seat. OUE Downtown Gallery , 6A Shenton Way, Singapore 068815, www.downtowngallery.com.sg 47. Palais Renaissance Location: Level 2 restroom The amenities are basic – there’s one nursing cubicle with a changing table. The entire room can be locked, and you’ll also have access to a sink, child toilet and power points. Palais Renaissance , 390 Orchard Rd, Singapore 238871, www.palais.sg 48. Paragon Location: Level 3 or level 5 (near the restrooms) Paragon’s nursing rooms match the high-quality interior of the mall itself, with comfy nursing chairs and complimentary baby toiletries! Clean and spacious, these stylish, lockable nursing rooms match their upscale mall surrounds with marble appointments and comfy seating. Amenities include a hot water dispenser, power points, separate nursing alcove with comfy seating, two cushioned changing tables and diaper disposal bags. Paragon Shopping Centre , 290 Orchard Road, Singapore 238859 , www.paragon.com.sg 49. Parkway Parade Location: Basement (near Japan Home); Level 2 (next to the ladies’ washroom and 6 Elements Hair Spa); Level 3 (next to the ladies’ washroom and Robert Piano). Wow, someone put some playful thought into Parkway Parade’s nursing rooms, with toys scattered about to distract the bubs! Key amenities here include nursing cubicles with armchairs and small tables, changing stations, a sink, power points and a hot/cold water dispenser. There are also high chairs and toys on certain levels. Parkway Parade , 80 Marine Parade Rd, Singapore 449269, www.parkwayparade.com.sg 50. Paya Lebar Square Location: Level B1 and Level 1 This bare-basics nursing room is lockable and can fit one pram only. However, there’s only one nursing room on each floor, so odds are, you’ll need to wait to use it. That said, the room is clean enough for a quick feed! Paya Lebar Square , 60 Paya Lebar Rd, Singapore 409051, www.payalebarsquare.sg 51. Plaza Singapura Location: Levels 2, 3, 4 and 6 (next to the ladies’ restroom) These baby nursing rooms are nicely decorated and clean, but there’s only one lockable nursing area per baby room so you might need to wait a while. There is also a changing table inside the nursing room and outside, a sink; power points and a hot and cold water dispenser. Plaza Singapura , 68 Orchard Rd, Singapore 238839, www.capitaland.com/sg/malls/plazasingapura 52. Raffles City Location: Level B1 (next to the restrooms near Marks & Spencer and Crumpler); Level 3 (next to restrooms near PS. Cafe). The lockable nursing room has an armchair and key amenities include a hot and cold water dispenser, changing station, baby diaper dispenser, sofa and nursing rooms with an electrical point. Raffles City , 252 North Bridge Rd, Singapore 179103, www.capitaland.com/sg/malls/rafflescity/en.html 53. Resorts World Sentosa (RWS) Locations: Click here for a full list of nursing rooms at RWS There are four nursing rooms scattered around RWS, and each one is within walking distance of the attractions here. There’s even a special Baby Centre at Universal Studios Singapore, complete with a microwave, coin-operated dispensers for diapers and bed liners and even a cute play space for older tots. The nursing areas include either lockable nursing cubicles or curtained nursing spaces, changing stations ad tables, hot and cold water dispensers and power sockets. Resorts World Sentosa , 8 Sentosa Gateway, Singapore 098269, www.rwsentosa.com 54. River Wonders Location: Near the entrance, Giant Panda Forest, Boat Plaza and Amazon Flooded Forest. The nursing rooms have diaper-changing facilities and plastic chairs. They can be locked, and also contain changing tables, sinks and power points. River Wonders , 80 Mandai Lake Rd, Singapore 729826, www.mandai.com/en/river-wonders.html 55. Scotts Square Location: Level 2 and 3 (near restrooms) Large and new-ish, these rooms look nice but considering how fancy the mall itself is, they are pretty minimalist in terms of amenities! Key features include one lockable nursing room with a bench, sink, changing area and a waiting area. Scotts Square , 6 Scotts Rd, Singapore 228209, www.instagram.com/scottssquaresg 56. Sentosa Island Location: Festive Walk (single rooms on B1 and Level 1, double rooms on Level 1 near Osia); Galleria (three nursing rooms). We hear the best nursing facilities on Sentosa Island are at Universal Studios – see the RWS entry above! But within public areas, you’ve got a few choices with necessary amenities like sinks, power points, changing tables and separate nursing alcoves. The Galleria nursing room is a little tricky to find; it’s tucked along a long hallway behind the shops! If you can’t find the nursing rooms, just check in with the friendly ground staff for directions. Sentosa Island , www.sentosa.com.sg 57. Shaw Centre Location: Level 4 (inside Isetan children’s department) The two lockable nursing rooms have basic amenities like chairs and small tables, changing stations, hot water dispensers and power points. Want to warm your baby’s food up before feeding them? Check in with the cashier just outside the nursing room to see if the food warmer is available. There are also high chairs available. Shaw Centre , 1 Scotts Rd, Singapore 228208, www.shawcentre.sg 58. The Shoppes at MBS Location: Levels B2 (next to Club Monaco and Rasapura Masters); B1 (next to Dior and Fila Kids) and Level 1 (next to Orient Crown or Imperial Treasure Fine Teochew Cuisine) These oh-so colourful rooms (peep that bold, stripey wallpaper!) offer plenty of privacy (limited to one family per room, although we’ve shared the changing tables in a pinch), along with a handy seat where you can strap in a wiggly toddler if need be. The nursing rooms at MBS are spacious enough to fit one stroller at a time, and are nice and quiet. The nursing rooms have chairs and tables, cushioned changing tables, a sink, baby seats and more, and there are two floors per level. The Shoppes at Marina Bay Sands , 8 Bayfront Ave, Singapore 018955, www.marinabaysands.com 59. Singapore City Gallery Location: Level 2 near Gallery room (accessible via glass lift or escalator from the ground floor) The nursing rooms at the Singapore City Gallery include stroller parking, diaper changing facilities, a hot and cold water dispenser, a sink and hand soap. Both nursing rooms are lockable and you can get comfy on the sofas and tables. Singapore City Gallery , 45 Maxwell Road The URA Centre, 069118, www.ura.gov.sg 60. Singapore Zoo Location: Rainforest Kidzworld, Reptile Garden and at the main entrance. Diaper-changing facilities are available at Rainforest Kidzworld, main entrance, Wildlife Learning Centre, Ah Meng Restaurant, Reptile Garden and Pavilion by the Lake. Spending the day at the Singapore Zoo ? Take a break from the heat and pop into these air-conditioned baby rooms to feed and change your own little monkeys! Key perks include nursing cubicles separated by curtains, changing stations, sinks, a hot and cold water dispenser, power points and a waiting area. Singapore Zoo , 80 Mandai Lake Rd, Singapore 729826, www.mandai.com 61. SingPost Centre Location: Levels B1 and L3 The nursing room here is clean but minimalist at best. There’s a sink and diaper-changing station, and a child-friendly toilet within, which is perfect if you have older kids. SingPost Centre , 10 Eunos Rd 8, Singapore 408600, www.singpostcentre.com 62. Suntec City Shopping Mall Location: Levels 1 (near the Suntec City Tourist Hub and the Adidas Store) and 2 (near Toys R Us and the Convention Centre). Clean and very spacious, the main Suntec nursing room on Level 1 offers two nursing alcoves with comfy chairs, along with multiple padded changing tables, and even a bottle steriliser. NB: The nursing room on Level 2 is much smaller, with just a single nursing seat. You can expect sinks, a bottle steriliser in the Level 1 nursing room, separate nursing alcoves with comfy chairs, a hot/cold water dispenser, cushioned changing tables and power points. Suntec City Shopping Mall , 3 Temasek Boulevard Singapore 038983, www.sunteccity.com.sg 63. Suntec City Convention Centre Location: Levels 1 and 2; Tower 3 (next to Toys R’ Us) There are multiple nursing rooms scattered across Suntec, but with it being a hub for a lot of working mamas, it’s a real shame there aren’t any power points to help with expressing milk. The nursing cubicle has curtains instead of locks, and there are changing stations and a hot and cold water dispenser. Suntec City Convention Centre , 1 Raffles Blvd, Singapore 039593, www.suntecsingapore.com 64. Takashimaya Location: Children’s Department, Level 4 This has long held the crown as the single best nursing room in Singapore, and in our humble opinion, no one’s come for it yet! Super clean, spacious, and comfortable, this family lounge has room for a whole gaggle of strollers. The five separate nursing areas each feature a comfy seat and a dedicated changing table. You’ll also find toddler high chairs (with trays!) and even a Huggies diaper dispenser. There’s also a spacious seating area with a TV where you can send bored older kiddos if need be. This room is worth seeking out if you find yourself on Orchard, and your bub needs a breather. And if – due to its popularity – it’s crowded, you’ll be relieved to know there are additional nice nursing rooms elsewhere in Ngee Ann City. Other amenities include a hot/cold water dispenser, power points and sinks. Takashimaya , 391 Orchard Rd, Singapore 238872, www.takashimaya.com.sg 65. Tampines Mall Location: Level 2 (near Lift Lobby A) Key features in the two lockable nursing rooms include armchairs, small tables and a baby holder, two changing stations a sink and a hot and cold water dispenser. Tampines Mall , 4 Tampines Central 5, Singapore 529510, www.capitaland.com/sg/malls/tampinesmall/en.html 66. Tampines 1 Location: Levels 2 and 5 You’ll find two lockable nursing rooms with benches, changing stations, a sink and a hot and cold water dispenser. Tampines 1 , 10 Tampines Central 1, Singapore 529536, www.tampines1.com.sg 67. Tanglin Mall Location: Level 3 (baby care room near restrooms); Level 2 (diaper changing room) Spacious – with enough space to wheel in a couple of strollers – this nursing room is usually pretty jumping due to all the baby-friendly amenities nearby. The decor is slightly dated, but it’s comfortable and has all the amenities a mama could need, including nursing armchairs and a table, changing stations, sink, hot and cold water dispenser and power points. Tanglin Mall , 163 Tanglin Road, Singapore 247933, www.tanglinmall.com.sg Read more: Guide To Tanglin Mall Shopping, Food & More 68. Thomson Plaza Location: Level 3 Key features of the lockable nursing area include a bench, changing table, sink and a waiting area. Thomson Plaza , 301 Upper Thomson Rd, Singapore 574408, www.thomsonplaza.com.sg 69. Tiong Bahru Plaza Location: Levels B1, 1 to 3 The nursing room area has a bench but no locks. There are also facilities such as a changing station, sink, waiting area, hot/cold water dispenser and power points. Tiong Bahru Plaza , 302 Tiong Bahru Rd, Singapore 168732, www.tiongbahruplaza.com.sg 70. United Square Location: Level 1 This popular kids’ mall has a pretty nice baby care room that can accommodate a couple of strollers and is kept very clean. The three lockable nursing rooms come with comfy armchairs, changing stations, a waiting area, hot water dispenser, sink, high chairs and power points. United Square , 101 Thomson Rd, Singapore 307591, www.unitedsquare.com.sg 71. Valley Point Shopping Centre Image Credit: Valley Point via Official Website Location: Level 1 There’s one nursing cubicle (no locks; separated by curtains), a changing table, sink and a hot and cold water dispenser. Valley Point Shopping Centre , 491 River Valley Rd, Singapore 248371, www.valleypoint.com.sg 72. Velocity @ Novena Location: Levels 2 (near NOVITA) Nice, clean and bright, the baby room in Velocity has everything you need, but it’s a bit out of the way from the more popular stores. The two lockable nursing rooms have a sofa, changing station, sink, and power points. There are also hot and cold water dispensers on levels 2 and 3. Velocity @ Novena , 238 Thomson Road, Singapore 307683, www.velocitynovena.com 73. VivoCity Location: Levels 2 (Lobbies Q and H) and 3 (Lobby H) You won’t be disappointed with these clean, spacious baby rooms, but, fair warning, the queues can be long during the weekend rush! There are four large nursing areas with armchairs; the one with locks and a waiting area is near the playground on Level 2. There are also changing stations, sinks, power points, and hot/cold water dispensers. VivoCity , 1 HarbourFront Walk, Singapore 098585, www.vivocity.com.sg 74. Waterway Point Location: B2 to Level 2 The spacious nursing room at Waterway Point comes with a padded diaper changing station, hot and cold water dispenser, a sink, and a breastfeeding room with a bench and an electrical point to charge your phone. This nursing room can fit up to two strollers and even has a bench for your husband to wait while you nurse your baby. Waterway Point, 83 Punggol Central, Singapore 828763, www.waterwaypoint.com.sg 75. West Coast Plaza Location: Level B1 Key features within the one lockable nursing room include a bench, changing table, sink, power points and a hot/cold water dispenser. West Coast Plaza , 154 West Coast Rd, Singapore 127371, www.fareastmalls.com.sg/west-coast-plaza 76. Wheelock Place Location: Level 1 This one is a bit difficult to get to with a stroller, with the lift to level 1 as your only option. Key features in the single, lockable nursing room include a changing table, sink and power points. Wheelock Place , 501 Orchard Rd, Singapore 238880, www.facebook.com/wheelockplacesg 76. Wisma Atria Location: Level 3 The baby room at Wisma Atria is really just a small area inside the female restroom so it’s not particularly pleasant, but it has the basics in a pinch! Think armchair and changing table (no locks), a sink and a hot/cold water dispenser. Wisma Atria , 435 Orchard Rd, Singapore 238877, www.wismaonline.com The Grandstand (closed) Location: Level 1 (near Lift 7) Located just around the corner from Dancing Crab, the nursing room here is not particularly peaceful, but it’ll do for a quick change and feed. The nursing room has no locks, but you’ll find a changing table, sink, power points and a hot and cold water dispenser, so your basic needs are covered. The Grandstand Want more help? Considering downloading the Nursing Room app , which helps you find the closest nursing room to you and all the amenities in it. Did we miss a public nursing room in Singapore? Please tell us (and send a snap) to sassy@sassymamasg.com Read more: The post Handy List Of Best Nursing Rooms In Singapore To Breastfeed appeared first on Sassy Mama .

articles.title: Where To Go For Tufting Classes In Singapore: Rug Tufting Workshops
articles.author: Sassy Mama
articles.content: Tufting is the art of making your own unique rug! Visit these tuft clubs and studios for carpet tufting workshops in Singapore to learn how to tuft a rug designed by you in just a few hours. Tufting, along with other artisanal hobbies like crocheting and knitting, has recently enjoyed a resurgence of interest, courtesy of TikTok. Perhaps it is the authenticity of handmade crafts that appeals to many, especially in this age of mass manufacturing. Tufting – the latest addition to viral DIY crafts ­– refers to a method of weaving textiles where yarn is looped through fabric, usually to make rugs. Rug tufting for beginners: Trending clips have made modern rug tufting look so satisfyingly simple, which is perfect for beginners. You don’t even need sewing experience to create tufting designs of every conceivable shape, size and colour. All that’s required is some patience in manoeuvring an automated tufting gun that rapidly punches needle into fabric, transforming loose threads into eye-catching designs. If you are looking for a bonding activity to do with your teen , why not join a tufting workshop in Singapore? Get ready to craft your own masterpieces at these local studios offering tufting classes. Best Rug Tufting Workshops In Singapore: 1. Tuft Club: rug tufting and tuft mirror workshops Image credit: Tuft Club Want to snazz up your floor, wall or mirror with some lovely bespoke pieces? Tuft Club offers two types of tufting classes – their rug tufting and tuft mirror workshops. The former allows you to make a rug or wall hanging up to 60 x 60cm, while the latter guides you on tufting mirror frames. The tufting workshops are both four and a half hours long and include detailed instructions on different tufting techniques for your designs. You can also book private tufting classes. Do note that the minimum age to sign up is 16. Tufting class: $75. Book here. Carpet Tufting in Singapore with Tuft Club: at 57 Circular Rd, #03-01, Singapore 049412 2. Everytuft: Tufting workshops for kids and adults Ever y tuft is a tuft studio that was started by a pair of friends who quit their jobs in pursuit of their dream and love of tufting! Tufting workshops at Everytuft are more than just lessons in tufting – they provide a community and space for those with the same passion for art and crafts to share their knowledge and tips on tufting. Tufting workshops are based on themes and purpose. If you are a newbie, start with the 1 and half hour workshop. There’s even a tufting workshop for kids with the Tiny Tuftie session for kids aged 10 and below! Tufting class: from $$90/person. Or try Tufting Jamming sessions at $28/hour. Book here . Carpet Tufting in Singapore with Everytuft: 16A Lim Tua Tow Rd, Singapore 547752 3. Hueplay Studio: Rugs N’ Tuft tufting classes Image credit: Hue Play Studio Singapore A homey space for artistic escapes, Hueplay Studio has art jamming experiences, punch needle workshops and tufting classes that they affectionately call Rugs N’ Tuft. There are over 30 yarn colours to inspire ideas for your tufting designs. For those who intend to work on more ambitious tufting patterns, upgrade to a 70 x 70cm frame at the store. It’s time to sip on tea, listen to some good music and tuft a customised rug with your loved ones. Tufting workshop: From $88. Book here. Carpet Tufting in Singapore with Hueplay Studio: at 77 Kampong Bahru Road, #02-01, Singapore 169376 4. beadbadwolf: rug and mirror tufting classes Image credit: BeabadWolf Cheryl, who is a textile artist and mother of two, is the founder of beadbadwolf. What she loves most is colours, and you’ll have plenty of those to play with in her workshops. Tufting classes at beadbadwolf are only available upon request.
