Not only does Cheryl teach rug and mirror tufting, but she also conducts workshops for tufting coasters and stools! At the tufted rug/mirror workshop, select your design, then make it come to life in a 55cm-65cm long piece. Leave it at the studio after class to be completed with glue and felt backing before picking it up a few weeks later. Tufting class: $135. Book here. Rug Tufting in Singapore with beadbadwolf: 195 Pearl’s Hill Terrace, #02-10, Singapore S168976 5. HelloRugs: tufting workshops with fun tuft designs Image credit: Hello Rugs Embark on four-hour therapeutic tufting sessions at HelloRugs. The studio has two class slots 10am-2pm and 4pm-8pm every day of the week except Tuesdays. Materials such as the tufting frame, cloth and yarn are provided and you’ll create rugs or wall hangings up to 55 x 55cm. Past participants have tufted Spongebob, Pokemon and Kermit rugs! Within the same week, HelloRugs will mail the finished work to you at no additional cost. Rug Tufting class: From $50/person. Book here. Carpet Tufting in Singapore with HelloRugs: 29 Paya Lebar Road, #02-01, Singapore 409005 Rug tufting workshops in Singapore that have closed: BoKkAna’s Club: bonding tufting classes (Closed) Image credit: Bokkanas Club BoKkAna’s Club is a cosy studio nestled in the heart of Singapore. Teaching cream glue craft and rug tufting, BoKkAna’s Club’s workshops are a fun way to bond with family and friends. At rug tufting classes, prepare an image for reference, choose your yarns and then operate the tufting gun to make your desired tufting design. Bring the rug home or leave it at the studio to dry for two to three weeks before getting it delivered to you. Rug Tufting class: $125/person (50x50cm frame), $155/person (70x70cm frame) (Temporarily closed) Rug Tufting in Singapore with BoKkAna’s Club: 729 North Bridge Road, Singapore 198697 Studio An: four-hour tufting workshops (Closed) Image credit: Studio An At Studio An’s four-hour tufting workshops, you can choose to tuft rugs for your floor, or to hang on a mirror or wall. Have a tufting design on your phone that you wish to see materialised? Project it on the tufting frame, then trace over the image with a permanent marker. This tufting studio is great for parent-child tufting classes as you’ll only be charged an additional $30 for a second person to work on your tufting design with you. Studio An provides more than 50 colours of cotton blended yarns for your tufting designs – feel free to experiment! Experienced tufting instructors will guide you through how to use the tufting guns and after completion, your rug will be given some finishing touches before being sent to your home in about three weeks. Tufting class: $185/person for a single session. Additional $30 if a second person is coming to work on the same tufting piece. articles.content: ‘Help! I’m looking for a dentist near me!’ Don’t worry, we’ve got you. Scroll through our list of dental clinics, family dental surgeries and kids’ dentists in Singapore. Looking for a caring kids’ dentist near you since your mini-me is afraid of visiting the dental clinic? Thankfully, dentist visits don’t have to be a stressful experience anymore, as there are loads of kids’ dentists, dental surgeries and dental clinics in Singapore that are family-friendly! Some have tellies so kiddos can watch cartoons before (or during!) an appointment, colourful decor and even little stickers and rewards. Whether you are looking for your child’s first dental checkup, scaling and polishing or have a dental emergency like a chipped tooth or root canal treatment, use our guide to find a family-friendly dental clinic in Singapore near you. Plus, scroll to the end for our useful tips to ease nerves before a dental check-up in Singapore. Family-Friendly Dental Clinics & Kids’ Dentists In Singapore: Burlinson Dental Surgery: Kids’ dental clinic in the East Image credit: Burlinson Dental Surgery Burlinson Dental Surgery is a dental clinic in the East that has served families for the past 14 years. Families in the East also trust them with their kids’ dental needs. Whether you’re looking for routine care or specialised treatments, this kids’ dental clinic in Singapore is ever-ready to help. Burlinson Dental Surgery, 55 Siglap Road, B1-28, Singapore 455871, Tel: (+65) 6241 3088, www.burlinsondental.com Atria-City Dental Group: Kids dental care Atria-City Dental Group is a well-established multi-disciplinary dental practice which offers a comprehensive range of general and specialised dental services for both children and adults since 1994. Kids especially love Raintree Dental Clinic’s play corner which includes a video game console and an in-chair entertainment system. Raintree Dental Clinic , 107 East Coast Road, Singapore 428799, www.raintreedental.com.sg Canaan Dental Surgery: Kids’ dentist in East Coast Image credit: Canaan Dental Surgery Not only is this dentist in Singapore absolutely kid-friendly, Canaan Dental Surgery is also known for its laid-back atmosphere, personalised service and state-of-the-art technology. This kid-friendly dentist engages kids through playful educational techniques to teach good dental habits in a fun way. Kids Dental World , Mount Elizabeth Novena Hospital, 38 Irrawaddy Road, #08-33, Singapore 329563, www.kidsdentalworld.com.sg Le 乐 by An Dental: Kids dentist at Orchard Road Image credit: An Dental Le 乐 by An Dental, located in the heart of Orchard Road, is a family clinic that has something for everyone. Le 乐 by An Dental, International Building (next to Lido), 360 Orchard Road #03-06/07, Singapore 238869, www.andental.sg National Dental Centre Singapore: Comprehensive oral care for kids Image credit: Pexels (for illustration purposes only) The Paediatric Dentistry Unit in the National Dental Centre Singapore (NDCS) provides comprehensive oral health care for children from birth to adolescence. Their team of dental specialists deal with examination and diagnosis, scaling & polishing, fillings and tooth extraction under local anaesthesia. The National Healthcare Group dental polyclinics are some of the cheapest dental clinics in Singapore. Simply make an appointment through the HealthHub app or by phone. National Healthcare Group Polyclinics, multiple locations including Woodlands, Yishun and Toa Payoh Polyclinic, www.nhgp.com.sx Nuffield Dental: Experienced kids dentists Image credit: Nuffield Dental Nuffield Dental’s eleven clinics offer dental check-ups, scaling and polishing, fillings, bite therapy and paediatric dentistry. Nuffield Dental , multiple clinics including Raffles Place, Serangoon, Holland Village, www.nuffielddental.com.sg NUP Dental Polyclinics: Basic dental services Image credit: Freepik (for illustrative purposes only) National University Polyclinics (NUP) offer cheap dental services at Bukit Panjang NUP Dental Polyclinic and Jurong, Queenstown NUP Dental Polyclinic. Book a dental appointment at a polyclinic via the HealthHub app. NUP Dental Polyclinics, three locations in Singapore including Bukit Panjang, Jurong and Queenstown, www.nup.com.sg Q & M Dental Group Singapore: Affordable dental services Image credit: Q & M Dental Group Q & M Dental is one of the more affordable dental clinics in Singapore offering subsidised services. Q & M Dental Singapore , multiple locations in Singapore, including Bugis, Bishan and Chinatown, www.qandm.com.sg SingHealth Polyclinics: Affordable dental services Image credit: Freepik (for illustration purposes only) SingHealth dental polyclinics offer dental services at selected SingHealth Polyclinic locations. Many of them are actively training specialists and dentists in Singapore and regionally in their respective areas of speciality. Specialist Dental Group, two locations at Mount Elizabeth and Napier Road , www.specialistdentalgroup.com T32 Dental: Kids dentist with TV & kids’ games Image credit: T32 Dental Group This dental clinic in Singapore has a dedicated paediatric department called T32 Junior. T32 Dental , multiple locations in Singapore including Camden, Jurong and Bedok, www.t32dental.com TP Dental Surgeons: Kids dental surgery Image credit: TP Dental Surgeons via Facebook Perched atop Ngee Ann City in an ultra-modern penthouse, TP Dental Surgeons offers advanced equipment and an outstanding dental team comprising general dentists in Singapore, endodontists, paediatric dentists, periodontists, oral and maxillofacial surgeons as well as orthodontists. If it’s your kiddos’ first dentist visit, there will be an examination involving “counting teeth”. TP Dental Surgeons , 391B Orchard Road, #26-01 Ngee Ann City Tower B, Singapore 238874, www.tpdental.com.sg Cheapest Dentist in Singapore Looking for the cheapest dentist in Singapore? Did you know that The Health Promotion Board’s School Dental Service provides free basic dental services in school dental clinics and mobile dental clinics at Preschool, as well as Primary, Secondary and ITE Year 1 schools? Click here for more information.​​​ Emergency dental services in Singapore If you are looking for cheap emergency dental services, check with the following dental clinics. However, do note wait times vary according to the number of specialists available each day: National Dental Centre Singapore National University Hospital Khoo Teck Puat Hospital National Healthcare Group (NHG) dental polyclinics SGH’s Department of Emergency Medicine (A&E) NUH Accident and Emergency Department where a Dental Officer on-call will attend to you Visiting a dentist in Singapore: FAQs When should I make the first visit to a paediatric dentist? The American Academy of Paediatric Dentistry (AAPD) recommends that you schedule an appointment at a kids’ dentist or family dental clinic within six months from when their first tooth erupts or by the age of one. However, there are also paediatric dentists who recommend visits around the age of three, unless your child has specific dental concerns. Dental experts agree that the earlier you begin this routine of visiting the dentist, the healthier their teeth, gums and mouth will be. In fact, early visits to the dentist can also help prevent cavities and tooth decay and other serious dental issues later on in life. What should I do if my child is scared of visiting the dental clinic? Several paediatric dentists have observed that parents may project their own fears onto their children. Instead of asking your kids to be brave or to not worry–these phrases can instil fear or doubt that may not have been present–let them read a book or a watch a video on visiting the dentist. This can help calm their nerves, which can also help develop healthy dental habits in the long run. You can also prep your child at home by practising how to open their mouth for the dentist or by pretending to count their teeth with a flashlight. What can we expect on a first visit to a paediatric dentist or dental clinic? It’s important to schedule your child’s first visit with a paediatric dentist, as these experts are trained to manage children in the areas of children’s growth and development, behaviour management and child psychology. Many paediatric dentists will do simple things like count your child’s teeth and offer a lighthearted introduction to the purpose of a dental visit. Some dentists may discuss your child’s diet with you and offer tips for good oral hygiene and teeth cleaning. This is also a good time to ask your kid’s dentist about any concerns you may have. Once your child is comfortable with their paediatric dentist, stick to a routine and bring them to the same dentist for subsequent dental appointments. How can I encourage good dental hygiene at home? It’s important to maintain good oral hygiene after your child’s first visit to a dental clinic in Singapore. Start by making brushing a habit twice a day. Invest in kid-friendly toothbrushes that are soft to medium in strength and teach your little one how to floss, too. The best way to cultivate good oral habits is to start by brushing your own teeth with your kids to set a good example. You can also use reward systems or turn brushing and flossing into a fun game. Positive reinforcement is always a great way to hone good dental habits. Set a routine by ensuring your child brushes their teeth at the same time and place every day, or make it part of their nightly bath time. Sometimes, letting them watch a fun and helpful video can motivate them to brush their teeth regularly. The most important way to help your child overcome their fear of the dentist is to look for kids’ dentists that take the time to explain or patiently answer any questions your child may have. Make sure your child gets plenty of rest prior to the visit, and if they are shy or nervous at the first visit, it is perfectly alright to stop and try again another day. Now that you’re prepared for your child’s first visit to the paediatric dentist, consider making an appointment at these dental clinics to keep their pearly whites shiny and bright! articles.title: Where To Find The Tastiest Rice Dumplings For Dumpling Festival & Dragon Boat Festival 2025
articles.author: Sassy Mama
articles.content: Here’s where to order celebratory bak chang/ba zhang and traditional rice dumplings in Singapore for the Dumpling Festival aka Dragon Boat Festival 2025. Don’t miss the rice dumpling promotions with early bird savings! Looking for rice dumplings in Singapore to celebrate the Dragon Boat Festival 2025 (also called Dumpling Festival 2025)? The traditional Chinese food for the Dragon Boat Festival is bak chang / bak zhang or zongzi — pyramid-shaped glutinous sticky rice dumplings with different fillings of pork, water chestnuts, mushrooms and other fillings wrapped in bamboo or reed leaves. Nyonya dumplings are stuffed with braised pork, five-spice powder and candied winter melon, while the rice dumpling ‘ Kee zhang ‘ has no filling and is eaten as a sweet, dipped gula melaka (palm sugar). Here’s where to find the tastiest rice dumplings to celebrate the Dumpling Festival in Singapore! ↓ Scroll on for where to find rice dumplings to celebrate Dragon Boat Festival 2025! Read more: Guide To Best Dim Sum In Singapore When is Rice Dumpling Festival 2025? The Chinese Dumpling Festival takes place on the fifth day of the fifth month of the Chinese Lunar Calendar which is Monday, 31 May 2025. Dragon Boat Festival History The Dragon Boat Festival commemorates the death of Qu Yuan, a Chinese poet and minister during the Zhou Dynasty Warring States period who was banished and accused of treason. He later drowned himself in the river when the Chu capital was captured by Qin. Legend has it that he couldn’t be saved by locals who tried to race out in boats to reach him in time. Fishermen beat their oars against the water to stop the man-eating fish in the river from devouring Qu Yuan’s body. Some say they threw cooked rice wrapped in leaves into the water, hoping that the fish would eat them instead. This legend has resulted in the celebratory Dragon Boat Festival with dragon boat races and the eating of rice dumplings wrapped in reed leaves. How to cook Rice Dumplings Rice dumplings are best eaten when they are steamed, but may also be eaten as sold from your favourite rice dumpling spot. If the rice dumplings are not eaten on the day of purchase, they should be placed in the refrigerator where they can be usually kept for up to four days. When you’re ready to tuck in, reheat the rice dumplings by steaming for 15 minutes or boiling for 12 minutes. Best Bak Chang/Rice Dumplings For Dumpling Festival 2025 So now that you know a little about the Dragon Boat Festival history, let’s check out some of the rice dumplings and gifting options in Singapore to celebrate this festival. 1. Pan Pacific Singapore: Handcrafted rice dumplings Image credit: Pan Pacific Singapore Indulge in succulent rice dumplings that are bursting with flavour this Dragon Boat Festival at the award-winning Cantonese restaurant Hai Tien Lo. Whether you’re looking for a thoughtful gift for business associates and friends or simply want to treat yourself to scrumptious rice dumplings at home, Pan Pacific Singapore’s Hai Tien Lo has just what you need. The exclusive Premium Rice Dumplings Set offers the highlights of their rice dumpling offerings this year including Supreme Rice Dumpling, Salted Fish and Preserved Meat Rice Dumpling and more. For a traditional rice dumpling, order the Teochew Rice Dumpling with Yam Paste, Chestnuts and Gingko Nuts or the Hokkien Rice Dumpling with Pork and Salted Egg Yolk. The Black Glutinous Nyonya Rice Dumpling offers a perfect blend of black and white glutinous rice with lean pork, candied melon, Japanese mushrooms, shallots and garlic. Order online for delivery or opt for self-collection at Pacific Emporium’s deli counter. Rice dumplings for Rice Dumpling Festival 2025: Order online from now to 31 May 2025 for delivery or pick-up from 1 May until 31 May 2025, 10am to 8pm. Call Tel: (+65) 6826 8240 or email specialevents.ppsn@panpacific.com for enquiries. Hai Tien Lo, Pan Pacific Singapore, 7 Raffles Boulevard, Marina Square Singapore 039595, www.panpacific.com 2. Singapore Marriott Tang Plaza Hotel: Handcrafted gourmet rice dumplings Image credit: Singapore Marriott Tang Plaza Hotel Celebrate Dragon Boat Festival 2025 in style with gourmet rice dumplings by the award-winning Wan Hao Chinese Restaurant. Taking rice dumplings to the next level, Wan Hao Chinese Restaurant introduces a new flavour that draws from the growing popularity of mala flavours. Their newly launched Pork Trotter & Peanut with Szechuan Green Peppercorn Rice Dumpling is packed with a slow-braised pork trotter with Chinese Herbs and marinated with green peppercorn sauce for a numbing, fiery kick. Another rice dumpling flavour that highlights popular local flavours is Pandan Gula Melaka with Shredded Coconut & Quinoa Glutinous Rice Dumpling that evokes the flavours of the well-loved Ondeh Ondeh. For exquisite flavours, order the 5-Head Abalone with Karasumi & Iberico Pork Rice Dumpling that is sure to tantalise your taste buds. If you prefer traditional flavours, the Signature Pork & Salted Egg Rice Dumpling is a must-try item that will bring back memories from days of old. Lastly, don’t miss their wholesome creation, the nourishing Cordycep Flower & Purple Glutinous Rice Dumpling that’s perfect for vegetarians. Quote EBRD25 to get a 25% early bird discount for rice dumplings from now until 11 May. From 12 – 31 May 2025, quote RD15OFF to get 15% regular discount for rice dumplings. For bulk purchases of 10 pieces or more, enjoy 30% off rice dumplings with promo code “BKRD30” upon check-out, from 18 April – 31 May 2025. Rice dumplings for Dumpling Festival 2025: Online pre-orders start from now until 28 May 2025 for self-collection or delivery from 12 to 31 May 2025. Call Tel: (+65) 6831 4605 or email mhrs.sindt.fb.reservation@marriotthotels.com to order. Wan Hao Chinese Restaurant, Singapore Marriott Tang Plaza Hotel, 320 Orchard Road, Singapore 238865, www.celebratorydelights.com 3. Joo Chiat Kim Choo: Traditional, Nonya rice dumplings Image credit: Joo Chiat Kim Choo This Dragon Boat Festival 2025, step inside Joo Chiat Kim Choo’s flagship store on Circuit Road and be greeted by trinkets and curios of nostalgia for a blast to the past. Joo Chiat Kim Choo is known for its traditional Chinese rice dumplings, such as the Teochew Rice Dumpling, Hokkien Rice Dumpling, Cantonese Bean Rice Dumpling and more. Joo Chiat Kim Choo offers rice dumpling bundles and we love that you can buy these morsels of delight all year round, not just during Dumpling Festival! Rice dumplings for Dumpling Festival 2025: Joo Chiat Kim Choo rice dumplings are available all year round. Order online. Joo Chiat Kim Choo, 30B Quality Road, Singapore 618826 and 77 Circuit Road, #01-450, Singapore 370077, www.joochiatkimchoo.com.sg 4. Man Fu Yuan: Handcrafted rice dumplings Image credit: Man Fu Yuan at InterContinental Singapore Celebrate the traditions of the Dragon Boat Festival with a choice of seven artisanal rice dumplings from Man Fu Yuan at InterContinental Singapore. This award-winning Cantonese restaurant has two new rice dumpling flavours, along with three rice dumpling gift bundle sets. Look out for the Nonya Rice Dumpling with Plant-Based Meat, Sweetened Winter Melon, and Mushroom, the Glutinous Rice Dumpling with Red Bean, Honey Date and Red Date, and the Duo Glutinous Rice Dumpling with Japanese Sweet Potato and Black Sesame which offers a refreshing change from the usual savoury rice dumplings. Quote RICERD15 to get 15% early-bird savings on selected items. Valid until 30 April 2025. Card members of Citibank, DBS, Maybank and UOB enjoy an exclusive 15% savings. Rice dumplings for Dumpling Festival 2025: Available for purchase until 28 May 2025 via festive@ihg.com, takeaway and delivery from 1 May to 28 May 2025. Man Fu Yuan , InterContinental Singapore, 80 Middle Road, Singapore 188966, www.singapore.intercontinental.com 5. Eastern Rice Dumpling: Dragon Boat Festival 2025 Image credit: Eastern Rice Dumpling The recipe for rice dumplings from Eastern Rice Dumpling has been passed down three generations for the last 40 years. Eastern Rice Dumpling is one of the more affordable rice dumpling spots in Singapore. Rumour is that prices are cheaper the earlier you buy and then increase towards Dumpling Festival, so be sure to order your rice dumplings early. Their popular rice dumplings include Nyonya Dumpling and the Hokkien Rice Dumpling made from fried glutinous rice and a filling of chestnut, mushroom and pork marinated with five spices. Rice dumplings for Dragon Boat Festival 2025: Available all year round. You can order online here . Eastern Rice Dumpling | Dong Yuan Bak Chang , online orders, www.easternricedumpling.com 6. Xin Cuisine Chinese Restaurant: Rice dumplings & bak zhang for Dragon Boat Festival Image credit: Xin Cuisine Chinese Restaurant Xin Cuisine Chinese Restaurant has a signature rice bak chang creation with Five-spiced Braised Pork Belly Meat, Salted Egg Yolk, Mushroom and Shrimp. There’s also Xin’s Signature Home-made Traditional Rice Dumpling and the Kee Chang Red Lotus Seed Paste Dumpling served with Osmanthus Sauce, as well as an Assorted Rice Dumpling Bundle set. Handcrafted in-house by Xin Cuisine’s Dim Sum Chef, these rice dumplings make a fab gift for Dragon Boat Festival 2025. Rice dumplings for Dragon Boat Festival 2025: Collection Delivery available from 1 to 31 May 2025, Wednesdays to Sundays. (Orders must be made 3 days in advance) All bak chang are available for order online . Xin Cuisine Chinese Restaurant, Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium, 317 Outram Road, Singapore, www.holiday-inn-singapore-atrium-estore.myshopify.com 7. Bak chang/Hokkien rice dumplings at Hoo Kee Bak Chang Image credit: Hoo Kee Bak Chang Hoo Kee Bak Chang 和记肉粽 (Michelin Bib Gourmand bak chang) is a family business that has been selling Hokkien style rice dumplings or bak chang for over 60 years throughout the year and not just during Dragon Boast Festival. Bak chang flavours range from the original flavour of roasted pork with chestnuts, as well as bak chang with salted duck egg yolk and the deluxe bak chang of pork, roasted chestnuts, salted egg yolk, and shiitake mushrooms. Rice dumplings for Dumpling Festival 2024: Available for purchase online all year round. Hoo Kee Bak Chang 和记肉粽 , www.hookeebakchang.sg 8. Rice dumplings at 藝 yì by Jereme Leung Image credit: Raffles Hotel Singapore You can rely on 藝 yì by Jereme Leung at Raffles Hotel Singapore for exceptionally handcrafted sweet and savoury rice dumplings, in honour of the annual Dragon Boat Festival celebrations. MasterChef Jereme Leung uses traditional and unique ingredients to make their rice dumpling stand out. Whether you’re craving sweet or savoury rice dumplings, you’ll be treated to meticulously and artfully handcrafted rice dumplings that will elevate your Dragon Boat Festival 2025 celebration. Rice dumplings for Dragon Boat Festival 2025 : Order rice dumplings online from 1 to 31 May 2025 for delivery or self-collection 藝yì by Jereme Leung from 12 to 31 May 2025. Cardholders from DBS/POSB, Citi, and UOB Singapore may enjoy a 20% early bird reduction for online purchases between 1 to 29 May 2025. Online orders for rice dumplings must be made at least two days in advance. Jereme Leung #03-02, Raffles Arcade, 328 North Bridge Road, Singapore 188719, www.rafflesgrabandgo.com 9. Thye Moh Chan: Teochew bak chang Image credit: Thye Moh Chan Rice dumplings here are expertly hand-wrapped with quality bamboo leaves and slow-cooked for over two and a half hours to ensure a plump and moist parcel with hidden delights. Tuck into Thy Moh Chan’s Teochew Double Delight Bak Chang and the Teochew Salted Egg Bak Chang, alongside exclusive rice dumplings like a flavourful Teochew Vegetarian Chang and BreadTalk’s subtly-sweet Sun Cake. Individual packs or rice dumpling bundle sets are also available, presented in a complimentary limited-edition bag – perfect for gifting. Rice dumplings for Dumpling Festival 2025: Thye Moh Chan’s Teochew Bak Chang are usually available at selected BreadTalk, Toast Box and Thye Moh Chan stores and online via Grabfood, Foodpanda and Deliveroo. Stay tuned for deets on when orders open. Thye Moh Chan , available at various stores in Singapore, www.thyemohchan.com So which rice dumpling will you be choosing to celebrate Dumpling Festival 2025? Use code 2025JHP-EB10 to enjoy a 10% early bird discount ! Register before 18 May 2025. Ages: 5 – 9 years old Holiday camp dates: 23 – 25 June 2025 , 10am – 12:30pm (Beat Boppers), 10am to 1pm (Tech Adventures) Where: HarbourFront, Hillion Mall, Kovan, Novena, Punggol, Tampines, West Coast Plaza, and Yishun Holiday camp prices: $298 (Beat Boppers) & $359 (Tech Adventures). Click here to register. I CAN READ , www.sg.icanread.asia Wonderlit: Reading, creative writing, public speaking, speech & drama holiday camps Image credit: Wonderlit Looking for a way to help your child become a confident reader and eloquent communicator? Sign them up for Wonderlit’s June 2025 Holiday Camps, where they will learn essential reading, writing and speaking skills that will empower them to excel academically and beyond. Designed for kids aged 3 to 12 years old, Wonderlit’s holiday camps will cover phonics and reading, creative writing, public speaking and speech & drama, all of which will spark your child’s imagination, encourage self-exploration and help them uncover their unique voices. Thanks to their engaging programme and interactive activities, many children who have attended Wonderlit’s camps in the past eagerly return for more enriching experiences. Don’t miss out on the chance to give your child a learning boost and nurture a love of the English language in your little one. Enjoy an early bird discount of 10% off when you book before 15 May 2025 or register four or more children at the same time. Ages: 3 – 12 years old Holiday camp dates: 2 to 27 June 2025 Where: Claymore Connect, 442 Orchard Road, #03-08 to #03-12, Singapore 238879 Holiday camp prices: Refer to their website for prices. Click here to register. Wonderlit, www.wonderlitworld.com Science Summer Camps In Singapore 2025 Newtonshow: Character-themed science and cooking holiday camps Image credit: Newtonshow If you’ve got a curious kiddo who’s into science (or just loves to create and explore), Newtonshow’s Summer Camps are worth checking out this school holiday. Running all summer long from 2 June to 29 August, these camps cater to kids aged 2.5 to 14 years and cover a wide range of interests. From Sanrio Science World and Superhero Science to Harry Potter themes and World Chef Cooking Camp. Expect hands-on activities like magnetic slime experiments, colour-changing potions, and DIY potion bottles that are fun, creative, and educational all at once. We love that meals are provided daily, and camps are kept small for more personalised attention. With four convenient locations across Singapore and an optional door-to-door bus service, logistics are a breeze. Plus, the flexible booking options – full-day, half-day, or even individual days – mean you can fit camp around your holiday plans. Quote SASSYMAMA20 to enjoy 20% off your holiday camps! Ages: 2.5 – 14 years old Holiday camp dates: 2 June – 29 August 2025 Where: West, East, Novena and Central Singapore Holiday camp prices: $100 per day. Click here to register. Newtonshow, www.newtonshowcamp.com Art Summer Camps In Singapore 2025 Little Artists Art Studio: Hands-on art holiday camp for kids Image credit: Little Artists Art Studio Do you have a creative child at home? This holiday camp is designed just for them! Known for their inspiring art lessons, Little Artists Art Studio is offering an Artrageous Summer Holiday camp, specially designed for kids aged 4 to 17 to unleash creativity. At this art holiday camp in Singapore, campers will explore various art forms from sketching to watercolour, clay sculpture, digital art, fashion design, manga illustration and more. Led by qualified Fine Art & Design educators from around the world, this art holiday camp will give your child an opportunity to get their burning questions answered and learn from the best of the best. Kids will take home three to seven completed artworks (depending on the length of their chosen programme), a certificate of participation and a creative goodie bag to commemorate their journey. Older students can sign up for tailored workshops for SOTA/DSA preparation and international art college portfolios for customised coaching, conceptual and creative development. Ages: 4 – 17 years old Holiday camp dates: 31 May – 15 August 2025; (9:30am – 4:45pm for four full days; 9:30am – 2pm for four half-days; two-day camps also available) Where: Siglap Centre, 55 Siglap Road, #02-18, Singapore 455817 Holiday camp prices: $300 – $850 (materials included, but lunch not included for full-day camps). Click here to register. Little Artists Art Studio, www.little-artists.com Disclaimer: Sassy Mama does not own or manage these holiday camps. All programme information is supplied by the camp and is subject to change. Check directly before booking. Unless mentioned, discounts are not stackable. Want more educational fun for kids? Scroll below for an awesome idea or two! The post Guide To Kids’ Summer Holiday Camps In Singapore In 2025 appeared first on Sassy Mama .

articles.title: UPDATED: 57 Best Indoor Playgrounds In Singapore For Kids Of All Ages
articles.author: Sassy Mama
articles.content: Looking for some indoor activities for kids? Check out these awesome indoor playgrounds in Singapore for kids of all ages from soft-play centres to indoor playgrounds for bigger kids! With so many indoor playgrounds in Singapore, your kids will be totally spoilt for choice when it comes to things to do in Singapore . Use our best indoor playgrounds list to choose your preferred play space depending on the age of your child – there’s something for tiny tots all the way up to older kids and even teens! Many of these indoor playgrounds have jungle gyms, interactive play spaces, and soft play areas plus for the bigger kids there are obstacle courses, trampolines, climbing walls, and skating zones and one even has the longest indoor slide in SG! Bonus: some of these indoor playgrounds have cafes or working spots where you can sit and have a drink or get some work done while the kiddos play. You’re welcome! PS: Many of these indoor playgrounds also host birthday parties and offer kids’ holiday camps ! And remember to pack socks (most indoor playgrounds in Singapore usually require non-slip socks!) for everyone otherwise, you’ll end up having to buy them. Best Indoor Playgrounds In Singapore: 1. [NEW!] Wan To Play @ Punggol Coast Mall: Ocean-themed indoor playground Image credit: Cherilyn Gan Indoor playground deets: Wan To Play’s newest ocean-themed indoor playground at Punggol Coast Mall features a bright and spacious area where little ones can explore and play. Little ones can get hands-on at two sensory play areas, while older kids can test their balance and coordination at an obstacle course, get competitive with a car racing game, or hop on a duck boat ride. Plus, don’t miss the giant horn slide and LED slides that will take the kids into a giant ball pit. There’s also a merry-go-round, a rock-climbing wall, role-playing activities and a trampoline to give the kids a sweaty workout! Wan To Play indoor playground prices: $35 for a two-hour pass for 1 adult and 1 child. Wan To Play, 84 Punggol Way, #01-60/61/62 Punggol Coast Mall, Singapore 829911 , www.wantoplay.sg 2. [NEW!] Wan To Play @ T3: Dino-themed indoor playground Image credit: Wan To Play via Facebook Indoor playground deets: Wan To Play unveils yet another indoor playground at Changi Airport Terminal 3. Fans of dinos will love this indoor playground because they will get to spot dinosaurs everywhere they turn! Younger tots can get hands-on with sensory play at the kinetic sand pit, while older kids can whizz down the slide into a giant ball pit. There’s also a merry-go-round, a rock-climbing wall, role-playing activities and a super cool battery-operated car for a ride around the indoor playground. Wan To Play indoor playground prices: $18 for a one-hour pass; $35 for a two-hour pass Wan To Play, Changi Airport Terminal 3, 65 Airport Boulevard, B2 North, #B2-14-18, Singapore 819663, www.wantoplay.sg 3. [NEW!] Jolly Jungle: Affordable indoor playground Image credit: Jessica Fang Indoor playground deets: Easties, there’s a new affordable playground hidden at the library of Our Tampines Hub! As its name suggests, Jolly Jungle is a rainforest-themed jungle gym concept playground, built for kids to explore. This Tampines indoor playground takes the form of a tree house, complete with slides, hidden corners, tunnels, viewing platforms and nets to climb through. Inside, you’ll find hidden treats, including suspended zebras and obstacles the kids can roll, jump and climb over. Kids can also let their imagination run wild with the seemingly endless supply of foam building blocks! Be warned: everything in this indoor playground is built kid-sized, meaning Mums and Dads, you’re going to have a workout following them through the jungle gym. Jolly Jungle indoor playground prices: From $13/hour on weekdays; $15/hour on weekends for 1 child & 1 adult Jolly Jungle, 1 Tampines Walk #03-02, Enter via Library, Level 2 Our Tampines Hub, www.jollyjungle.sg 4. [NEW!] F3 Theme Park: Farm-themed with longkang fishing Image credit: F3 Theme Park Indoor playground deets: Indoor longkang fishing, corn and soy grinding, digging up (plastic) veggies, wheelbarrows and more–that’s what you can expect at F3 Theme Park at City Gate. This farming-themed indoor playground is definitely unique and has activities for kids of all ages. Besides the farming activities, there’s also a traditional ball pit with a small playground with a slide. The ball pit offers plenty of good ol’ fun, too, with an inflatable trampoline and other inflatables over the sea of balls. The star of the show at F3 Theme Park is the longkang fishing, but parents, please ensure that your kids walk slowly and are gentle with the little fish! The longkang fishing may not be suitable for younger kids who may just want to splash around in the water. F3 Theme Park indoor playground prices: From $29.80/hour F3 Theme Park, 371 Beach Road, #02-16 City Gate, Singapore 199579, www.f3themepark.com 5. SuperPark Singapore: Adventure playground in Singapore Image credit: SuperPark Indoor playground deets: This massive indoor playground at Suntec City has something for everyone! Littles as well as older kids (and even adults) can enjoy more than 20 sports-centric activities spread out over two levels. Manoeuvre obstacle walls, trampolines, zip wires, slides, pedal car racing tracks and more at the Adventure Area, or skate, scoot and try your hand on the gymnastics floor at the Freestyle Hall at SuperPark . Swing for the stands at the baseball nets, work on your jump shop at street basketball or enjoy some time at the golf range. Superpark shouts all things Minecraft this school holidays with plenty of exciting kids’ activities , including a Minecraft Toy Store, a $10 stack attack candy bowl, a yoghurt live station and more! Head down on the weekends, where you can meet and greet with Minecraft characters, join an exciting Sub Soccer competition, get airbrush tattoos and more. But that’s not all you’ll find at this indoor playground in Singapore! Parents and toddlers can bond at the Kids’ Gym, which has a soft play obstacle course, a small climbing wall and the signature Sliding Mountain. Click here to find out everything there is to know about SuperPark! SuperPark indoor playground prices: Free for infants aged 1 and below; $22.90 for kids below 100cm; from $30.90 for kids above 100 cm and adults. Grip socks are sold separately for $3.50 a pair SG60 deals available! Buy 2 tickets and get 60% off the 3rd ticket . Seniors get 60% off tickets too! Valid till 31 December 2025. SuperPark , 3 Temasek Boulevard, Suntec City Mall, #02-477 (North Wing), Singapore 038983, Tel: (+65) 6239 5360, www.superpark.sg 6. Pixie Trixie Playhouse: Indoor spa experience for kids Image credit: Pixie Trixie Indoor playground deets: If you’re on the hunt for a unique indoor playground experience in Singapore, Pixie Trixie Playhouse in East Coast should definitely be on your radar. Also known as Singapore’s first kids’ spa and makeover haven, Pixie Trixie Playhouse is where little ones can enjoy a full-on spa session that includes a DIY chocolate facial, mini mani & pedi, footbath with fizzy bathbomb and even a hair and make-up makeover. We love that all products used are specially formulated for children, so your mini-me can indulge without worry! Once they’re all dolled up, they can explore the indoor play area that’s equipped with a mini kitchen, supermarket and doctor’s clinic. There’s also a ball pit, train set, Barbie Dream House and even board games to keep older kids engaged. Don’t worry, there’s something for the boys too! The Boys-Only Fun Spa features a mini shopping trip to choose spa goodies, bathrobes and slippers and a welcome drink served in a champagne flute. The session includes a DIY chocolate facial, footbath with fizzy bath bomb, temporary tattoos, and cool hairstyling. Watch our Reel here . Pixie Trixie indoor playground prices: $49 for boys, $89 for girls Pixie Trixie Playhouse , 926 East Coast Road, Singapore 459116, Tel: (+65) 8493 9949, www.pixietrixieplayhouse.com 7. Pororo Park Singapore: Popular indoor playground Image credit: Pororo Park via Facebook Indoor playground deets: The Pororo Park Singapore indoor playground at Marina Square is all kinds of awesome. Dive into the Shark Ball Pool, dig into the Hinoki Pit, Play-pretend at Petty’s supermarket and explore with your friends at Poby’s Play gym; don’t forget to hop onboard their star attraction, the Pororo Express Train! We love the adorable Mini Teacup station at Pororo Park Singapore, that takes inspiration from the mini teacups you always find at theme parks! Here, the teacups are tailor-made for the younger ones with their gentle rotations. Other new stations at Pororo Park Singapore include the mini carousel, which features characters from the animated series, and the Swing. Kids can also meet Pororo and his friends IRL, at special meet-and-greet sessions at Pororo Park Singapore. If you’re heading down to Pororo Park Singapore indoor playground on weekends, then the whole family can take part in the Pororo & Friends weekend sing-along shows, too! Wind down afterwards at the cafe, and be sure to pick up cool merch from the toy store. Oh, and did we mention that Pororo Park Singapore is also a great place to host your child’s birthday party ? Pororo Park Singapore indoor playground prices: $10 (babies below 9 months); $38 (kids aged 9 months to 12 years, inclusive of one adult. Adult tickets must be purchased with a baby ticket); $10 (additional adult). SG60 deals available! Get 2 adult and 2 child tickets for just $60 ! Valid till 31 December 2025. Pororo Park , 6 Raffles Boulevard, Marina Square, #02-29, Singapore 039594, Tel: (+65) 6239 5360, www.pororoparksg.com 8. Tayo Station: Indoor playground in the East Image credit: Tayo Station Indoor playground deets: Tayo Station at Downtown East is an indoor playground based on the popular animated series “Tayo the Little Bus.” Tayo Station features lots of exciting opportunities where tots can learn through play! Newly reopened after a revamp, this playground has an expanded kiddy road circuit for kids to zoom down on little cars complete with a realistic cityscape that has pedestrian crossings, traffic lights that work and even a garage! There are also tube slides, a two-storey play structure, and sensory play stations for tots plus for older kids a basketball competition station. Tayo Station indoor playground prices: 2-hour child ticket (including 1 adult) is $27.90 (off-peak) and $31.90 (weekends, PH, school holidays); Babies (<9 months): $10; Additional adult: $8. SG60 deals available! Get 2 adult and 2 child tickets for just $60 ! The bundle comes with a free Tayo Toy Bus . Valid till 31 December 2025. Tayo Station , E!Hub, Downtown East, 1 Pasir Ris Close, Level 3, Singapore 519599, Tel: (+65) 6239 53, www.tayostation.com Read more: Best Deals & Promos In Singapore: Attractions, Dining & More 9. VroomTown: Indoor playground with driving circuit Image credit: Kiki Tjai Indoor playground deets: Located in Marina Square, VroomTown is a mega indoor drive-play academy and indoor playground featuring multiple Singapore icons including the Merlion, Gardens by the Bay and Changi Airport! Kids get one hour of play at the pastel-coloured indoor playground which includes a realistic city driving experience with cute traffic lights and a drive-through. It’s not a go-karting experience per se but kids will need to learn how to operate their vehicles and observe road safety rules. This indoor playground is great for kiddos 5 and up as they’ll be allowed to drive independently while tots below 5 will require parental supervision (in the same car). VroomTown indoor playground prices: Beginner child entry ($38); licensed child drivers ($49) -includes 1 free adult entry. VroomTown , Marina Square, #01-208, Singapore Tel: (+65) 8877 4846, www.vroomtown.com.sg 10. The Artground @ GAC: Explore the islands of Singapore & Indonesia Image credit: The Arground @ Goodman Arts Centre Indoor playground deets: The Artground’s latest play space invites little adventurers to journey across the islands of Singapore and Indonesia, where myths, folklore, and legends come to life. Just opened last week, this new indoor playspace features climbing elements and a sensory path set along the back of a majestic mythical sea dragon! Kids visiting this unique indoor playground in Singapore can explore and experience firsthand how these imaginative ideas come to life. Do note that all visitors must have a valid ticket before entry, as walk-ins are not allowed. Tickets are released weekly and sold per time slot, so stay updated through the booking link for more details. Don’t forget your non-slip grip socks. The Artground indoor playground prices: $5/pax on weekdays; $8/child & $5/adult on weekends The Artground @ GAC, Goodman Arts Centre, Block J, #01-40, 90 Goodman Road, Singapore, www.theartground.com.sg 11. Paragon: Mall indoor playground (FREE!) Image credit: Paragon Mall Indoor playground deets: In between shopping and cafe-hopping on Orchard Road, stop by Paragon mall to let the kids run around at this free indoor playground on level 5. It’s named ‘The Jungle Adventure Tower’, and little ones will have a blast climbing up the treehouse, whizzing down the slide and having a go at the see-saw. Younger tots can play interactive games on the wall which will spark their curiosity and help them practice their fine motor skills. Paragon Mall indoor playground prices: FREE! Paragon, 290 Orchard Road, Singapore 238859, www.paragon.com.sg 12. Smigy at Orchard: Ball pits and trampoline Image credit: Smigy Playground via Facebook Indoor playground deets: Calling all fans of Smigy’s indoor playground! Smigy has an outlet in the heart of the city at Forum the Shopping Mall on Orchard Road! Kids will love the all-time favourite play stations like a giant ball pit and trampoline. But that’s not all – Smigy has integrated technology to give kids exciting pretend-play opportunities like working in a supermarket, milking a cow and more. Smigy indoor playground prices: $23 per hour or $35 for 2 hours. Each indoor playground ticket admits one child and one adult. Smigy at Orchard, Forum The Shopping Mall, 583 Orchard Road, B1, Singapore 238884, www.smigy.sg 13. Yooland: Indoor playground at West Gate Image credit: Yooland via Instagram Indoor playground deets: One of the largest indoor playgrounds in town, Yooland at Westgate features 7,000 square feet of fun, where kids can dive into a giant ball pit, whizz down slides and bounce away on a trampoline. Younger tots will love the sensory (snow) sand pit, where they can avoid the hyperactive older kids who might be running around! There’s even a rock climbing wall so kids can get active and get a good workout while strengthening their gross motor skills. Look out for the interactive installations and pretend play opportunities. Dress up like a princess, put on some make-up and cook up a storm in the play kitchen! Yooland indoor playground prices: $25 per hour and $35 for 2 hours from Monday to Friday. Each ticket admits 1 adult and 1 child (1 – 18 years old). Kids under 1 can enter for free with an accompanying adult ($10 per hour). Yooland, Westgate, 3 Gateway Drive, #03-36/37, Singapore 608532, www.instagram.com/yooland_sg 14. Pirate Land: Indoor playground at Eastpoint Mall Image credit: Cherilyn Gan Indoor playground deets: Pirate Land has just opened a new indoor playground at Eastpoint Mall. Designed for kids aged 6 and below, this indoor playground in Singapore is compact, so you won’t have to worry about losing sight of your kids. Kids can bounce away on trampolines or whizz down a futuristic slide into a ball pit. There are interactive games on a large digital screen and pretend play rooms. LEGO builders can spend their afternoon at the LEGO table, while tots can crawl and explore at the soft play area. Older kids can try their hand at the VR Zone just outside this indoor playground for $12 per game. Watch our video here . Pirate Land indoor playground prices: $15.90 per child (0 – 2 yrs old), $28.90 per child (2 – 12 yrs old); Each child ticket comes with one adult entry, $8 for additional adult. Unlimited play during weekdays & three-hour playtime during weekends and public holidays. Pirate Land, 3 Simei Street 6, Eastpoint Mall, #04-12 /13/14, Singapore 528833, www.piratelandsg.com 15. Wan To Play Sky Castle: Indoor playground in Pasir Ris Mall Image credit: Jessica Fang Indoor playground deets: Wan To Play has opened a new outlet at the Pasir Ris Mall, and it has something for kids of all ages! This indoor playground is not the largest in scale, but trust us when we say there’s plenty for kids to do. First up, is the huge bubblegum-coloured ball pit from which the little ones can explore a three-storey gym and slide down three slides. There’s also a trampoline corner. Little ones can also play make-believe at a well-stocked supermarket, complete with cooking stoves. There’s also a make-up corner, dress-up costumes and policeman props. There’s also a sensory sand pit as well as a kinetic sand station. Wan To Play Sky Castle indoor playground prices: $18 for 1 hour; $35 for two hours (for one adult and one child). Additional adults and kids below 1 year old from $10. Wan To Play Sky Castle , 7 Pasir Ris Central, #02-58, Singapore 519612, www.facebook.com/Wantoplaysg 16. Whoose Party!: Indoor playground in Tai Seng Image credit: Whoose Party Indoor Playground Indoor playground deets: This indoor playground in Tai Seng is a child’s wonderland filled with engaging kids’ activities , so mum and dad can finally catch a break! Older kids can get competitive with crazy go-karts and satisfy their need for speed then put on a velcro suit and bounce on a trampoline and stick their bodies on the wall! The highlight of this indoor playground has to be its 6.25-metre LED-lit mega slide. We love the toddler-friendly space upstairs with smaller slides and toy cars, so you won’t have to worry about your little tot getting trampled on by a bigger kid. Plus, you can even host your kiddo’s next birthday party here to guarantee fun for kids of all ages. Whoose Party! indoor playground prices: $15 for 1 hour and $25 for 2 hours. $10 for each additional adult. Whoose Party!, 601 MacPherson Road, Grantral Mall, #02-09, Singapore 368242, www.whooseparty.com 17. The Artground @ One Holland Village: For younger kids Image credit: Beate Baldry Indoor playground deets: The Artground at One Holland Village has an indoor playspace featuring a unique concept that guarantees fun for little tots (best for crawlers and tots up to 5). The curious garden has a treehouse, toadstools and gnomes that seek to ignite creativity amongst the kiddos. For the fam, there are weekend art-based programmes where parents, grandparents and children can connect through art activities. The Artground indoor playground prices: $5 per person (including babies in arms). Free admission for Orange & Blue CHAS cardholders. The Artground , 7 Holland Village Way, #01-20 One Holland Village, Singapore 275748, www.theartground.com.sg 18. SkyPark By Kiztopia: Obstacle courses & more Image credit: Kidztopia Indoor playground deets: SkyPark By Kiztopia @ Cineleisure is another indoor playground by Kiztopia for kiddos aged 6 and up. SkyPark By Kiztopia @ Cineleisure offers an action-packed indoor adventure-scape of thrilling challenges including rock climbing and high-element obstacle courses like that at X-SCAP8 also on Orchard Road . This Kiztopia outlet has a pedal kart, vertical sticky wall, multi-level play structure that gamifies challenges and fosters friendly competition and more! Here’s what to know about Kiztopia SkyPark before you head down. SkyPark By Kiztopia indoor playground prices: Below 16 years old: $24.80 (1 hour play); $34.80 (2-hours play); Sky Pass (10 sessions). SkyPark By Kiztopia tickets here. SkyPark By Kiztopia @ Cineleisure , Orchard Cineleisure, 8 Grange Road, #04-04/05, Singapore 239695, www.kiztopia.com 19. 2 Bears Hideout: Indoor playground at T2 transit (FREE!) Image credit: Changi Airport Indoor playground deets: Transiting through Changi Airport Terminal 2? Check out 2 Bears Hideout, a tiny indoor playground just beside the row of eateries. It’s a small area where kids can run around, and kids can also get a lovely view of aeroplanes on the tarmac. Mama and Baby Bear have ladders and slides that are perfect for burning off some energy before flights! 2 Bears Hideout indoor playground prices: FREE! 2 Bears Hideout , Changi Airport Terminal 2, Airport Boulevard, 60, Singapore 819643, www.changiairport.com 20. Adventure HQ: Play for older kids Image credit: Adventure HQ Indoor playground deets: Adventure HQ at HomeTeamNS Khatib is an indoor playground in Singapore that’s actually geared for tweens, teens and adults too! Expect themed rock climbing walls, a ninja course, rope climbing structures and most excitingly the longest slide in Singapore! It’s actually open-air (but sheltered) so it gets hot and humid. Best to wear light sports gear. It’s 2,800 square metres big and four storeys high. Advance booking is required. Watch our video here . Adventure HQ indoor playground prices: From $40.74. Click here for detailed ticket prices. Adventure HQ HometeamNS Khatib , 2 Yishun Walk, Singapore 767944, Tel: (+65) 6705 9420, www.hometeamns.sg Read more: Adventure HQ Review 21. X-SCAP8: High-elements indoor playground Image credit: Beate Baldry Indoor playground deets: X-SCAP8 is an indoor playground for big kids and adults complete with a three-level high element course over 10m tall and a thrilling X-Warrior Challenge obstacle course! X-SCAP8 (pronounced escapade) also has a Smash Lab where players over a certain age can let loose with a baseball bat and wrench plus there are arcade games and a golfing simulator making this indoor playground in Singapore super for tweens and teens. Read our review of X-SCAP8 here. X-SCAP8 indoor playground prices: The “X-Warrior” EAT & PLAY ticket (incl. $5 F&B Credit + 5 Arcade Tokens) is $29 X-SCAP8, Orchard Central, 181 Orchard Rd, Singapore 238896, #07-02, www.xscap8.com 22. Kiztopia @ Jewel Changi Airport: Aviation-themed indoor playground Image credit: Kiztopia Indoor playground deets: Another indoor playground by Kiztopia, this time within Toys”R”Us in Jewel Changi Airport. This is also Kiztopia’s first-ever aviation-themed playground, so look forward to airplane-themed obstacle courses, a thrilling slide leading into an ocean ball pit, a giant plane structure, and more. Kiztopia Jewel indoor playground prices: $24.80 for 1 adult and 1 child for 1 hour. $34.80 for 2 hours. $10 for each additional adult. Kiztopia , Toys”R”Us @ Jewel, 78 Airport Blvd., B1-210 Singapore Changi Airport, 819666, www.kiztopia.com 23. (REOPENED!) AIRZONE: Indoor suspended net playground Image credit: AIRZONE Indoor playground deets: After a long closure, Airzone has finally reopened, just in time for the March holidays ! AIRZONE is the world’s first indoor suspended net playground – a net of ropes knitted together to turn the mall atrium space between the different floors of City Square Mall into a playground floating in the air! AIRZONE is an elevated playground with different zones – there’s one access (you need to climb up a rope bridge) and one exit (a PVC slide) per floor. AIRZONE isn’t ideal if you’re scared of heights; for this reason, we think it’s best suited for courageous kiddos aged 4+, maybe even 6 years old and onwards. AIRZONE indoor playground prices: From $27.90 per single admission. AIRZONE , 180 Kitchener Road, #02-K4/K10, City Square Mall, Singapore 208539, www.airzone.sg 24. Amazonia: Ice-age themed indoor playground Image credit: Amazonia Indoor playground deets: At Amazonia indoor playground there are climbing structures and slides for little kids and toddlers, plus an ‘Ice World’ theme with a focus on the freezing poles – a nice break from the Singapore heat! Kiddos can bounce on the netted trampolines and try to score hoops, go down a fun wave slide or play in the ‘snow’ ball bit, complete with vacuum ball tubes for added interactive play. There’s a café and soft play playground area for toddlers, conveniently fenced off from the rest of the fun. Amazonia indoor playground prices: $38.90 (children aged 3 and above); $28.80 (toddlers under the age of 3 on the day of the visit) Amazonia , 1 Kim Seng Promenade, #03-113, Great World City, Singapore 237994, Tel: (+65)6836 2544, www.amazoniafun.com Read more: Where To See Dinosaurs In Singapore: Dinosaur Playgrounds, Parks & More 25. AMPED: Trampoline playground for kids Image credit: AMPED via Facebook Indoor playground deets: AMPED is more trampoline park than an indoor playground but it’s a great spot to venture to if your kids are already outgrowing traditional indoor playgrounds in Singapore. AMPED is very well-organised as you book your time slot online, preventing it from getting too crazy. When you arrive, you pop your socks on (you’ll need special grip socks), collect your coloured bracelet and get ready to jump around! On Wednesdays from 10am to 12pm, there’s a special under-5-year-old session for little bouncers. AMPED Trampoline Park indoor playground prices: $19 per hour AMPED Trampoline Park , 10 Raeburn Park, Block C, Level 2 02-33, Singapore 088702, Tel: (+65) 9823 8443, www.ampedsingapore.com Read more: Best Trampoline Parks In Singapore For Kids Of All Ages 26. Better Play: Montessori-inspired play space Image credit: Better Play via Facebook Indoor playground deets: Better Play is a Montessori-inspired play area in Singapore that has two distinct spaces – one for littlies and one for confident walkers up to six years of age. Sit down to playtime with your kiddo and dive into a huge range of high-quality toys that encourage focused engagement and learning, or let your older ones do their own thing while you unwind with a cuppa. Better Play indoor playground prices: $25 for two hours, 1 child & 1 adult (Monday to Thursday); $29 for two hours, 1 child & 1 adult (Friday to Sunday); 10% off for siblings. Better Play , 451 Joo Chiat Road, #02-11, Katong Point, Singapore 427664, Tel: (+65) 9725 6954 (WhatsApp), www.betterplaysingapore.com 27. Bouncetopia SAFRA Choa Chu Kang: Playground with inflatable Image credit: Kiztopia Indoor playground deets: Bouncetopia by Kiztopia is located at SAFRA Choa Chu Kang and consists of 6,400 square feet of Superhero-themed play areas. At this inflatable bouncy castle indoor playground, kids can bounce to their hearts’ content on the myriad of colourful bouncy castles, get competitive at the obstacle courses and satisfy their adrenaline rush at the tallest slide that takes you into a giant ball pit (it’s fun even for adults!) We’d definitely recommend close parent supervision for younger kids. Also, be sure to wear long pants and long sleeves to protect your skin from slide burns! Bouncetopia by Kiztopia Choa Chu Kang indoor playground prices: $19.80 per child (1-hour play), $28.80 per child (2-hour play), $12 per adult. Babies under 12 months old can enter with a paying adult. Bouncetopia by Kiztopia at SAFRA Choa Chu Kang, 28 Choa Chu Kang Drive, #01-04, Singapore 689964, www.kiztopia.com 28. Buds by Shangri-La: Indoor playground at Shangri-la Image credit: Shangri-la Indoor playground deets: An indoor playground by the Shangri-La Singapore hotel, this family staycation spot offers tons of fun for kids of all ages (but best for younger ones); think massive ball pit, a bunch of slides, trampolines, a “sand” area (with rice instead of sand – much cleaner!), and a baby and toddler soft play area. Buds also includes activity rooms that offer organised activities (at an extra cost). Buds by Shangri-La indoor playground prices: The indoor play facilities and classes are open to hotel guests and the public. You’ll have to register upon check-in. $36 per child for 3 hours for hotel/service apartment guests. Public rates: $48 nett per child (Non-Peak Rate, Monday – Friday)/$68 nett per child (Peak Rate, Saturday, Sunday, PH and Singapore School Holidays) for 3-hour play time at buds by Shangri-La and Splash. Buds by Shangri-La , 22 Orange Grove Road, Shangri-la Singapore, Singapore 258350, Tel: (+65) 6213 4833, www.shangri-la.com Read more: Best Kid-Friendly Hotels In Singapore For Family Staycations 29. Canopy Park: Giant mirror slide & suspended nets Image credit: Jewel Changi Airport Indoor playground deets: Kids love airports, so if you’re scratching your head to come up with a new adventure, why not combine a trip to Jewel Changi Airport? Mama gets to shop, you all get to eat some delicious food and then head to Canopy Park for some indoor play! This is more of an add-on destination while you’re at Jewel rather than an indoor playground to centre your activities around. Suitable for kids aged 18 months to 12 years old, there is a mirror maze, bouncing nets, and giant slides – and it’s a bit of a bargain at $6, with a variety of unlimited play bundle deals currently on offer. Read our full review here . Canopy Park @ Jewel indoor playground prices: Standard entrance fee of $6 for Singapore Residents Canopy Park @ Jewel Changi Airport , Level 5, Jewel at Changi Airport, 78 Airport Boulevard, Singapore 819666, www.jewelchangiairport.com 30. Future World @ ArtScience Museum: Play areas within an interactive exhibit Image credit: Cherilyn Gan Indoor playground deets: We know, we know! This is officially an art exhibition more than an indoor playground in Singapore, but the FutureWorld exhibit is very interactive and kids can play while they are here so we are allowing it! Created in collaboration with the Japanese art and technology collective teamLab, FutureWorld takes up nearly a quarter of the museum’s total gallery space. It feels less like an art exhibit, and more like a hands-on interactive play space, for both kids and adults – don’t miss seeing your own drawings come to life on a big screen! Future World indoor playground prices: Standard entry from $25 adult/$20 child Single Exhibition Ticket Future World at ArtScience Museum , 6 Bayfront Avenue, Singapore 018974, Tel: (+65) 6688 8888, www.marinabaysands.com 31. Hip Kids Club: Affordable indoor playground at Orchard Image credit: Hip Kids Club Indoor playground deets: While kids up to 120cm tall are allowed to use this indoor playground, it is particularly suitable for little ones. Complete with climbing frames, balance beams, a circus tent, ride-on bikes, a slide, rubber floors and a ball pit, this indoor playground is perfect for toddlers. Hip Kids Club indoor playground prices: $25 for a one-year membership; $5 for one-time entry Hip Kids Club , 583 Orchard Road, Forum Shopping Mall, Singapore 238884, www.forumtheshoppingmall.com 32. IKEA Småland: Indoor playground at IKEA Tampines (FREE!) Image credit: IKEA Indoor playground deets: Enter a magical forest as little ones step foot into this indoor playground Småland at IKEA Tampines and IKEA Småland Alexandra. Jump into the huge semi-circle ball pit or cosy up in the mushroom hut, find a book in the reading area or do some colouring in the arts and crafts corner. There’s also a mini Småland theatre where kids can enjoy a movie. Watch out as weekends are super busy! IKEA Småland indoor playground prices: FREE! Kids (4-9 years old) can play at Småland for free for an hour per day while mum or dad shops at IKEA. IKEA Tampines , 60 Tampines North Drive 2, Singapore 528764 and 317 Alexandra Road, Level 1, Singapore 159965, www.ikea.com 33. The Joy of Toys: Indoor playground with toys Image credit: The Joy of Toys Indoor playground deets: A totally unique speciality indoor playground by Clarke Quay, Joy of Toys is fab for babies and toddlers in particular. Instead of your typical giant slides and ball pits, it’s filled with beautiful wooden toys, puzzles and games (which are swapped out on a monthly basis to keep things interesting). The Structured Play sections, better for slightly older kids, feature manipulatives, construction, developmental toys and puzzles, and even brain teasers. Meanwhile, the Open-Ended Play sections include a kitchen, dollhouse, and miniatures – all perfect for letting littlies’ imaginations run wild. Joy of Toys indoor playground prices: $19 (toddler play space); $25 (main play space) Joy of Toys , 6 Eu Tong Sen Street, #03-51, Clarke Quay Central (Yellow Zone), Singapore 059817, www.thejoyoftoys.com.sg 34. Kidodo: Indoor playground at City Square Mall Image credit: Kidodo Playground Indoor playground deets: Kidodo is a small play area at City Square Mall sporting a spiral slide, sand area, ball pit and a mini-trampoline. There are more small slides on a different level, an obstacle course and an activity wall. Remember to wear socks and book ahead! Kidodo indoor playground prices: One-time entry for one hour of playtime starts from $12 (admits one child and one accompanying adult). Kidodo Indoor Playground , 180 Kitchener Road, Mall, #02-19A, City Square Mall, Singapore 208539, www.kidodo.sg 35. KidsSTOP @ Science Centre Singapore: Educational indoor playground Image credit: Science Centre Singapore Indoor playground deets: A trip to KidsSTOP at the Science Centre in Jurong is probably one of our all-around favourite kids’ things to do in Singapore. Is it an indoor playground or education? Both – that’s the brilliance! It scores big for kids because there are so many different areas to play in – from uncovering dinosaur fossils in the palaeontology sandpit to doing a bit of karaoke and loads more! KidsSTOP indoor playground prices: $5 – $20 (child) and $5 – $13 (adult) KidsSTOP , Science Centre Singapore, 15 Science Centre Road, Singapore 609081, Tel: (+65) 6425 2500, www.science.edu.sg 36. Kidz Amaze: Indoor playground at SAFRA Image credit: Kids Amaze SAFRA Jurong Indoor playground deets: We love the two massive SAFRA spots in Toa Payoh and Jurong – among the largest indoor playgrounds in Singapore. Expect climbing structures aplenty, with ball pits, slides and lots of fun for kiddos (up to 13 years old). Psssst! There’s also a first-of-its-kind in Singapore indoor water playground at SAFRA Punggol Club with five slides and a themed splash pad, Splash @ Kidz Amaze is just for kids 18 months to 13 years, and spans an amazing 24,000 sqft. There is no reservation required and unlimited playtime applies for all three Kids Amaze indoor playgrounds. Kids Amaze indoor playground prices: Kids under 12 months enter free at Kids Amaze SAFRA Jurong/babies below 2 months old enter free at Kids Amaze SAFRA Toa Payoh; from $10.10 on weekdays, from $12.15 on weekends; $4.05 for each accompanying adult. Sign up as a Kidz Amaze member to enjoy up to 50% off entrance rates. Kidz Amaze , multiple locations in Singapore, including SAFRA Jurong, SAFRA Punggol and SAFRA Toa Payoh, www.safra.sg 37. Kiztopia Club Punggol: Safari-themed indoor playground Image credit: Kiztopia Indoor playground deets: Hit up Kiztopia at Punggol Town Square for 12 different safari-themed play areas. This Kiztopia outlet lets kids go all out with AR interactive games and jump to their heart’s content at the trampoline. There are slides, obstacle courses, a ball put and more. Kids will also love the roleplay rooms and sandput at this Kiztopia indoor playground. Kiztopia Punggol indoor playground prices: Single-entrance tickets start from $24.80 (1 hour of play) to $34.80 (2 hours). A ticket includes one child + one adult; additional adults are $12 each. Kiztopia Punggol , 85 Punggol Central, #01-01/02/03/04, Singapore 828726, www.kiztopia.com Read more: Kiztopia Marina Square Review 38. Little Bear’s House: Role-play indoor playground Image credit: Little Bear’s House Indoor playground deets: This family-run indoor playground in Serangoon Gardens is geared toward younger kids (primarily 0-5, though kids up to 8 are welcome to join), with lots of high-quality wooden toys, puzzles, and a reading corner full of engaging books. There’s also a dedicated toddler area for littlies under 18 months with extra padding and age-appropriate toys. You can tell Little Bear’s House is run by a mama, with plenty of comfy sofas that are perfect for nursing mamas. Little Bear’s House indoor playground prices: $25 per child for two hours on weekdays; $28 on weekends; packages from $238 Little Bear’s House , 21 Lichfield Road, Singapore 556841, Tel: (+65) 6974 6398, www.littlebearshouse.sg.com 39. KidZania Singapore: Kids’ city at Sentosa Image credit: Cherilyn Gan Indoor playground deets: KidZania Singapore at Sentosa is like a mini-city made just for kids! Lining kid-sized streets are a police station, fire station, A&E, dentist, hospital, bank, radio station and department store. Kids get to take part in an array of fun activities including being a firefighter, pilot, dentist and more while parents can kick back and relax. Read our full review of KidZania Singapore . KidZania Singapore indoor playground prices: From $29 (free for babies aged 0 – 1). Full pricing details here . KidZania Singapore , 31 Beach View Road, #01-01/02 Sentosa Island, Singapore 098008, www.kidzania.com.sg 40. PIP’s PLAYbox: Indoor playground at Esplanade (FREE!) Image credit: Esplanade Indoor playground deets: Located in Esplanade, PIP’s PLAYbox serves as the perfect place for some air-conditioned fun in the heart of the city centre. This children’s art space features a cosy interior with a loft, an arts and crafts area and a reading corner with books by Singapore writers and illustrators. There is also an outdoor play area. The indoor playground also occasionally hosts a range of activities in conjunction with Esplanade, including storytelling sessions and hands-on activities and workshops. PIP’s PLAYbox indoor playground prices: FREE! Register before your visit. PIP’s PLAYbox , 1 Esplanade Drive, Singapore 038981, www.esplanade.com 41. PLAY by Kinderplay: Affordable indoor playground at Changi Airport Image credit: PLAY by Kinderplay Indoor playground deets: Perfect for wearing the little ones out before you get on a long flight–or if you live in the East–PLAY by Kinderplay is a Cartoon Network-themed indoor playground. It’s accessible to the public at Basement 2 of Changi Airport Terminal 3. The space isn’t huge, but it gets the job done. And there are plenty of other kid-friendly activities nearby , too! PLAY by Kinderplay indoor playground prices: $12 (toddlers below 2 years old); $21-$25 (child); 1 adult enters free with each paying child; $6 (additional adult per 30 minute block). PLAY by Kinderplay , 65 Airport Boulevard, Changi Airport Terminal 3, #B2-14/15/16/17, Singapore 819663, www.facebook.com/play.sgT3 42. Plain as Play by The Makers’ Club: Children-only indoor play Image credit: Plain as Play by The Makers’ Club Indoor playground deets: Mamas who want to run errands or sneak in a workout/lunch date can drop off their little ones for playtime. At Plain as Play, children aged 18 months to 6 years are cared for and guided through play sessions by ECDA-qualified preschool educators who will help children embrace a playmaker’s growth mindset. The studio is inspired by The Maker Movement and the Reggio Emilia approach whereby children are empowered to express themselves through open-ended play. Get hands-on with interactive installations, devise your own creations at the cool tinkering corner, and create your own adventure in small-world play – the options are endless. This play studio also hosts parties, private events and workshops. Plain as Play indoor playground price: $35 per play session. Maker Experience Sessions are bookable by the hour up to a maximum of four hours. Plain as Play by The Maker’s Club , 199A East Coast Road, Level 2, Singapore 428902, Tel: (+65) 8044 3254, www.themakersclub.com 43. Pirate Land @ The Centrepoint: Affordable Orchard indoor playground Image credit: Pirate Land Indoor playground deets: Ahoy, ye mateys! Pirate Land is the first pirate-themed indoor playground in Singapore! You’ve got your standard pretend play (supermarket, “Kitchen Square”, toys), along with ever-popular trampolines and a bouncing house. You’ll also find a ball pit, giant slide, LEGOs and a pirate-ship climbing structure, as well as a soft play area for babies and toddlers. But what we’ve heard really sets Pirate Land apart is its laser tag (separately priced), along with a Virtual Reality room for grown-ups! There’s unlimited play on weekdays and three-hour playtime on weekends. Bookings are not necessary but are encouraged. The Polliwogs: VivoCity indoor playground Image credit: The Polliwogs Indoor playground deets: This VivoCity indoor playground is a pretty slick operation and hugely popular. We’ve found ourselves at this brightly-coloured, brightly-lit soft play more times than we care to remember. Buy a package if you live nearby, you’ll be back! Highlights include a bouncy castle, tonnes of climbing structures, and huge slides. The Polliwogs indoor playground prices: From $28.90/child. Click here for detailed ticket bundles The Polliwogs , 1 Harbourfront Walk, #03-12 VivoCity, Singapore 098585, www.thepolliwogs.com 45. Nekoland: Indoor playground with cat cafe Image credit: Nekoland Indoor playground deets: Felines take centre stage at Nekoland by The Polliwogs! There’s an indoor playground with a ball pit, slides, nets, trampolines and more. Cat interaction zone tickets from $12. Nekoland, 6 Eu Tong Sen Street #04-63 The Central Singapore 059817, www.nekoland.co Read more: Cat Cafes In Singapore 46. SMIGY Playground: Indoor playground at United Square Image credit: SMIGY Playground Indoor playground deets: This fairytale-themed indoor playground currently has 3 branches in Singapore with its United Square branch boasting more than eight cool play stations for little ones. Inside, you’ll find a fun trampoline, slides, racing tracks, climbing structures and swings, all set against a pretty pastel background. SMIGY indoor playground prices: From $23 for one hour. SMIGY Playground, United Square #B1-01, 1 Thomson Road, Singapore 307591, www.smigy.sg 47. SMIGY Playground: PLQ Mall indoor playground Image credit: SMIGY Playground Indoor playground deets: We love the aesthetic pastel colours at SMIGY Playground at PLQ Mall, suitable for kids aged 2 to 6! Over here, kids can dive into a foam pit and ball pit, and bounce around on trampolines. There are also a fair share of slides they can whizz down, and plenty of swings. Little ones can grab a kiddy car to zoom around the race car track, and those with lots of energy have plenty of structures to climb. SMIGY indoor playground prices: From $23 for one hour. SMIGY Playground , PLQ Mall, Level 3, 10 Paya Lebar Road, PLQ Mall #03-05/06, Singapore 409057, www.smigy.sg 48. SMIGY Playground: Tiong Bahru indoor playground Image credit: SMIGY Playground Indoor playground deets: The SMIGY playground Tiong Bahru branch features its must-have ball pit, a double-level play gym, a race track where kids can run around the whole indoor playground, carousel, trampolines and more! SMIGY indoor playground prices: From $23 for one hour. SMIGY Playground , 298 Tiong Bahru Road #02-115A, Tiong Bahru Plaza Singapore 168730, www.smigy.sg 49. SMIGY Playground: Indoor playground at Forum The Shopping Mall Image credit: SMIGY Playground Indoor playground deets: SMIGY’s indoor playground in Forum The Shopping Mall has a sandpit, interactive wall games, a space where the kids can pretend play (be a doctor, a chef and more!), a trampoline, and even a unique play area where you can milk a cow! SMIGY indoor playground prices: From $23 for one hour. SMIGY Playground , Forum The Shopping Mall, 583 Orchard Rd, B1, Singapore 238884, www.smigy.sg 50. T-Play Bukit Batok: HomeTeamNS indoor playground Image credit: T-Play HomeTeamNS Bukit Batok Indoor playground deets: With something for kiddos from 6 months of age all the way up to 12 years, T-Play at the amazing 4,200-sqft HomeTeamNS Bukit Batok is the most interactive, transportation-themed indoor playground in Singapore. T-Play Khatib: Yishun indoor playground Image credit: T-Play Khatib Indoor playground deets: T-Play Khatib at HomeTeamNS Khatib is best for younger kids and is the first Peranakan-themed indoor playground in Singapore. Wan To Play Forest: Indoor playground in East Image credit: Wan To Play Forest Indoor playground deets: This indoor playground in the East is a forest-themed indoor playground for younger kids with climbing walls and ball pits.
