articles.title: Changi Bay Point: Guide To Coastal Walk, Changi Bay Park, Cycling & Sea Views With Jeju Island Vibes
articles.author: Cherilyn
articles.content: Want Jeju-like views in Singapore? Plan a day out at Changi Bay Point, where you can take a stroll along the boardwalk with the kids, cycle by the sea and get a break from city life Changi Bay Point offers Jeju-like views without leaving our little red dot! This hidden gem on the East Coast boasts amazing Insta-worthy views that make you feel like you’re in South Korea! Because it’s tucked away, you get to escape the typical crowd, soak in the sea breeze and truly enjoy a breath of fresh air. Whether it’s cycling along the Changi Bay Park Connector with the kids or strolling along the Changi East Boardwalk for sunset views , Changi Bay Point is a spot you must add to your bucket list. Here’s our kid-friendly guide to Changi Bay Point so you can plan your next family day out! Jumplinks: – Things to Do at Changi Bay Point – Where to Eat at Changi Bay Point – How to Get to Changi Bay Point – Round Island Route: Changi Bay Point Park Connector Map Things to do at Changi Bay Point: 1. Take in the Jeju Island in Singapore Vibes Image credit: @avchiang via Urban Redevelopment Authority via Facebook Most of us can’t pack our bags and take a vacation whenever we want. That’s why we’re thankful for places like Changi Bay Point, which gives us a break from the hustle and bustle of the city with breathtaking views. Unlike Sentosa where you’ll see plenty of ships along the coastline, you’ll find it hard to spot a ship in the ocean at Changi Bay Point. If you’re an early bird, you’ll be able to catch the sunrise and a cool breeze that mimics scenes from a K-drama that was shot at Jeju Island. 2. Take Insta-worthy photos of the Lone Tree at Changi Bay Point Image Credit: cattan2011 via Flickr The lone trees at Upper Seletar Reservoir and Jurong Lake Gardens are well known by keen photographers, but Changi Bay Point boasts a “floating” tree. During high tide, this lone tree appears to be floating in the sea with its roots planted on the shoreline. There are lots of photo opportunities around Changi Bay Point (s= sunrise and sunset are usually the best times for pics) so take out your phones or cameras and snap plenty of photos for the gram. It’s a fun thing to do with kids too (and distracts them from complaining about “boring” walks!) 3. Changi Bay Park Connector: Cycling at Changi Bay Point Image credit: SGBike If there’s one thing that’s true about Singaporeans, it’s that many of us love cycling , and we’re so blessed to have smooth cycling paths that allow us to journey from one end of the island to another. Changi Bay Park Connector is a 3.5km cycling path that takes you along the eastern corridor of the Round-Island-Route, which spans a total of 75km, certainly not for the faint of heart! Enjoy a scenic view of sand and sea that will hopefully take your mind off the burning sensation in your legs. 4. Stroll at Changi East Boardwalk at Changi Bay Point Image credit: cattan2011 via Flickr Enjoy a leisurely walk along the Changi East Boardwalk that takes you even closer to the water’s edge. There’s a small pavilion with benches so you can give your legs a rest and take in the tranquil view. 5. Changi Beach Park: BBQ & Picnic Image credit: NParks Get nostalgic with a kampong ambience at Changi Beach Park, one of the oldest coastal parks in Singapore . From BBQ pits and palm trees to the sun, sand and sea, there is plenty to do with the kids. Let the kiddos play on the beach (bring sand toys) or get your workout in and enjoy cycling or jogging with an unparalleled view. Then refuel at a seafront restaurant and watch the magnificent sunset. Where to Eat at Changi Bay Point: Al Capone’s Changi Civil Service Club Image credit: Al Capone’s Changi Civil Service Club via Facebook A short 5-minute walk from the Changi Coastal Walk, Al Capone’s offers American comfort food like Full Roast Grilled Chicken, BBQ Pork Ribs, Fried Calamari and more. Sip on your favourite cocktails to recharge from a day by the sea, while the kids fill their tummies with pizza and fries. Al Capone’s Changi Civil Service Club, 2 Netheravon Rd, Singapore 508503, Tel: (+65) 6908 9711, www.facebook.com/AlCaponesChangi Changi Beach Seafood Paradise Image Credit: Changi Beach Seafood Paradise via Facebook Imagine satisfying your seafood craving with seafront views – that’s what you’ll get at Changi Beach Seafood Paradise. Dig into local favourites like Chilli Crab, Prosperity Kampung Chicken and more. Changi Beach Seafood Paradise, 2 Andover Rd, Singapore 509984, Tel: (+65) 9113 5215, www.facebook.com/Changibeachseafoodparadise Changi Village Hawker Centre For a budget-friendly option, head to Changi Village Hawker Centre near Changi Point Coastal Walk for your typical local fare. From Nasi Lemak, to Goreng Pisang, Wonton Mee and more, you’re sure to find whatever you’ve been craving to satisfy your hunger pangs. Changi Village Hawker Centre, 2 Changi Village Rd, Singapore 500002 The Coastal Settlement Image credit: The Coastal Settlement via Official Website This casual dining restaurant is a short walk from the Changi Boardwalk, so it makes a great place to head to after spending the day out in the sun. Be surrounded by lush greenery at this alfresco restaurant , and indulge in familiar local flavours with a twist – think Baby Squid Spiced with Red Chilli, Curry Leaves & Smoked Paprika or Wagyu Beef Hor Fun. The Coastal Settlement , 200 Netheravon Rd, Singapore 508529, Tel: (+65) 6475 0200, www.thecoastalsettlement.com Mr. Mamak Craving delicious Indian food? Fans of Mr. Mamak love the soft chappati, Tandoori Chicken Dum Briyani and the Naan with Butter Chicken. This fuss-free Indian restaurant will satisfy any craving for Indian food – just be sure to order something that’s not spicy, if the kids can’t take the heat just yet! Mr. Mamak, Block 5 Changi Village Road, #01-2019, Singapore 500005, Tel: (+65) 6384 4424, mr-mamak.business.site The Seagrill Image credit: The Seagrill via Official Website The Seagrill is a charming alfresco seafood bistro bar along Changi Beach Park with mouthwatering dishes and an unobstructed view of the sea. From kid’s all-time favourites like Mac N’ Cheese and Spaghetti Bolognese to a craving-satisfying Seafood Platter and a Grilled Barramundi Fillet, there’s something for everyone! The Seagrill, 260 Nicoll Dr, Changi Beach Park, Singapore 498991, Tel: (+65) 6935 0076, www.seagrill.com.sg Image credit: NParks via Facebook How to Get to Changi Bay Point: By MRT / Bus: Take Bus 35 from Bedok or Tanah Merah station. Get off at Changi Coast Road – Before Changi Ferry Road. Then walk about 1.5km to Changi Bay Point. By Car: Park at Changi Beach Park Carpark 7 and walk or cycle over to Changi Bay Point. Round Island Route: Changi Bay Park Connector Map Image Credit: NParks For all the avid cyclists out there or those who want a scenic cycling route, the Round Island Route is one to add to your list. The Round Island Route spans a whopping 150km and stretches across the eastern half of Singapore from Rower’s Bay in the north-east to Changi Bay Point, eventually ending at Berlayer Creek in the south. You’ll get to ride through some of the best parks in Singapore – Sengkang Riverside Park, Pasir Ris Park, Changi Beach Park and East Coast Park . So, what are you waiting for? Take the kids out for a fun day out at Changi Bay Point to soak up some sun, admire Jeju-like views and enjoy seafront dining. Read more: The post Changi Bay Point: Guide To Coastal Walk, Changi Bay Park, Cycling & Sea Views With Jeju Island Vibes appeared first on Sassy Mama .

articles.title: Kids Get Free Meals & A Playground With Colouring Corners At This Hidden Gem In Bugis
articles.author: Sassy Mama
articles.content: Looking for the perfect weekend hangout with the family? Guoco Midtown in Bugis has freebies and activities for kids, plus family-friendly offerings that are sure to top your list. Parents, if you’re on the lookout for a new weekend hangout , we might have just the perfect spot for you tucked away in the heart of Bugis. Guoco Midtown is a hidden gem that offers seamless accessibility, just an 8-minute walk from the East-West Line via the underpass or a breeze to drive to with convenient parking options at the mall. Think cosy cafés, family-friendly restaurants, and a dedicated kids’ corner, complete with a playground, colouring activities, and more! Here’s what you can expect on your next family day out at Guoco Midtown between 18 to 20 April and every Sundays from 27 April to 30 November 2025: Kids eat free deals on Sundays Image credit: British Indian Curry Hut Weekend outings with the family aren’t complete without filling those little bellies with delicious meals to keep them energised for the day ahead! That’s why we love that restaurants at Guoco Midtown offer Kids’ Dine for Free promotions for little ones under 12, making our Sundays so much sweeter! Whether it’s a hearty lunch from The Telegraph by Olivia & Co., a taste of Korean flavours from Dal.Komm PlayGround, or the good ol’ chicken nuggets and fries from British Indian Curry Hut, there’s something for everyone. Plus, it’s the perfect spot to switch things up—somewhere new for the kids to explore while you sit back and enjoy your meal. Do note that terms and conditions apply. Check the full list of participating restaurants here. Free playground, colouring corners & freebies for kids In addition to exclusive dining promotions, kids can enjoy a variety of exciting, complimentary activities. Kids with energy to spare can run, climb, and play at the playground in Midtown Market, while those who prefer a quieter activity can enjoy the colouring corner. With popcorn and candy floss stations available, there’s plenty to keep little ones entertained. Note that the popcorn and candy floss will be available every Sunday from 11am to 2pm. Wait, there’s more! Simply spend a minimum of $50 in a single receipt at Guoco Midtown’s participating tenants between 18 and 20 April and every Sunday between 27 April and 25 May, and you’ll enjoy 2 hours of free parking at Guoco Midtown! At Guoco Midtown, Sundays become extra special. Start making your weekend plans with the fam today! Follow them on Instagram and Facebook , and be sure to tag them if you’re having a family day out there. Guoco Midtown, 128 Beach Road, Singapore 189773, www.guocomidtown.com Read more: Best ‘Kids Eat Free’ Deals In Singapore The post Kids Get Free Meals & A Playground With Colouring Corners At This Hidden Gem In Bugis appeared first on Sassy Mama .

articles.title: 27 ‘Kids Eat Free’ Deals In Singapore
articles.author: Sassy Mama
articles.content: Check out these awesome restaurants where kids eat free in Singapore! Save these ‘kids eat free’ deals for bonding time as a family. We round up all the newest ‘kids eat free’ deals in Singapore to save you some hard-earned cash! Singapore’s got a reputation for having a wide range of culinary options – you know we love us some dim sum , pizza and pasta , Korean BBQ , mookata and Indian food – but when you’ve got lots of little hungry mouths to feed, the food bill can rack up! So here, we bring you all sorts of great places where kids eat free in Singapore! Kids can score a free buffet at Edge, chow down for free at Cafe Melba, munch on free burgers at Hard Rock Cafe, eat free pizza or pasta at La Nonna, and more! Also check out our list of great deals and promos in Singapore , birthday deals , lunch deals and some insider info on how to score free cinema tickets ! Disclaimer: While all info is correct at publishing, we’d advise calling ahead in case these kids eat free deals change. ↓ Keep scrolling for restaurants where kids eat free in Singapore: 1. Edge, Pan Pacific Singapore: Buffet with kids’ play area and menu Image credit: Edge Edge at Pan Pacific Singapore serves up a scrumptious buffet spread featuring local and international dishes. There are seven open kitchens to marvel at the master chefs at work, and we love that there are kid-friendly activities to keep the little ones occupied. From a dedicated kids’ play area to a specially curated kids’ buffet menu, your little ones are in for a treat. Kids Eat Free Deal: Kids below 6 years old dine for free Edge, Pan Pacific Singapore, 7 Raffles Boulevard, Singapore 039595, www.panpacific.com Read more: Guide To The Best Brunches In Singapore 2. La Brasserie: Classic French bistro with views of Marina Bay waterfront Image credit: La Brasserie If you’re up for some delicious French cuisine with the fam, head over to La Brasserie, which serves up a must-have weekend champagne brunch spotlighting some French favourites, as well as Asian and Indian delights. It’s the perfect place for introducing kids to the delectable world of French cuisine. Kids Eat Free Deal: Kids below 6 years old dine for free La Brasserie, The Fullerton Bay Hotel Singapore, 80 Collyer Quay, Singapore 049326, www.fullertonhotels.com 3. Genius Central: Free Margherita pizza or pasta on Sundays Image credit: Genius Central Genius Central is a cosy cafe in Far East Square serving delicious plant-based dishes. The dishes here are also mostly made with organic, whole-food ingredients with everything made in-house, including their sauces and dressings. Kids Eat Free Deal: Kids below 12 years old dine for free and enjoy a free Margherita pizza or Pomodoro Pasta with every purchase of two mains on Sundays. Limited to one redemption per table. Genius Central, 7-13 Amoy Street, #01-01 Far East Square, Singapore 049949, www.geniuscentralsingapore.com 4. Atrium Restaurant, Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium: Kids below 5 eat for free Image credit: Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium If you’re feeling a little bougie and crave an international buffet with the family, head to Atrium Restaurant at Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium, where kids below 5 years old eat for free with every paying adult! This halal-certified restaurant features an extensive selection of delicious dishes, from international flavours to local Singaporean favourites. Kids will love the grilled chicken drumstick and braised beef brisket, which are well-loved dishes among the younger diners. They can also get creative at the DIY Congee Station, or indulge in sweet treats such as ice cream with wafer or rainbow bread, as well as the chocolate fondue. There is also a selection of fruits to balance the treats! Apart from the kids eat free deal, kids between 6 and 12 years old get to enjoy the buffet at only $25++ per pax. The best part? This promotion is available all day, every day – perfect for whether you’re heading for a casual buffet lunch or looking to treat the family to a weekend buffet experience. Kids Eat Free Deal: Kids below 5 years old eat for free with every paying adult, while kids between 6 – 12 years old enjoy a special rate of $25++ per pax. Atrium Restaurant, Holiday Inn Singapore Atrium, 317 Outram Road, Singapore 169075, www.singaporeatrium.holidayinn.com Read more: Best Spots For High Tea In Singapore 5. Lawry’s The Prime Rib: Kids eat free on Sundays Image credit: Lawry’s The Prime Rib via Instagram Craving a succulent prime rib? At Lawry’s The Prime Rib, treat yourself to a hearty Lawry’s Cut of Prime Rib, while the kids enjoy a three-course kid’s set menu. Kids Eat Free Deal: Kids under 12 years old eat free on Sundays with every adult main or set menu ordered. Maximum of two free kids’ meals per table. Minimum order of two adult main courses or set menus required. Not stackable with other discounts and promos. Valid until 30 November 2025. Lawry’s The Prime Rib, 333A Orchard Road, #04 – 01 / 31, Singapore 238897, www.lawrys.com.sg 6. The Coconut Club: Kids get a free plate of nasi lemak Image credit: The Coconut Club via Instagram This one’s for all the Nasi Lemak lovers! At The Coconut Club, you’ll find all things ‘lemak’. Indulge in Beef Rendang Nasi Lemak, Homemade Otah Nasi Lemak or even Meatless Rendang for those who prefer plant-based protein. Kids eat free deal: Each child under 5 years old will get a plate of coconut rice, peanuts, ikan bilis and cucumber, the classic Nasi Lemak meal! The Coconut Club, 269 Beach Road, Singapore 199546 and 97 Frankel Avenue, Singapore 458222, www.thecoconutclub.sg Read more: Great Singapore Deals & Promos On F&B, Attractions, Shopping & More 7. Meatsmith: Kids enjoy a free burger meal Image credit: Meatsmith via Instagram There’s nothing like indulging in mouthwatering BBQ! Meatsmith is proof that you can find authentic American barbecue outside the U.S. Try their dry-aged, hand-selected beef from Australia and the USA. Kids aged 12 and below can dig into a scrumptious burger and fries while you enjoy your BBQ meal. Kids eat free deal: Kids under 12 years old can dine for free with every adult main purchased (minimum spend of $30++). Not stackable with other promos. Meatsmith, 167-169 Telok Ayer Street, Singapore 068620, www.meatsmith.com.sg 8. Cafe Melba: Kids eat free on Mondays Image credit: Cafe Melba via Facebook Cafe Melba at Goodman Arts Centre is a well-known name on the kid-friendly cafe lists with its huge space for running around At Cafe Melba Mediapolis, they also have the perfect space for scooting. Here, kids eat for free every Monday, where they can enjoy good food and bounce away on the bouncy castle afterwards. For more fun, join the Café Melba Kids Club for exclusive perks like birthday treats and fun activities. Kids Eat Free Deal: Kids eat for free on Monday with a minimum spend of $25 on a main meal. Cafe Melba , Café Melba Goodman, 90 Goodman Road, #01-56 Block N Goodman Arts Centre, Singapore 439053 & Café Melba Mediapolis, 1 Stars Ave, #03-01, Singapore 138507, www.cafemelba.com.sg Read more: Fab Birthday Deals & Perks In Singapore 9. COCA: Free Thai-Chinese steamboat for the kiddos Image credit: Coca Restaurants Singapore Pair your steamboat soups with more than 65 ingredients at this cool Thai-Chinese hot pot restaurant . With house specialities such as shrimp paste, handmade dumplings, seasonal vegetables, as well as fresh meat and seafood, you’ll certainly be spoilt for choice. Kids Eat Free Deal: One child eats free for every two paying adults. Valid for kids aged 5 – 11 for the regular buffet. Reserve here. COCA , three locations in Singapore including Temasek Boulevard and Orchard, www.coca.com.sg Read more: Must-Try Chinese Restaurants In Singapore 10. Hanjip Korean Grill House: Free kids’ meal on weekends lunch Image credit: Hanjip Korean Grill House via Facebook Hanjip Korean Grill House offers a free kids’ meal set with every paying adult! Available for lunch on Saturdays and Sundays, choose from three different free kids’ meal sets for your little one to enjoy. Each set also comes with apple or orange juice, and you can find these kids’ meals available for $10 on regular days. Kids Eat Free Deal: Kids under 10 can enjoy a free kids lunch set with every paying adult. Do note that Hanji Korean Grill House’s kids eat free deal is only valid during selected periods such as the school holidays. Be sure to check their Facebook page for updated info. Hanjip Korean Grill House , 3C River Valley Road, #01 – 11, Singapore 179022, www.hanjip.sg Read more: Where To Score Lunch Deals & Lunch Sets In Singapore 11. Kanada-Ya: $1 kids’ meal with any purchase of Special Ramen Image credit: Kanada-Ya via Instagram Sometimes, a warm bowl of ramen is just what you need! Kanada-Ya is one of our go-to’s for hearty and comforting ramen, with must-tries such as the Truffle Ramen and the Mala Tonkotsu Ramen. Come here with the kids, where kiddos under 12 can enjoy a Kid’s Ramen or Kid’s Don with every order of Special Ramen. This kids eat free deal is only valid at Marina Square, PLQ Mall & Jem outlets. More info here. Kids Eat Free Deal: Kids enjoy ramen at just $1 with every purchase of a Special Ramen Kanada-Ya, multiple locations in Singapore, including Marina Square, PLQ Mall and Jem, www.kanada-ya.sg 12. La Nonna: Free pasta and pizza on Sundays Image credit: La Nonna via Facebook Expect traditional Italian cuisine served in an unpretentious and inviting Trattoria atmosphere at La Nonna. Signatures include the Truffle Egg Pizza, Crab Meat Linguine, Oven Roasted Lamb Rack and Tiramisu. Tip: Happy Hour is also a steal – a bottle of Prosecco is $38++, and there are complimentary sides like Italian Sausages, Bruschetta or Calamari. Kids Eat Free Deal: Kids (12 years & below) can enjoy a complimentary kids main with every adult main ordered. Tonito Latin American Kitchen , 78 Airport Boulevard #02-248, Singapore 819666, www.tonito.sg Read more: Our Favourite Restaurants At Jewel 20. articles.title: Soothing Eczema Creams & Skincare For Babies And Kids In Singapore 2025
articles.author: Sassy Mama
articles.content: Struggling with itchy and irritated eczema-prone skin? Try these simple tips and over-the-counter eczema creams, anti-itch creams, soaps and skincare products to soothe, rebuild and repair your child’s skin Looking for eczema creams in Singapore to help your little one’s eczema or atopic dermatitis? Often, these patches of inflamed, itchy skin can appear red, cracked or rough, and may even have blisters. If you suspect your child has eczema, it’s always best to consult your doctor. If your child’s eczema does not respond to over-the-counter eczema creams, if their condition worsens or if the skin has become infected, they may need a stronger prescription-only eczema product or steroid cream. Help alleviate eczema symptoms with these tips: Bathe your child in soothing lukewarm water. Use a mild soap or a non-soap cleanser when washing. After a bath gently pat skin dry with a towel (don’t rub the skin which can irritate it and tear the skin). Follow the golden 3-minute rule: “lock in” moisture by applying moisturiser within 3 minutes of bathing. Moisturise daily with a good skin-barrier-healing moisturiser. Choose your child’s clothing wisely: avoid rough, synthetic and scratchy fibres in favour of cotton and soft fabrics. Keep your little one’s fingernails short to prevent their nails from breaking the skin if they scratch too hard. Keep a diary of what your child’s eczema triggers and skin irritants might be; these can range from harsh soaps, detergents, shampoos, and disinfectants, to things in their diet like dairy products, eggs, soy and wheat, or allergens like pets and pollen. What causes eczema? Unfortunately, the causes of eczema still remain unknown, and there are no cures or treatment options for eczema. However, what can help are eczema creams and anti-itch products that are designed to control and minimise inflammation, while moisturising skin and building its natural protective barrier. We’ve sorted out some of the best eczema creams in Singapore, which aim to soothe and minimise symptoms of atopic dermatitis or eczema in order to heal the affected skin and prevent flare-ups of itchiness and other eczema symptoms. Do note that some over-the-counter eczema creams contain steroids such as hydrocortisone. Always check with a doctor or paediatrician before applying these eczema creams on a baby’s skin. Read more: Eczema Triggers & Tips To Avoid Them Best Eczema Creams & Eczema Skincare In Singapore Suu Balm: Eczema skincare formulated by the National Skin Centre Image credit: Suu Balm Crafted by the esteemed National Skin Centre, Singapore, Suu Balm’s range has become a go-to choice for parents seeking relief for their little ones battling eczema. What sets Suu Balm Kids Moisturiser apart is its rapid itch relief within 5 mins* thanks to its formulation with natural mint leaves, allowing your child to get back to the joy of playtime! Furthermore, with three types of skin-identical ceramides, this cream goes beyond mere relief, actively replenishing the skin barrier. And worry not, their premium formula is steroid, paraben, preservative, and fragrance-free, ensuring the utmost safety for your little one’s precious skin. Pair this with Suu Balm Kids Head-to-Toe Wash which is crafted for ultra-gentle cleansing. This wash is soap and sulfate-free, ensuring it gently cleanses without stripping away natural moisture. With its rich, creamy texture, enriched with five moisturising ingredients, your child will enjoy a soothing experience that leaves their skin feeling soft without any tightness or discomfort. Click here to spend a minimum of $70 and receive a 25ml kid’s moisturiser. Valid until 30 April 2026. Free item will automatically be applied at check-out. Eczema cream suitable for: Newborns and children with dry, sensitive or eczema-prone skin. Where to find eczema cream: Guardian, Watsons & Unity retail stores or online at suubalm.com , Shopee and Lazada . Suu Balm , www.suubalm.com Aveeno: Eczema creams & anti-itch skincare Image credit: Aveeno Aveeno has a whole range of eczema creams and skincare for skin that’s prone to eczema, or atopic dermatitis with their Aveeno Baby Dermexa Range. These specially formulated eczema creams and anti-itch products have been clinically proven to help relieve dry, itchy and irritated eczema-prone infant’s skin. Made with triple oat complex, it promises to keep baby’s skin moisturised for up to 24 hours. Eczema cream suitable for : Babies Where to find eczema cream : Available at all major retailers Aveeno, www.aveeno.com.sg AweMed: Itch-relieving eczema skincare Image credit: AweMed Series via Instagram Developed in partnership with local dermatologists, AweMed has become a popular brand for their proven itch-relieving formulas. The AweMed spray is often recommended for on-the-go use to relieve itch quickly, while the AweMed Repair + Daily Moisturiser serves as an eczema cream, and is great as an everyday moisturiser that’s suitable for babies. Eczema cream suitable for : All ages Where to find eczema cream : Online AweMed, www.awemedseries.com Babyganics: Eczema care skin protectant cream Image credit: babyganics Singapore via Instagram Formulated with soothing ingredients like colloidal oatmeal and NeoNourish (the brand’s unique blend of 100% natural seed oils), this eczema cream by Babyganics is famous the world over for protecting and nourishing baby’s sensitive skin. Adults love it, too! It’s clinically proven to give long-lasting relief by increasing and improving skin hydration and protecting and supporting skin barrier function. Eczema cream suitable for: All ages Where to find eczema cream: Online at Lazada, RedMart, Shopee, Qoo10 and ShopCorlison Babyganics, www.babyganics.com.sg Bepanthen: Eczema products with 24-hour hydration Image credit: Bepanthen With over 75 years of experience in helping people protect and heal damaged skin, Bepanthen takes special care in selecting ingredients that will bring much-needed relief to eczema-prone skin. Bepanthen’s SensiWash Daily Gentle Body Wash is a gentle yet effective body wash for dry, sensitive and eczema-prone skin that will clean without leaving it feeling dry and itchy. After a soothing bath, apply Bepanthen’s SensiDaily Moisturizer, a moisturising eczema cream that has a unique Derma Defense Formula to strengthen the skin barrier, protect the skin from flare-ups and provide long-lasting hydration up to 24 hours. Read more about Bepanthen’s Eczema range here. Bepanthen’s eczema creams suitable for: Babies 1 month and up with eczema-prone skin Where to find Bepanthen’s eczema cream: Online at Bepanthen’s website or in-store at Guardian, Watsons and Unity Bepanthen, www.bepanthen.com.sg CeraVe: Baby moisturizing eczema cream Image credit: CeraVe via Instagram CeraVe Baby Moisturizing Cream is a hit with parents and dermatologists, thanks to its rich, hydrating formula. If you’re looking for something other than hydrocortisone cream, this moisturiser does wonders. This eczema cream works by protecting and restoring the skin’s natural barrier due to essential ceramides. It’s free from parabens and phthalates and is a great itch-relief eczema cream for quick relief from itchiness. Eczema creams suitable for: Babies four weeks old and up Where to find eczema cream: Guardian & Watsons stores or online on Shopee, Lazada, Amazon SG CeraVe, www.cerave.com.sg Cetaphil: Eczema creams & washes for eczema-prone skin Image credit: Cetaphil Singapore via Facebook Cetaphil’s gentle range of eczema creams, body washes and lotions are dermatologist-recommended and formulated with synthesised oat extract and dihydroavenanthramide D. These ingredients mimic the natural calming effect of oats in reducing itch and irritation, so you or your baby can break the scratching cycle. Their eczema products are easily available and often come in larger sizes so you can use them for the whole family. Eczema cream suitable for: All ages Where to find eczema cream: Online, baby shops, pharmacies and selected supermarkets Cetaphil, www.cetaphil.com.sg Eucerin: Highly-rated over-the-counter eczema cream Image credit: Eucerin via Facebook The Eucerin Eczema Relief Flare-up Treatment is a highly-rated over-the-counter eczema cream that’s easily available online and in stores. The rich, soothing eczema cream formula is formulated with Colloidal Oatmeal (a skin protectant), Ceramide-3 to lock in moisture, and Licorice Root Extract to help soothe minor irritation, and to help strengthen the skin’s protective moisture barrier. This eczema ointment is free of steroids, fragrances, and dyes. For daily use, try the Eucerin Eczema Relief Cream. Eczema cream suitable for: Adults, children and babies 3 months and up. Where to find eczema cream: Amazon SG , Guardian and Watsons Eucerin, www.eucerin.sg Mustela: Eczema cream for newborns Image credit: Mustela Looking for a anti-itch hydration cream for your bub in sweaty Singapore? You’ll want a lightweight, fast-absorbing eczema cream that hydrates without leaving a sticky residue. Mustela Stelatopia Emollient Face Cream has essential lipids derived from simple plant ingredients like sunflower oil and avocado – with n o nasties – 0% fragrance, paraben, phthalate, phenoxyethanol, EDTA, and SLS. This fragrance-free cream is super on baby’s face, soothing eczema-prone skin, but can be used for the whole body. Eczema cream suitable for: Newborns and older kids Where to find eczema cream : Online and Amazon SG Mustela, www.mustela.com QV Skincare: Quick-relief eczema cream Image credit: QV Skincare Singapore via Facebook QV Skincare’s soap-free QV Gentle Wash and highly concentrated moisturising QV Flare-Up Eczema Cream are best-selling sensitive skin and anti-itch products in Singapore’s hospitals and are just the thing for dry, sensitive and eczema-prone skin. Take note of the QV Flare Up Wash, it’s what to reach for when eczema is in full force. Unlike soap, this gentle wash cleanses skin without stripping away the skin’s natural oils yet it gets rid of Staphylococcus Aureus bacteria that can aggravate eczema. Eczema cream suitable for: Young children or adults Where to find eczema cream : Online and at major pharmacies and hospital pharmacies QV Skincare, www.qvskincare.com Scenze’s Rivadouce Dermo: Hypoallergenic eczema creams Image credit: Scenze via Facebook Specially formulated for very dry skin with atopic tendency, Scenze’s Rivadouce Dermo range repairs, protects and nourishes the fragile skin barrier of eczema-prone skin. You’ll be glad to know that this range of eczema products is hypoallergenic (skincare tested under dermatological control) and is formulated to minimise the risk of allergic reactions. It’s also paraben and phenoxyethanol-free. The eczema range is made in France with natural extracts of alpine plants as well as water purified by osmosis (in order to eliminate chemicals and anything harmful to the skin including heavy metals, nitrates and pesticides). Eczema cream suitable for: Newborns and older children Where to find eczema cream: Online. (Local shipping is free for orders weighing above 30kg.) Scenze, www.scenze.com Topicrem: Eczema cream for sensitive skin Image credit: Topicrem via Facebook Topicrem AD Emollient Balm has been developed for very dry, sensitive and atopic skin and is suitable for bodies, as well as the sensitive faces of infants, children and adults. It’s a light, non-sticky and non-greasy, anti-itch formula that has been tested under dermatological and paediatric control on atopic skin. There are no parabens, fragrances, silicones, colourants, or alcohol. Eczema cream suitable for : All ages Where to find eczema cream : Online at Amazon and in-store at selected Guardian, Watsons, Unity, as well as Ng Teng Fong Hospital and local polyclinics Topicrem, www.fr.topicrem.com Vanicream: Moisturising eczema cream for dry, itchy skin Image credit: Vanicream via Facebook All of Vanicream’s products are made free of dyes, fragrance, masking fragrance, lanolin, parabens and formaldehyde releasers. Their cleansers and moisturisers are all highly rated by those with eczema and sensitive skin. They even have a gentle SPF 50+ sunscreen! Eczema cream suitable for : The whole family Where to find eczema cream : Amazon SG , iHerb, Shopee and Lazada Vanicream, www.vanicream.com Remember, finding the right eczema creams and anti-itch products to treat your kids’ eczema is often a trial and error process, so don’t give up mama! articles.title: Tiny Pod’s Co-Living Train Hotel ‘Train Pod’ At one-north: Rooms, Rates & Booking
articles.author: Cherilyn
articles.content: Train Pod at LaunchPad in one-north will open in the second quarter of 2025. Built with a decommissioned MRT carriage, this innovative hotel will feature eight rooms and integrated food and beverage vending machines. Are you or your child a fan of trains? Book a room at Train Pod, Tiny Pod’s newest co-living hotel in one-north at JTC LaunchPad that will open its doors to the public in the second half of 2025. In addition to three other shipping container pod hotels at Gardens by the Bay , Haw Par Villa and one-north, Train Pod will soon join the family with eight tiny pods that can sleep up to two pax. From its amenities to room rates and dining options, here’s all you need to know about Train Pod at one-north for a unique staycation in Singapore with the kids . Train Pod: An innovative co-living hotel at one-north Image credit: Cherilyn Gan Train Pod is a boutique co-living hotel, a new concept by Tiny Pod, that gives a decommissioned MRT carriage a new lease on life. In partnership with innovative local startups, Train Pod utilises high-tech systems to enhance the co-living experience. From smart lock systems by Igloohome to AI-powered crowd counting and crisis detection by Ailytics and self-check-in by Vouch and GenAI chatbots, guests of Train Pod will be in for a seamless, stress-free escapade. Rooms At Train Pod: Eight rooms with bathrooms Image credit: Cherilyn Gan Train Pod is tiny but mighty! There will be eight rooms that optimise space efficiency and offer the essential comfort you need to unwind. Each room is equipped with an attached bathroom and LCD panels in the driver’s compartment that depict real-life footage of the train’s earlier journey through the tunnel. Dining At Train Pod: 24/7 vending machines Image credit: Cherilyn Gan For easy access to food and beverage, there is a 24/7 food and beverage vending machine café, an outdoor dining area and outdoor public benches that repurpose original MRT train seats. There are also bicycle racks to invite others to join the community and gather over a cuppa or an afternoon snack. Location Of Train Pod: 10-minutes from one-north MRT Image credit: Cherilyn Gan Train Pod is located at the car park next to Block 69 Ayer Rajah Crescent in the heart of JTC LaunchPad. It is about a 10-minute walk from one-north MRT station. Bookings & Room Rates At Train Pod Image credit: Cherilyn Gan Train Pod @ one-north will open for bookings in the second half of 2025. Check back again later for more deets. To give you an idea of how much a room might be, the rates for their One-North Container Hotel range from $118 to $300 per night for a room that fits up to four pax. Train Pod @ one-north, 69 Ayer Rajah Crescent, Singapore 139961, www.tinypod.com Read more: The post Tiny Pod’s Co-Living Train Hotel ‘Train Pod’ At one-north: Rooms, Rates & Booking appeared first on Sassy Mama .

articles.title: Mother’s Day Dining Guide 2025: Best Restaurants With Buffet, Brunch & Dinner To Celebrate Mum
articles.author: Sassy Mama
articles.content: Want to make reservations for Mother’s Day dinner or brunch in Singapore? These restaurants have delicious 2025 Mother’s Day menus and buffet spreads, plus Mother’s Day promotions so you can treat Mum in style! Looking to book a meal out for Mother’s Day (pssst! Mother’s Day is Sunday, 11 May 2025)? Why not head out for a special Mother’s Day dinner, brunch or lunch to celebrate the woman who does so much for the fam? Reserve your table at these hot spots offering special spreads for 2025 Mother’s Day dinner, high tea, brunch or lunch, plus special Mother’s Day promotions! And don’t forget to pick out a gorgeous Mother’s Day gift , pre-order a bouquet of flowers and check out all the other deals and promos taking place so you can treat Mum to a fab day out. Read more: Mother’s Day Exclusive Perks JUMBO Group: Mother’s Day celebration with complimentary bird’s nest Image credit: Zui Teochew Cuisine Bring Mum for an indulgent Teochew feast at Chui Huay Lim Teochew Cuisine and Zui Yu Xuan Teochew Cuisine! Their signature must-haves include iconic classics such as steamed pomfret, the tender braised duck paired with beancurd slices and the highlight? The succulent roasted suckling pig which makes for the perfect centrepiece. Don’t miss the smooth yam paste that’s sure to delight every palate. For Mother’s Day, their specially curated set menu is packed with collagen-rich and wholesome ingredients like fish maw, sea cucumber, and Hashima. Be sure to explore the exclusive chef’s specials such as the Supreme Seafood Soup with Bird’s Nest and Winter Melon, the Peppery Shark’s Fin Soup with Pig’s Stomach and Chicken, and the revitalising Double-boiled Hashima with Red Dates and Lotus Seeds. As an extra treat, all mothers dining for Mother’s Day will enjoy a complimentary Double-boiled Bird’s Nest with Rock Sugar! (Terms and conditions apply.) Mother’s Day dining: 1 – 11 May 2025 How much: Set menu from $338++ Chui Huay Lim Teochew Cuisine, 190 Keng Lee Rd, #01-02 Chui Huay Lim Club, Singapore 308409, Tel: (+65) 6732 3637, www.zui-teochewcuisine.com Zui Teochew Cuisine, 130/131 Amoy St, Far East Square, Singapore 049959, Tel: (+65) 6788 3637, www.zui-teochewcuisine.com Little Farms Restaurant: Special Mother’s Day menu Image credit: Little Farms Restaurant Looking for the perfect spot to celebrate Mum this Mother’s Day? Little Farms has you covered! Little Farms’ restaurants feature beautiful interiors that complement their fresh, high-quality dishes. Known for their commitment to sustainable and ethically sourced produce, Little Farms Restaurant is a popular spot for wholesome, delicious food made from the finest ingredients. This Mother’s Day, they’re offering a specially curated menu with only the best ingredients perfect for Mum to indulge. Kick off your meal with the must-try Charred Selva Tiger Prawn, made with sustainable prawns from Selva Shrimps, or if you’re craving something more hearty and satisfying, savour the flavour-packed Roasted Eggplant and Red Pepper Arancini. For mains, choose between the rich White Miso Black Cod that’s infused with umami goodness, or the comforting Potato Gnocchi alla Pesto Genovese. Of course, no celebration is complete without a sweet ending! For a sweet finish, treat Mum to the Strawberry & Pistachio Cake – a collaboration with Pâtisserie CLÉ that’s sure to impress! Mother’s Day dining: 10 – 11 May 2025 How much: $14-$38 per person Little Farms Restaurant, multiple locations in Singapore including Tanglin Mall, Holland Village and Sentosa, www.littlefarmscafe.com Ellenborough Market Café: Mother’s Day international buffet with activity station Image credit: Ellenborough Market Café Is Mum a fan of Peranakan food ? Then Ellenborough Market Cafe is the perfect spot for a memorable Mother’s Day lunch or dinner! Located along the picturesque Singapore River, this restaurant in Paradox Singapore Merchant Court serves up comforting Peranakan dishes and more that are sure to impress. Mum can indulge in soulful Peranakan classics like Nonya Chap Chye, Ayam Buah Keluak, and Blue Pea Coconut Rice. The Mother’s Day buffet also serves up delicious international dishes as well as assorted sushi and sashimi and local favourites like laksa and chilli crab. There’s even a chicken shawarma station that’s sure to be a hit! Don’t forget to save room for dessert because the signature Durian Pengat and Nyonya kuehs are absolute must-tries! With alfresco and pet-friendly dining spaces, your furry friends can also be part of the Mother’s Day celebration. Plus, Ellenborough Market Cafe has a special actiivity station for Mother’s Day where little ones can create a keepsake for Mum. The cafe will even mail the finished creation to her, making the day extra special! Quote SassyMama40 upon payment to enjoy 40% off your Mother’s Day buffet! Mother’s Day dining buffet: 10 – 11 May 2025 How much: $98++ per adult; $42++ per child (6 – 12 years old) Ellenborough Market Café, Paradox Singapore Merchant Court, 20 Merchant Road, Singapore 058281, www.paradoxhotels.com Read more: Mother’s Day Gift Ideas @Stevens: Bridgerton-inspired Mother’s Day brunch Image credit: Novotel Singapore On Stevens If Mum is like us and eagerly awaiting the next season of Bridgerton, then Lady Whistledown invites you to @Steven this Mother’s Day for a Bridgerton-inspired brunch! Enjoy a day filled with Bridgerton-themed activities, including a hand fan painting session, a flower bar where you can craft a bouquet to gift Mum and more. The space will also be beautifully adorned with lush floral displays, capturing the opulence and charm of the Bridgerton world. As for the food, look forward to live stations featuring Beef Wellington, paired with accompaniments like tender asparagus, herb-roasted potatoes, pumpkin, and a variety of rich sauces such as red wine gravy and seeded mustard. There’s also freshly made pasta with a choice of velvety carbonara sauce or a rich, creamy garlic prawn sauce. Buffet highlights include seafood on ice, a Laksa station, a Dessert Corner with Bailey’s cheesecake, lemon custard teacakes, a selection of cheeses, plus an ice cream station and a chocolate fountain for the little lords and ladies! Book your Mother’s Day buffet brunch before 3 May 2025 to enjoy an early bird promotion of 20% off ! Mother’s Day brunch: 11 May 2025, 12pm – 3:30pm How much: $118 per adult; $28 per child @Stevens, Novotel Singapore On Stevens, 28 Stevens Road, Orchard District, Singapore 257878, www.novotel-singapore-stevens.com 15 Stamford: Mother’s Day brunch with flower arrangement workshop Image credit: The Capitol Kempinski Hotel Singapore This Mother’s Day, treat Mum to the VIP experience she deserves at The Capitol Kempinski Hotel Singapore. Indulge in a lavish Mother’s Day brunch at the hotel’s signature restaurant, 15 Stamford, featuring an exquisite spread including freshly shucked oysters, a foie gras station, the crowd-favourite White Pepper Crab, Herbal Duck, and even a live Hokkien Mee station! To make this Mother’s Day brunch extra special, Mum gets to join a complimentary DIY flower arrangement workshop and a cooking workshop! There’s also a lucky draw where she stands a chance to win attractive prizes. Over at the newly opened Capitol Bistro. Bar. Patisserie, don’t miss the “Garden of Love” Mother’s Day Sharing Platter, complete with a mix of appetisers and decadent desserts. For a more elegant afternoon, Mum can unwind with a Mother’s Day Afternoon Tea at the Lobby Lounge or enjoy a sweet surprise from The Boutique at 15 Stamford. Mother’s Day brunch: 11 May 2025 How much: from $158++ per person or $888 for two people (comes with a bottle of Dom Perignon champagne) 15 Stamford, The Capitol Kempinski Hotel Singapore, 15 Stamford Road, Singapore 178906, www.kempinski.com Alley on 25: Mother’s Day lazy breakfast Image credit: Alley on 25 This Mother’s Day weekend, pamper Mum with a delicious brunch at Andaz Singapore’s Alley on 25. The ever-popular Lazy Breakfast is getting a special Mother’s Day edition, featuring a delectable spread of Continental, Asian, and Western delights, plus mouthwatering breakfast mains. Start with a choice of cage-free egg dishes, including options like the Sarawak Black Pepper Crab Eggs Benedict, the Singaporean Breakfast, the Fisherman’s Breakfast, and the crowd-favourite Shakshuka. The Mother’s Day buffet also comes with seafood-on-ice, smoked seafood, a charcuterie selection and more. The star of the show, the 18-month aged Prosciutto di Parma DOP, is a must-try treat that shouldn’t be missed. Be sure to try the small plates too, which include the Thai Pomelo Salad, Alley’s Tuna Poke Bowl, and Caesar Salad. Book your Mother’s Day buffet before 4 May 2025 to get 20% off . All mums will receive a complimentary Botanical Bliss mocktail. Mother’s Day dining buffet: 10 & 11 May 2025 How much: $68++ per adult; $34++ per child (6 – 12 years old) Alley on 25, Andaz Singapore, 5 Fraser Street, Singapore 189354, www.hyatt.com Allora: Mums dine free at this Mother’s Day buffet Image credit: Crowne Plaza Changi Airport Treat mum to a lavish Mother’s Day brunch at Allora at Crowne Plaza Changi Airport to show your love and appreciation for all she has done. Look forward to an exquisite selection of fresh seafood, succulent roasts, handcrafted pasta and decadent desserts, indulgent treats that will make Mum feel extra special and cherished this Mother’s Day. Begin with ocean-fresh prawns, mud crab, scallops and oysters, and don’t miss fresh salmon and tuna sashimi and green tea soba noodles. For hearty mains, savour Braised Lamb Ossobuco with Roasted Root Vegetables, Slow-Cooked Whole Chicken with Rosemary Jus and their Signature Pork Ribs Glazed in Balsamic BBQ sauce. Get your fill of carbs at the Cheese Wheel Pasta Station and a protein fix at their carving stations with gourmet condiments and house-made sauces. End your Mother’s Day celebration on a sweet note with tiramisu, cheesecake, citrus meringue tart and more. Mum dines for FREE with every two paying adults. Enjoy 1-for-1 on selected house pours and cocktails during Happy Hour from 12pm – 7pm. Mother’s Day dining buffet: 11 May 2025, 12pm – 3pm How much: $98++ per adult & $49++ per child. Mum dines for free with a minimum of two paying adults. Kids 6 and under dine for free! Book a table here. Allora, Crowne Plaza Changi Airport, 75 Airport Boulevard, #01-01, Changi Airport Terminal 3, Singapore 819664, www.changiairport.crowneplaza.com Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel Singapore: Mother’s Day brunch with special gift Image credit: Food Capital, Grand Copthorne Waterfront Treat Mum to a buffet brunch this Mother’s Day at Food Capital, located in the Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel Singapore! Their specially curated Mother’s Day brunch buffet features an expansive array of international delights, including a Seafood Island with freshly shucked oysters, Gratinated Boston Lobster with Honey Mango Salsa, and succulent snow crab legs. Asian cuisine lovers are in for a treat too, with signature dishes like Singapore Chilli Crab paired with Pomelo and a Crispy Szechuan Bun, wok-fried Mini Lobster in Black Pepper Sauce, and more. To wrap up your feast on a sweet note, head to the Japanese Soufflé Pancake live station, where fluffy pancakes are served with Mixed Berries Compote and Sarawak Pineapple Compote. As a special touch this Mother’s Day, all mums will receive a beautifully curated floral diffuser to mark the occasion! Mother’s Day dining buffet: 11 May 2025, 12pm – 3pm How much: from $132++ per adult with free flow Mocktails, Soft Drinks and Juices; $162++ per adult with free flow Prosecco, House Pour M-Wines, Soft Drinks and Juices; $66++ per child (6 – 12 years old). Children under 5 dine for free. Food Capital, Grand Copthorne Waterfront, 392 Havelock Road, Singapore 169663, www.grandcopthorne.com.sg Lawry’s The Prime Rib Singapore: Mother’s Day set menu Image credit: Lawry’s The Prime Rib Singapore We’re big fans of steak here at Sassy Mama, and Lawry’s The Prime Rib Singapore is easily one of our top picks when it comes to the best steakhouses in Singapore . This Mother’s Day, treat Mum to a special celebration with Lawry’s The Prime Rib Singapore specially curated set menu! Indulge in their Signature Prime Rib of Beef – aged for up to 28 days for maximum tenderness and slow-roasted on beds of rock salt to lock in all that juicy, flavourful goodness. It’s carved and served tableside from their iconic Silver Cart, and paired with their famous Spinning Bowl Salad for the full Lawry’s experience. The best part? The elegant interiors make it a picture-perfect spot for Mother’s Day, with floor-to-ceiling windows that offer stunning views of Orchard Road. Enjoy 10% off Mother’s Day Set Menu when you confirm your reservation by 5 May 2025! American Express premium cardholders can enjoy 15% off the Mother’s Day set menus when they confirm their reservation by 7 May 2025. Additionally, spend a minimum of $500++ and receive a complimentary bottle of Chateau La Coste ‘Lady A’ Rose ! Mother’s Day dining: 9 – 11 May 2025 How much: $179++ per person Lawry’s The Prime Rib Singapore, 333A Orchard Rd, #04 – 01 / 31, Singapore 238897, www.lawrys.com.sg Publico Ristorante & Garden: Mother’s Day brunch with balloon sculpting and face painting Image credit: Publico Ristorante & Garden Treat Mum to an indulgent Italian brunch buffet at Publico Ristorante & Garden! Kick things off with family-style starters like Pugliese burrata bruschetta and a beautifully curated charcuterie board served right to your table. After, dive into buffet favourites like the seafood on ice bar with fresh oysters and tuna tartare topped with ikura. Don’t miss the live stations featuring handmade pasta, wood-fired pizzas, a carvery of smoked ham, and more. Some of our favourites include the braised beef short ribs and truffle chicken skillet is absolute must-tries. And of course, no Italian feast is complete without a sweet ending! Save room for the mini tiramisu, lemon meringue tarts, and a spread of decadent desserts. If you have little ones in tow, there will be balloon sculpting and face-painting activities to keep them entertained! Mother’s Day dining: 11 May 2025, from 12.30pm How much: $118++ per adult and $68++ per child (6 – 12 years old); free-flow Astoria Prosecco Rosé at $68++ per guest for two hours Publico Ristorante & Garden , 1 Nanson Road Singapore 238909, www.publico.sg Wolfgang’s Steakhouse by Wolfgang Zwiener: Mother’s Day set menu with gift set Image credit: Wolfgang’s Steakhouse Singapore Can’t decide whether to treat Mum to a scrumptious buffet or a thoughtful gift this Mother’s Day ? At Wolfgang’s Steakhouse, you can do both! Their special Mother’s Day menu is a dinner feast fit for a queen, kicking off with Wolfgang’s Steakhouse’s Chef’s Special soup, featuring a pulled chicken leg and maitake mushroom in a deep, 12-hour slow-cooked chicken broth. For the main course, choose between the luxurious 100% USDA Prime Black Angus Filet Mignon or the delectable Chilean Seabass. Finish off the perfect Mother’s Day dinner with Wolfgang’s Steakhouse’s timeless Tiramisu. Elevate the Mother’s Day dinner celebration with the Cabana Crush, a refreshing cocktail made with Tequila, Watermelon, Granita, and Agave. We love that every table gets a complimentary Polaroid photo, but the real cherry on top is the exclusive L’Occitane En Provence Mother’s Day gift set for each Mum, featuring a Cherry Blossom Perfumed Soap and Verbena Body Lotion (while stocks last!). Mother’s Day dining: 7 – 14 May 2025 How much: $148 per person Wolfgang’s Steakhouse Singapore, InterContinental Singapore Robertson Quay, 1 Nanson Road, Robertson Quay, #02-01, Singapore 238909, www.wolfgangssteakhouse.sg Read more: Best Steakhouses In Singapore For Wagyu Beef, Grilled Steaks, Affordable Steaks & More Keep scrolling for more ideas to have a fab Mother’s Day 2025 celebration! articles.title: 14 Affordable Jewellery Brands In Singapore: Stylish Costume Jewellery
articles.author: Sassy Mama
articles.content: Whether you’re into minimal jewellery, unique designs or looking for something personalised or handmade, there’s something for everyone in our list of affordable costume jewellery brands in Singapore! Everything that glimmers may not be gold, but we have to admit we’re partial to a bit of sparkle when it comes to beautiful jewellery! There’s no shortage of brands offering stunning (yet affordable) jewellery in Singapore, from those offering minimal designs to one-of-a-kind styles and customisable options. These jewellery brands in Singapore also make great Valentine’s Day gifts , Mother’s Day gifts and Christmas gifts for her that are easy on the wallet! Scroll through our list of physical and online jewellery stores in Singapore! Costume Jewellery & Affordable Jewellery Brands In Singapore: White Finches: Affordable handcrafted jewellery White Finches focuses on sustainable handcrafted jewellery. Instead of using plastic or epoxy resins, they use mainly natural stones and freshwater pearls that do not pose a significant environmental risk, keeping in line with their commitment to sustainability! You’ll love their stuff if you’re into simpler styles, clean lines and architectural shapes. The earth tones of the natural stones and the pearls’ lustre give off an understated polished look that’s perfect for everyday wear. White Finches, whitefinches.com By Invite Only: Stylish jewellery in Singapore By Invite Only is known for stylish, hypoallergenic jewellery pieces – the homegrown brand has been around for over a decade! Their handmade pieces are all made ethically and at great price points. They’ve now also expanded to offer fine jewellery under their Gldsmth range, with many of the pieces being made of recycled solid gold. By Invite Only, multiple locations, www.byinviteonly.shop Hanna Lee: Affordable costume jewellery Hanna Lee has a huge range of sparkly everyday jewellery pieces – you’ll be so spoiled for choice scrolling through their online store or visiting them in Tanglin Mall ! If you’re big on wearing pieces that offer protection, Hanna Lee’s ‘evil eye’ collection offers many colourful rings, stackable bracelets and more with the iconic eye design. Hanna Lee, 163 Tanglin Road #02-01, Singapore 247933, shophannalee.com EDEN + ELIE: Handcrafted jewellery in Singapore EDEN + ELIE is a socially conscious handcrafted jewellery brand that creates heritage-inspired modern pieces. Our top picks have to be those featuring the traditional bead-weaving technique, seen on everything from pendants to bangles and even charm bracelets! Most, if not all, of their pieces are 24k plated gold. EDEN + ELIE, multiple locations, edenandelie.com Del Rio Jewels: Handmade jewellery This Singapore-based mama-owned brand offers stunning affordable jewellery pieces handmade in Turkey. We love that there’s the option to customise their costume jewellery pieces too (the Tuyo range is made up of initial necklaces, rings and bracelets in solid and Swarovski diamond varieties) and you can even create something really special by customising something under their fine jewellery line – a collection of 14k solid gold pieces starting from just $150! Del Rio Jewels, www.delriojewels.com Envet: Bohemian jewellery Singapore Created for playful, carefree spirits, we love Envet for their summer-ready bohemian chic styles. All their designs sport lots of beads, irregular pearls and colourful ‘evil eye’ drop pendants. Good luck choosing just one piece because you’ll fall in love with everything! Envet, www.envet.co Lustre Jewellery: Gemstone jewellery Lustre has a loyal cult following in Singapore thanks to its unique designs featuring precious gemstones like labradorite, citrine, topaz, moonstone and quartz. You can find everything from simple single-stone rings to elaborate stud earrings, all set in 24k gold plate over silver or nickel-free brass. Lustre Jewellery, www.shoplustre.com Monica Vinader: Luxurious costume jewellery Monica Vinader is known for its costume jewellery with a luxurious touch all over the world with its trendy designs. With two physical shops in Singapore, it’s easy to swing by for a last-minute gift, or just order online where you can shop from the comfort of home! Monica Vinader, locations in ION and Takashimaya, www.monicavinader.com The Ordinary Co: Minimalist costume jewellery If you’re on the hunt for minimal yet durable costume jewellery, The Ordinary Co has many gold vermeil pieces that are known to stand the test of everyday wear. Everything on their site is reasonably priced too, with nothing over $59.90. The Ordinary Co, www.theordinary.co Pandora: Edgy jewellery brand Pandora needs no introduction! Best known for their snake chain charm bracelets, you won’t be able to resist collecting the hundreds of beautiful charms they offer in silver, rose gold and gold. They’ve also got a fab range of rings, necklaces and earrings – many in matching sets that are great for gifting. Pandora, multiple locations, sg.pandora.net Pyar Jewellery: Singapore jewellery brand Locally designed and handmade by artisans in an ethical jewellery factory in Bali, Pyar jewellery is largely inspired by travel (oh those shell amulets… *heart eyes*). Working exclusively with certified recycled silver and brass, the materials are sustainably sourced from an ethical maker and supplier located in the north of Bali. Pyar Jewellery, multiple locations, pyarislove.com SOAMI: Personalised jewellery Personalised jewellery is definitely having a moment right now, and SOAMI is at its forefront! If you’re into edgy yet understated jewellery with meaning, SOAMI’s range of customisable cuffs, signet rings and simple pendants are perfect for everyday wear (we’ve tried and tested their CECE classic cuff and it really does withstand the elements!). All you have to do is decide what you’d like engraved! SOAMI, multiple locations, www.soami.co Swarovski: Fashion jewellery in Singapore You can always trust Swarovski to bring on the bling – scroll through their website and you’ll find lots of stunning designs (don’t miss the sale section for amazing markdowns), either for yourself, or for gifting on a special occasion! Swarovski, multiple locations, www.swarovski.com/en-SG Tessalate.co: Affordable costume jewellery Known for their quality gemstones, Tessalate.co’s range of costume jewellery gives off an air of luxury that’s easy on the pocket. You can also browse their fine jewellery section, featuring natural diamonds in varying price points depending on your budget. Tessalate.co, Wheelock Place #02-14, Singapore 238880, shoptessellate.co Looking for a gift? articles.title: Where To Find The Best Chocolates In Singapore For Gifting
articles.author: Sassy Mama
articles.content: Looking for a special gift? Say it with chocolates! From bean-to-bar creations to chocolate truffle gift boxes, here are some of the best chocolates in Singapore for gifting. Looking to gift or indulge in the best chocolate in Singapore? If you ask us, every day of the year is the right time for chocolate. But all chocolates are not created equal. Supermarket chocolate brands might be ok to satiate a late-night craving, but when it comes to Valentine’s Day , Mother’s Day , and Christmas , it’s worth stepping up your game for one of the following artisanal chocolate brands ( partners take note! ). From limited-edition bonbons to chocolate truffles and much more, here’s the best of the best when it comes to high-end chocolates! And best of all, most of these gourmet chocolate brands can deliver chocolates right to your doorstep–so no excuses! Read more: Flower Delivery Services & Florists In Singapore Our Fave Chocolate Brands For Gifting: Lemuel Chocolate: Bean-to-bar chocolate Image credit: Lemuel Chocolate Lemuel Chocolate is a bean-to-bar chocolate house that sources and imports quality cacao beans from cacao farmers and reputable cacao agents around the world. They then manually and carefully sort, roast, crack, winnow and grind them into the individual, uniquely delicious chocolate. From single-origin chocolate bars to special chocolate gift boxes and bonbons, you’ll be spoilt for choice. Lemuel Chocolate , 1 Vista Exchange Green The Star Vista, #01-04/05, Singapore 138617 , www.lemuelchocolate.com Mr Bucket Chocolaterie: House-made chocolate bars Image credit: Mr Bucket Chocolaterie Specialising in house-made artisanal chocolate bars and treats, Mr Bucket Chocolaterie uses cacao sourced only within Asia. Inspired by Roald Dahl’s novel Charlie and the Chocolate Factory, this chocolate shop in Singapore conveys its own interpretation of the story through its artisanal chocolate dragees. At their chocolate ‘factory’ and cafe in Dempsey, you can customise your own slab of chocolate. Mr Bucket Chocolaterie, 23 Sin Ming Road, #01-15, Singapore 570023, www.mrbucket.com.sg Anjalichocolat: Handmade chocolate bonbons and truffles Image credit: Anjalichocolat This artisanal chocolatier has everything from fruity chocolate bars and chocolate lollipops to tasting squares and handmade bonbons, and truffles. Everything’s made with Belgian couverture and no preservatives. We love Anjali’s beautiful packaging and how they seem to have a new chocolate collection for each and every season and occasion. Plus, you can discover the experience of making chocolates yourself! Anjalichocolat, 163 Tanglin Road, #02-153 Tanglin Mall, Singapore 247933, www.anjalichocolat.com Chocolate Anatomy: Specialises in truffles Image credit: Chocolate Anatomy What kicked off this luxury chocolate project was a simple, tailored recipe of chocolate truffles that surprised friends, family and even the baker herself.​ Now, Chocolate Anatomy has moved on to developing exciting new chocolate truffle flavours. A very personal and customised experience is offered here, where customers can participate in the chocolate creation process and tailor the chocolate to suit their palates. Chocolate Anatomy , 183 Jalan Pelikat, The Promenade@Pelikat, Singapore 537643, www.chocolate-anatomy.com Awfully Chocolate: Premium chocolate cakes Image credit: Awfully Chocolate A homegrown brand that’s expanded to 12 locations across the island, Awfully Chocolate is all about premium chocolate. We are quite partial to their legendary chocolate cake, but if you’re after gift-worthy chocolates, we suggest opting for one of their gorgeous chocolate gift sets or artisanal chocolate truffles. Awfully Chocolate , multiple locations in Singapore including East Coast, Orchard and Jurong East, www.awfullychocolate.com Chocolate Origin: Halal chocolate bonbons & cakes Image credit: Chocolate Origin With 12 locations sprinkled all over the island, it won’t be hard to get your fix of chocolate cake or truffles from Chocolate Origin! The chocolate truffles are highly recommended for their rich and intense chocolatey flavour. Chocolate Origin is Halal-certified, making them one of the only halal chocolate makers in Singapore. Chocolate Origin , multiple locations in Singapore including Punggol, Bishan and Yishun, www.chocolate-origin.com The Dark Gallery: Boutique dark chocolate shop Image credit: The Dark Gallery The Dark Gallery is a boutique dark chocolate café that serves up a range of handmade, artisanal, single-origin chocolates, all made right on site in their kitchen! Dark chocolate is the best kind of chocolate , by the way. It’s rich in antioxidant flavonoids and is thought to help prevent heart disease! We are downright drooling over their artisanal bonbons and their gorgeous bean-to-bar craft dark chocolates! The Dark Gallery , three locations in Singapore including Orchard, Raffles Boulevard and City Hall, www.thedarkgallery.com Godiva: Luxurious Belgian chocolate & truffles Image credit: Godiva So it’s not exactly a homegrown brand, but these luxurious Belgian chocolates have long been synonymous with exquisite confectionery gifting. They always have great gifting options for true chocoholics! Don’t skimp on their ultra-indulgent ice cream cones when you visit. From chocolate truffles to chocolate bars, Godiva has something to satisfy every chocolate craving. Godiva , multiple locations in Singapore including Orchard, Raffles City and Jewel, www.godiva.com.sg Janice Wong: Chocolate bon bons and cakes Image credit: Janice Wong These just might be the most Instagrammable chocolates in Singapore (and that’s really saying something). As the doyenne of all that is sweet in Singapore (and beyond – she’s going global!), Janice Wong has been named Asia’s best pastry chef and has gained worldwide recognition for her avant-garde, cutting-edge creations. Is it odd that we’d almost want to frame their beautiful chocolates? Janice Wong , three locations in Singapore including Raffles Place, Orchard and Marina Gardens, www.janicewong.online Fossa Chocolate: Drinking chocolate & fruity chocolate bars Image credit: Fossa Chocolate Fossa Chocolate is a local, artisanal bean-to-bar luxury chocolate maker that roasts, cracks, and winnows cacao beans and refines them into chocolates right in their very own workshop. Each small batch of chocolate is lovingly handcrafted and totally free of additives. If you’re after something really special, they do chocolate customisations too. Fossa Chocolate , multiple locations in Singapore including East Coast, Ang Mo Kio and Buona Vista, www.fossachocolate.com Läderach: Swiss chocolate pralines & truffles Image credit: Laderach Läderach is most famous for their delicious large slabs of FrischSchoggi (Fresh Chocolate), handcrafted without additives or preservatives by their artisans in Switzerland. You can get them as a bundle of curated flavours in one packet, or check out their pralines, truffles or beautiful gift boxes. Läderach, multiple locations in Singapore including Orchard, Jurong East and Marina Bay, www.sg.laderach.com Laurent Bernard Chocolatier: Gourmet chocolate bars Image credit: Laurent Bernard Chocolatier via Facebook Laurent Bernard is a French artisan chocolatier who opened his first café in Singapore in 2006 after 20 years of culinary experience. Laurent’s Café (located along the river in the charming Robertson Quay) quickly became famous for its chocolate soufflé and hot chocolate, and now his menu boasts everything from gourmet treats like macarons and chocolate truffles to mouthwatering cakes for any occasion. Laurent Bernard Chocolatier, The Pier at Robertson Quay, Mohammad Sultan Road, #01-11, Singapore 239013, www.laurentbernard.com.sg See’s Candies: Popular chocolatier since 1921 Image credit: See’s Candies See’s Candies began when Mary See wanted to share her homemade candy recipes with the world. Today, some of her original recipes – Peanut Brittle, Victoria Toffee, and Chocolate Walnut Fudge – are still well-loved. To add a personal touch, you can customise a box of chocolates and candies for someone special or pick up a pre-packed box if you’re in a pinch! See’s Candies ,The Forum Shopping Mall, 583 Orchard Road, #01-K2, Singapore 238884, www.sees.com Hello Chocolate: Bean-to-bar chocolate Image credit: Hello Chocolate Hello Chocolate is a multi-label online artisanal chocolate shop offering a wide range of chocolates from all over the world. They even have vegan, sugar-free and halal-friendly chocolate! Do note that these chocolates ship from Canada, so order in advance to avoid delay. Hello Chocolate , www.hellochocolate.asia ROYCE’: Quality chocolate from Sapporo Image credit: ROYCE’ ROYCE’ was founded in Sapporo in 1983 and now makes chocolate of world-class quality in Hokkaido. They’ve got everything from cookies to chocolate truffles to pure chocolate and even chocolate-covered chips (don’t knock it till you try it! Seriously, they’re so good). ROYCE’ , multiple locations in Singapore including Serangoon, Tampines and Jurong East, www.royce.com.sg VENCHI 1878: Italian chocolate bars & spreads Image credit: VENCHI 1878 VENCHI began in 1878 when a young man spent his savings to buy two cauldrons and started creating chocolate. Today, you can enjoy the fruit of his labour through unique chocolate creations including a chocoviar bar, indulgent chocolate spreads and more. VENCHI 1878, five locations in Singapore including Bayfront, Orchard and Marina Bay, www.sg.venchi.com Affordable chocolates in Singapore If you’re looking for a more affordable chocolate option, then check out Candy Empire , Choco Express and The Cocoa Trees to get a box of chocolates or sweet treats for your loved ones. With a wide range of chocolate brands and candies like Baileys Truffle Selection or Lindt Swiss Luxury Chocolate, you can be sure to find something for everyone here. articles.title: NDP Fireworks 2025: Best Spots To Watch National Day Fireworks In Singapore For FREE!
articles.author: Sassy Mama
articles.content: SG60 celebrations are in full force! Here are the best places to watch the National Day 2025 fireworks in Singapore, promising stellar views as you celebrate the nation’s birthday. It’s that time of the year again! National Day 2025 is a big one this year, with SG60 celebrations already underway. And, of course, spectacular fireworks displays will light up Singapore’s sky as we celebrate the nation’s birthday and catch the fab NDP rehearsal fireworks. Check out the best spots to catch the show—including some great FREE places to watch fireworks in Singapore! Read more: NDP 2025 Events: National Day Parade, Heartland Celebrations & More Jump to: – FREE fireworks viewing spots for NDP 2025 – Restaurants & hotels with views of the NDP 2025 fireworks in Singapore – Where to watch NDP 2025 fireworks in Singapore heartlands Where to watch NDP 2025 fireworks in Singapore for free! Pack a picnic, wear comfy clothes and head to these vantage points in Singapore – you just might be lucky and catch a FREE view of the NDP 2025 fireworks! Read more: Best Rooftop Dining Restaurants 1. The Helix: Free fireworks viewing spot Image credit: Cox Architecture A popular pedestrian bridge that connects Marina Centre to Marina South, the Helix (a.k.a the Helix Bridge or Double Helix) is one of the best vantage spots to watch the National Day Parade 2025 fireworks in Singapore for free! This Insta-worthy bridge is beautifully lit up in the evenings, too, so it’s always worth a trip just for the ‘gram. Where: Marina Bay, bridge linking Marina Bay and Marina Centre, Singapore 038981 Access via: Bayfront or Promenade MRT stations 2. Marina Reservoir: Marina Bay fireworks Image credit: Unsplash This reservoir is one of the most popular locations for brilliant views of the 2025 NDP fireworks display across the Bay. We highly suggest coming early to snag a good spot in advance. There’ll be plenty to do while you wait for the NDP fireworks; pack snacks and kites and you’ll have a ball with the kids on the lovely windy green. Then, settle down to watch the NDP 2025 fireworks in Singapore light up the sky over the Singapore Flyer, Gardens by the Bay and Marina Bay Sands. Where: 8 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018951 Access via: Marina Bay MRT station, then SBS bus number 400 from Marina Bay Financial Centre. Car Parking at Gardens By the Bay. Read more: NDP 2025 Events: National Day Parade, Celebrations & More 3. Gardens by the Bay: NDP fireworks with Supertrees Image credit: Flickr Head to the waterfront promenade at Bay East Garden – it connects to East Coast Park via the Barrage and there are loads of great spots for stunning views of fireworks in Singapore along its 2km stretch. Best of all, the garden is open 24 hours and admission is free, so you can sit back and watch the 2025 National Day Parade fireworks spectacle with the fam. Where: 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953 Access via: Bayfront MRT Station and follow the underground linkway. Expect crowds in the MRT (grab a rentable cycle to avoid the masses). Car Parking at Gardens By the Bay. 4. Mount Faber Peak: NDP fireworks vantage point Image credit: Flickr Home to the Singapore cable car attraction, Mount Faber Peak is popular with families looking for a gorgeous hike or walk among the greenery . Want to eat dinner while watching the NDP 2025 fireworks in Singapore? Head to Arbora @ Mount Faber Peak for a mix of Western classics and kid-friendly options with stupendous views of the Singapore skyline. Where: 109 Mount Faber Road, Singapore 099203 Access via: Harbourfront MRT and then take a 12-15 minute walk up 5. Marina Bay Sands Promontory, Merlion Park: CBD fireworks Image credit: Pexels Accessed by a short walk across the Jubilee Bridge, Merlion Park is where you’ll find all the best fireworks action. The crowds flock here each year, so come early to get a prime spot to watch the 2025 National Day Parade fireworks in Singapore. Where: One Fullerton, near the Central Business District Access via: MRT from Raffles Place Park at One Fullerton Read more: NDP 2025 Events: National Day Parade, Celebrations & More 6. Waterfront Promenade, Esplanade: View of Marina Bay fireworks Image credit: Flickr A free view of the NDP 2025 fireworks in Singapore and must-see views of Singapore’s skyline? This breezy spot is where it’s all at. There are restaurants all around the area, so come early for a bite with the kiddies before parking yourself on the steps for prime views of the fireworks display. Where: 1 Esplanade Drive, Singapore 038981 Access via : City Hall or Esplanade MRT stations 7. The Lawn @ Marina Bay: Watch NDP fireworks in Singapore Image credit: @travel_with_betti via Instagram If there’s a number one stop to watch the 2025 National Day Parade fireworks in Singapore then this is it. The Lawn @ Marina Bay may just be a patch of grass in the heart of the CBD, but it’s laid-back and has good views of the fireworks. Where: 11 Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018940 Access via : Downtown MRT Station 8. Victoria Theatre: Beautiful fireworks viewing spot in Singapore Image credit: VisitSingapore Victoria Theatre and Victoria Concert Hall is a beautiful venue in itself. Although it offers a partially blocked view of the 2025 NDP fireworks, this venue is bound to see large crowds gather every year. Be sure to get there early to secure a good spot! Where: 11 Empress Pl, #01-02, Singapore 179558 Access via: 3-minute walk from City Hall MRT and Raffles Place MRT 9. High Street Centre Carpark: Less crowded fireworks spot Image credit: @lorenz_huang via Instagram You might think it’s strange to head to a carpark for National Day fireworks, but if you want to avoid the usually crowded places, then this is the place to go! The 5th floor of the carpark overlooks the Singapore River with a gorgeous view of the city skyline and the Marina Bay area, which is where you’ll see the 2025 NDP fireworks! Where: 1 North Bridge Road, Singapore 179094 Access via: 6-minute walk from Clarke Quay and City Hall MRT stations 10. Marina Barrage: Free fireworks viewing spot Image credit: Ken Goh via Flickr You won’t get a full view of the fireworks here, but we love the green space on the rooftop of Marina Barrage that overlooks the city skyline. You can see the Singapore Flyer, Marina Bay Sands, and a glimpse of the Esplanade, plus get a peek of the National Day Parade fireworks. Pack a picnic and get comfy under the starry night! Where: 8 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018951 Access via: Gardens by the Bay MRT station, Exit 2 11. Marina South Pier: Quiet fireworks viewing spot Image credit: Paul Ang via Flickr Located along Marina Coastal Drive, Marina South Pier is tucked further away from the prime location for the 2025 NDP fireworks, but you’ll probably still be able to see the fireworks. If you have younger kids who might be afraid of very loud noises, then this might be a great place to catch the National Day fireworks without busting your eardrums! Where: 31 Marina Coastal Drive, Singapore 018988 Access via: Marina South Pier MRT, Exit B 12. Marina Square Rooftop: View of Marina Bay fireworks Image credit: DPGreen Okay, you might not get the best views from this spot. But since it overlooks part of the Singapore cityscape, including Marina Bay Sands, you should be able to catch a glimpse of the National Day Parade fireworks. Since it’s located on the rooftop of a popular mall downtown, it might get crowded. So, be sure to get there early to save the best spot to see the NDP fireworks! Where: Rooftop of Marina Square, 6 Raffles Blvd, Singapore 039594 Access via: top floor of the Marina Square Mall, 4-min walk from Esplanade MRT station via Exit C 13. Singapore Flyer: Prime fireworks viewing spot Image credit: Singapore Flyer via Facebook Catching the NDP 2025 fireworks in Singapore from the Singapore Flyer will give you the best bird’s eye view, and because it’s the hottest seat in the nation, the tickets get sold out quickly! It’s a bit of a cheat entry into the best ‘free’ spots to watch the 2025 NDP fireworks since you still have to buy a ticket to the flyer. Where: 30 Raffles Avenue, Singapore 039803 Access via : Promenade MRT Station National Day Parade 2025 fireworks in Singapore’s heartlands Image credit: Ministry of Defence, Singapore (MINDEF) via Facebook National Day SG60 celebrations will take place across the island, includingthe heartlands, so you’re guaranteed to be able to view the stunning 2025 National Day fireworks near you. Details have yet to be released, so stay tuned! Read more: NDP 2025 Events: National Day Parade, Celebrations & More Restaurants & hotels with views of 2025 National Day fireworks in Singapore Image credit: CÉ LA VI Singapore via Facebook Want birds-eye views of the NDP fireworks in Singapore? Then why not book a weekend staycation – some hotels have National Day 2025 staycation packages – or watch the fireworks over a nice dinner at one of the island’s best rooftop restaurants ? Here are some restaurants and hotels with the best views of the National Day fireworks in Singapore (but you should always call to check if your table/room will have a view of the fireworks to avoid disappointment): – Pullman Singapore Hill Street – JW Marriott Singapore South Beach – CE LA VI, Marina Bay Sands – LAVO, Marina Bay Sands – Highhouse – LeVeL 33, Marina Bay Financial Centre – VUE – ART Restaurant – Marina Bay Sands Singapore – PARKROYAL Collection Marina Bay – The Fullerton Bay Hotel – The Ritz-Carlton, Millenia Singapore – Fairmont Singapore – Pan Pacific Singapore – Mandarin Oriental, Singapore – Singapore Flyer – Peninsula Excelsior Hotel – Swissotel The Stamford Sassy Mama Tip: One thing to consider if you are checking out all the best locations for National Day Parade 2025 fireworks in Singapore is not just the view of the fireworks, it’s how (and when) you are going to get back home, especially if you are up late with kiddos, as these spots get very busy and catching a taxi may be difficult! Find other cool things to do with the fam on long weekends below! The post NDP Fireworks 2025: Best Spots To Watch National Day Fireworks In Singapore For FREE! appeared first on Sassy Mama .
