Enjoy 15% off for their Super Early Bird Promotion when you order a Mother’s Day cake from 10 April 2025. While stocks last. Terms and conditions apply. Emicakes, multiple locations in Singapore including Orchard, Tampines and Bukit Batok, www.emicakes.com.sg Read more: Restaurants to Book for a Mother’s Day Meal Artisanal Apparel & Home Decor: Practical Mother’s Day gift idea Image credit: Artful House If Mum is a fashionista, check out Artful House , an online lifestyle retailer that offers gorgeous artisanal apparel and meticulously handcrafted home décor. They produce items in small batches, promising unique and limited-edition pieces. For Mother’s Day 2025, enter code SASSY12 at checkout when you purchase any full-price item online between 10 April and 31 May 2025 to get 12% off your order. Artful House, 315 Outram Road, #08-04 Tan Boon Liat Building, Singapore 169074, www.artful-house.com Jewellery with Diamonds: Gorgeous Mother’s Day Gift idea Image credit: Carat Heritage Keen to get Mum an extravagant Mother’s Day gift? These gemstones have the same hardness, brilliance and durability as natural diamonds, promising to bring a smile to Mum’s face for a lifetime. Carat Heritage uses diamonds graded VS1 clarity and F colour and above that are handpicked by their experts, ensuring they meet their rigorous standards. Whether you want to surprise Mum with earrings, rings, necklaces or bracelets, there’s something to suit every woman’s taste. Since lab-grown diamonds are much less expensive than mined diamonds, Mum can confidently wear her diamonds every day. Quote SASSY15 or click here to get 15% off all items. Valid until 11 May 2025. Weekend Getaway: A relaxing Mother’s Day celebration in Singapore Image credit: Banyan Tree Bintan For Mother’s Day 2025, surprise mum with a short trip across the border or take a ferry to Bintan , Batam or Desaru for an easy trip out of SG with gorgeous waters and palm trees for the weekend! Or, consider a weekend trip to Johor Bahru , Kuala Lumpur or the up-and-coming Labuan Bajo . If you’re looking to splash out and surprise her with destinations further afield, we’ve got travel guides and recommendations for Europe , Japan & South Korea , Thailand , Australia and more . Personalised Subscription Boxes: Practical Mother’s Day Gift idea Image credit: Hook Coffee via Facebook Want a gift for Mother’s Day 2025 that keeps on giving? Opt for subscription boxes! Each month, Mum will receive a delightful surprise tailored to her preferences and needs. From gourmet snacks to beauty products, books, gardening supplies, and more, the options are endless. Some subscription boxes that we think she will love include this flower subscription by Winderflower , a fruit subscription box by Yayapapaya , and a coffee subscription box by Hook Coffee for coffee lovers! Spa Treatment: Stress-relieving gift for Mother’s Day 2025 Image credit: Spa Central Treat mama to some pampering at one of our fave spas . This thoughtful gift idea for Mother’s Day in Singapore is sure to bring a smile to Mum’s face and give her a much-needed break that she deserves. You can also check out our roundup of fave facials in Singapore and best onsen s! At-Home Mobile Beauty Service: Pampering gift idea for Mother’s Day Image credit: Freepik – for illustrative purposes only. You can even surprise mama at home with a mobile beauty service for Mother’s Day 2025! Think mani-pedis, massages and even hairstyling services without even having to leave the house. Check out our guide for a full list of mobile beauty services that come to you. Solo Staycation: Much-needed Mother’s Day Gift idea Image credit: Sofitel Singapore Sentosa Resort & Spa Book a luxurious staycation as gift for Mother’s Day in Singapore, so Mum can catch up on her latest read, enjoy uninterrupted meals and recharge from the busyness of daily life with kids. Check out our list of Kid-friendly Staycation Hotels and Deals before you book. Gift Card: Sponsored shopping spree for Mother’s Day 2025 Image credit: Sephora Singapore via Instagram Mum likely spends most of her money on the kids, so why not purchase a gift card for her favourite store? Some of our favourite brands to shop from are Sephora for make-up, Lululemon for activewear, Love, Bonito for clothing, and Aurate for jewellery. This personalised Mother’s Day gift idea would pair perfectly with an afternoon off so Mum can enjoy shopping in peace this Mother’s Day 2025! Read more: Where To Get Affordable Jewellery In Singapore That’s Stylish Kobo or Kindle: Practical Mother’s Day gift idea Image credit: Pixabay Does mum like to read or would she like to if she could only find the books she wanted easily? Why not gift her an e-reader as a gift for Mother’s Day 2025? The two big brands are Amazon’s Kindle and Rakuten’s Kobo tablet . Kobo provides the larger range as compared to Kindle, and we do love how you can link up your Kobo to the OverDrive app that lets you borrow and download eBooks/audiobooks from the Singapore library. Family Photography Session: Mother’s Day 2025 family photoshoot Image credit: Katie Martin-Sperry Photography Mums are often the ones taking the pics so why not gift mum a family photo session by a professional! Whether it’s a maternity shoot or family shoot, she’ll love to be able to look back on photos of that sweet mama-child bond. Scroll through our Guide to Family Photographers to choose a suitable photographer for a family photo shoot on Mother’s Day 2025! Scented Candles: Therapeutic Mother’s Day gift idea Image credit: Sally’s Room via Facebook For mums who love a fragrant home, scented candles make the perfect gift for Mother’s Day in Singapore. With a plethora of scents available, there’s something to suit every mom’s taste or mood. Check out these ones from Misty Daydream , Sally’s Room and Oyasumi Scents ! Some of these brands even allow you to personalise the candles with mum’s name, making this a thoughtful Mother’s Day gift idea! Yacht Party: Extravagant Mother’s Day 2025 celebration Image credit: Seek Sophie This Mother’s Day 2025, why not book an experience as a Mother’s Day gift? Treat mum to a day out at sea with a yacht booking! Enjoy sunsets and star-lit dinners on an evening cruise, or try a great variety of water sports with minimal hassle. We’ve got a great list of yacht charter options in Singapore here (some priced as low as $250!). Read our Guide to 20+ Unique Experiences to Try in Singapore ! High Tea Experience: Indulgent Mother’s Day 2025 gift Image credit: Paradox Singapore Merchant Court If mum hasn’t yet tried a high tea experience, Mother’s Day 2025 is the perfect occasion to book one! We’ve rounded up all our favourite high tea spots across the island from high tea with amazing views to traditional, English-style high teas, to high teas with a cocktail kick, those that highlight local faves and more. For special Mother’s Day celebration menus , check out our roundup just for Mother’s Day lunches, high teas and dinners. Creative Family Portrait: Personalised Mother’s Day 2025 gift Image credit: illustrationby.lyd via Instagram An illustration of a family photo or your favourite family moment is one of the best gifts for your mum, especially if you’re targeting her heartstrings. For Mother’s Day 2025, check out some of our favourite illustrators are amazing at family portraits. They will even include your four-legged family members too, ensuring no one gets left behind! Check out these illustrators – By Craft Room , illustrationby.lyd and starrymnl . A Bouquet Of Flowers: Classic gift for Mother’s Day 2025 Image credit: fnp.sg We’ve got a list of the best florists and flower shops in Singapore for you to surprise your partner with this Mother’s Day. Pair this with some chocolates , and you’ll have the classic Mother’s Day gift! Personalised Bag: Thoughtful gift for Mother’s Day 2025 Image credit: Sometime – By Asian Designers via Facebook There’s something special about personalised gifts, isn’t there? We’re all about that sentimental touch! And nowadays, you can personalise just about anything from crossbody bags to tote bags and even cup holders! This practical Mother’s Day gift is something that will complement Mum’s lifestyle. Sometime By Asian Designers and The Imprint are some of our go-to’s for personalised essentials. Handmade Gift: Heartfelt gift for Mother’s Day 2025 Image credit: Unsplash – for illustrative purposes only. Something homemade (by the kids) is sure to put a smile on mum’s face! Whether it’s an artwork, a handmade card, handmade fabric bookmark or jewellery, anything that is made with love makes for a sweet gift for Mum this Mother’s Day 2025. New cookware: Practical gift for Mother’s Day 2025 Image credit: Le Creuset Let’s give it up for mama’s cooking! Nothing quite compares, right? Show your appreciation this Mother’s Day 2025 by treating Mum to a fresh set of cookware! Only get this gift if you know she’ll be excited about it (this idea could also backfire!) We absolutely love the cookware from Le Creuset, Midori , Cosmic Cookware and Neoflam! Their stylish and high quality sets not only elevate our cooking game, but also add a touch of aesthetic to our kitchen! A Quirky Door Sign: Funny gift idea for Mother’s Day Gift 2025 Image credit: Amazon SG Fact: Finding time for self-care as a mom can feel like a luxury. Even a few minutes for a skincare routine can be a challenge without interruptions. For a quirky gift this Mother’s Day 2025, consider giving Mum a ‘Do Not Disturb’ door sign for Mother’s Day from Amazon from $11.99 . It might help buy mama a few minutes of peace! No matter the gift this Mother’s Day, remember to give that amazing leading lady in your life a big hug, and say I love you! Read more: The post Mother’s Day 2025 In Singapore: Fun & Thoughtful Ideas & Gifts For Mum appeared first on Sassy Mama .

articles.title: Delicious Desserts In Your Neighbourhood: Cupcakes, Tarts, Local Desserts, Doughnuts, Bingsu & More!
articles.author: Sassy Mama
articles.content: Wondering where to find the best dessert shop in Singapore? Whether you need an afternoon cake, an awfully chocolate hit, a post-dinner dessert, celebration cupcakes or local desserts like ice kacang and Bingsu, you can find the tastiest dessert near you with this list! If you’re hunting down a sweet treat head over one of the best dessert shops in Singapore to get your Awfully Chocolate fix, slice of apple pie, celebration cake , or icy Bingsu on a hot day! We could all use a sweet little pick-me-up from time to time and fortunately, there’s no shortage of great dessert cafes in Singapore! From doughnuts to ice cream to local specialities (ice kacang or durian, anyone?), we’ve rounded up our fave sweet treats all over the island and a lot of places now offer dessert delivery! Disclaimer: All information is subject to change. Always check directly before booking. Jump to these tasty desserts in Singapore: – Cupcakes & Cakes – Birthday cakes – Ice Cream & Milkshakes – Local Desserts: Ice Kacang, Durian & More – Bingsu – Doughnuts, Pastries & Other Desserts Cupcakes, Tarts & Cakes: Dessert Shops in Singapore Awfully Chocolate Image credit: Awfully Chocolate via Instagram Chocoholics in Singapore beware! One visit to Awfully Chocolate and their divine chocolatey cakes (and much more) will have you absolutely hooked. Your little one’s birthday party is an extra excuse to place that Awfully Chocolate order, with their chocolate cakes, cupcakes, tarts, brownies and ice creams screaming out to be bought (and devoured pronto!). We love popping by Awfully Chocolate for a quick choccy fix for ourselves to Awfully Chocolate Truffles to gift. Is this dessert near me? Order online for islandwide delivery, or visit one of Awfully Chocolate stores located across Singapore! Awfully Chocolate, multiple locations in Singapore; Awfully Chocolate flagship:131 East Coast Rd 131 Singapore, www.awfullychocolate.com Read more: Best Chocolate Brands In Singapore 2am Dessert Bar Image credit: 2amdessertbar via Instagram Dessert for dinner? Sounds good to us! This elegant Holland Village boîte from celebrated pastry chef Janice Wong serves gorgeously inventive dishes that push the boundaries between sweet and savoury. Is this dessert near me? Order online for delivery, or visit them in Holland Village. 2 am Dessert bar, 21A Lor Liput, Singapore 277733 www.2amdessertbar.com Plain Vanilla Cupcakes Image credit: Plain Vanilla With flavours ranging from cinnamon brown sugar and red velvet to lemon coconut and dark chocolate ganache , Plain Vanilla Bakery has a cupcake to suit every taste. If you’re looking for customisable birthday cakes , you’ve come to the right place. They offer plenty of other wholesome bakes as well. Is this dessert near me? Order online for delivery or visit Cluny Court, Orchard, Telok Ayer, Neil Road, Tiong Bahru or East Coast Road. Plain Vanilla Bakery, www.plainvanilla.com.sg PS.Cafe: Dessert cafe in Singapore Image credit: PS.Cafe If you’re in the mood for a lovely outdoor dining spot, PS.Cafe has you covered. Their handmade slices of cakes are the stuff of legends and we have a special place in our hearts for the Chocolate Blackout Cake. Is this dessert near me? Order online for delivery or visit Ann Siang Hill, Dempsey, East Coast Park, Great World City, One Fullerton, Orchard, Raffles City, River Valley, Marina Bay Sands, Jewel or Tiong Bahru. PS.Cafe, www.pscafe.com Nesuto Patisserie Image credit: Nesuto Nesuto is a little sweet haven on Tras Street brought to you by the same folks behind Shuu by Koki Tamagoyaki, the choux pastry located in Raffles City. Find layer cakes like the green Matcha Souffle Sponge or black Goma Sesame, or our all-time favourite Le ’Mmm — an Espresso Dark Chocolate layer sponge cake that manages the oxymoron of being fudgy yet light, with a Valhrona Jivara 40% Milk Ganache. Is this dessert near me? Order online for delivery, or visit them at Tanjong Pagar or Jewel Changi Airport. Nesuto, www.facebook.com/dear.nesuto Read more: Where To Find The Best Birthday Cakes In Singapore Pâtisserie CLÉ Image credit: Pâtisserie CLÉ Pâtisserie CLÉ, now in a charming shophouse in River Valley, offers finely executed French pastries and entremets, available for takeaway and delivery only. If you fancy dessert at a cafe, their full-fledged Pâtisserie CLÉ café opens in Dairy Farm with speciality tarts and dessert entremets from Apple Nutmeg Cake to the adorable cow-shaped Moo dessert. Is this dessert near me? Order online for dessert delivery , or visit them at River Valley. Pâtisserie CLÉ, 415 River Valley Road and 4 Dairy Farm Lane, 01-13 Dairy Farm Mall Melvados Image credit: Melvados via Instagram Looking for halal dessert in Singapore? Head to Melvados, where you’ll find indulgent halal brownies, cheesecakes, lava cakes and ice cream that will feel like a slice of heaven on earth! This healthier dessert cafe also sells diabetic-friendly brownies, so those on a low-sugar diet can still enjoy a yummy dessert. Is this dessert near me? Order online, or find them in 10 locations in Singapore including United Square, Anchor Point, Jurong Point, Eastpoint, PLQ Mall and Harbourfront. Melvados, melvados.com Read more: Best Halal Restaurants In Singapore Windowsill Pies Image credit: Windowsill Pies via Instagram This Haji Lane café serves up truly delectable pies ranging from the classic (Pecan, Morello Cherry) to “Grasshopper” (Dark Chocolate Cake with peppermint whipped cream and salted chocolate cookie clusters) and “Toucan” (Pineapple and yoghurt curd, passionfruit seed glaze and homemade muesli morsels). Is this dessert near me? Order online for delivery, or visit them at Kim Seng Promenade or Jurong Gateway. Windowsill Pies, www.facebook.com/WindowsillPies Cat & The Fiddle: Dessert shop in Singapore Image credit: Cat & the Fiddle Cakes Love cheesecake? Cat & the Fiddle offers premium cheesecakes in 20 original flavours specially created by Singapore’s iconic dessert chef, Daniel Tay. You can even get a taste of ten flavours with the Fickle Feline cake. Because the cakes are self-ordered online and self-collected, savings can be passed to customers while prices are kept sweet as a kiss. These desserts are certified Halal, too! Is this dessert near me? Order online for delivery or visit Bishan, Clarke Quay, Jurong or Woodlands. Click here for the full list of locations . The Cat & The Fiddle, www.catandthefiddle.com Read more: Where to Order Customised Cakes The Butter Studio Image credit: Butter Studio via Facebook This Halal-certified cake shop churns out local-inspired homestyle desserts and bakes like Salted Caramel Red Velvet (OMG), Tropical Ondeh Cake, and Sea Salt Nutella Tart. You’ll find cakes , cupcakes, home-baking kits, and much more at this dessert cafe. Order online or visit their bakery café. Is this dessert near me? Jalan Besar (bakery café); Orchard, Tampines, Bugis (mall counters) The Butter Studio, www.thebutterstudio.com Ice Cream & Milkshakes: Dessert cafes in Singapore For our ultimate guide to ice cream in Singapore read this ! Birds of Paradise Image credit: Gelato from Birds of Paradise The “botanical gelato” at this Katong boutique (with a new location at Jewel!) is handmade daily, in delectable flavours like White Chrysanthemum, Strawberry Basil, and Sea Salt Hojicha. Their freshly made “Thyme Cones” are also a massive draw. Don’t just take our word for it — just follow the massive queues at Jewel Changi Airport. Is this dessert near me? Katong, Jewel Changi Airport, Craig Road, Beach Road, Mandai Wildlife West and Holland Village. Birds of Paradise, www.birdsofparadise.sg Read more: Best Food At Jewel Changi Airport Black Tap: Dessert shop in Singapore Image credit: Black Tap Craft Burgers & Beers This American burger restaurant at MBS just might be most famous for their Crazyshakes ( pictured above ), calorific milkshake extravaganzas that come topped with candy coatings, lollipops, full slices of cake (!) and other fun desserts. At $19+ they ain’t cheap, but they’re fun to split for a special treat. Is this dessert near me? Marina Bay Sands Black Tap Craft Burgers & Beers, www.blacktap.com FATCAT Ice Cream & Coffee Boutique Image credit: FATCAT Ice Cream & Coffee Boutique via Instagram Famed for their ice cream and charcoal waffle combos, FATCAT in Bedok has a loyal following of Easties. In addition to a rotating slate of “Standard” and “Premium” flavours (check their IG Stories for that day’s selection), they also offer inventive “Signatures” like Butter Beer, Hay & Honey, Earl Grey Lavender, and Watermelon Soju. Besides their stalwart ice cream, FATCAT also has yummy brownies, burnt cheesecake, and unique confections like Durian Chocolate Tart. Is this dessert near me? Order for delivery (East Coast area) or visit Kovan FATCAT Ice Cream & Coffee Boutique, www.instagram.com/fatcatsg Read more: Best Gelatos & Ice Cream In Singapore Kind Kones Image credit: Kind Kones via Instagram This vegan ice cream parlour features scoops that are free from dairy, refined sugar, soy, gluten, and other artificial additives. Flavours range from chocolate sorbet, strawberry ice cream and almond brittle to more unique offerings like Haw Flakes and Blue Earth (hued by natural Butterfly Pea flower). There are other vegan desserts on offer, too, like gluten free Chocolate Ganache Cake and Sweet Potato brownies. Is this dessert near me? Order online for delivery, or Forum Shopping Mall, The Paragon, Great World, Westgate & Suntec City Kind Kones, www.kindkones.com Read more: Guide To Sengkang Grand Mall Momolato Image credit: Momolato With flavours like Pu’Er Chocolate, Blue Pea Hokkaido Vanilla Creme Brulee and more, Momolato is just the place for a unique gelato fix if you’re in the Kampong Glam area. Everything’s made with fresh, natural ingredients, plus they even have keto-friendly ice cream if you’re cutting carbs. If you’re looking for something healthier for the kids, their fresh fruit popsicles are just as refreshing, minus all the added sugar! Other healthy options include sugar-free lattes, keto frozen yogurt and gelato cakes. Momolato is Halal-certified. Is this dessert near me? Visit this dessert cafe in Singapore at Haji Lane Momolato, www.momolato.com Ben & Jerry’s Image credit: Ben & Jerry’s Singapore via Instagram With legendary flavours like Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough, Cherry Garcia & New York Superfudge Chunk (not to mention lots of yummy new dairy-free flavours), American ice cream chain Ben & Jerry’s is the perfect cool-off dessert when you’re visiting Singapore Zoo or the Night Safari. You’ll also find a centrally-located scoop shop right on Orchard at 313 Somerset. Prices aren’t the lowest, but the brand is dedicated to fair trade practices and social justice, so you can feel good as you lick! Is this dessert near me? Order online for delivery or visit VivoCity. Ben & Jerry’s, www.benjerry.com.sg Read more: Where To Go For Gelato & Ice Cream In Singapore Swensen’s Image credit: Swensen’s via Instagram Classic American ice cream brand Swensen’s arrived in Singapore back in 1979, and has grown to dozens of outlets all over the island with all manner of ice cream sundaes and ice cream cakes. They’re Halal-certified, too! Is this dessert near me? Order online for delivery or visit one of 25 locations around Singapore. Swensen’s, www.swensens.com.sg Island Creamery Image credit: Island Creamery via Instagram Made fresh on-site daily using only the best ingredients, Island Creamery is a wildly popular homegrown mainstay that’s been churning out the sweet stuff since 2004. Don’t expect any boring flavours here. It’s all about Asian-inspired flavours like Tiger Sorbet, Teh Tarik, Pineapple Tart, and Pear Sake. There’s an irresistible range of take-home cakes, too. Is this dessert near me? Order online for delivery or visit Holland Village Island Creamery, www.islandcreamery.com Local Dessert Specialities: Ice Kacang, Durian & More Ah Chew Desserts Image credit: Ah Chew Desserts Since 2003, Ah Chew Desserts has been serving up traditional and modern Asian and Southeast Asian desserts (more than 50 in all, now!). Choose from hot and cold dessert varieties of classics like Mango Sago, Glutinous Rice, Grass Jelly Mixed Fruits, Black Sesame Paste, Gingko Barley, and much, much more! Is this dessert near me? Order online for islandwide delivery, or visit them in Bugis and Orchard. Ah Chew Desserts, www.ahchewdesserts.com Ah Mah Homemade Cakes Image credit: iluvahmahsg via Instagram Launched to great popularity in Singapore in 2017, Ah Mah Homemade Cakes are inspired by Taiwanese egg sponge cakes, and are made purely with milk, high-quality, locally produced eggs, and flour. They’re also baked fresh daily with no preservatives, and come in flavours like pandan, gula melaka, and golden salted egg. Their melt-in-your-mouth cheesecake is delish, too. You’ll also be able to find Chinese New Year goodies each time the Lunar New Year season rolls around. Is this dessert near me? Paya Lebar & Vivo City Ah Mah Homemade Cake, www.ah-mah.com.sg Jin Jin Desserts: Dessert shop in Singapore Image credit: Jin Jin Dessert via Facebook There are outstanding ice kacang stalls all over the island, but consensus seems to be that Jin Jin Desserts stall at ABC Brickworks in Bukit Merah is the cream of the crop. Their dessert specialties: Gangster Mango Ice and Power Chendol featuring gula melaka sourced specially from Indonesia. Is this dessert near me? Bukit Merah, South Bridge Road and East Coast Jin Jin Desserts, www.facebook.com/JinJinDessertClub Mei Heong Yuen Dessert Image credit: Mei Heong Yuen Dessert via Facebook If you’re craving traditional Chinese dessert, Mei Heong Yuen Dessert is one of Singapore’s pioneers, with roots from China dating back to 1950! You’ll find classic desserts like herbal glass jelly and soya bean options here, along with black sesame desserts and even ice desserts with fruits and pearls! Is this dessert near me? Chinatown, Clementi, Novena, Eunos, Yishun, City Hall, Suntec City, Downtown East and Simei Mei Heong Yuen Dessert, www.meiheongyuendessert.com.sg Nine Fresh Desserts Taiwan Image credit: Nine Fresh via Instagram Okay, we know this isn’t exactly a ‘local dessert’ since it originates from Taiwan. But Nine Fresh serves up more traditional desserts – think Soy Bean Curd, Grass Jelly and Ai-yu from Taiwan. Top it with taro balls, boiled peanuts, green beans and red beans to enjoy every bite! Is this dessert shop near me? Order online , or find them at 19 locations in Singapore including Ang Mo Kio, Bedok, Woodlands, Chinatown, Hougang, Jurong Point and Jewel. Nine Fresh Dessert Taiwan, ninefresh.com Four Seasons Durians Image credit: Four Seasons Durian via Instagram Tracing its origins to a durian fruit stall on Thomson Road, Four Seasons Durians began turning out delectable cakes, durian desserts, crepes and more desserts in the late 90s. Today, they’ve got a flagship restaurant at Jewel and dessert counters across the island. Is this dessert near me? Order online for delivery, or find them in Tampines, Serangoon and Sembawang Four Seasons Durian, www.fourseasonsdurians.com Royal Durian Image credit: Royal Durian Singapore via Instagram Royal Durian is one of the go-to Musang King durian specialists in Singapore! Besides actual durian fruit, Royal Durian offers a variety of delectable durian desserts from durian puffs, to mousse cups, sliced cakes and durian chocolate truffles! Everything is just so rich in creamy, sweet durian flavour, so if you’re a true durian lover, you have to try their desserts! Is this dessert near me? Jurong Royal Durian, WhatsApp: (+65) 8186 8552, www.instagram.com/royalduriansg Bingsu desserts: Dessert shops near you Ice Lab Image credit: Ice Lab With a menu of 20 different bingsu flavours, Ice Lab is the perfect spot to find a dessert that will tickle everyone’s fancy! As bingsu is often served in large sharing portions, we appreciate that they offer smaller ‘Single’ dessert portions for those who want something icy but not too over-the-top. Is this dessert near me? Bugis & Jewel Changi Airport Ice Lab , www.instagram.com/icelab.sg Home Best Dessert Image credit: Home Best Dessert via Facebook This dessert spot in Chinatown offers bingsu in a variety of flavours so you can beat the heat after a day of exploring! Choose from classic Korean rice cake bingsu to Matcha bingsu and even those with gelato on top so you get the best of shaved ice and ice cream in one dessert! Is this dessert near me? Chinatown HomeBest Dessert, www.facebook.com/bestbingsusingapore OH MY MANGO Dessertbar Image credit: Oh My Mango Bingsu with fresh fruits, amazing flavours and available in four locations islandwide – that’s Oh My Mango Dessertbar! You’ll also find thick, fluffy toasts topped with ice cream and a variety of sauces. It’ll be hard to pick just one flavour! Is this dessert near me? Gek Poh Shopping Centre and Sunshine Place Oh My Mango Dessert Bar, www.facebook.com/OMMDB Oriental Ice Bistro Image credit: Oriental Ice Bistro via Instagram Oriental Ice Bistro is a halal-certified dessert cafe in Little India. Their dessert menu boasts ‘Korean bingsu with a twist’, milkshakes, waffles, toast and a variety of speciality drinks! Is this dessert near me? Little India Oriental Ice Bistro, www.instagram.com/oriental.ice.bistro Read more: Best Halal Restaurants & Cafes In Singapore Smile Dessert Image credit: Smile Dessert Singapore via Facebook Smile Dessert’s IG-worthy interiors are enough reason to check out one of their dessert cafes (they have ball pits kids can play in!) plus their bingsu, souffle pancakes and drinks will hit the spot. Is this dessert near me? Funan Smile Dessert, www.facebook.com/Smile-Dessert-Singapore Doughnuts, Pastries & Other Desserts Ange Bakes Keto Image credit: Ange Bakes Keto via Instagram Love sweets but livin’ that keto lifestyle? Keto bakery AngeBakes uses only natural sugar substitutes, and all of their desserts are low-carb and comprised only of whole foods. We salivate over treats like Keto Pineapple Tarts, Earl Grey Cheesecake and Keto Brownies. Yum! Is this dessert near me? Order online. Ange Bakes Keto, www.angebakesketo.com Burnt Ends Bakery Image credit: Burnt Ends True, they’re known for their barbecue, but Burnt Ends bakery also serves up a slammin’ doughnut (which you can now order to enjoy at home from their online bakery shop or at their Bakery in Dempsey). In addition to classic plain, dusted with just the right amount of sugar other doughnut varieties come filled with Passionfruit Curd, Nutella and Vanilla Cream. Is this dessert near me? Order online for islandwide delivery, or find them in Dempsey. Burnt Ends Bakery, www.bakery.burntends.com.sg Bread Talk Image credit: Bread Talk via Instagram While Bread Talk is known for its delicious Floss Bun, we love that it also has a variety of other breads, cakes and pastries here. If you forgot to order a cake in advance, no worries! Simply purchase a cake from the dessert shelf. Just want to indulge in something sweet? Order a slice of Dark Forest Gateau or Matcha Yuzu. Is this dessert near me? Order online , or find them in 36 locations across the island, including Orchard, Ang Mo Kio, Woodlands, Chinatown, Jurong Point, and Marina Bay Sands. Bread Talk, www.breadtalk.com.sg Cedele Singapore Image credit: Cedele via Instagram With a mission to help people eat well and be well while enjoying life, Cedele is an artisanal bakery with a range of bread, cakes, sandwiches, pastries and desserts. From the classic Red Velvet Earl Grey cupcake to a Lemon Meringue Cake, Cedele sure has everything to satisfy a sweet tooth! Plus, they even have vegan cakes. Is this dessert near me? Order online for islandwide delivery, or find them in 24 locations including City Square Mall, Compass One, Great World, Paya Lebar Quarter and Buona Vista. Cedele, cedele.com Read more: Best Birthday Cakes In Singapore D9 Cakery Image credit: D9 Cakery via Instagram Many of Singapore’s top hotels have spectacular dessert offerings, but only D9 seems to display them as if they were fine works of art or precious jewels. Pop into the lobby of the voco Singapore and you’ll find an impressive six-meter showcase of handcrafted, edible art pieces, from tarts and cheesecakes to a whole range of Valrhona Chocolate-inspired confections. They’ve got amazing 2D and 3D birthday cakes made to order, too! Is this dessert near me? Email for delivery, or find them in Orchard. D9 Cakery, orcharddining.vocohotels.com Lola Faye Cafe Image credit: Lolafaye.cafe via Instagram This late-night dessert cafe (they open from 2pm to 2am daily!) is known for their indulgent chunky cookies. Head to Lola Faye Cafe for waffles and ice cream, sweet stuffed croissants, towering milkshakes and more! Is this dessert near me? Located between Bendemeer and Lavender MRT Stations Lolafaye.cafe, www.instagram.com/lolafaye.cafe Paris Baguette: Dessert cafe in Singapore Image credit: Paris Baguette via Instagram Feeling for French-inspired dessert in Singapore? We love the fruity tarts and croissants that are crispy on the outside but oh so soft on the inside! They also have a delightful selection of cakes and desserts for every occasion. Is this dessert near me? Order online, or find them 19 locations in Singapore including Paya Lebar, Serangoon, Ang Mo Kio, Bedok, Yishun, Bugis, Orchard, Raffles Quay and Jurong East. Paris Baguette, www.parisbaguette.com.sg Sourbombe Artisanal Bakery Image credit: Sourbombe Artisanal Bakery Bomboloni, croissants, choux pastry… hungry yet? Sourbombe Artisanal Bakery in Jewel and Dhoby Ghaut are famous for being Singapore’s first artisanal sourdough bomboloni cafe, so expect beautifully made pastries that look too good to eat! Is this dessert near me? Jewel Changi Airport, One Holland Village, Wisma Atria Sourbombe Artisanal Bakery, www.sourbombebakery.com Dark Gallery Image credit: Dark Gallery This boutique dark chocolate café serves up a bevvy of handmade, artisanal, single-origin chocolates, all made right on site in their Halal kitchen. We adore their artisanal bonbons – particularly flavours like White Chocolate Rose Tea, Early Grey Peppermint, and Toffee Sea Salt (all 66% dark chocolate). And they’ve got plenty of plated desserts, too, like ice cream sundaes, waffles, chocolate cakes, and much more Is this dessert near me? Funan, Orchard, Millennia Walk Dark Gallery, www.thedarkgallery.com Mr. Holmes Bakehouse (Closed) Image credit: Mr. Holmes Bakehouse San Francisco-based bakery Mr. Holmes Bakehouse (the ‘cruffin’ creators!) is located in Orchard, offering their famous ‘cruffins’ – a hybrid croissant with a flaky, sugar-dusted and cream-filled croissant baked in the shape of a muffin. It’s the place to head for donuts, croissants and those delicious cruffins. articles.title: Best Pottery Classes In Singapore Including Kids Pottery, Pottery Painting & More
articles.author: Aisyah Amin
articles.content: Ready to get creative with clay? These pottery classes in Singapore allow you and your child to spin the wheel, dive into hand-building techniques with kids pottery classes, clay-making workshops, pottery painting and more. Looking for a fun and creative way to keep your kids engaged? Pottery classes in Singapore offer the perfect blend of hands-on fun and artistic expression. With an array of kids pottery classes and clay-making workshops available, little ones can dive into wheel-throwing, master hand-building techniques, and craft their very own clay masterpieces. There are even pottery painting workshops for kids who just want to unleash their creativity with some colour! Plus, some pottery classes in Singapore even feature parent-child sessions, making it a fantastic opportunity for bonding while both of you get your hands busy with some creative clay fun. Read more: Best Art Classes for Kids Best Pottery Classes In Singapore: Am I Addicted: Pottery classes led by professional ceramists Image credit: Am I Addicted Am I Addicted offers beginner-friendly pottery classes in Singapore for both kids and adults in its spacious studio. Classes are led by professional ceramists, and past customers sing praises for the trainers, highlighting their patience. Choose from pottery classes like wheel-throwing, hand-building, and pottery painting. While wheel-throwing is for ages 12 and up, younger kids can get creative with hand-building (crafting anything from clay animals) and more. The pottery painting sessions at Am I Addicted let you personalise bowls, cups, or plates starting at just $15. While walk-ins are welcome, booking in advance often scores you better deals. Am I Addicted , #05-37~52, Orchard Central, Singapore 238896, Tel: (+65) 8852 3370, www.amiaddicted.sg ARUDIO: Affordable pottery classes Image credit: ARUDIO Founded by a ceramic artist, ARUDIO is a ceramics studio in Singapore offering a range of affordable pottery classes. Kids as young as 6 can join the fun with trial classes, choosing between “Introduction to Hand-building” and “Introduction to Wheel-throwing” (the latter is for kids aged 12 and up). These 3-hour sessions are kept small to ensure personalised guidance as kids learn pottery techniques and create their own artworks. For older kids interested in exploring pottery further, ARUDIO offers workshops with 5-10 sessions, perfect for diving deeper into the craft. Plus, the classes are flexible, allowing you to book slots that fit your schedule. ARUDIO, Nordcom II, Tower 2 and Macpherson (LTC Building C), Tel: (+65) 8838 9256, www.arudioceramic.com Clay Clay Pottery: pottery painting for kids Image credit: Clay Clay Pottery Not keen on getting your hands dirty? Opt for pottery painting instead. Some studios in Singapore offer pottery painting workshops, perfect for a fun and creative session with your little ones. At Clay Clay Pottery, you’ll find a range of unpainted pieces just waiting for a splash of colour! From cups and plates to vases, there’s plenty to choose from. Plenty of brushes are at your disposal, and you can even don a cute apron. Clay Clay Pottery, 755 North Bridge Road, Floor 1, Singapore 198723, www.clayclaypottery.com Clay Cove: Pottery classes led by professional ceramists Image credit: Clay Cove Clay Cove is a pottery studio in Singapore that boasts more than 20 years of expertise, with classes catering to both adults and kids. Their kid’s pottery classes cater to ages 5 – 14. With classes ranging from Foundation to Advanced, kids will explore fun techniques like pinching, coiling, slab-building, and hollowing. The Intermediate class even lets them craft their own coiled bowls, cups, and pencil holders! For those looking to spend quality time together, Clay Cove also offers Parent and Child pottery sessions. These two-session classes cater to kids as young as 3, and is a great way to bond while creating your own clay masterpieces together. Clay Cove, 402 Orchard Road, #04-05 Delfi Orchard, Singapore 238876, Tel: (+65) 6733 8129, www.claycove.com Goodman Ceramic Studio: Pottery classes for families Image credit: Goodman Ceramic Studio Pottery classes at Goodman Ceramic Studio are led by seasoned professionals, ensuring that you’re learning from the best in the field. This pottery studio in Singapore offers family-friendly classes for children as young as 4. We love that the pottery classes are unique in their use of storytelling to captivate and inspire the little ones. In a fun and interactive one-time session, kids will explore the basics of wheel-throwing and carved vessel decoration, fostering their imagination while having fun. Plus, an additional parent can join in for just $70, perfect for a family activity! Goodman Ceramic Studio, 71 Ubi Crescent, #01-01 Excalibur Centre, Singapore 408571, Tel: (+65) 9455 8405, www.goodmanceramicstudio.com Mud Rock Ceramics: Weekly pottery classes for kids Image credit: Mud Rock Ceramics Mud Rock Ceramics is a well-known pottery studio in Singapore that also functions as a production and education space. The instructors here are highly skilled, with their pottery pieces featured in top restaurants – including those of Michelin-star chefs. Some have even been gifted to figures like Queen Elizabeth II and The Vatican. Their weekly kids’ pottery classes are a great way for children to learn the basics of pottery while having fun. They also have classes ranging from beginner to advanced levels and host private sessions, which are perfect for parties ! Mud Rock Ceramics, 315 Outram Road, Tan Boon Liat building, #14-01, Singapore 169074, www.mudrockceramics.com PotteryPlease!: Paint your own pottery Image credit: PotteryPlease! PotteryPlease! is a relatively new paint-your-own-pottery studio in Singapore, born from the founder’s passion for creating beautiful, personalised pottery gifts. The studio offers a variety of pottery pieces to choose from, including cups, plates, and more. With 24 different underglaze colours, you can unleash creativity as you paint your masterpiece! Their 1.5-hour pottery painting package comes complete with access to all necessary brushes, materials, and aprons. PotteryPlease!, Queensway Shopping Centre #03-40 & #03-48, 1 Queensway, Singapore 149053, www.potterypleasee.com Read more: Fun Kids’ Events & Things To Do This Weekend Studio Asobi: Parent-accompanied pottery classes Image credit: Studio Asobi Studio Asobi is a cosy, home-based pottery studio run by a couple who sought a peaceful escape from Singapore’s busy lifestyle. Their pottery classes are by appointment only, making it a personalised experience. They welcome kids as long as they’re accompanied by an adult. The studio offers a variety of pottery workshops and classes, including Play Time Open Sessions. These sessions are more laid-back than structured pottery classes, allowing you to explore and create at your own pace. While there’s no instructor to guide you, the open setting encourages learning and inspiration from fellow potters. Studio Asobi, 705 Hougang Ave 2, Home Studio, Singapore 530705 (appointment only), www.studioasobi.com Thow Kwang Pottery Jungle: Pottery studio with over 50 years of heritage Image credit: Thow Kwang Pottery Jungle Thow Kwang Pottery Jungle is a family-run pottery gem boasting over 50 years of heritage in ceramics. Originally starting as a cottage industry with a traditional wood kiln, they’ve grown into one of Singapore’s largest exporters and importers of pottery wares. Their Hand Building & Potter’s Wheel workshop caters to kids aged eight and up. Younger kids under 8 can join in, too, with an accompanying parent. The 2.5-hour workshop lets your little ones get hands-on experience with pottery, from hand-building to glazing, and even a go on the pottery wheel. The best part? They’ll get to bring home their own creations! Thow Kwang Pottery Jungle, 85 Lorong Tawas, Singapore 639823, Tel: (+65) 8409 5588, www.potteryjungle.com The Potters: Pottery classes for kids Image credit: The Potters The Potters is a charming pottery studio in North Singapore, offering a range of workshops for different group sizes and age groups. Their kids’ pottery classes, designed for children aged 7-12, offer flexible options from a single session to a five or 10-session workshop. With small class sizes and patient instructors highly recommended by past customers, kids will receive plenty of attention as they learn the basics of pottery. During the sessions, they’ll get to unleash their creativity and craft two unique art pieces to take home. The Potters, A’Posh BizHub, 1 Yishun Industrial Street 1, #06-17, Singapore 768160, Tel: (+65) 9779 4111, www.thepotters1881.com The Potters’ Guilt: Holiday pottery workshops for kids Image credit: The Potters’ Guilt The Potters’ Guilt, a popular pottery studio located on Pearl’s Hill Terrace, offers a wide range of classes for all skill levels. Whether you’re a beginner learning the basics or looking to dive deeper into various pottery techniques, there’s something for everyone here. During school holidays, The Potters’ Guilt hosts workshops for kids aged 6-12, where they can create their own clay artwork using the slab-building technique. Although the current school holiday workshops have ended, be sure to keep an eye on their website for updates on the next round of workshops! The Potters’ Guilt, 195 Pearl’s Hill Terrace #01-03, Singapore 168976, www.thepottersguilt.com Read more: Guide to Kids’ Summer Holiday Camps Taoz Ceramics Studio: Pottery classes in Orchard Image credit: Taoz Ceramics Studio Taoz Ceramics Studio is a cosy pottery studio in Orchard that doubles up as an educational branch offering pottery courses for all levels. For those looking to refine their skills or dive deeper into the art of pottery, Taoz Ceramics Studio offers a range of courses from beginner to advanced levels. articles.title: Guide To The Cathay Reopening At Dhoby Ghaut: Food, Shops, Parking & More
articles.author: Cherilyn
articles.content: After an extensive renovation, The Cathay has finally reopened at Dhoby Ghaut! From food to retail shops, parking rates, The Cathay Residences and more, here’s our guide to help you plan your day at this shopping mall. The long wait is over because The Cathay at Dhoby Ghaut finally reopened its doors on 28 March 2025 after almost two years! The Cathay is a historical landmark and an urban living and shopping destination for people of all ages. The 16-storey Cathay Building features a shopping mall from Level 1 to 6 and The Cathay Residence from Level 7 to 16. From affordable food like Saizeriya and a local food court to a 24-hour gym for fitness buffs and IUIGA for minimalist homeowners, there’s something for everyone. Jump to: – History of The Cathay – Food at The Cathay – Shops at The Cathay – Gym at The Cathay – The Cathay Residences – How to get to The Cathay – Parking at The Cathay History of The Cathay Image credit: Bras Basah Bugis via Instagram Situated at the foot of Mount Sophia, The Cathay is a national monument with a rich history dating back to the early years of World War II and the Japanese occupation. When The Cathay Cinema first opened in 1939, followed by the main tower in 1941. The Cathay stood as the tallest building and was known for being Singapore’s first skyscraper and air-conditioned cinema that screened American and British films in Singapore. Cathay Cinema first opened on 3 October 1939 and featured 1,321 seats surrounded by black marble pillars, green-tilted floors and gold ceilings. A couple of years later, The Cathay Restaurant opened on the fourth floor and became popular in the 1950s but has since shut down. NEW! 360-degree Multimedia Screen at The Cathay Image credit: The Cathay One of the newest additions to The Cathay is a three-story, 360-degree multimedia screen. This captivating addition features dynamic visuals in HD, inviting shoppers to pause and enjoy the view from all angles. There are seating steps around the display, so you can catch a break from your shopping spree or unwind with a cuppa and a good conversation, while the kiddos are entertained by the ever-changing visuals. Food at The Cathay: What to eat at The Cathay The Cathay is home to 11 food & beverage outlets to help you refuel in the middle of a work day or your next shopping spree on the weekend. But if you’re looking for a place that will satisfy everyone’s craving, head to Basement 1 for the food court at The Cathay. Yakiniku Like: Japanese BBQ Image credit: Yakiniku Like! via Instagram Fancy a Japanese barbecue for lunch? Yakiniku Like offers top-quality meat at an affordable price. They especially cater to solo diners but you can also dine with your family too. Choose your favourite cuts of meat then grill away! Yakiniku Like , The Cathay, 2 Handy Road, #01-02, Singapore 229233, www.instagram.com/yakinikulikesg Read more: Best Sushi Restaurants In Singapore Saizeriya: Affordable Italian cuisine Image credit: Saizeriya via Facebook With little ones in tow, you can’t go wrong with pizza and pasta! Drop by Saizeriya at The Cathay to satisfy hungry tummies with affordable Italian mains including Pepperoni Pizza, Spaghetti Bolognese and more. We especially love their chicken wings that are grilled to perfection! Saizeriya, The Cathay, 2 Handy Road, #B1-11, Singapore 229233, www.saizeriya.com.sg Read more: Best Italian Restaurants In Singapore Starbucks: Beautiful cakes & artisanal coffee Image credit: Starbucks Singapore via Facebook We hear you, mums & dads! If you’re exploring The Cathay with the kids, you’ll probably need a mid-day caffeine kick. Head to Starbucks to get your caffeine fix and treat the kids to a slice of cake for afternoon tea . Plus, be sure to check out their latest adorable Snoopy & Friends collection. Starbucks, The Cathay, 2 Handy Road, #01-01, Singapore 229233, www.starbucks.com.sg Read more: Best Cafes In Singapore With Free Wifi & Good Coffee Food Avenue: Food court at The Cathay Image credit: Freepik – for illustrative purposes only Looking for a place that has something for every palate? The Cathay’s food court at Basement 1 has a variety of local dishes from Chicken Rice to Hokkien Mee, Char Kway Teow and more. Just be sure to head down before the lunch or dinner crowd rushes in! Food Avenue, The Cathay, 2 Handy Road, #B1-09/10/14, Singapore 229233 One Pot: For ma la hotpot lovers (opening soon) Image credit: Shi Li Fang Hot Pot Calling all hotpot lovers! Head to One Pot, a franchise of the infamous Shi Li Fang Hot Pot, to treat yourself to a rich and comforting ma la broth. Choose from a wide selection of fresh ingredients to customise your ma la bowl. articles.title: Yacht Rentals In Singapore: Where To Hire Affordable & Luxury Yachts For Boat Trips & Parties
articles.author: Sassy Mama
articles.content: Whether you’re looking for an overnight staycation in luxury yacht, a yacht party, a yacht for fishing or the cheapest yacht rental for a new experience, yacht rentals in Singapore are a great way to have a fun day out! Looking for a yacht rental in Singapore to plan a unique celebration or a getaway from the city? Don’t worry, we’ve got you covered. While living in Singapore means you’ve got access to off-the-beaten-track islands and many good beaches , you may want a new way to experience these offerings. A yacht charter or yacht rental is a great way to enjoy Singapore’s best sunsets , tuck into star-lit dinners and have fun with a great variety of water sports with minimal hassle. Whether you’re looking for a luxury yacht for a sailcation to Pulau Ubin or a cheap yacht rental for a fun date out at sea, here’s our handy list of some of the best yacht rentals in Singapore. Quick tip: Each operator has an array of yacht rental packages, so be sure to ask about meals, personalisation requests, trip durations, group sizes, island hop-on, hop-off options and other necessities you may need to bring on your own before making a boat booking. If your yacht is stopping at Lazarus Island , ask if they will be mooring at the beach where you can swim to the sand or just within the jetty area (calmer for water sports but without the island feel). Read more: Family-Friendly Social Clubs or Kid-Friendly Family Staycations in Singapore Yacht Rentals In Singapore: Advant Yacht: Customisable yacht rental Image credit: Advant Yacht via Instagram Customisation is king here, as each yacht rental package is tailored to suit your needs (price upon request). Their yacht can host up to six people and take you along Singapore’s serene waters. Yacht rental price: From $1,500. Up to 27 guests. Minimum four-hour booking. Advant Yacht , ONE15 Marina Sentosa Cove Singapore, 11 Cove Drive, #01-01, Sentosa Cove, Singapore 098497, www. advantyacht.com Marina Keppel Bay: Yacht rental with dinner Image credit: Marina at Keppel Bay via Facebook A yacht rental from Marina Keppel Bay allows you to embark in style on a fun-filled day cruise to Singapore’s surrounding islands. Opt for the stunning sunset cruise, which comes with dinner onboard. Perks on board include beach toys, floating mats, karaoke systems and more. Yacht rental price: Submit a request online for a quotation. Marina Keppel Bay , 2 Keppel Bay Vista, Singapore 098382, Tel: (+65) 6976 4118, www.marinakeppelbay.com/yacht-charter ONE15 Luxury Yachting: luxury overnight yacht rental Image credit: Dudarev Mikhail via Shutterstock The best way to enjoy a barbecue? With a yacht rental from ONE15 Luxury Yachting, of course. Book a luxury yacht for a 2D1N staycation away from the city. Spend the day out at sea, unwind with a swim in the ocean or simply relax under the warm sun. You will even get to enjoy freshly prepared meals and dine alfresco with a breathtaking view of the sea. Yacht rental price: from $4,000++ for 2D1N staycation (up to five pax). Two-hour yacht rental in Singapore from $488++ (up to six pax). ONE15 Luxury Yachting , 11 Cove Drive, #01-01, Sentosa Cove, Singapore 098497, Tel: (+65) 6305 9676, www.one15luxuryyachting.com Republic of Singapore Yacht Club: Yacht rental for water activities Image credit: Republic of Singapore Yacht Club Founded in 1826, The Republic of Singapore Yacht Club is the oldest yacht club in town. They offer a variety of facilities for yacht owners and also have a range of yacht charters available for the public. Each yacht rental comes with water activities for the whole family including stand-up paddle, kayaks and a floating mat. Yacht rental price: Price varies depending on your choice of yacht. Contact their team for yacht rental prices. Republic of Singapore Yacht Club, 52 West Coast Ferry Road, Singapore 126887, www.rsyc.org.sg Royal Albatross: Yacht party experience Image credit: Royal Albatross Royal Albatross offers a unique 2.5-hour experience onboard a four-mast 22-sail Tall Ship that comprises a delicious seven-course dinner and optional wine-tasting session plus live entertainment. Enjoy a scrumptious dinner as you sail along Singapore’s southern coastline with the wind in your hair! How much: From $225 per adult for a Sunset Dinner Cruise. Royal Albatross, 8 Sentosa Gateway, Sentosa Island, Singapore 098269, Tel: (+65) 9350 7475, www.tallship.com.sg Read more: Best Mother’s Day Gift Ideas In Singapore SAF Yacht Club: Sailing programme and yacht berths Image credit: SAF Yacht Club While SAF Yacht Club isn’t a place where you can rent a yacht, you’ll find sailing courses for kids and adults to enjoy some time out at sea. If you own a yacht, you can register to become a member and hire a dry or wet berth for your yacht. Yacht berthing membership price: From $85 per month. SAF Yacht Club, 43 Admiralty Road West, Singapore 759962, www.safyc.org.sg Seek Sophie: Affordable yacht rental Image credit: Seek Sophie Seek Sophie offers over 40 yacht rental options from affordable four-hour yacht trips, to gorgeous luxury catamarans, pet-friendly yachts, fishing yacht trips, and even yacht staycations! Seek Sophie also has more interesting yacht rental options like a rustic ‘Hong Kong Junk Boat’ trip (aboard an antique HK junk boat!) and a four-hour yacht trip with water activities included. Yacht rental price: From $581 for a four-hour getaway (for ten pax) Seek Sophie , www.seeksophie.com Shimmering Sea Cruises: Luxury yacht rental Image credit: Shimmering Sea Cruises via Official Website Shimmering Sea Cruises offers sailing trips aboard their flagship yacht, the La Fortuna – a luxurious 45-ft custom build Flash Powered Catamaran. The yacht comes with a large front open deck for alfresco dining, relaxing or entertaining. Yacht rental price: From $488 nett for a four-hour fun cruise or fishing trip package (up to 10 pax). Shimmering Sea Cruises , 52 West Coast Ferry Road, Singapore 126887, WhatsApp: (+65) 9656 3511, www.shimmeringseacruises.com Trident Marine Asia: Yacht rental for getaway trips Image credit: Trident Marine Asia via Instagram Weekend getaways are a breeze with Trident Marine Asia’s yacht rentals in Singapore. These boats take you to nearby islands such as Bintan , Batam , Langkawi , Nikoi and more. Stay onboard or look into their affordable pick-up and drop-off services to these islands. Yacht rental price: From $200++ for up to seven guests for four-hour yacht charter Trident Marine Asia , Republic of Singapore Yacht Club, 52 West Coast Ferry Road, Singapore 126887, Tel: (+65) 6904 8327, www.tridentmarineasia.com Valencia Yachts: Yacht rental for parties Image credit: Valencia Yachts via Facebook Valencia Yachts has several magnificent catamarans to choose from. Suitable for day charters, evening cruises or even overnight trips with your friends and family, Valencia Yachts’ catamarans are all about luxurious living at sea. Each yacht charter comes with a friendly captain and an experienced crew to ensure that your yacht rental experience is a seamless one. Yacht rental price: From $799 for four-hour yacht charter Valencia Yachts , ONE°15 Marina Sentosa Cove, Singapore, 11 Cove Drive, #01-01, Sentosa Cove, Singapore 098497, Tel: (+65) 9383 0098, www.valenciayachts.com Wanderlust Adventures: Luxurious yacht rental Image credit: Wanderlust Adventures via Facebook Whether you want to rent a yacht for a fishing trip with your pals, a staycation with your bae or a fun family day out with the kids, Wanderlust Adventures has just the yacht you need. They have huge yachts that can take up to 55 pax if you’re hosting a party and smaller yachts for an afternoon out at sea for 8 to 10 pax. Plus, they even have a pet cruise package available for furkids! Yacht rental price: From $899 for a four-hour private fishing trip with up to 8 pax. Wanderlust Adventures, Sentosa Cove Village, 1 Cove Drive, Singapore 098497, Tel: (+65) 6969 3378, www.wadventures.com.sg White Sails: Affordable yacht rental Image credit: White Sails via Facebook Perfect for both day and night charters, there’s plenty that’ll impress when you book the Sunrise catamaran for your yacht party. This affordable, hassle-free yacht rental is big on comfort with three bedrooms for the family. Little ones will have a blast on the trampoline-style open deck space. Plus, you’ll be attended to by a friendly crew that is known for its exceptional service. Yacht rental price: From $899 for a four-hour yacht rental (up to 10 pax) White Sails , Marina at Keppel Bay, 2 Keppel Bay Vista, Singapore 098382, Tel: (+65) 8661 7600, www.whitesails.com.sg The Yacht Club: Yacht rental with water sports Image credit: The Yacht Club via Instagram There are more than 20 yachts to choose from at The Yacht Club, which offers yacht rentals in Singapore, food, tipples and water sports. You can even opt for a private Romantic Cruise for a special celebration. Yacht rental price: From $650 for the first five pax (additional $100 per pax for up to 22 pax) for a 4-hour weekday yacht charter. The Yacht Club , 138 Robinson Road, #03-42, Oxley Tower, Singapore 068906, Tel: (+65) 9839 5130, www.theyachtclub.sg Yachtly: Cheap yacht rental Image credit: Yachtly via Instagram One of Singapore’s more affordable options for yacht rentals in Singapore, Yachtly offers various boat sizes to accommodate different-sized groups. The operator aims to keep its experiences unique, whether it’s dining under the stars, relaxing on inflatable floats or riding around on a jet ski. Yacht rental price: From $654.48 for up to 18 pax. Yachtly , 1 Scotts Road, #24-10, Shaw Centre, Singapore, 228208, Tel: (+65) 8299 2678, www.yachtly.com.sg YachtCharter.sg: Yacht rental for birthday parties Image credit: YachtCharter.sg via Official Website Whether you’re looking for sailing or water activities in the Southern Islands, or throwing a birthday party for your partner or child, YachtCharter.sg has plenty of yacht rentals in Singapore to satisfy. The company works closely with its operators, so you’ll always be clued in to last-minute discounts and unique yacht availabilities. Yacht rental price: From $880 for up to 18 pax. YachtCharter.sg , Tel: (+65) 6850 5059, www.yachtcharter.sg YachtCruiseSG: Private yacht rental for date night Image credit: YachtCruiseSG via Facebook Fancy hopping in a yacht for a front-seat view of the gorgeous Singapore sunset? YachtCruiseSG offers a Sunset & Skyline Happy Hour Yacht Cruise that comes with a refreshing drink and light bites as you make stops at scenic locations including Pulau Tekukor, St. John’s Island, Lazarus Island and Sisters’ Island. How much: $99 per pax (ages 3 – 70) YachtCruiseSG , WhatsApp: (+65) 9231 3939, www.yachtcruisesg.com Yacht Rental by Sea Experiences: Yachts for fishing Image credit: Yacht Rental by Sea Experiences If you love to fish, then this is the yacht rental for you! Yacht Rental by Sea Experiences offers a fleet of boats tailored for fishing but can be used for other activities as well. Some of their yacht rentals even come with a unicorn float, inflatable kayak , fishing rods, stand-up paddle and a floating water mat. Yacht rental: From $690 for up to ten pax. Yacht Rental by Sea Experiences, Tel: (+65) 9178 1234, www.yachtrental.com.sg Yacht BBQ by Sea Friends: Yacht rental for BBQ parties Image credit: Sea Friends via Facebook Want to host a BBQ party on a yacht? Rent a yacht from Yacht BBQ by Sea Friends, which offers four-hour yacht charters from One Degree 15 to Lazarus / Southern Islands. All prices include unlimited use of water toys (kayak, SUP, animal floats, water mat) and BBQ sets (one set serves five pax). You can even bring your own BBQ sets or F&B at no extra charge. How much: From $588 for up to five pax on weekdays (with complimentary welcome drinks and city skyline tour). Yacht BBQ by Sea Friends, Tel: (+65) 8869 7769, www.yachtbbq.com Changi Sailing Club: Yacht rental with sailing courses Image credit: Changi Sailing Club via Instagram Changi Sailing Club has various sailing boat rentals in Singapore (from the mini Optimist Junior to Lasers) although you’ll need to be a member and sail the boat yourself. If you don’t know how to sail a boat, then sign up for their sailing courses. Affordable yacht rentals are also available for CSC members. How much: From $12 per hour for the mini Optimist sailing boat (minimum of 3-hour rental) Changi Sailing Club , 32 Netheravon Road, Singapore 508508, Tel: (+65) 6545 2876, www.csc.org.sg Singapore Island Cruise & Ferry Image credit: Singapore Island Cruise & Ferry via Facebook Singapore Island Cruise & Ferry isn’t technically the place for charters or yacht rentals in Singapore, but it does promise plenty of fun for the fam. The ferry operator specialises in island-hopping to St. John’s and Lazarus Island as well as Kusu Island. There’s a pre-determined schedule in place, and children of all ages, as well as small furkids, are welcome for a boat trip in Singapore to remember. How much: From $15 for a ferry to St. John’s/Lazarus Island & Kusu Island Singapore Island Cruise & Ferry , 31 Marina Coastal Drive, Marina South Pier, #01-04, Singapore 018988, www.islandcruise.com.sg Read more: The post Yacht Rentals In Singapore: Where To Hire Affordable & Luxury Yachts For Boat Trips & Parties appeared first on Sassy Mama .
